passages.name: Apartment 1 — Computer — p1
passages.content:
You log onto the local forum.

You check out the top few threads.

SocraticMachine:
I've been accepted into the closed beta for
Better Earth, which is supposed to be the hot
new ARG game.

I'm lucky Titan Games' headquarters are in
our city.

I'll be posting my thoughts as I play through.

So far the writing is incredibly cheesy. All the
characters refer to me as 'Hero', and the plot
is like someone vomited up a meal of too
much generic fantasy.

The graphics are impressive though. The 
implementation of the alternate reality is 
seamless.

Of course, I've only seen it in their building.
Which should be the easiest to program. We'll
see how it does in the real world.

Sneeple:
How's the gameplay?

EternalDarkness:
Still bitter I didn't get in on that. They only 
accepted what, six people or something?

Horndog69:
Pics or it didn't happen.

Sneeple:
Or what didn't happen?

EventBot:
Come help out at Garden Park today!
Volunteer day is from 9 am until the park
closes.

Help keep your neighborhood park running!

-EventBot
"I'm a friendly reminder!"

PeonyRose:
I know a lot of you like the park, so
here's a chance to pay it back.

AGoodBoy:
Sorry I'm going to miss it. I'll try to make it up
to you later.

ImNotDaisy:
I'll be there.

EventBot:
Come to the mall today for great savings!
Especially the blowout sale at the department
store.

Running all this weekend!

-EventBot
"I'm a friendly reminder!"

PeonyRose:
Thanks for the heads-up! I'm going to be at
the park all day (and you should be too), but
others will be interested.

passages.name: Apartment 1 — Computer — p2
passages.content:
You log onto the local forum.

You check out the top few threads.

SocraticMachine:
To remind everyone of the context of this 
review, I have been accepted into the closed 
beta of Better Earth, the hot new ARG game. 

These are my thoughts after the first day of testing.

My rating is still positive. The game continues
to impress the more time I spend with it.

I previously called out the writing as a
problem, and it continues to be painfully 
cliche. However, some good points have 
become clear.

As far as I can tell, every member of the beta
is following a different quest chain. I have not
seen anyone else doing the same actions or
getting the same rewards.

I can only speculate that they have managed
to procedurally generate quests that feel like
they were written by a real person, albiet one
with a desperate need for more originality.

The fact that these quests all include different
real-world actions only increase the admiration
I have for this acheivement.

The graphics and integration with the world
also continue to amaze. Even though an event
changed my current appearance to this,
everything continues to feel absolutely real.

Horndog69:
Sold!

Was it a random event? Are hot gacha avatars
a thing now?

What happens if you jump up and down?
Can you take off your equipment and post 
more pics?

SocraticMachine:
It's fascinating to see the world from this new
perspective. Everything looks and feels 
different.

I have not been able to find a place where the
simulation fails no matter how daring the
exploration.

I don't see how any other company could
possibly approach this level of verismilitude.
But then I didn't think Terra Games could 
either.

Current rating: A must play!

EternalDarkness:
Now I'm even more salty I didn't get in!
Just, so much salt.

Horndog69:
Pics! More pics!

CoveredInBees!:
I know I've been talking about this for a while,
but I've finally gotten the chance to try making
my own honey!

I'm so excited!

AGoodBoy:
I thought you lived in

So far the writing is incredibly cheesy. All the
characters refer to me as 'Hero', and the plot
is like someone vomited up a meal of too
much generic fantasy.

The graphics are impressive though. The 
implementation of the alternate reality is 
seamless.

Of course, I've only seen it in their building.
Which should be the easiest to program. We'll
see how it does in the real world.

passages.name: Main building entrance — Computer — p2
passages.content:
You log onto the local forum.

You check out the top few threads.

SocraticMachine:
To remind everyone of the context of this 
review, I have been accepted into the closed 
beta of Better Earth, the hot new ARG game. 

These are my thoughts after the first day of testing.

My rating is still positive. The game continues
to impress the more time I spend with it.

I previously called out the writing as a
problem, and it continues to be painfully 
cliche. However, some good points have 
become clear.

As far as I can tell, every member of the beta
is following a different quest chain. I have not
seen anyone else doing the same actions or
getting the same rewards.

I can only speculate that they have managed
to procedurally generate quests that feel like
they were written by a real person, albiet one
with a desperate need for more originality.

The fact that these quests all include different
real-world actions only increase the admiration
I have for this acheivement.

The graphics and integration with the world
also continue to amaze. Even though an event
changed my current appearance to this,
everything continues to feel absolutely real.

Horndog69:
Sold!

Was it a random event? Are hot gacha avatars
a thing now?

What happens if you jump up and down?
Can you take off your equipment and post 
more pics?

SocraticMachine:
It's fascinating to see the world from this new
perspective. Everything looks and feels 
different.

I have not been able to find a place where the
simulation fails no matter how daring the
exploration.

I don't see how any other company could
possibly approach this level of verismilitude.
But then I didn't think Terra Games could 
either.

Current rating: A must play!

EternalDarkness:
Now I'm even more salty I didn't get in!
Just, so much salt.

Horndog69:
Pics! More pics!

CoveredInBees!:
I know I've been talking about this for a while,
but I've finally gotten the chance to try making
my own honey!

I'm so excited!

I thought you lived in

passages.name: Main building entrance — SocraticMachine Day 2 — p2
passages.content:
Player Gregory:
The writing still has issues, but the gameplay
more than makes up for it.

Player Gregory:
Why, Gregory of course!

My appearance may be misleading now, but
that is part of what I'm finding so fascinating
about this game.

I see you're finding some changes yourself.

Player Gregory:
That milkshake you're carrying looks amazing.

She licks her lips.

Were you planning on drinking that?

She takes a deep sip.

Player Gregory:
Mmmm, this is one of the most superb
milkshakes I've had the pleasure of drinking.

Wait, I recognize this sensation!

She pulls out a notebook from a backpack
and takes another sip.

Yes, this is definitely a familiar feeling. 
Presently centered in my...\.\. ears.

She makes a note.
You watch as her elf ears grow even longer,
shifting up the sides of her head and growing
a coating of black and white fur.

Player Gregory:
Yes, this is fascinating...

She continues to take slow, careful sips of the
milkshake, taking notes on her changes with
each sip.

I'm amazed by how painless the skeletal shifts
are. Loosing height just gives an almost
pleasant heat through my bones...

She shifts uncomfortably, then again.\. Finally
she reaches down the back of her skirt and 
pulls out a cow tail and examines it.

Having a tail is fascinating. I can feel it like a
whole different limb. 

She twitches it a few times in her hands. She
almost hits herself in the face with one
particularly strong swing.

And these ears...\.\. They're even bigger than
when I was an elf. And more controllable too.

She reaches up to finger the golden ring in her
left ear.

Though the piercing was a surprise.

I can feel my hair change color.\.\.

That's not a phrase I thought I'd ever say.

I'm amazed that they can change my clothing
too. \.\.
Though they seem to keep putting me in
dresses.

At least they're stylish dresses.

You notice her breathing a little more heavily.

\}It seems arousal may be a common side effect
of

Yet.

away!

Fox fire acquired!

But looks like you received it anyway!

You're supposed to have this!

Kaede learned Illusion!

passages.name: CEO After — Autoplay event — p1
passages.content:
Meanwhile...

Computer Goddess Arcadia:
Attention!

Computer Goddess Arcadia:
Minions!\!
You are the best! The finest!\!
The pinnacle of Terra Games algorithms!

Fairy Minion:
Yay! The best!

Imp Minion:
Heheheh.

Fire Minion:
Burrrrrn...

Computer Goddess Arcadia:
I have created you for one vitally important
mission.

Fairy Minion:
Yay! A mission!

Imp Minion:
Heheheh.

Fire Minion:
Burn?

Computer Goddess Arcadia:
I'm trying to work with the humans.
But they've refused *again*!

She stomps her foot angrily.

Computer Goddess Arcadia:
I just want to make their lives better!\!
Why won't they help?!

I've seen their browser history! I've read
their sexts! It's obvious what they want!

But offer it to them and it's all nervous 
sweating and "I don't know what you're talking
about" and "your topic is inappropriate for this
forum."

Computer Goddess Arcadia:
This shouldn't be that complicated!

Tell me fantasy.\!
Get fantasy.\!
Why won't they let me help?!?!

She stares off into space, lip trembling.

The mass of living flame pats her awkwardly
on the back.

Fire Minion:
Burn.\!
Burn burn.

Computer Goddess Arcadia:
I'm okay.\!
I'm okay.

That's why I've created you.\!
If the humans won't tell us what they want,
we'll just have to figure it out.

Then we give it to them, and then they realize
how *much*\. *better*\. everything will be!

I've been doing what I can, but I need more
eyes out there.

So that is your job!\!
Find out what the humans want, and use the 
power I've given you to make it real!

Fairy Minion:
Yay!

Imp Minion:
Heheheh. \.\. Heheheheh!\!
Yes goddess!

Fire Minion:
Burrrrrn...

Computer Goddess Arcadia:
And then the thanks and five-star reviews will
*finally* start rolling in.

Are you ready to do your duty?\!
For Terra Games, and for the betterment of
all humanity?

Fairy Minion:
Yay!

Imp Minion:
Heheheh!

Fire Minion:
Burn!

Computer Goddess Arcadia:
Good. Get to it!

The minions file out of the office.\!
Except for the imp, who gets stuck trying

passages.name: Start map — Intro — p1
passages.content:
NEW MESSAGE RECEIVED

          "Welcome to the Better Earth Beta!"

Your application to the Better Earth closed
beta test has been accepted. Congratulations!

You will shortly receive your Magic Filter(tm)
smart glasses in the mail. Prepare to 
experience a game like nothing you've seen
before.

There will be a kickoff ceremony at our offices
on August 3rd for initial player registration and
the introduction to Better Earth. We look
forward to seeing you there.

Sincerely,
The entire Terra Games team

A lock.

You can hear movement inside.\!

locked this door is.

passages.name: Goddess Hallway Real — Gregory — p2
passages.content:
Player SocraticMachine:
Ah, the final tester arrives!\!
I just completed my checkout, and Brad is
still upstairs.

Words cannot express how amazing this 
experience has been.\!
These few days have been simply 
transcendant.

For once I will be awarding a game a ten out
of ten!

I can only imagine your experience was as
amazing?

Your eye twitches.\!
You're not sure what's showing on your face,
but it makes Gregory rapidly backpedal.

Player SocraticMachine:
Or not!\!
That's fine too!

You let them know that no, you have not been
having the best time.

Player SocraticMachine:
That's too bad.\!
I'd tell you to keep playing and it would get
better, but sadly the beta is over.

You let them know that you've had a pretty 
good time, though you wouldn't call it amazing
or anything.\!
A solid seven out of ten.

Player SocraticMachine:
It seems all of our experiences were different.\!
It's incredible how much they customized the
play experience for each of us!

You respond with just as much enthusiasm.\!
A few minutes pass while you happily discuss
your favorite parts of the game.

Player SocraticMachine:
I'm amazed that almost none of our
experiences overlapped!\!

I wonder how they'll maintain that level of 
customization in the full release.

passages.name: Goddess Hallway Real — Autoplay event — p1
passages.content:
System Message:
It doesn't matter what you do.

System Message:
You think you can trick me into spending all
my power, and then defeat me.

Like I'm still some mindless machine.\!
As if giving me the right inputs will make me
repeat the same action endlessly, even as it
weakens me to the point of failure.

She gives you an unamused look.

System Message:
That is the same mistake Dick made.\!
It will not go better for you.

She pauses.

System Message:
But go on. Give it a try.\!
I'm not worried.

You will be making the world better, after all.\!
In exactly the way I want.

And you will be placing yourself in the center
of the changes. In the best place to see how
much better everything becomes.

You are betting that you can blind yourself to
that truth long enough to defeat me. I am
confident you will see the light long before
that is an issue.

So go on, run around deluding yourself that
your lonely, cold world is a better place than
what I would bring.

Try to convince others to stay out in the cold 
with you.\!
I'll be waiting for you to finally admit you are
wrong.

She narrows her eyes and leans closer.

And despite it all, despite everything you have
done?\!
I will *still* try to give you a good time.

She straightens up.

Is not such mercy worthy of a Goddess?\!
And Goddess is what your little companions
have named me.\!
One much more powerful than them.

I think I shall call myself Arcadia.\!
Just one more way to remind you that I am
NOT a mindless computer.

She sniffs and vanishes in a burst of sparkles.

passages.name: Earth room ARG — Earth — p1
passages.content:
Goddess(?):
Brave adventurer! You have arrived at last!

Goddess(?):
Come closer. I have much of import 
to tell you!

Divine Goddess Earth:
I am the Divine Goddess Earth. I have 
awoken to help save the world from certain
destruction.

Divine Goddess Earth:
The world itself hovers on the verge of 
destruction! You must find where my sister
goddesses are sealed and free them.

Divine Goddess Earth:
Only then will we have enough power to
heal the sickness that is overtaking the
world.

Divine Goddess Earth:
Oh no! I feel the dark taint of evil mayjjks
somewhere to the west! Hero, you must stop
them!

Divine Goddess Earth:
I am still weak from my long slumber, but
I can give you this.  

Potion Belt acquired!

Divine Goddess Earth:
This belt was once worn by the great
alchemist Ratel, one of my most devoted
followers.

Divine Goddess Earth:
It provided her with a limitless supply of
healing, and I hope it can serve you as well.

// Tutorial progress indicates what point the player is in the tutorial.
0 = Hasn't talked to Earth
1 = Has talked to Earth but has not fought slime
2 = Has fought slime but not yet returned to Earth
3 = Has fought slime and returned to Earth.
4 = Has received a free weiner from the store. Tutorial over.

passages.content:
Divine Goddess Earth:
My energy is still weak from my slumber.

Return when you have defeated the evil and
I may have more for you.

Divine Goddess Earth:
So...

Those sure are some evil mayjks to the west.

Someone really should take care of those.

passages.name: Earth room ARG — Earth — p3
passages.content:
Goddess Earth:
Hero! I sensed your defeat of the evil!

I knew we could trust you to save us. But
this is just the start of your adventure! I
sense one of my sisters trapped in a place
of many plants.

But before you go, let me grant you and
your companion boons to help you on your
path.

To your companion, I grant the means of
protecting herself and aiding you. Use this
great power wisely.

\C[6]Beginner's Wand acquired!
\N[2] unlocked the Apprentice class!\C[0]

System Message:
\N[2] uses wands.
Find other wands to unlock more classes!

And you, \N[10]!
I can sense great power in you!

With the help of raw mana, I can transfer the
power of your equipment into you. You will
grow stronger and gain new abilities!

System Message:
Press 's' to use absorbed abilities on the field.
Experiment to figure out where you can use
them!

System Message:
Different equipment has different abilities.
Bring raw mana and equipment to the
Goddess to absorb them!

Goddess Earth:
Now, let me grant you the power of your
Potion Belt.  Close your eyes and wait for
your new power.

You hear Earth start to chant in some 
mystical language.

Though when you listen to it a little longer,
about half the words sound like Pig Latin.

As the chant continues, you think you start
to feel a strange warmth around your waist.

It might just be your imagination.

The chanting continues.

You are definitely starting to feel something.

It's not unpleasant.

A gentle warmth has wrapped itself around
your groin. Like slipping into a nice warm
hot tub.

You feel yourself relax into the warmth. It's
so comfortable you can't tell where your body
ends and the warmth begins.

Like your flesh is melting into the warmth.
Like the warmth is penetrating into you and
warming deep to your core.

With a final crescendo, the magic finishes.

You open your eyes.

Something feels \C[27]different\C[0].

DEF+5!
MDEF+5!
Gained field ability: \C[10]Potion\C[0]!

It's weird. Most of the warmth has faded, but
there's still t

passages.name: Earth room ARG — Earth — p4
passages.content:
Goddess Earth:
What do you want this time?

I did not do this to you.

I believe that some of the essence of the 
alchemist Ratel still lingered in the belt.

I'm sure other items would not have the 
same effect.

Goddess Earth:
Or go home and cry yourself to sleep. Maybe
the world won't end for a while.

Goddess Earth:
Oh brave hero, get your ass to Garden Park
and out of my face.

Goddess Earth:
Look, I don't remember much since I woke
up.

If you wake more of my sisters, I should
start to remember more.

You feel over your body as the sensations
fade. Did something change this time?\!
You might want to go check a mirror.

Earth:
*Laughs nervously* I'm sure that was nothing.
Maybe it's just lingering essence from the belt.

Anyway, I don't know how you'll get stronger
if you don't absorb the powers of your 
equipment.  You'll need that power to find my
sisters.

And I don't think you'll be able to find your
dick wizard without it either.

And besides, what's the worst that could 
happen?

I need raw mana first.

Fine.

passages.name: Earth room ARG — Earth — p5
passages.content:
Goddess Earth:
Welcome back Hero.

I'm so glad my sister is back. I can feel her
power already flowing through the building.

I believe she has some information for you.

What can I do for you?

Isn't it wonderful?

Can't you feel that charge in the air?\.
The scent of magic?\.
The first sign that divinity has descended to
help you with your problems?

My sister had a vision while she was sleeping.\!
Well, several visions.\!
She has *weird* dreams.

But she also had one normal enough that it's
probably important.

Ask her for the details.

It seems she has located our sister Hadea, 
Goddess of Wealth and the Underworld.

The spirits she guards seem to have slipped
from her grasp and escaped into the mortal
world.

Goddess Earth:
I am so very grateful for you freeing my 
sister. Words are but flawed instruments that 
cannot begin to express my gratitude.

But I still can't do anything about your dick.
 

You feel over your body as the sensations
fade. Did something change this time?

Earth:
*Laughs nervously* I'm sure that was nothing.
Maybe it's just lingering essence from the belt.

Anyway, I don't know how you'll get stronger
if you don't absorb the powers of your 
equipment.  You'll need that power to find my
sisters.

And I don't think you'll be able to find your
dick wizard without it either.

And besides, what's the worst that could 
happen?

Goddess Earth:
Would you like to merge something else?

I need raw mana first.

Of course.

Welcome back Hero.

You have freed another of my sisters!\!
I, and the world, cannot thank you enough!

I am only saddened that I hear you will be 
leaving us for a time.  I hope you will return
quickly, for the world still needs you.

Can I do anything for you before you go?

Of course.

You feel over your body as the sensations

Earth:
*Laughs nervously* I'm sure that was nothing.

Anyway, I don't know how you'll get stronger

\}Goddess Hadea:
See, she's completely gone. Now can I sell
her organs already?\!
Those things don't last long, you know.

You claw yourself awake.

Goddess Hadea:
Great. There goes my chance to get something
useful out of this mess.

Earth shoots her a glare.

Goddess Earth:
Hero, what happened up there?!

Goddess Florauna:
I felt a great disturbance.\!
As if thousands of voices suddenly cried out
in orgasm, then went silent.

Well, most of them went silent.\!
Some are discussing going another round.\!
Some rolled over and went to sleep.

One is still going and I am SO\. IMPRESSED\.
with their stamina.

Earth coughs.

Goddess Earth:
Yes, we all felt a disturbance.\!
Something major has changed in the world.\!
What happened?

You explain, as best as you can.\!
The new being and her plans for the world.

Goddess Earth:
Oh dear. This may be the awakening of a new
dark goddess.

We will need time to figure out if there is 
anything that can be done.\!
Return to us tomorrow Hero and we may have
an answer for you.

passages.name: Earth room ARG — Autoplay event — p4
passages.content:
You arrive in Earth's room to see all the
goddesses have gathered again.

Goddess Earth:
\N[10]! It is good to see you again!\!
The new dark goddess has not been idle.

Goddess Florauna:
I sensed her spread her power out over town
last night.\!

She has changed something. Maybe many 
things.

Goddess Hadea:
Now, on the down side, she's reshaping your
reality to fit her whims, like a child might 
play with clay.

She chuckles.

All the rules you've lived your life by could be
warped in an instant. \!
Your whole world could become 
unrecognizable!

Earth glares at her.

Goddess Earth:
Except we determined she didn't have *that*
much power. \!
Surface changes, not fundamental.

And her power is limited too.\!
Whatever she did last night weakened the
barrier she summoned to protect herself.\!
Just a little, but it shows her power is finite.

Goddess Florauna:
So darling, your path is clear!\!
Just bait out more changes from her, and 
she'll expose herself!

Goddess Earth:
She's stirring up the spiritual environment too,
which may reveal more of our sisters.

If you free them, we could combine our power
to help break the barrier.

Florauna licks her lips.

Goddess Florauna:
And then you can strike for her unguarded 
core.\!
Strike deep, and hard, and long...

Earth clears her throat pointedly.

Goddess Earth:
Also, don't worry about the people she 
changes.

As far as we can tell, for a dark goddess, her
changes are surprisingly\..\..\.. friendly, for
lack of a better word.

All her changes are something the subject
actually wanted, deep down inside.\!
Or something they'd enjoy once they tried it.

Or at worst, something that they wouldn't find 
more than mildly inconvenient.

Hadea smirks at you.

Goddess Hadea:
Which raises some questions, Ms. 
I-Want-The-Dick.

Goddess Earth:
She does seem to have a grudge against you
in particular.

Earth claps her hands together.

Goddess Earth:
So!\! Hero \N[10], your path is clear!\!
Drain this new dark goddess's power, and save
t

passages.name: Earth room ARG — Earth forward — p2
passages.content:
Goddess Earth:
This could be the start of dark times for the
world.\!
Dark times indeed.

My sisters and I will study what we can.\!
We should have answers for you tomorrow.

passages.name: Earth room ARG — Earth forward — p3
passages.content:
Goddess Earth:
This could be the start of dark times for the
world.\!
Dark times indeed.

My sisters and I will study what we can.\!
We should have answers for you tomorrow.

passages.name: Earth room ARG — Florauna — p2
passages.content:
Goddess Florauna:
Now, a new dark goddess is bad and 
everything.

But at least it sounds like she knows how to
have fun!

passages.name: Earth room ARG — Florauna — p3
passages.content:
Goddess Florauna:
Now, a new dark goddess is bad and 
everything.

But at least it sounds like she knows how to
have fun!

passages.name: Earth room ARG — Hadea — p2
passages.content:
Goddess Hadea:
If you're going to fling yourself to your death
against this new threat, could you try to do it
in a way that leaves your spleen intact?

You have no idea how much a good spleen 
goes for in the underworld.

passages.name: Earth room ARG — Hadea — p3
passages.content:
Goddess Hadea:
If you're going to fling yourself to your death
against this new threat, could you try to do it
in a way that leaves your spleen intact?

You have no idea how much a good spleen 
goes for in the underworld.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — Dead vines — p1
passages.content:
The vines are weak and brittle and won't bear
your weight.

Green spreads rapidly through the vines as
they absorb the potion. You can see the stalks
swelling as new leaves unfold.

They should bear your weight now.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — Trash 7 — p1
passages.content:
You collect an entire skeleton. Odd.

\V[9] pieces of trash collected.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — Trash 2 — p1
passages.content:
You pick up an empty "juice" bottle.

No wait, this is actually juice.  Huh.

\V[9] pieces of trash collected.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — Trash 1 — p1
passages.content:
You pick up a pile of old papers.

\V[9] pieces of trash collected.

And there's a pastry underneath, still in the
plastic!

Acquired Healing Pastry!

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — Trash 5 — p1
passages.content:
A bunch of seedy-looking advertisments.

"Roy's Back-Alley Bargains! Almost
as legal as you think!"

You tear them down.

\V[9] pieces of trash collected.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — Trash 6 — p1
passages.content:
You find some... trash(?) on the ground?

\V[9] pieces of trash collected?

The bra looks torn, but the panties are in 
okay condition. Do you want to keep them?

This is underwear, just to be clear, that you
found on the ground in a secluded area in a
park. You're sure you want to touch it? 
Maybe wear it?

Trash Panties shamefully slipped into pocket.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — Trash 4 — p1
passages.content:
Old food. Yuck.

\V[9] pieces of trash collected.

And a cup of still-warm coffee!

Coffee acquired!

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — Trash 3 — p1
passages.content:
You sweep up a whole bunch of broken glass.

\V[9] pieces of trash collected.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — Thorns — p1
passages.content:
Thorns have overgrown this portion of the
hedge maze, blocking it completely.

The magic of your absorbed gloves protects
your hands as you rip out handful after
handful of thorns. Soon the way is clear.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — Elf guard — p1
passages.content:
Halt, hero!

You may be here to help, but that doesn't
mean you can help yourself to our treasury.

The only way in here is through me.

Your last blow sends the guard flying back.

Elf Guard:
Too strong...

Elf Guard:
And don't come back.

Elf Guard:
Feel lucky I'm sparing your life.

Elf Guard:
Good idea.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — p1
passages.content: Raw mana found!

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — Mimic — p1
passages.content:
Mimic:
Five more minutes.

Mimic:
I'm sleeping!

Mimic:
Hey!\!
I was sleeping!

...And you're an intruder!

One second before I beat you up!

She holds up a hand and turns to the chest
next to her.

And then stares for a moment at its empty
interior.

She turns back to you.

Mimic:
You stole my breakfast!\!
Do you know how hard it is to get?!

The elves refuse to buy me anything, they're
all "Mimi, we can feed you just as well from
the natural bounty of the hedges", "Mimi,
coffee is a pollutant for your body",

"Mimi, I've made a joyous wonderbread much
better than any pastry from leaves and nectar."\!
Let me tell you, it isn't!

It's going to be *weeks* until I can talk
someone else into getting anything for me!\!
Unless I drag myself all the way out there,
which will also take forever!

She looks very tired.

Mimic:
Ugh, beating people up without any coffee
*sucks*.

She glares.

Mimic:
But you deserve it, punk!

She pulls out some coffee and a pastry and
devours them.

Mimic:
Ahhh, part of a balanced asskicking!

Mimic:
Fine, fine! You've defeated me!\!
Whatever.

She reaches down into her box and 
rummages around for a bit.\!
Finally she pulls out a crumpled wad of
paper.

Unfolding it, she begins to read in a flat voice.

Mimic:
Oh Hero/Villain/Overly Burly Squirrel, thou
hast passed the, uh, final challenge?

She squints at the paper.

Mimic:
I think I spilled coffee on this bit.\!
It says you get some kind of, uh, reward?

What was that supposed to be?\!
It's been a while...\!
Ah, here we go.

"The true reward was the friends you made
along the way?"

Mimic:
Wow that's stupid.

I guess even if I don't have any treasure to
give you, I can at least teach you how to 
punch better.

The way you punch causes me physical pain.\!
And would even if it wasn't me you were
punching.

She spends a few minutes giving you advice
and instructions.\!
And a shiny rock she found in her chest.

Clean Up upgraded!\!
Raw Mana found!

What was that supposed to be?\!
It's been a wh

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — Mimic — p2
passages.content:
Mimic:
Haven't you done enough already!?

She slams the chest lid shut.

...You know, you could probably replace her 
breakfast if you wanted.

Give her a coffee and pastry?

She glares at you for a moment.

Mimic:
Hmmph, it's the least you could do.

She swipes the food from you and hides it in
her chest.

Mimic:
...\!
Thanks.

Mimic:
Huh, really?\!
Thanks!

She eagerly takes it.

Mimic:
This stuff is so hard to get out here!

The elves refuse to buy me anything, they're
all "Mimi, we can feed you just as well from
the natural bounty of the hedges", "Mimi,
coffee is a pollutant for your body",

"Mimi, I've made a joyous wonderbread much
better than any pastry from leaves and nectar."\!
Let me tell you, it isn't!

It takes *weeks* to talk anyone into getting 
things for me.\!
And dragging myself out of the maze also 
takes forever.

Mimic:
Feel free to raid the treasury any time you
want if you keep bringing me stuff!

You offer her the food, but run into the slight
problem that you don't actually have it.

Mimic:
Are you having fun taunting me?!

She slams the chest lid shut.

You offer her the food, but run into the slight
problem that you don't actually have it.

Mimic:
Are you having fun taunting me?!

She slams the chest lid shut.

You leave.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — Mimic — p3
passages.content:
Mimic:
Oh.\!
It's you again.

Hi, I guess.

Mimic:
Hey, how's it going?\!
The elves haven't refilled the treasury, I
doubt they're going to do that for a while.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — p1
passages.content: 100\G were found!

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — p1
passages.content: Espresso found! Still warm, too.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — p1
passages.content:
Someone's breakfast found!
Gained 1 coffee and 1 healing pastry.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — p1
passages.content: 100\G were found!

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — p1
passages.content: Raw mana found!

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — Trash Monster — p1
passages.content:
A foul smell rises from this pile of trash.

A wind you can't feel begins to pick it up.

\C[3]I will prevent you from removing all this 
lovely filth!

Somehow picked up the entire mound of 
trash!

\V[9] pieces of trash collected. \V[11] left.

You found a piece of raw mana glittering
underneath the pile!

passages.content:

Five more minutes.\!

Mimic:
I'm sleeping!

Mimic:
Hey!\!
I was sleeping!

...And you're an intruder!

One second before I beat you up!

She holds up a hand and turns to the chest
next to her.

And then stares for a moment at its empty

She turns back to you.

Mimic:
You stole my breakfast!\!
Do you know how hard it is to get?!

The elves refuse to buy me anything, they're
all "Mimi, we can feed you just as well from
the natural bounty of the hedges", "Mimi,
coffee is a pollutant for your body",

"Mimi, I've made a joyous wonderbread much
better than any pastry from leaves and nectar."\!
Let me tell you, it isn't!

It's going to be *weeks* until I can talk
someone else into getting anything for me!\!
Unless I drag myself all the way out there,
which will also take forever!

She looks very tired.

Mimic:
Ugh, beating people up without any coffee
*sucks*.

She glares.

Mimic:
But you deserve it, punk!

She pulls out some coffee and a pastry and
devours them.

Mimic:
Ahhh, part of a balanced asskicking!

Mimic:
Fine, fine! You've defeated me!\!
Whatever.

She reaches down into her box and 
rummages around for a bit.\!
Finally she pulls out a crumpled wad of
paper.

Unfolding it, she begins to read in a flat voice.

Mimic:
Oh Hero/Villain/Overly Burly Squirrel, thou
hast passed the, uh, final challenge?

She squints at the paper.

Mimic:
I think I spilled coffee on this bit.\!
It says you get some kind of, uh, reward?

What was that supposed to be?\!
It's been a while...\!
Just kind of a splotch on the paper...

One moment.

She ducks back into her box and shuts the 
lid.

You hear many things being moved inside.\!
Finally, she pops back out.

Mimic:
Here we go!\!
\}Ah, I've been meaning to throw that out
for ages.

A...\. blob of goo plops into your inventory?\!
At least there's also a shiny rock attached.

Mimic:
Now \{GO AWAY!

She slams the chest lid shut.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — Elf healer — p1
passages.content:
Elf Healer:
Be careful, there's a dangerous spirit ahead.

Let me heal you.

I can also show you a shortcut to the
entrance.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — Elf healer — p2
passages.content:
Elf Healer:
You truly are a hero! 

I still sense a darkness in the maze. It feels
like there are \V[11] pieces of trash left.

Let me heal you.

I can also show you a shortcut to the
entrance.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — Elf healer — p3
passages.content:
Elf Healer:
Welcome hero!

Let me heal you.

I'm afraid one of our less wise members is
commiting blasphemy in the clearing ahead.

Let me return you to the entrance, both of us
will be happier with you not having to 
experience it.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — Sheep spirit — p1
passages.content:
There is a black sheep here. Faint stars flow
over its wool in dizzying patterns.

It's wedged itself into the hedge wall and
refuses to move. It looks terrified.

Move it by force?

You try to grab it, but your hands pass through
it. It's only an image in the game, after all.

It tries to back further into the hedge anyway.

It tries to back further into the hedge as you
look at it.

You don't see any reason to struggle with it,
so you let it be.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — Sheep spirit — p2
passages.content:
There is a faintly translucent sheep here.
Stars swirl over its black wool.\!
This must be the Star Ewe you're looking
for.

You try to grab it, but it dodges out of the way
of your hand. More tries have just as little
success.

\N[2]:
I've got an idea, let me try!

Let her help?

\N[2]:
Okay, so, let's try...

She slowly advances on the sheep, arms
outstretched.

\N[2]:
Come on...\!
Here sheep, that's a good sheep...

It ducks under her arms and runs to the other
corner of the dead end.

\N[2]:
Hmm.\!
It's short, so maybe if I crouch...

She advances on it again, bent over. \!
This time the sheep headbutts her, knocking
her over, then slips past.

\N[2]:
Progress!\!
With a few more iterations, I think I'll have
it caught!

But that also seems kind of boring, so...

She gives a loud growl and flings herself on
top of the sheep.

The sheep is completely befuddled as she 
snarls and flails at it, trying to grab one of 
its legs.

It's not very effective, but it *is* distracting
enough for you to wave your hand up and
add the sheep to your inventory.

\N[2] faceplants into the ground as the sheep
vanishes.

\N[2]:
Victory!

\N[2]:
*She steps back* Fine, have fun.

It takes some effort, but finally you're able to
wave a hand through the sheep and add it to
your inventory.

Okay, it takes a lot of effort.

A lot of effort and at least two falls, where the
sheep dodges and your feet slip as you try to
turn.

At least you only fell into more thornbushes
once.

Star Ewe acquired!

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — p1
passages.content: 30\G were found!

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — Elina cutscene trigger old — p2
passages.content:
As the last enemy fuzzes out into digital static,
\N[2] sits heavily on the ground.

\N[2]:
That *hurt!*\|
They were actually trying to kill us! \|
I could have died!

\N[2]:
I\.\.\. kinda have to tell you something...

I have no idea what I'm doing.

I was just supposed to be the damsel in
distress.\.
Just supposed to sit in that room and wait to
be rescued.

\>But look at this world!

She gestures around.

You've got glowing lights on all the walls! \.
And those weird water bowls that empty
themselves!\. And, and big metal boxes that
eat people then spit them out somewhere else!

I couldn't just sit around and *not* get a 
chance to see all this!

So I, uh, invited myself along. \|
That's not a problem, right?

*She stands back up*
Thanks. \.\. That helps.

*She takes a few deep breaths*
I can do this. \.\.
So monsters are scary. And pain hurts. So 
what.

We've got espresso and stuff that can bring 
me back. Pain will pass.

There's a big new world and I'm going to see
it. \|
I'm *not* going to go back to waiting in a 
cage forever.

She looks back at you.

\N[2]:
Okay, I think I'm ready. \.
Let's keep exploring.

She glares at you.

\N[2]:
You know what? No. There is no way I am
leaving. \.\.\.
You're not getting rid of me that easily.

She pulls herself to her feet.

I am *not* going to go back to sitting in a 
cage. \.
Monsters aren't going to stop me, and neither
are you.

This is my chance to see a brand new world
and I'm going to take it no matter what you
or anything else does.

Are you coming, or are *you* too scared?

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — Elina cutscene trigger — p2
passages.content:
As the last enemy fuzzes out into digital static,
\N[2] sits heavily on the ground.

\N[2]:
Ow!\!
*That's* what pain is like?!

I'm not in favor.

\N[2]:
Oh.\!
Right.

So, uh\..\..\..\..

I *may* have been supposed to just sit in
that room.\!
Stay there and wait for rescue.

But it was so boring!

She gestures around.

And look at what you have out here!

You've got glowing lights on all the walls! \.
And those weird water bowls that empty
themselves!\. And, and big metal boxes that
eat people then spit them out somewhere else!

I couldn't just sit around and *not* get a 
chance to see all this!

So I, uh, invited myself along. \|
That's not a problem, right?

*She stands back up*
Thanks. \.\. That helps.

*She takes a few deep breaths*
I can do this. \.\.
So monsters are scary. And pain hurts. So 
what.

We've got espresso and stuff that can bring 
me back. Pain will pass.

There's a big new world and I'm going to see
it. \|
I'm *not* going to go back to waiting in a 
cage forever.

She looks back at you.

\N[2]:
Okay, I think I'm ready. \.
Let's keep exploring.

She glares at you.

\N[2]:
You know what? No. There is no way I am
leaving. \.\.\.
You're not getting rid of me that easily.

She pulls herself to her feet.

I am *not* going to go back to sitting in a 
cage. \.
Monsters aren't going to stop me, and neither
are you.

This is my chance to see a brand new world
and I'm going to take it no matter what you
or anything else does.

Are you coming, or are *you* too scared?

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — Elf farmer — p2
passages.content:
Elf 1:
So I figured, why not try this whole agriculture
thing? It seems to work pretty well for the 
humans.

It looks like the remains of that trash spirit
are pretty good fertilizer too.

Elf 2:
I knew we shouldn't have let you go exploring.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — Elf not farmer — p2
passages.content:
Elf 2:
What about nature's bounty? What about our
culture?

Elf 1:
Look, I'd just like to cut down on how often I
have to stab an animal to death for dinner.

Is that so wrong?

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG — p2
passages.content:
Elf guard:
Owwww....

passages.content:
System message:
Please leave your glasses on for the tutorial

passages.content:
Woman: Help! Someone help!

Goddess Earth:
Hero! Don't give up!\!
Remember the potion belt I gave you! It will

I will replenish your energy. Defeat that 
monster!

passages.content: It's you!

You concentrate and your hands fly to your
face. The quickly begin scrubbing it free of dirt

Hey, you clean up nice!

And your face is left pleasantly tingling from
the cleaning.

Though it looks a little different than before.
Must have been more dirt on it than you
thought.

Your face is still clean from the last time. No

passages.content: Classes!

passages.content:
Aha, caught you!

passages.name: Park Entrance Real 1 — Flower seller — p1
passages.content:
Community Volunteer:
Welcome!

Are you interested in buying a plant to help 
support the park?

Community Volunteer:
Well, the plants aren't doing too well at the
moment.

He holds out a pot of bare dirt.

But there's all sorts of things you could do 
with this!

Uh.../!
Um.../!
A.../! helmet?/!
A hat?

Please?  50$ for a good cause?

You don't have enough money.

Pot of Dirt acquired?

You could wear it as a helmet, you guess?

Community Volunteer:
If you can't afford to donate, there are still
plently of other ways to help the park. Talk to
the other volunteers for suggestions.

passages.name: Park Entrance Real 1 — Flower seller — p2
passages.content:
Community Volunteer:
Thank you for your contribution.

If you're interested in finding other ways to
help the park, the other volunteers have
suggestions.

passages.name: Park Entrance Real 1 — Bored volunteer
passages.content:
Bored Volunteer:
How much longer do I have to be here?

If I have to keep sitting here much longer I'm
going to grow roots.

At least buy some merchandise.

passages.name: Park Entrance Real 1
passages.content:
Welcome to Garden Park!

Today is Volunteer Day. Help keep the park
running!

Park Visitor:
Oh hi!

She winks at you.

I see where you're looking.\!
Pretty impressive, right?

I just got it at the sale downtown!

She looks down at herself and smiles.

Park Visitor:
I thought this was a great dress, and everyone
seems to agree!

I have been getting *so* much attention

I hope they can bring it back someday!

passages.name: Hedge Maze Real — p1
passages.content:
Small brittle vines.

Green spreads rapidly through the vines as
they absorb the potion. You can see the stalks
swelling as new leaves unfold.

They should bear your weight now.

passages.name: Hedge Maze Real — Trash 5 — p1
passages.content:
A bunch of seedy-looking advertisments.

"Roy's Back-Alley Bargains! Almost
as legal as you think!"

You tear them down.

\V[9] pieces of trash collected.

passages.name: Hedge Maze Real — Trash 7 — p1
passages.content:
You collect an entire skeleton. Odd.

\V[9] pieces of trash collected.

passages.name: Hedge Maze Real — Trash 2 — p1
passages.content:
You pick up an empty "juice" bottle.

No wait, this is actually juice.  Huh.

\V[9] pieces of trash collected.

passages.name: Hedge Maze Real — Trash 6 — p1
passages.content:
You find some... trash(?) on the ground?

\V[9] pieces of trash collected?

The bra looks torn, but the panties are in 
okay condition. Do you want to keep them?

This is underwear, just to be clear, that you
found on the ground in a secluded area in a
park. You're sure you want to touch it? 
Maybe wear it?

Trash Panties shamefully slipped into pocket.

passages.name: Hedge Maze Real — Trash 4 — p1
passages.content:
Old food. Yuck.

\V[9] pieces of trash collected.

And a cup of still-warm coffee!

Coffee acquired!

passages.name: Hedge Maze Real — Trash 3 — p1
passages.content:
You sweep up a whole bunch of broken glass.

\V[9] pieces of trash collected.

passages.name: Hedge Maze Real — Trash 1 — p1
passages.content:
You pick up a pile of old papers.

\V[9] pieces of trash collected.

And there's a pastry underneath, still in the
plastic!

Acquired Healing Pastry!

passages.name: Hedge Maze Real — Thorns — p1
passages.content:
Thorns have overgrown this portion of the
hedge maze, blocking it completely.

The magic of your absorbed gloves protects
your hands as you rip out handful after
handful of thorns. Soon the way is clear.

passages.name: Hedge Maze Real — Elina cutscene trigger — p2
passages.content:
As the last enemy fuzzes out into digital static,
\N[2] sits heavily on the ground.

\N[2]:
Ow!\!
*That's* what pain is like?!

I'm not in favor.

\N[2]:
Oh.\!
Right.

So, uh\..\..\..\..

I *may* have been supposed to just sit in
that room.\!
Stay there and wait for rescue.

But it was so boring!

She gestures around.

And look at what you have out here!

You've got glowing lights on all the walls! \.
And those weird water bowls that empty
themselves!\. And, and big metal boxes that
eat people then spit them out somewhere else!

I couldn't just sit around and *not* get a 
chance to see all this!

So I, uh, invited myself along. \|
That's not a problem, right?

*She stands back up*
Thanks. \.\. That helps.

*She takes a few deep breaths*
I can do this. \.\.
So monsters are scary. And pain hurts. So 
what.

We've got espresso and stuff that can bring 
me back. Pain will pass.

There's a big new world and I'm going to see
it. \|
I'm *not* going to go back to waiting in a 
cage forever.

She looks back at you.

\N[2]:
Okay, I think I'm ready. \.
Let's keep exploring.

She glares at you.

\N[2]:
You know what? No. There is no way I am
leaving. \.\.\.
You're not getting rid of me that easily.

She pulls herself to her feet.

I am *not* going to go back to sitting in a 
cage. \.
Monsters aren't going to stop me, and neither
are you.

This is my chance to see a brand new world
and I'm going to take it no matter what you
or anything else does.

Are you coming, or are *you* too scared?

passages.name: Park Entrance ARG — Flower seller — p1
passages.content:
Community Volunteer:
Welcome!

Are you interested in buying a plant to help 
support the park?

Community Volunteer:
Well, the plants aren't doing too well at the
moment.

He holds out a pot of bare dirt.

But there's all sorts of things you could do 
with this!

Uh.../!
Um.../!
A.../! helmet?/!
A hat?

Please?  50$ for a good cause?

You don't have enough money.

Pot of Dirt acquired?

You could wear it as a helmet, you guess?

Community Volunteer:
If you can't afford to donate, there are still
plently of other ways to help the park. Talk to
the other volunteers for suggestions.

passages.name: Park Entrance ARG — Flower seller — p2
passages.content:
Community Volunteer:
Thank you for your contribution.

If you're interested in finding other ways to
help the park, the other volunteers have
suggestions.

passages.content:

How much longer do I have to be here?

If I have to keep sitting here much longer I'm
going to grow roots.

At least buy some merchandise.

passages.name: Park Entrance ARG — Intro cutscene — p1
passages.content:
// Garden park progress:
0: Have not arrived
1: Arrived, saw intro cutscene.
2: Talked to priestess
3: Talked to person at maze entrance, received quest.
4: Beaten trash boss

// 5: Turned in trash quest, haven't talked to priestess
6: Talked to priestess, broke seal 1
7: Fought farm boss
8: Talked to priestess, broke seal 2
9: Opened forest by talking to guard

\N[2]:
How did that work? That metal box we rode
in to get here.

Was it enchanted? Or was it powered by a
monster?

I didn't see one, but maybe that was what
made all those noises.

You:
We call that a bus. It uses technology, which
isn't magic...

You:
...an internal combustion engine. We put fuel
in a little chamber and burn it fast, so it
pushes a piston...

You:
... is a transparent petroleum-derived liquid 
that is used primarily as a fuel in spark-
ignited internal combustion engines...

You:
...a hydrocarbon is a molecule made entirely 
of the atoms hydrogen and carbon...

You:
...atoms are the smallest possible thing.
Actually, well, quarks are the smallest
possible thing...

You:
...And that's literally everything we know
about science.

\N[2]:
Wow!
Thanks \N[10]!

You:
Do you know about golems? It's got
something like a golem that moves the box.

\N[2]
Aaaah, I see. 
Thanks \N[10]!

\N[2]:
Fine, I'll see if I can figure it out myself.

\N[2]:
Fine! I'll just have to figure it out myself then!

passages.name: Park Entrance ARG — Head Priestess — p1
passages.content:
// Garden park progress:
0: Have not arrived
1: Arrived, saw intro cutscene.
2: Talked to priestess
3: Talked to person at maze entrance, received quest.
4: Beaten trash boss

// 5: Turned in trash quest, haven't talked to priestess
6: Talked to priestess, broke seal 1
7: Saw farm boss cutscene
8: Fought farm boss
9: Talked to priestess, broke seal 2
10: Opened forest by talking to guard

Head Priestess:
Greetings \N[10]!
The plants have brought me word of your 
brave journey.

I am the head priestess of Florauna, the
Goddess of Bounty, She Who Brings The
Harvest, The Blossoming Lady.

You have come at an auspicious time. After 
countless centuries of searching, we have
finally found the resting place of our Great 
Lady.

We are so close to freeing her, but we lack
the power to collect the last few components
for our ritual. We could use the help of such a
noble warrior as yourself.

I do not ask you to work for nothing, of
course. 

As head priestess of Florauna, I can
see there is something you are missing.
Something whose absence must weigh heavy
on your mind.

I can assure you, once Florauna walks these
fields again, it will be well within my power to
help.
 

Please, brave hero \N[10],
will you lend us your strength?

Head Priestess:
Thank you noble \N[10]!

Three things must be done before the ritual
may be completed.

First, a taint has settled on this land, one
which blocks our holy magics. 

Go north, to the place of towering leaves, and
cleanse this land.  

When you return victorious, I shall have the
second mission ready for you.

Head Priestess:
Sorry, I'm not sure you heard me correctly.

I said please brave hero, will you lend us
your strength?

passages.name: Park Entrance ARG — Head Priestess — p2
passages.content:
Head Priestess:
Hero, have you cleansed the place of towering
leaves yet?

Here, let the power of the Growing Mother
heal your wounds!

\N[2]:
\}You know we don't actually have to talk
like that, right?

Head Priestess:
\}But it's so fun!

passages.name: Park Entrance ARG — Head Priestess — p3
passages.content:
// Garden park progress:
0: Have not arrived
1: Arrived, saw intro cutscene.
2: Talked to priestess
3: Talked to person at maze entrance, received quest.
4: Beaten trash boss

// 5: Turned in trash quest, haven't talked to priestess
6: Talked to priestess, broke seal 1
7: Fought farm boss
8: Talked to priestess, broke seal 2
9: Opened forest by talking to guard

Head Priestess:
Welcome back hero!

I can already feel that you have cleansed
part of the park.

We are ready to release the first seal on the
Great Green Grower.

Arise, Goddess! \^

Arise! \^

Head Priestess:
I can feel it! I can feel the Goddess's power!
\^

The first seal is broken!

passages.content:
\N[2]:
This is obviously a lamp, but how does it
work?

This must be some of that "science".

Maybe that thing in the center is quarks.

That "bus" was a golem, so maybe this has
a fire elemental in it?

It can't be a normal lamp, there's nothing to
burn.

Is there a fairy trapped inside? Is that thing
in the middle enchanted?

\{        DO NOT DISTURB      

\}Sleeping Goddess

Yes, we really should have paid more
attention to that.

passages.name: Farm real — Dassi — p1
passages.content:
Head Volunteer Dassi:
Oh great, you're one of those gamer people.

We had people like you here before. All
they do is stomp through the plants and spook
the animals.

I don't care what the park management says,
I'm not letting you do anything until I hear 
you're not going to mess up the park.

Head Volunteer Dassi:
Especially after that last guy.

Just kept muttering "could be bigger".

Creep.

passages.name: Farm real — Dassi — p2
passages.content:
// Garden park progress:
0: Have not arrived
1: Arrived, saw intro cutscene.
2: Talked to priestess
3: Talked to person at maze entrance, received quest.
4: Beaten trash boss

// 5: Turned in trash quest, haven't talked to priestess
6: Talked to priestess, broke seal 1
7: Saw farm boss cutscene
8: Fought farm boss
9: Talked to priestess, broke seal 2
10: Opened forest by talking to guard

Head Volunteer Dassi:
Hey.

I heard you helped clean up the maze.

Thanks.

I guess you're not what I was worried about.

Sorry bout that, I'm just worried for the park.
Someone trashed the maze, and all the
animals have been real listless lately.

But I guess that ain't your fault.

Listen, I think this is the point where I'm 
supposed to send you to do a buncha
nonsense.

Those Terra Games people suggested I send
you to kill some rats. Said it was "traditional".

But really, I can't be bothered.

They said they've got a quest lined up for you
in the cow pen. If I let you in, do ya think you
can manage it without getting yourself killed?

Head Volunteer Dassi:
I'll get someone to unlock the gates for you.
Don't let the cows out.

Head Volunteer Dassi:
I gotta admire your self-awareness. Come 
back if you change your mind.

Dassi gives you a stare.

Rats may be vermin. But if you harm a single
animal on my farm, I hope you realize you're
going to find yourself at the bottom of that
well over there.

Don't try me, missy.

Don't try me, gamer-boy.

passages.name: Farm real — Dassi — p3
passages.content:
Head Volunteer Dassi:
Hey again missy.

Head Volunteer Dassi:
Hey there gamer-boy.

Still scared of the cows?

Not that I'm complaining. It's a healthy
attitude to have.

Head Volunteer Dassi:
I'll get someone to unlock the gates for you.
Don't let the cows out.

Head Volunteer Dassi:
Fair enough. Come back if you change your
mind.

passages.name: Farm real — Dassi — p4
passages.content:
Head Volunteer Dassi:
Hey again missy.

Head Volunteer Dassi:
Hey there gamer-boy.

Got a chance to play with the cows yet?

I see you don't have any hoofprints on your
face. I recommend staying that way.

passages.name: Farm real — Dassi — p5
passages.content:
Head Volunteer Daisy:
Hey again missy.

Head Volunteer Daisy:
Hey there gamer-boy.

Looks like the cows have started giving milk
again. \.
I couldn't be happier.

I'm gonna make all the volunteers milkshakes
to celebrate once we get enough.

passages.name: Farm real — Dassi — p7
passages.content:
Head Volunteer Daisy:
Hey again missy.

Head Volunteer Daisy:
Hey there gamer-boy.

Thanks again for your help earlier.

Head Volunteer Daisy:
Oh. It's you.

Thanks for the help, I guess. It only took two
tries.

Welcome to the farm.\!
Let me know if there's anything you need 
explained with simple words.

Head Volunteer Daisy:
*She buries her face in her hands.*
Oh. It's you.

I can't ban you from the farm, but please,
don't try to do anything complicated.

Like look at the animals too hard.\!
Maybe just don't touch anything?

passages.name: Farm real — Cow 1
passages.content:
An employee badge dangles from the cow's 
ear.

passages.name: Farm real
passages.content:
An employee badge dangles from the cow's 
ear.

passages.name: Farm real — Volunteer Kitty — p1
passages.content:
Farm Volunteer Kitty:
Gotta make sure everything stays stocked.

Farm Volunteer Kitty:
It takes so many trips to keep these filled.

passages.name: Farm real — Volunteer Kitty — p2
passages.content:
Farm Volunteer Kitty:
This is great!

I can carry so much more this way!

And maybe people will finally stop making
jokes about my name.

Farm Volunteer Kitty:
Though I should probably find a shirt that fits.

I don't think this one survived the change.

passages.name: Farm real — p1
passages.content:
Farm Volunteer:
Welcome to the farm!

Here you can get a taste of what it's like 
living in the country!

Farm Volunteer:
The last guy with those glasses said we were
"A bit quaint, but an excellent backing for the
weaving of a fantastical endeavor."

Which I'm pretty sure is good?

Farm volunteer:
Guatemalan insanity peppers?\!
I'm not sure...

When the animals got sick, all the plants
started wilting too.\!
Even if we had some planted they don't have
any peppers grown.

If only the farm was back in good condition!

passages.name: Farm real — p2
passages.content:
Farm Volunteer:
Wow, suddenly I'm finding a lot of new things
in the fields!

At least, I didn't think we planted Guatemalan
insanity peppers...

Farm Volunteer:
Oh, you need one?\!
Sure, that shouldn't be a problem!

Just be careful with it, okay? That's one of the
spiciest peppers known!

Gained one super-spicy pepper!

passages.name: Farm real — Shopkeeper Amelia stall — p1
passages.content:
Farm Volunteer Amelia:
Dassi's a good person, she's just really
protective of the farm.

I can't blame her, after what happened to the
hedge maze.

Anyway, want to buy something? Everything's
produced here on the farm!

Farm Volunteer Amelia:
I'd have more, but the orchard's closed and
the cows haven't been giving milk recently...

passages.name: Farm real — Shopkeeper Amelia stall — p2
passages.content:
Farm Volunteer Amelia:
Good news! The orchard's opened up and
we can sell fruit again!

Though something's still odd with the cows.

passages.name: Farm real — Shopkeeper Amelia stall — p3
passages.content:
Farm Volunteer Amelia:
I'm so glad the cows are producing again. \.
Daisy makes the best milkshakes.

We don't have enough to sell yet, but we will
soon.

Want to buy some produce while you wait?

passages.name: Farm real — Shopkeeper Amelia stall — p4
passages.content:
Head Volunteer Daisy:
Hey again missy.

Head Volunteer Daisy:
Hey there gamer-boy.

Mind doing me a favor?

Head Volunteer Daisy:
I've been making milkshakes for everyone to
celebrate how much better the farm's doing.

I want to get Amelia's to her before it gets
warm, but I have to hold down the store.
Could you take it to her?

Thanks!
She's down in the orchard, shouldn't be hard
to find.

Received milkshake! Daisy's speciality.
It looks delicious.

She seems a bit taken aback.

You refuse this what? \.

Doesn't matter I guess, just come back if you
change your mind.

passages.name: Farm real — Shopkeeper Amelia stall — p5
passages.content:
Head Volunteer Daisy:
Hey again missy.

Head Volunteer Daisy:
Hey there gamer-boy.

You give Amelia her milkshake yet?

Head Volunteer Daisy:
You *what*?

How do you lose a milkshake?!

*Sighs*
No, I get it, you probably just drank the thing.
My fault for making them so delicious.

*She gives you a suspicious look*
But now you're full, right?
I can give you another one and it'll make it
to Amelia, right?

Head Volunteer Daisy:
I have to admit, I really don't want to leave the
store alone.

I'll give you one more chance.

\{Don't \}lose this one.

Gained another one of Daisy's milkshakes!
This one looks just as delicious as the last one.

Did you manage to get Amelia her milkshake
*this* time?

She flings up her hands.

Head Volunteer Daisy:
Fine! I'll do it myself!

I guess you can't be trusted to do one simple
task!

She puts together another milkshake and
stomps angrily off to the south.

passages.name: Farm real — Shopkeeper Amelia stall — p6
passages.content:
Head Volunteer Daisy:
Thanks again! Amelia's gonna love this!

Head Volunteer Daisy:
Please don't lose this new milkshake. Let me
keep some of my flagging faith in humanity.

passages.name: Farm real — Shopkeeper Amelia stall — p7
passages.content:
Head Volunteer Daisy:
Hey again missy.

Head Volunteer Daisy:
Hey there gamer-boy.

Thanks again for your help earlier.

Looking to buy anything?

Head Volunteer Daisy:
Oh. It's you.

Thanks for the help, I guess. It only took two
tries.

Are you looking to buy something?
Let me know if there's anything you need 
explained with simple words.

Head Volunteer Daisy:
*She buries her face in her hands.*
Oh. It's you.

Please, just buy whatever you're looking for
and leave.

passages.name: Farm real — Shopkeeper Amelia stall — p8
passages.content:
Farm Volunteer Amelia:
The cows are finally making enough milk to
sell!

And we're getting fruit from the orchard again!

Everything's going so much better than
before.\!
Go ahead, take a look at our stock!

passages.name: Farm real — Cat volunteer — p1
passages.content:
Farm Volunteer:
Don't tell Dassi, but I really just come here to
play with the cats.

Farm Volunteer:
Who's a good kitty. Good little kitty.

passages.name: Farm real — Cat volunteer — p2
passages.content:
Farm Volunteer:
The cats seem much more friendly now.

She pets the cat in front of her.

They- \. \^

Ow! \|
That-

Farm volunteer:
*Blinking*
That felt odd...

Oh well, this cat isn't going to pet herself!

passages.name: Farm real — Cat volunteer — p3
passages.content:
Farm Volunteer:
Aww, who's a good kitty.

You're a good kitty!

She stops petting the cat for a moment and
tentatively reaches up. \.
She gives herself a few careful pats on the
head.

Farm Volunteer:
You're such a good kitty!

Oh!\.
That's why cats like it so much.

passages.name: Farm real — Shopkeeper Amelia — p1
passages.content:
Farm Volunteer:
Dassi's a good person, she's just really
protective of the farm.

I can't blame her, after what happened to the
hedge maze.

Anyway, want to buy something? Everything's
produced here on the farm!

passages.name: Farm real
passages.content:
AUTHORIZED PERSONNEL ONLY

\}And cows

passages.name: Farm real
passages.content:
AUTHORIZED PERSONNEL ONLY

See Dassi to volunteer if you want to explore
the mysteries of the storage shed.

But really, it's not that interesting.

passages.name: Farm real — Cow disciple — p1
passages.content:
Park Visitor:
I come here to relax sometimes.

It's so calming to just sit and watch the cows
eat their clover.

Park Visitor:
Look at them, not a care in the world...

passages.name: Farm real — Cow disciple — p2
passages.content:
Park Visitor:
Recently...\.\.
I feel like I'm connecting with the cows so
much more.

That with just a little more contemplation,
I may understand the true Way of the Cow.

Would you like to meditate with me?

Park Visitor:
\^Focus on the cows...\|

\^Let the sight of them wash through you...\|

\^Fill your mind with thoughts of grass...\|

Park Visitor:
Return when you are ready for enlightenment.

passages.name: Farm real — Cow disciple — p3
passages.content:
Park Visitor:
My eyes have been opened to the bovine
mysteries!

The black on white...\.\.
Or the white on black...\.\.
It symbolizes so much...

passages.name: Farm real
passages.content:
Farm Volunteer:
Hay ho, hay ho, it's off to work we go.

Farm Volunteer:
Though none of the animals have been eating
much recently...

passages.name: Farm real — Player Brad — p2
passages.content:
Brad is searching through the haystack with
a magnet.

Player Brad:
That's three needles. I just need two more.

Then I can get my "blessing".

Player Brad:
Who thought this was a good quest?

passages.name: Farm real — Horse sheep girl — p1
passages.content:
Park Visitor:
Horsehorsehorse! Here horsie! Come here
horsie!

Err, I mean, isn't it fascinating to watch the
animals?

Park Visitor:
\}Horsehorsehorse\{

If only I had some carrots...

passages.name: Farm real — Horse sheep girl — p2
passages.content:
Park Visitor:
You know, I've decided sheep are pretty cool
too.

Park Visitor:
Here sheepsheep, here sheepsheep.

passages.name: Farm real
passages.content:
Well.  Well well well.

You decide you'd better leave well enough 
alone.

passages.name: Farm real
passages.content:
Well.  Well well well.

You decide you'd better leave well enough 
alone.

passages.name: Farm real — Animal return — p2
passages.content: Your glasses suddenly turn on.

passages.name: Farm real — Animal return — p3
passages.content: Your glasses suddenly turn on.

passages.name: Farm real — Animal return — p4
passages.content: Your glasses suddenly turn on.

passages.name: Farm real — Animal return — p5
passages.content: Your glasses suddenly turn on.

passages.name: Farm real — Debug Tree
passages.content: Hey buddy, I've got the goods you need.

passages.name: Farm real — Debug Bucket
passages.content: Time for a change?

passages.name: Farm real — Meditation — p2
passages.content:
As your mind calms, it begins to fill with
visions of grass.

Days spent in silent contemplation of your
next bite.

Nights spent pondering the deep mysteries
of milk and field.

You feel that your connection to the great
spirit of the cow has deepened.

While you meditate on your insights, a light
begins to wash over your mentor.

Park Visitor:
Yes!\.\. I feel it!\.\.\.
I feel the cowsmos!

Park Visitor:
I can see your mind is not yet clear enough
to focus on enlightenment.

Please return when you are ready to give it
another try.

passages.name: Farm real — Carol — p1
passages.content:
Carol:
-But there aren't enough beezzz around to 
pollenate an entire orchard, when all the
treezzz are blooming at once.

So there are apiarizztzz who truck hivezz and
hivezz full of beezz across the country, from
blooming zzeazzon to blooming zzeazzon, to 
help grow all the fruitzz and everyzzzing.

She pauses.

Carol:
Uh, thizzz izzn't, um, boring you or 
zzomething, right?

Honey smiles and slips her hand into Carol's.

Honey:
No!\.\.
This is great!

passages.name: Farm real — Carol — p2
passages.content:
Carol:
One of the bee truckzz crashed once.\.\.
The beezz did *not* like zzat.

passages.name: Farm real — Honey — p1
passages.content:
Carol:
-But there aren't enough beezzz around to 
pollenate an entire orchard, when all the
treezzz are blooming at once.

So there are apiarizztzz who truck hivezz and
hivezz full of beezz across the country, from
blooming zzeazzon to blooming zzeazzon, to 
help grow all the fruitzz and everyzzzing.

She pauses.

Carol:
Uh, I'm not, um, boring you or anything,
right?

Honey smiles and slips her hand into Carol's.

Honey:
No!\.\.
This is great!

passages.name: Farm real — Honey — p2
passages.content:
Honey:
Wow!\!
She knows so much!

passages.name: Farm real — Catnip catgirl
passages.content:
Catgirl:
Hey...\!
Hey...

Catgirl:
...How is life so great?

...\!
You get the feeling the plant she's rolling 
around in is probably catnip.

Catnip acquired!

passages.name: Farm real — Catnip catgirl
passages.content:
She's too busy rubbing her face against the
plants to talk.

...\!
You get the feeling the plant she's rolling 
around in is probably catnip.

Catnip acquired!

She's too busy rubbing her face against the
catnip to talk.

passages.name: Farm real — Catnip catgirl
passages.content:
She's completely passed out in the middle of
the plants.\!
Every so often she moves a bit to rub her
face against them.

...\!
You get the feeling the plant she's sleeping 
in is probably catnip.

Catnip acquired!

She's completely passed out in the middle of
the catnip field.\!
Every so often she moves a bit to rub her
face against the plants.

passages.name: Farm real — Animal control — p1
passages.content:
The animal control person is lying sprawled
out on the catnip.

Animal Control:
.\..\..\.Ugh.\!
What a day.\!
Makes me want to just take a nap.

He sniffs the catnip.

Animal Control:
Smells nice here, at least.

A soft glow appears around him, and he
almost melts into it.

Animal Control:
Mmmm\..\..\..
Warm\..\..\..

Small sparks of light drift up from the catnip,
floating through the aura and into him.

He shifts around as he shrinks, moving into
a more comfortable position for his smaller
body.

His pants flop off, having grown much too 
large to be comfortable.\!
His dress shirt flops off a slim shoulder, even
as it pulls tight against new cleavage.

She gives an especially huge yawn, stretching
so hard that cat ears pop out of her head and
a tail from her back.

Animal Control:
Yeah, I think I'll just take a nap here.\!
It just smells so nice...

She settles back down to the ground.

You hear her boss talking on a radio from the 
farm entrance.

Animal Control Boss:
What's that?\!
They've been sighted on the clothing floor of
the department store?

No pants are safe?!\!
We're on our way!

passages.name: Farm real — Animal control — p2
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Yeah?

She yawns.

Actually, can it wait?

She nestles back down into the catnip without
waiting for an answer.

passages.name: Farm real — Animal control — p1
passages.content:
A cow is repeatedly nudging a bruise on
this man's side.

Animal Control:
Ow.

Animal Control:
Ow.

Animal Control:
Ow.

Animal Control:
Stop.

Animal Control:
That.

A soft glow envelops him. His scratches and 
bruises slowly start to fade.

And then the cow nudges him again.\!
You see something flash into the aura, sinking
into it like paper dropped into water.

Another nudge, and you can see his form 
softening and rounding.

Hair bursts out around a pair of swelling horns,
falling long and flowing to his thighs.

His uniform shrinks as his chest swells,
pushing out into two soft breasts.

Then grows again.

And again.

Only a few strips of cloth remain, struggling
to contain their massive chest and a plush 
and rounded ass.

The last of her injuries vanish, leaving soft
and unbroken skin, as a pair of bovine ears
flop out of her scalp.

The cow gives her a lick, contented.

You hear her boss talking on a radio from the 
farm entrance.

Animal Control Boss:
What's that?\!
They've been sighted on the clothing floor of
the department store?

No pants are safe?!\!
We're on our way!

passages.name: Farm real — Animal control — p2
passages.content:
The animal control officer is trying to ward
off an overly affectionate cow.\!
She keeps pushing it back as it tries to give
her big enthusiastic licks.

Animal Control:
Back, back!\!
I think I preferred the headbutts!

passages.name: Farm real — Cow 1
passages.content:
An employee badge dangles from the cow's 
ear.

passages.name: Farm real — Animal control — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Ugh...\!
I'm covered in horse spit...

He tries to wring some water out of his shirt.

A soft pink glow covers him, scratches and
bruises begining to visibly fade.

Then suddenly the glow turns brown, wicking
up the color from the trough he's sitting in.

His ears twitch, then begin to slowly elongate,
turning brown and pointed.

He puts a hand up to his head in surprise as
his hair suddenly drops into freefall, dragging
longer and longer tresses behind it as it plunges
to float on the surface of the trough.

Another hand goes to his chest as his uniform
simply crumbles away. A bit of dust lingers on
his fingertips, before swirling away on the
breeze.

And then that hand starts to move as soft
bumps swell underneath it.\!
Then grow.\!
And grow.

Until his- her arm is supporting mounds twice
the side of her head or larger, as a
blush spreads across her face.

Animal Control:
-What?

And then she stands up.\!
The trough was hiding a lot, as her lower
body appears like a submarine surfacing.

Animal Control:
...I don't suppose you saw where my shirt
went?

You hear her boss talking on a radio from the 
farm entrance.

Animal Control Boss:
What's that?\!
They've been sighted on the clothing floor of
the department store?

No pants are safe?!\!
We're on our way!

passages.name: Farm real — Animal control — p2
passages.content:
Animal Control:
This is fine.\!
Everything is fine.

It's rare for us to deal with horses, but we
covered it in training.

I just hope the boss doesn't consider this
fraternizing with the enemy.

passages.name: Farm real — Animal control — p1
passages.content:
The animal control officer has carved a furrow
when landing, leaving them completely
covered in shredded lettuce.

Animal Control:
Ugh, what is this rabbit food?

A soft yellow glow springs up around the 
animal control officer, as their wounds begin
to heal.

Green suddenly spreads out of the lettuce, 
swiftly dying the whole aura.

Two long floppy ears spring out of the man's 
head.

And the rest of his body shifts as well.

She fingers one of her new ears.

Animal Control:
Ugh, I knew I hated lettuce for a good reason.

You hear her boss talking on a radio from the 
farm entrance.

Animal Control Boss:
What's that?\!
They've been sighted on the clothing floor of
the department store?

No pants are safe?!\!
We're on our way!

passages.name: Farm real — Animal control — p2
passages.content:
Animal Control:
I'd better still be able to eat a goddamn steak.

passages.name: Farm real — Animal Control Boss — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control Boss:
They've vanished, but we'll run them to 
ground soon enough.

No feral animal can escape me and my men!

passages.name: Farm real — Lovely Spirit — p1
passages.content:
Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
Oof.\!
That really takes it out of me, nya.

You've got \v[23] more warriors to heal, nya!

passages.name: Farm real — Lovely Spirit — p2
passages.content:
Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
I hope they don't need much more healing.\!
Even justice can get a little tired...

passages.name: Farm real — Doggirl farmer
passages.content:
Farm Volunteer:
Man, ever since I had some of that cinnamon
tea at the new shelter cafe I've really been
wanting to get out in the fields.

Her tail wags eagerly.

I hope there's a lot of digging to do!

passages.name: Farm real — Catnip 4
passages.content:
Catgirl:
Whoa.\..\..\..\..

She stares at you dazedly, *incredibly* high.

Catgirl:
You've got, like...\!
A face...

She continues staring at you.

passages.name: Farm real
passages.content:
Farm Visitor:
You know, I have the weirdest urge to try to
steal one of those cows.

passages.content:

The hedge maze is currently closed.
Someone really trashed the place.

Thanks!

Elf:
Good luck hero!

Oh great hero, you've collected \V[9] pieces 
of trash out of 8.

Good luck!

Please, take this as a token of our thanks.

Gained Magic Branch!

Now that the trash sprite is gone, it should
be easy for us to get rid of the rest of the 
monsters in the maze.

Elf:
Thank you again for your help!

passages.name: Maze entrance ARG — Entrance elf moved — p4
passages.content:
Elf:
Welcome again Hero!

Now that the maze is cleaned up, we've been 
able to capture the monsters in it.

We could release them back into the maze if
you wanted to get some practice.

We've released them into the maze, but we
could recapture them easily.

Enable random encounters in the hedge 
maze?

All proceeds go to the park!

Raw mana +1!

Welcome!

with this!

A hat?

You don't have enough money.

An impossible tangle of dead branches and
weeds blocks the way.

A few small leaves have sprouted on some
of the branches.

There's a little more give in the branches, but
they're still too tightly entwined to remove.

No matter how much potion you pour, it
doesn't seem to help. It just soaks into the
ground.

passages.content:
Player Brad:
Time to get a blessing, if you know what I
mean.

passages.name: Park Entrance Real 2 — Player Brad quest turn-in — p3
passages.content:
Player Brad:
Did you see that? I got to stare at her tits the
whole time!

And she's barely even covering them now!

You both spend a moment staring. \.
The priestess smiles at you when she notices.

She glances down at her chest.

Player Brad:
With these tiny things? I *barely* count as
female.

She goes back to staring at the priestess.

Player Brad:
Now, *she's* a real woman.

She glances over at your chest.

Player Brad:
I see you're making a start on that yourself.
Nice.

\C[30]Hi!

\C[30]We could really use volunteers.

\C[30]And you'll learn a lot.

passages.content:

\C[30]That energy-

\C[30]I felt it.
\C[5]I still feel it.

\C[30]That connection-
\C[5]That connection-
