passages.content: No really, I'm supposed to be here!

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Bystander 1 — p2
passages.content:
Park Volunteer:
Ow, one of those bees stung me!

Park Volunteer:
At least I should finally be able to do my job
with that jerk gone.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Bystander 1 — p3
passages.content:
Park Volunteer:
It looks like the orchard is finally getting back
to normal!

It looks like we might be able to start picking
fruit again soon. Check the farm stand to buy
it!

She rubs her side.

Park Volunteer:
If only this bee sting would stop hurting.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Shadow the cat — p1
passages.content:
There's a cat lying here.

Its collar says "Shadow".

You hear a shout from the entrance.

Park Volunteer TJ:
Tell that cat to stop slacking and start working!

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Shadow the cat — p2
passages.content:
There's a cat lying here.

Its collar says "Shadow".

It's sleeping peacefully.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Bees 3 — p1
passages.content:
Bees! Angry bees! Angry bees everywhere!

You shield your face and hope for the best.

They fly in and sting you on the chest.

It...\. doesn't actually hurt very much?\|

Though your chest feels warm and swollen.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Bees 2 — p1
passages.content:
So many bees!  Why?!

Before you can react, they fly straight at your
face.

It...\. doesn't actually hurt very much?\|

But your lips feel weird and swollen.\!
Heck, your whole face feels kind of weird.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Bees 1 — p1
passages.content:
Aaaah! Bees!

You try to run, but they follow and sting you
all over your butt.

It quickly stops hurting, but it feels swollen.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Beeologist — p1
passages.content:
Park Volunteer Carol:
Speaking as a professional beeologist,
something's gotten the bees up there real
angry.

Fortunately, I have this specially prepared bee
wrap. It's full of all sorts of calming bee 
pheremones.

All we need is someone to run up and wrap
the hive in this, and it should put the bees
right to sleep.

Park Volunteer Carol:
Great! Let me know how it goes!

Uh, unless you're going to come back chased
by a giant swarm of bees.

Not that that's going to happen. Perfectly safe!
\|
But still, no need to come back.

Acquired Bee Blanket! \.

It smells like honey and slumber.

Park Volunteer Carol:
Well what else are you going to do? Get more
fruit for that idiot at the entrance?

At least this is different.

\}And surely even he wouldn't keep us from
calling an ambulance...

\N[2]:
That weird person at the entrance does seem
to dislike bugs...

Maybe this is an opportunity to acquire some?

And I want to see how the bee blanket
works...

Park Volunteer Carol:
I'll have you know I'm the park's leading
beetician.

Beeicist.

Bee-science-person.

Look, this is almost certainly probably going
to work.  How about it?

\N[2]:
That weird man at the entrance does seem to
dislike bugs...

I don't think we're going to get a better chance
to get some than a plan made by a certified 
beeologist.

Park Volunteer Carol:
Remember, you can either try to keep
pleasing that idiot at the front, or you can go
for plan Bee.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Beeologist — p2
passages.content:
Park Volunteer Carol:
Good luck! 

Not that you need it.

I'm sure bee stings are just psychosomatic.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Beeologist — p3
passages.content:
Park Volunteer Carol:
Holy crap, you're still alive?!\.
And the bees are calm?!

I mean, uh, just as expected!

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Beeologist — p4
passages.content:
Park Volunteer Carol:
Hah! Not a single sting from that swarm!
Beestrology wins again!

Park Volunteer Carol:
Though I have to admit that I'm not a fully
trained Beeologist yet.

That takes a PhD and all I've got is a BeeA.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Yellow fairy — p1
passages.content:
Yellow Fairy:
Hero! I'm so glad you've come!

Red Fairy:
Why do you keep doing this? No one has been
able to see you.

The hero's not coming.

Red Fairy:
See, even the hero agrees with me!

Red Fairy:
Wait, you can see us?!

Yellow Fairy:
Welcome great Hero!

Yellow Fairy:
The hero will come if we wait long enough!

They already helped the elves. It's just a 
matter of time!

Yellow Fairy:
Hero!  You've arrived!

Yellow Fairy:
Welcome oh great Hero!

The orchard is in dire straits!

Once it was a peaceful place, where children
played and adults picked fruit at high but not
extreme prices.

But then the Bad Apple came.

No, not just a bad apple, the Worst Apple.

Before long, its corruption spread to all the 
other fruit. The apples, the melons, the 
grapefruit, they've all gone wrong.

Red Fairy:
I saw a pile of grapefruit attack a squirrel.
\}It was horrible...

Yellow Fairy:
Please Hero, defeat the Worst Apple and bring
peace back to our home!

The Worst Apple is hiding somewhere in the
melon patch to the north.  I know you can
defeat it!

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Yellow fairy — p2
passages.content:
Yellow Fairy:
Please Hero, defeat the Worst Apple and save
our home!

It's still hiding somewhere in the melon patch
to the north.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Yellow fairy — p3
passages.content:
Yellow Fairy:
Thank you so much Hero!

The curse has been 
lifted!

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Yellow fairy — p4
passages.content:
Yellow Fairy:
She's just selling fruit juice.\.\.

But somehow it works?

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Orchard guard version bee — p2
passages.content:
Park Volunteer BeeJ:
Thizzz izzz all your fault.

She pouts.

Park Volunteer BeeJ:
Where am I even supposed to find clothezz?
No one makes shirtzz for four armzz and thizz
zztinger thing!

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Orchard guard version bee — p3
passages.content:
Park Volunteer BeeJ:
Pleazze tell thizz idiot to shut up.

Park Volunteer BeeJ:
Or I'm going to figure out how to uzze thizz
zztinger.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Orchard guard version bee — p4
passages.content:
Park Volunteer BeeJ:
How izzz she enjoying thizzz?!

Park Volunteer Carol:
Beecause itzzz amazzzzzzzing!

Hey hey, I'm going to do a dance! Try to
guess where the flowerzzz are!

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Red fairy — p1
passages.content:
Red Fairy:
Great, another idiot who can't see us.

Yellow Fairy:
Red, be polite! What if that was the Hero?

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Red fairy — p2
passages.content:
Red Fairy:
Fine, I guess you're the Hero. Doesn't mean
you'll accomplish anything.

Yellow Fairy:
Sorry, Red's just grumpy her prize melon 
tried to eat her yesterday.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Red fairy — p3
passages.content:
Red Fairy:
I have a new idea. Fruit deathmatches!

Yellow Fairy:
Red, no.  Just... no.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Red fairy — p4
passages.content:
Red Fairy:
Hero! I have studied the fruit and learned its
ways.

I have run with the fruit in the wild. I have
swam with the fruit in the rivers. And I have
learned.

I can give you a potion I made that will bring
the fruit out. And I can teach you chants,
insults in the language of the fruit that will
drive it into a blind rage.

But, uh, it wasn't cheap. So if you wouldn't
mind contributing to my studies?

Red Fairy:
Hello again hero!
Interested in more fruit bait?

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Blue Fairy — p1
passages.content:
An apple a day
Keeps the doctor away

Because it jumps on his head
And smashes his nose
And punches his ears
And...

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Blue Fairy — p2
passages.content:
Everything is awesome!
Everything is cool when the mean fruit's been
smashed!

Except the fruit hiding in the trees
The angry fruit out for revenge

passages.name: Orchards ARG — D2 Honey after — p2
passages.content:
Honey buries her face in the flowers and takes
a deep breath.

Her face is mostly hidden by the flowers, but
you think you see her unusually long tongue 
lick up some nectar.

Honey:
These really are the best!

passages.name: Orchards ARG — D2 Beeologist After — p2
passages.content:
Carol:
Now thezzze are quality flowerzz!

Perfect shape, a zzweet but not cloying zzmell,
just the right mouthfeel...

The beezzz have given them a 9.8 out of ten.

And the low zzcore is Beetrice, zzzhe doezzn't
give *anything* a perfect.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Dying tree — p1
passages.content:
This tree isn't doing well.  The leaves are
brown and slowly dying.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Dying tree — p2
passages.content: The tree is looking much better now.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Dying tree — p1
passages.content:
This tree isn't doing well.  The leaves are
brown and slowly dying.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Dying tree — p2
passages.content: The tree is looking much better now.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Darren — p1
passages.content:
The man on the left is staring worriedly into
his drink.

Man:
I'm just worried that it'll all turn out wrong.

The other man reaches out and grabs his hand
reassuringly.

Other man:
Kyle. Kyle. It'll be fine.

We've both talked to them about joining our
relationships before. It'll all work out.

Kyle:
But Lily has never been up for it before.

Other Man:
And so we gave them space. But now Rose 
and Lily have both said they want to discuss
it.

Kyle:
Darren, that's why everything has to go right!
If this is a chance for us all to join together,
it needs to go perfectly.

And that's not happening with the store
closed.

Darren:
Look, you know that Rose and Lily care for
each other, right?

Kyle:
Yes...

Darren:
And they both care about both of us?

Kyle:
Yes...

Darren:
That's what's needed. That's the important
part.

We'll be able to work out the rest somehow,
if we're all trying.  Whatever form that takes.

Look, it's just a power outage. Soon the
store's going to open back up.

And then we're going to go back in there and
get them something that shows just how
valuable they are to us.

It'll be fine.

Kyle stares into his drink again. But he does
seem less worried.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Quadruple scene — p1
passages.content:
You see Kyle and Darren behind the barn.

Kyle is sitting on a stump while Darren is
crouched down, examining her leg.

Darren:
Look at the articulation on this!

He bends her leg up and down, staring at her
knee.

Darren:
It's so lifelike!

And this material!

He runs his hands up her thighs, completely
oblivious to her slowly flushing face.

Darren:
Smooth...\!
Protective...\!
Durable...

Yet somehow still soft and warm!

He gently rubs her inner thigh, completely
missing her soft intake of breath.

Darren:
It's like the perfect blend of plastic and skin!

He shuffles forward a little, pulling her leg
aside and leaning in to examine where her 
leg joins her torso.

He doesn't seem to notice his face is right up
against her crotch.\!
She definitely does.

Darren:
And this joint! It-

His robot girlfriend can no long bite back a 
soft moan as he rubs his hands along it.

Kyle:
MODESTY COVERS RETRACTED.

Hidden ports iris open on her breasts, 
deploying already-stiff blue nipples.

You catch another hint of blue behind 
Darren's head, but he's hiding it from view.

A faint smell fills the air, a strange but 
surprisingly alluring mix of feminine arousal 
and clear mineral oil.

Darren jerks back in surprise.

Darren:
I-

Kyle catches his head before he can move 
far.\!
She gently starts to press him closer.

Kyle:
Please...\!
Don't stop...

She starts to moan, as he brings his mouth
down to her slit.

You back off before they can see you 
watching.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Quadruple scene — p2
passages.content:
You can still hear soft moaning and cries from
behind the barn.\!
You decide not to interrupt.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Compliment fairy — p1
passages.content:
Blue Fairy:
Ooo, you're pretty!

She pouts.

Blue Fairy:
I hope you learn to enjoy being pretty!

Blue Fairy:
Yay pretty!

Blue Fairy:
It's okay if you don't think so.

I'm sure you'll get prettier!

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Compliment fairy — p2
passages.content:
Blue Fairy:
Hello again pretty lady!

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Compliment fairy — p3
passages.content:
Blue Fairy:
I knew such a pretty lady could save us!

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Cat — p1
passages.content:
The most adequate cat you've ever seen is 
lying here.

It offers no resistance as you scoop it into
your inventory.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Melon fairy 1 — p1
passages.content:
Blue Fairy:
Yay! The Hero is here!

Go Hero!

I saw the Apple run off to the north!

And I've been saving this for the hero!

*Gained watermelon!*

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Melon fairy 1 — p2
passages.content:
Blue Fairy:
Yay Hero! Yay!

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Melon fairy 1 — p3
passages.content:
Blue Fairy:
Yay! You did it!

Now the orchard will be normal again!

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Melon fairy 2 — p1
passages.content:
Red Fairy:
All the others say I have to give you these to
help.

Gained 2 grapefruit.

Red Fairy:
Just because you're saving us all or whatever.

Why are you even talking to me anyway. The
monster ran off to the northwest.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Melon fairy 2 — p2
passages.content:
Red Fairy:
Shouldn't you be off fighting something?

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Melon fairy 2 — p3
passages.content:
Red Fairy:
Okay I guess you did defeat the Worst Apple
and save the orchard.

But what have you done for us recently?

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Melon Fairy 3 — p1
passages.content:
Yellow Fairy:
You're close Hero! I saw the Worst Apple run
south!

Here, I saved this for you!

She holds out a pile of fruit.

Suddenly you hear a roar from the south.

The fruit comes to life and attacks!

Yellow Fairy:
I'm so sorry Hero! Please forgive meeee!

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Melon Fairy 3 — p2
passages.content:
Yellow Fairy:
I'm sooooooo sorry!

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Melon Fairy 3 — p3
passages.content:
Yellow Fairy:
I'm sooo glad you could save the orchard
anyway!

Yellow Fairy:
Thank you!

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Melon Fairy 4 — p1
passages.content:
Red Fairy:
Watch out! WATCH OUT! It's right behind you!

Yup, there it is.

Time for the fight scene!

You're not going to give it the satisfaction.

The Worst Apple gives one last cry, then 
dissolves into sparkles and vanishes.

Red Fairy:
That was amazing!

It was all "rahr!"! And you were all "thwack!"
and "zap!" and "jiggle!"

It was all "rahr!"! And you were all "thwack!"
and "zap!"

Do it again! Do it again!

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Melon Fairy 4 — p2
passages.content:
Red Fairy:
You were so cool when you beat that monster!

Red Fairy:
I'm gonna go find you an even bigger monster
and it'll be even cooler to watch!

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Goggles tree — p1
passages.content:
You look up at the tree. 

Something is gleaming up in the top branches.

You could probably knock it down by shaking
the tree, but the branches also hold a ton of
fruit. And the fruit looks angry.

Shake the tree?

Fruit rains down on your head!

A pair of goggles plummets out of the tree in
front of you.  They look big enough to fit over
your glasses.

Better to leave it alone.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Goggles tree — p2
passages.content: The tree is empty now.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Goggles tree — p1
passages.content:
You look up at the tree. 

Something is gleaming up in the top branches.

You could probably knock it down by shaking
the tree, but the branches also hold a ton of
fruit. And the fruit looks angry.

Shake the tree?

Fruit rains down on your head!

A pair of goggles plummets out of the tree in
front of you.  They look big enough to fit over
your glasses.

Better to leave it alone.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Goggles tree — p2
passages.content: The tree is empty now.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Beeologist interviewing — p2
passages.content:
Park Volunteer BeeJ:
What are you- go away!

Park Volunteer Carol:
But I've never met a bee I could interview 
before!

You have to answer my questions! It's for
science!

Park Volunteer BeeJ:
I zzzaid no!

Park Volunteer Carol:
Come on, just a few questions.

\^What dances do you know?\.
Can you talk to normal bees?\.
On a scale of 1-10, how much do you want to
have sex with flowers?\.

\^Are you fertile?
Do you have a queen?
Do you want a queen?
Where does your honey come out of?\.

Park Volunteer BeeJ:
*Glares*
I am going to zzzting you zzzooo hard.

// Bee people: determines progress of this event
1: saw intro conversation
2: Beeologist has transformed

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Beeologist interviewing — p3
passages.content:
Park Volunteer BeeJ:
I'm not anzzering quezzztions!

Park Volunteer Carol:
Come on, it's for science! Bee science!

Park Volunteer BeeJ:
*Glares*
I am going to zzzting you zzzooo hard.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Beeologist interviewing — p4
passages.content:
Park Volunteer Carol:
This is amazzzing!

Park Volunteer Carol:
Hey hey, want to go shove our faces in zzome
flowerzzz together? \.
It'll bee amazzzing!

Park Volunteer BeeJ:
How did thizzz make you even worse?!

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Beeologist trigger — p2
passages.content: You heard a cry of pain from the north.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Beeologist trigger — p2
passages.content: You heard a cry of pain from the north.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Player Brad — p2
passages.content:
Player Brad:
I bet if I do more quests that priestess'll swell
up even bigger.

Player Brad:
Uh, about quests. \.Any idea how to punch a 
fish?

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Fairy fight start — p1
passages.content:
You see three fairies clustered around a 
spectral cat.

Purple Fairy:
Caught you!

Blue Fairy:
We'll protect everyone from you evil fruit!

Red Fairy:
Uh boss, are you sure this is a fruit?

Purple Fairy:
Of course! Look, it's fuzzy like a peach! And 
it's got that big stem in back!

Blue Fairy:
And sharp teeth like an apple!

Red Fairy:
Boss! Humans!

Purple Fairy:
Humans! Are you here to protect this evil 
fruit? Are you enemies of justice?!

Blue Fairy:
Yeah! Justice!

Red Fairy:
Can they even hear us?

Purple Fairy:
How many times do I have to tell you? It's the 
speech that's important, not if they can hear!

Blue Fairy:
Yeah! Warriors of Justice give speeches!

Red Fairy:
They're villains! Finally, real villains!

Purple Fairy:
Lovely Warrior Rangers of Justice! Attack!

Red Fairy:
Boss! Boss! I've heard of this!\.\. I think they're 
trying to use "logic" against us!

Purple Fairy:
Logic?! How evil!\.
Attack!

Red Fairy:
Boss! They're leaving!

Purple Fairy:
Enemies of justice always run! \.
Attack!

Purple Fairy:
They're too powerful!\.
RUUUUUUUN!!!!!

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Apple tree — p1
passages.content: You shake the tree.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Apple tree — p2
passages.content:
You shake the tree.

Nothing happens.

A cluster of angry fruit falls on your head!

Nothing happens.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Grapefruit tree — p1
passages.content: You shake the tree.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Grapefruit tree — p2
passages.content:
You shake the tree.

Nothing happens.

A cluster of angry fruit falls on your head!

Nothing happens.

passages.content:
You shake the tree.

Nothing happens.

It looks like there isn't any fruit on this tree.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Fruitless tree
passages.content:
You shake the tree.

Nothing happens.

It looks like there isn't any fruit on this tree.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Fruitless tree
passages.content:
You shake the tree.

Nothing happens.

It looks like there isn't any fruit on this tree.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Fruitless tree
passages.content:
You shake the tree.

Nothing happens.

It looks like there isn't any fruit on this tree.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Honey and Carol intro — p2
passages.content:
Honey:
I never knew flowers could be this amazing!

You hear a voice off in the distance.

DID ZZZOMEONE MENTION FLOWERZZZ?!

Carol:
Who izz it?! Who'zzz zzhe flower lover?!

Honey:
...Me?

Carol:
I love flowerzzz! They're zzzo pretty and they
smell zzzo great and-
Want to zzzee my favorite flower?

Honey:
Yeah!

Carol:
They're zzzo good! You'll love them!
They're over here!

Carol:
Thozze flowerzzz are nice, \}but not the bezzt. 
A bit insipid...

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Shopkeeper Amelia — p2
passages.content:
Farm Volunteer Amelia:
I heard the orchard was having problems,
but it looks like it completely recovered!

There's no problem with selling fruit now!

She doesn't seem to have noticed the
milkshake you're holding.

Give it to her?

Farm Volunteer Amelia:
Is that one of Daisy's milkshakes?

Thank you!
She said she was going to send me one, but
I wasn't sure when I would get it.

She takes a deep drink and licks off the 
milkshake moustache.

Farm Volunteer Amelia:
Mmm, no one makes milkshakes like Daisy.

She takes another drink, and another. \.\.
You watch as she works her way through the
whole shake. \|
Nothing happens?

Farm Volunteer Amelia:
I always tell myself I'm not going to drink
it that quickly, but it's just too good to stop.

Though-- *She hiccups*

Oh no, this always-\.\^

She hiccups again. With an almost audible 
*pop*, a pair of black-and-white spotted ears
spring out of the sides of her head.

This *hic*\. is *hic*\. why *hic*\. I should
*hic*\. go slower!

A horn pops out of the left side of her head
with the first hiccup, then the right horn follows
on the second.

After the third the tip of a tail sticks out of the
back of her pants. With the fourth, it flops out
to swing freely behind her.

Farm Volunteer Amelia:
I... \|
I always forget that?\|
They stopped!

She gives a contented sigh and licks the last
bit of milkshake off her lips.

Still, it's so worth it.

You keep the milkshake for now.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Shopkeeper Amelia — p3
passages.content:
Farm Volunteer Amelia:
Thanks again for delivering my milkshake!

I can't wait until the next time Daisy makes
them.

passages.name: Orchards ARG — Shopkeeper Amelia — p4
passages.content:
Farm Volunteer Amelia:
Daisy makes the best milkshakes!\.\.
Though I'm surprised she left the stand to
deliver it.

passages.name: Park Entrance Real 4 — Flower seller — p1
passages.content:
Community Volunteer:
Welcome!

Are you interested in buying a plant to help 
support the park?

Community Volunteer:
Well, the plants aren't doing too well at the
moment.

He holds out a pot of bare dirt.

But there's all sorts of things you could do 
with this!

Uh.../!
Um.../!
A.../! helmet?/!
A hat?

Please?  50$ for a good cause?

You don't have enough money.

Pot of Dirt acquired?

You could wear it as a helmet, you guess?

Community Volunteer:
If you can't afford to donate, there are still
plently of other ways to help the park. Talk to
the other volunteers for suggestions.

passages.name: Park Entrance Real 4 — Flower seller — p2
passages.content:
Community Volunteer:
Did you feel that?!

Why, I feel five years younger!

And look, all the plants are blooming now!

passages.name: Park Entrance Real 4 — Flower seller — p3
passages.content:
Community Volunteer:
The flowers have been selling much better
since they all bloomed!

Would you like to buy one?

Please?  50$ for a good cause?

You don't have enough money.

Plant pot acquired!

You could wear it as a helmet, you guess?

Community Volunteer:
If you can't afford to donate, there are still
plently of other ways to help the park. Talk to
the other volunteers for suggestions.

Why, that wouldn't happen to be one of 
Daisy's milkshakes you've got there, would it?

Could I, uh, give it a taste?
No one makes milkshakes like Daisy does.

You hand over the milkshake.

He takes a long drink.

He takes another long drink. \.

You blink. It almost looks like his wrinkles
are starting to fade.

Community Volunteer:
Ah, that's the stuff.

Another drink.\. His skin is definitely smoothing
itself out, like time is running backwards. And
he seems to be leaning less on his cane.

You know, I used to help out with the farm,
before these old bones stopped being able to
handle it.

He takes a big stretch. There's a series of 
loud popping noises, and when he relaxes
he's easily standing straight.
He props his cane up on one shoulder.

Daisy made these back then too. Best things
I ever tasted.

He's standing straight now, but he's still just
as short as when he was hunched over his
cane. In fact, you think you see him dropping
another inch or two as you watch.

His skin has finished smoothing out to a 
healthy young texture, seeming to suck 
his beard back into his face as it goes.

Uh.../!

A.../! helmet?/!
A hat?

You don't have enough money.

Pot of Dirt acquired?

Could I, uh, give it a taste?
No one makes milkshakes like Daisy does.

You hand over the milkshake.

He takes a long drink.

He takes another long drink. \.

You blink. It almost looks like his wrinkles
are starting to fade.

Community Volunteer:
Ah, that's the stuff.

Another drink.\. His skin is definitely smoothing
itself out, like time is running backwards. And
he seems to be leaning less on his cane.

You know, I used to help out with the farm,
before these old bones stopped being able to
handle it.

He takes a big stretch. There's a series of 
loud popping noises, and when he relaxes
he's easily standing straight.
He props his cane up on one shoulder.

Daisy made these back then too. Best things
I ever tasted.

He's standing straight now, but he's still just
as short as when he was hunched over his
cane. In fact, you think you see him dropping
another inch or two as you watch.

in your chest.

It lingers for a moment, then concentrates

passages.name: Park Entrance ARG 4 — Head Priestess — p1
passages.content:
A wave of energy rolls out as the final pillar
is shattered. The park bursts to life around
you, flowers and grass tearing themselves
out of the ground.

The head priestess begins to blossom as well
as the energy passes through her.

Head Priestess:
Hero! You've done it!

A final seal remains on the godess's prison,
but with this we have more than enough
power to open it.

But beware, legend says that a fearsome 
creature will test any who wish to approach
the goddess for worthiness.

Let me heal you.

Speak to me when you are ready to face the
goddess's guardian.

passages.name: Park Entrance ARG 4 — Head Priestess — p2
passages.content:
Head Priestess:
Are you prepared to face the goddess's 
guardian, Hero?

Head Priestess:
Step back while I prepare.

Thank you. Now, let us make sure we break
the seal.

She calls the junior priestess over.

Head Priestess:
Prepare yourself. We will be pouring all our
energy into awakening our goddess.

Junior Priestess:
It's an honor!

The two priestesses face each other and link
hands. They close their eyes and begin to 
chant.

Slowly, they lower their heads until their 
foreheads are touching.

Their enormous breasts press together and 
squeeze out around their arms as they move 
closer.

A glow begins to build up around them.

Head Priestess:\^
Oh great Goddess Florauna, hear our plea.\|

\>Head Priestess:
\>Oh great Goddess Florauna, hear our plea.

Let thy seal open!

Junior and Head Priestess:
Open!

The front of the seal slowly grinds open.\.

A figure appears from within.

Guardian(?):
The seal has been opened!

\^Who thinks themselves worthy to-\.

\^Junior and Head Priestess:
Open!\|

\^Guardian(?):
You dare-\.

\^Junior and Head Priestess:
Open!\|

Open!\|

bolt of lightning, crashing into one of the seal
pillars. 

She collapses to the ground, smoke wafting 
gently from her body.

Guardian(?):
\}You win.

The priestesses step back from each other
and open their eyes.

Return to me when you are ready to face the
goddess's challenge.

passages.name: Street Real — Driver — p2
passages.content:
The man is staring blankly into the open hood
of the car.

Driver:
Why won't you start?

I gave you gas.\.\. I changed your oil.\!
Do you need a jump? \.\.A new battery?\|
A hug?

Driver:
Ow!\.\.
I don't need a jump, the car does!

passages.name: Street Real — Driver — p3
passages.content:
She's carefully rocking back and forth on her
wheels.

Driver:
So that's the brake...\|
That's the gas...

She starts, then blushes.

Driver:
And that must be the stick shift.

Driver:
Hee!\.\.
That tickles!

passages.name: Street Real — Dog walker — p2
passages.content:
Dog walker:
Who's a good Poochie? You're a good Poochie!

passages.name: Street Real — Car front — p2
passages.content:
A lightning bolt shoots from your fingers, and
you hear the car engine rumble to life.

But the energy keeps pouring out of you.

And then the stream of electricity arcs.

Driver:
Whaaaaaaaa!!!

The stream of electricity continues to pour
from your fingers, despite anything you do to
try and stop it.

So much energy passes through the car that
it begins to glow and twist. \.\.
Meanwhile the man is nearly floating off the 
ground on a web of electricity.

The hood of the car rises into the air, pulled 
up by strings of lightning.\!
Folds itself much smaller.

Then slams into the man, wrapping around 
him.

Then another piece.\.\. And another.

The whole scene grows so bright that you
have to close your eyes, tears streaming down
your face.

// 0 = event not activated
1 - pulled self away, no TF.
2 - just changed
3 - day after change

Until finally you feel the flow of energy abate.

You open your eyes.

The car has vanished, leaving behind a single
changed figure.

Driver:
Uh...

She looks ill.

Driver:
I...\.\.\. ugh...

She spasms, making a loud clicking noise.\.\.
She clutches her stomach.

She clicks again, looking like she's about
to heave.

And again.

Except this time it's followed by the sound of
an engine starting up.

She gives a massive belch, blasting you with
the smell of exhaust.\!
Then pounds her chest a time or two, 
straightening up and looking relieved.

Driver:
Oh, that feels so much better.

She turns to you.

Driver:
Thanks for the help!

passages.name: Street Real — Driver zooming — p2
passages.content:
Driver:
Wheeeeee!\!
This is so much more fun than driving!

And I get double the gas mileage!

passages.name: Street Real
passages.content:
System Message:
No need for boring old money, \N[10]!\!
The game drops exciting BE Bucks for you to
spend!

passages.name: Street Real — p1
passages.content:
Park Volunteer BeeJ:
Look at what zzzey did to me! I demand you
arrezzzt them!

Security Guard:
Sorry Ma'am, but for one, I can't arrest a 
beehive no matter what it's done.

Park Volunteer BeeJ:
Then at leazzt go after that zzztupid bee lover!

Security Guard:
And two, I'm just mall security.\!
I can't arrest anyone!

Park Volunteer BeeJ:
I can't beelieve it! Thizzz hazzz to break
zzzome zzzort of law!

passages.name: Street Real
passages.content:
\{Historic Landmark
\}Open for public use!

For all your religish needs!

passages.name: Street Real — p1
passages.content: Your glasses click on as you enter the bank.

passages.name: Street Real — Escaped dog — p1
passages.content:
A dog is here eagerly sniffing at a dumpster.

You give Doug a call and he arrives a few
minutes later.

Shelter Head Doug:
Come on Daisy, good girls don't roll in trash.\!
We are going to have to give you such a bath
when you get back.

\v[144] out of 3 dogs rescued!

passages.name: Street Real — Kyle — p1
passages.content:
Kyle:
Oh no oh no oh no.

He's staring at the box for the model robot he
just bought.

Kyle:
Batteries not included.\!
My gift for Darren needs to be perfect! It can't
be missing anything!

He turns to the department store.

Kyle:
It's okay Kyle. You can just go buy batteries.
It'll be fine.

He turns back.

Kyle:
But I shouldn't *need* to buy batteries!\!
It's fine, this is fine!

I don't need to make everything perfect, no
one will mind. No one.

Kyle:
...But what if he does?

Kyle:
He won't.

Kyle:
Unless...

Kyle:
Come on Kyle, just make a decision!\!
One or the other!

Kyle:
I'm stuck.\!
I-\. I just can't-

I just can't get the strength to move!\!
It'll all go wrong somehow!

passages.name: Street Real — Kyle — p2
passages.content:
Kyle:
I-\. I can't.

I just need a nudge.\!
The energy to choose!\!
Augh, why am I like this?!

He takes a deep breath.

Kyle:
No, no, this is fine.\!
I can just give this to Darren.

I wouldn't mind if he gave me this, so he
won't mind if I give him this.\!
He won't hate me forever for a single tiny
mistake.

He takes another deep breath, not noticing
his boxed robot starting to crackle with
electricity.

You have to shield your eyes as it grows 
brighter and brighter.

Kyle:
This will all be fine.\!
This is fine.\!
This is fine.

This is-\!
\{ALL SYSTEMS OPTIMAL

The light fades, revealing a changed Kyle.

Kyle:
I'm going to-

She jerks as she realizes her hands are 
empty.

Kyle:
Oh no.\!
Oh no oh no oh no.

She starts frantically patting herself down, 
searching for the box.

Kyle:
It can't be missing.\!
Oh god, how is it missing.

She checks the former location of her pockets,
her front...

Kyle:
Where?\!
Where?!\!
W- where...?

Her hands find something unexpected on her
chest.

Kyle:
What...?

She squeezes.

Kyle:
Ah!

She finally takes a look at herself.

Kyle:
Oh.\!
Oh!

Kyle:
Oh, I think Darren is going to enjoy this
even more than another model kit!\!
\}(I've seen those pictures on his computer.)

She gives her breasts another squeeze.\!
And smiles.

Kyle:
Ooo, I think I should go give him his present.\!
\}(I'm going to enjoy this more too.)

She happily walks away.

passages.name: Florauna room ARG — Goddess — p1
passages.content:
Goddess Florauna:
Hero! I have seen things!\!
Dreams!\! Visions!\! Things you wouldn't 
believe!

Things that would snap your frail mortal mind
like a twig!

She pauses.

A dry twig.\!
Green twigs can be extremely tough.\!
Almost exactly unlike a mortal mind.

She pauses again.

Anyway! The visions!

I have seen a chained seed, slowly beginning
to sprout.  The seed itself is trapped, but its
roots are starting to spread and spread...

I have seen my sister Hadea! She is safe, but
eternallly trapped in an impossible task.\!
She strives and strives, but she will never 
complete it, not without aid.

And while she struggles, the spirits she keeps
locked away have made a bid for freedom...

I have seen a strange blue bird, faster than 
the wind.  Though a hungry beast forever
stalks its steps, it never falters, never fails.

It's such a funny little bird! It beeps, and it
runs, and there was this one time that the
beast tried to paint a tunnel to fool it but then
it ran through anyway and--

The head priestess clears her throat.

Head Priestess:
Oh great Florauna, I believe you are getting
just a bit off track.

Goddesss Florauna:
Oh yes, what would I do without you?

She beams at her priestess.

Goddess Florauna:
Hero, you must save my sister Hadea!

She is trapped in just the biggest store I've
ever seen!\!
One with the \{\C[27]cutest\C[0]\} outfits!

Why, I saw a skirt that would just go perfectly
with your eyes, \N[10]! 
And then you could add-

The priestess clears her throat again. 
Loudly.

Goddess Florauna:
Er, yes.  

You must free my sister Hadea!\!
Defeat the escaped spirits!\!
Find your way through the seal hiding her!\!
Complete her impossible task!

And if you did a little accessorizing while you
were there, I think it would look pretty great
on you~

System Message:
Your next challenge awaits at the department
store downtown.

System Message:
Will you be able to find the Goddess and 
complete her impossible task?

passages.name: Florauna room ARG — Goddess — p2
passages.content:
Goddess Florauna:
Hero! I am so glad to see you again!

Why, I was just thinking how lovely it would
be to see my savior!

And it looks like you have made some 
connection with forces beyond yourself, as
heroes so often do!

Let me read your energies.

She holds her hands out to you and 
concentrates.

Goddess Florauna:
I see you have made a connection with the
great and noble cow! I would say its strength
is about \V[80].

Goddess Florauna:
The power of nature itself flows through you!
About \V[76] units of nature, I'd say.

passages.name: Florauna room ARG — Goddess — p3
passages.content:
Goddess Florauna:
Oh hero! I was so sad to hear you'll be leaving
us for a while!

I look forward to your return!

Goddess Florauna:
I do love your new look though!
I'm so glad you took my advice and spruced
up your outfit a little!

passages.name: Florauna room ARG — Goddess — p5
passages.content:
Goddess Florauna:
A wonderful morning to you, \N[10]!

This is just such a wonderful day!\!
The birds are singing, the bees are buzzing,
and all the animals are screwing!

Why, it fills me with such energy!

She twirls, while birds sing in chorus and 
rabbits hump each other in the room's corners.

Goddess Florauna:
This new energy has given me all sorts of 
ideas!

Why, I think I might be able to help your 
companions blossom into their true potential!

And I could always check if you've made a
connection to the greater spirits of the world.

She holds her hands out to you and 
concentrates.

Goddess Florauna:
I see you have made a connection with the
great and noble cow! I would say its strength
is about \V[80].

Goddess Florauna:
The power of nature itself flows through you!
About \V[76] units of nature, I'd say.

Goddess Florauna:
Darling, you've been hanging out with a
dragon? Spicy!
You've absorbed \V[77] units of it's nature!

Goddess Florauna:
I'm afraid you have not made any connection
with the greater forces of our world, 
\N[1].

It's sad!\!
Tragic!\!
Go out there and explore!

The goddess presses a hand dramatically to 
her forehead.

Goddess Florauna:
Oh!\!
I'm so sorry darling, but you lack the raw 
mana I need for this!

Please, come back with some and I would
*love* to help you out.

You ask Florauna what she means by upgrading
your companions.

Goddess Florauna:
Why darling, I am the Goddess of Growth!
Of Overflowing Bounty!

Helping people grow is my duty! My calling!

Helping them blossom forth, swell into their 
true potential...\!
Why, I'd love to help even if you *hadn't* done
so much for me and my sisters!

Now, their exact upgrade will depend on their
class.

And they'll need to have advanced far enough
in it - you can't build a tower without a base!

But get far enough and who knows how many
times I can help them grow!

She hugs herself with delight.

Goddess Florauna:
Oh darling, it's going to be wonderful!

Her priestess gives a cough.

He

passages.content:
Goddess Florauna:
A wonderful morning to you, \N[10]!

Our sister Fittina is back and our power swells!

And with her here, everything else can swell
as well!

The goddess does a happy twirl.

The two of us have always bonded over our
love of bodies growing bigger, and rounder, 
and more massive.

She has always had an odd fondness for hard
muscle, while everyone knows that plush
curves are much more comfortable.

But with our powers combined once more I'm
sure we can defeat this dark goddess!

passages.name: Florauna room ARG — Head priestess — p1
passages.content:
Head Priestess:
It's so wonderful to have the goddess back 
with us!

passages.name: Florauna room ARG — Head priestess — p2
passages.content:
Head Priestess:
Thank you again for your help hero!\!
Please return soon!

passages.name: Florauna room ARG — Head priestess — p3
passages.content:
Head Priestess:
The great Florauna said she had to consult with
her sisters.\!
I hope everything is okay.

passages.name: Florauna room ARG — Head priestess — p4
passages.content:
Head Priestess:
Lady Kaede! Welcome back!

The Goddess Florauna, may she spring
bountiful forever more, has revealed to us
some of the lost secrets of crafting your
weapons!

Please, take a look!

passages.name: Florauna room ARG — Brad blessing — p1
passages.content:
You see Brad and Florauna talking.

Brad is looking the goddess up and down.

Player ( . )( . )SexGod:
Nice, nice. Could be better, but nice.

He looks back at her face.

Player ( . )( . )SexGod:
So, goddess, lady. I hear you've got a reward
for me?

Goddess Florauna:
Oh yes darling, I've heard of what you did for
my priestesses yesterday!

The goddess looks consideringly at Brad for a
moment. Then smiles.

Goddess Florauna:
Giving you a reward is the least I can do!

Are you ready to be granted one of your 
deepest desires?

Player ( . )( . )SexGod:
Go for it.

The goddess puts out her hands and 
concentrates.

There is a sudden pulse of light, so bright you
have to shield your eyes.

The light fades.

Revealing a completely unchanged Brad.

She looks down at herself in confusion and
gives her chest a poke.

\>She looks down at herself in confusion and
gives her chest a poke.\<

Her breasts suddenly spring forward.

Player ( . )( . )SexGod:
Better.

She starts feeling up her breasts with her
hands, then looks up at the goddess.

Player ( . )( . )SexGod:
Hey, thanks!

She wanders out of the room, hands still busily
squeezing and groping.

Florauna turns to her priestess.

Goddess Florauna:
At least *someone* here is properly grateful
for a blessing.

passages.name: Florauna room ARG — Kaede — p2
passages.content:
Kaede is looking down at her changed figure.

Kaede:
Ah, it dost my heart good to be a small step
back towards my former glory.

She turns to look at her tails.

Kaede:
And I have always liked the way black looks
on me.

Kaede is looking down at her changed figure.

Kaede:
Ah, it dost my heart good to be a small step
back towards my former glory.

Kaede is looking down at her changed figure.

Kaede:
I do not believe that I have ever possessed
so slight a stature.

She bounces on her feet.

Kaede:
Though it dost leave me feeling quite nimble!

Kaede:
It dost mine heart good to be able to bask
in the presence of mine goddess for a nonce.

passages.name: Pet shelter 1
passages.content:
Shelter Head Felix:
I guess if you really have to get a dog, you
can go to the other side of the counter.

But wouldn't you rather have a cat?

Shelter Head Felix:
Welcome to the pet shelter!

Let me know if you're interested in meeting
our cats!

A cat is one of the most affectionate pets you
can get, and it knows how to take care of 
itself.

passages.name: Pet shelter 1
passages.content:
Shelter Head Doug:
We've also got some cats too I guess.

But honestly, most of them are jerks.

Go to the other end of the counter if you
want to meet them anyway.

Welcome!

We've got some amazing dogs here looking
for a new home.

They're called man's best friend for a reason.
You won't find another pet as loyal or as
friendly.

passages.name: Pet shelter 1
passages.content:
There are two donation jars here, labeled
CATS and DOGS.

It looks like they have exactly the same
amount of money in each.

Donate?

Volunteer:
Thank you for your donation!

Please ask us if you're interested in meeting 
our animals.

He waits until you step away.

Out of the corner of your eye, you see him
scowling at the CATS jar.

He slips a dollar into the DOGS jar to bring
them equal again.

You don't have enough money!

Volunteer:
Thank you for your donation!

Please ask us if you're interested in meeting 
our animals.

He waits until you step away.

Out of the corner of your eye, you catch him
frowning at the DOGS jar.

He dumps a handful of change into the CATS
jar to balance it out.

You don't have enough money!

You leave the jars alone.

and cats.

They called me a heathen and made me sit in
the corner?

passages.name: Coffee shop — Coffee shop menu
passages.content:
You overhear the two baristas talking.

Barista Joel:
Have you restocked yet?

Barista Daryl:
I still haven't found a local place to get 
everything.

Barista Joel:
Have you looked?

Barista Joel:
Look, you need to get moving on this. I know
buying local is important to you, but we're
nearly out of sweeteners *and* dairy.

Barista Daryl:
Okay, fine, I'll do it tomorrow.

Barista Joel:
You'd better. \.Or I'm going to do it.

Barista Joel:
I figure I can just go to the supermarket. \.\.
Non-dairy creamer's super cheap there.

Barista Joel:
They've got bulk honey too. \.\.
Or even better, corn syrup!

Daryl dramatically clutches his chest.

Barista Daryl:
No, please! You wouldn't do that to me, would
you?

Barista Joel:
As long as you get started tomorrow I won't.

Barista Daryl:
I promise, I promise!

Joel notices you waiting at the counter.

Barista Joel:
What can I get started for you?

passages.name: Coffee shop — Kyle — p1
passages.content:
The man on the left is staring worriedly into
his drink.

Man:
I'm just worried that it'll all turn out wrong.

The other man reaches out and grabs his hand
reassuringly.

Other man:
Kyle. Kyle. It'll be fine.

We've both talked to them about joining our
relationships before. It'll all work out.

Kyle:
But Lily has never been up for it before.

Other Man:
And so we gave them space. But now Rose 
and Lily have both said they want to discuss
it.

Kyle:
Darren, that's why everything has to go right!
If this is a chance for us all to join together,
it needs to go perfectly.

And that's not happening with the store
closed.

Darren:
Look, you know that Rose and Lily care for
each other, right?

Kyle:
Yes...

Darren:
And they both care about both of us?

Kyle:
Yes...

Darren:
That's what's needed. That's the important
part.

We'll be able to work out the rest somehow,
if we're all trying.  Whatever form that takes.

Look, it's just a power outage. Soon the
store's going to open back up.

And then we're going to go back in there and
get them something that shows just how
valuable they are to us.

It'll be fine.

Kyle stares into his drink again. But he does
seem less worried.

But what if I choose the wrong gift?

Darren:
Look, you know that Rose and Lily care for
each other, right?

Kyle:
Yes...

Darren:
And they both care about both of us?

Kyle:
Yes...

Darren:
That's what's needed. That's the important
part.

We'll be able to work out the rest somehow,
if we're all trying.  Whatever form that takes.

Look, a gift is a nice idea, but it's not the
essential part. The essential part is us, and the
love we'll communicate with our gift.

Here, let's take a minute to finish our drinks
and relax.

And then we're going to go back in the store 
and get them something that shows just how
valuable they are to us.

It'll be fine.

Kyle stares into his drink again. But he does
seem less worried.

passages.name: Coffee shop — Darren — p1
passages.content:
The man on the left is staring worriedly into
his drink.

Man:
I'm just worried that it'll all turn out wrong.

The other man reaches out and grabs his hand
reassuringly.

Other man:
Kyle. Kyle. It'll be fine.

We've both talked to them about joining our
relationships before. It'll all work out.

Kyle:
But Lily has never been up for it before.

Other Man:
And so we gave them space. But now Rose 
and Lily have both said they want to discuss
it.

Kyle:
Darren, that's why everything has to go right!
If this is a chance for us all to join together,
it needs to go perfectly.

And that's not happening with the store
closed.

Darren:
Look, you know that Rose and Lily care for
each other, right?

Kyle:
Yes...

Darren:
And they both care about both of us?

Kyle:
Yes...

Darren:
That's what's needed. That's the important
part.

We'll be able to work out the rest somehow,
if we're all trying.  Whatever form that takes.

Look, it's just a power outage. Soon the
store's going to open back up.

And then we're going to go back in there and
get them something that shows just how
valuable they are to us.

It'll be fine.

Kyle stares into his drink again. But he does
seem less worried.

passages.name: Coffee shop — p1
passages.content:
Customer:
Excuse me, I'm *trying* to enjoy my drink.

passages.name: Coffee shop — p1
passages.content:
Customer:
What happened? It suddenly got really busy
in here.

passages.name: Coffee shop — p1
passages.content:
Frustrated Customer:
The department store shuts down *and* it's
going to take forever to get coffee.

Today is the worst.

passages.name: Coffee shop — p1
passages.content:
Annoyed Customer:
I can't believe they kicked us out of the
department store.

And I had just found the perfect skirt too!

passages.name: Coffee shop — p1
passages.content:
Irritated Customer:
This was supposed to be a pick-me up before
more shopping.

Now it's a pick-me-up until I can shop again.

passages.name: Coffee shop — p1
passages.content:
Customer:
I tell you, the manager of that department 
store is going to be getting quite the stronly
worded note from me.

I can't believe the power went out in a new
building. If their building is that shoddy, how
is their merchandise?

passages.name: Coffee shop — p1
passages.content:
Annoyed Customer:
I can't believe they shut down the department
store in the middle of the big opening sale!

passages.name: Coffee shop — Other counter clerk — p1
passages.content:
Barista Joel:
Whoa, we got a huge rush of people suddenly.
What happened?

passages.name: Coffee shop — Other counter clerk — p2
passages.content:
Barista Joel:
Welcome!\!
Talk to Daryl if you want to order something.

passages.name: Coffee shop — Other counter clerk — p3
passages.content:
Barista Joel:
I'm so happy to see Daryl making new drinks
again.

He's really been hurting, not being able to 
come up with anything.

passages.name: Coffee shop — Other counter clerk — p4
passages.content:
Barista Joel:
You need something to wake up someone, and
normal coffee doesn't work?

Hmmm.

Barista Joel:
Hey Daryl, do you still remember the recipe for
that super-espresso you made a few years 
back?

The one that kept us up for a week straight?

Barista Daryl:
Yeah, let me see if we've got everything.

He starts going through the shelves.

Fine ground coffee.\..\..\..\.. check.

Yerba mate.\..\..\..\.. check.

Guayusa extract.\..\..\..\.. check.

Desoxyn Lite.\..\..\..\.. check.

And that just leaves.\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..

Barista Daryl:
Hey Joel, did we ever more Guatemalan 
insanity peppers?

Barista Joel:
No.\!
I don't know why you had those in the first 
place.

Those things are *nasty*!

Barista Daryl:
For passion!\!
For art!\!

To explore never-before seen frontiers of the
barista's craft!

Joel sighs.

Barista Joel:
No, there was no way I was getting more of 
those things if we didn't need them.\!
Can you leave them out?

Barista Daryl:
Leave them out?\!
Leave them *out*?!\!
They were the heart and soul of that drink!

Without them I might be able to make a
drink that would awaken your mind, but it
wouldn't nourish your *soul*!

Also, I'm pretty sure you need the peppers \}to
make you sweat out the rest of the drink
before it makes your heart explode.

Barista Joel:
Daryl, you know I love helping you with your
art.

And you've made some stunning works of 
unparalleled creativity.

But do we need to have The Talk again about
liability and how far you can go without 
requiring a waiver?

Barista Daryl:
Fine, I'll tone it down some.\!
But it still needs an insanity pepper!\!
That's my limit!

Joel sighs and turns back to you.

Barista Joel:
And there you have it.\!
If you bring us a Guatemalan insanity pepper,
we can make you your drink.

You should check the farm in Garden Park.
They've grown some pretty weird stuff in the
past.

passages.name: Coffee shop — Other counter clerk — p5
passages.content:
Barista Daryl:
Have they found the ingredients for my genius
to work yet?

Barista Joel:
Take a look in the farm in Garden Park to see
if they've got any insanity peppers.

passages.name: Coffee shop — Other counter clerk — p6
passages.content:
Daryl takes a sniff of the pepper you hand him
and immediately starts coughing.

Barista Daryl:
Oh wow.

He continues, eyes streaming.

Barista Daryl:
That's the kick I remember!\!
With this I can make something that would
wake up a *rock*.

Barista Joel:
(May not actually work on rocks).

Barista Daryl:
Just give me a minute.

He pulls out a bunch of equipment and gets
to work.\!
Grinding, blending, filtering, until finally he 
hands pours the final product into a cup.

He starts to hand it to you, until Joel pointedly
clears his throat.

Barista Joel:
A-*hem*!

Daryl rolls his eyes.

Barista Daryl:
Fine.

He hands Joel the cup.

Barista Joel:
Order for \N[1]!

He hands you the cup.

Barista Joel:
Enjoy!

You hear them talking as you turn away.

Barista Daryl:
You know, I had forgotten how fun that was to
make. I think I'll add it to the daily special
rotation.

passages.name: Coffee shop — Other counter clerk — p7
passages.content:
Barista Joel:
Good luck with the drink!\!
And if you ever want to try a less *intense*
version, Daryl's added it to the daily specials.

Check back every day to see if it's available!

passages.name: Coffee shop — Brad — p2
passages.content:
Brad is staring dejectedly into a cup of coffee.

She sighes a deep, heartfelt sigh.

Player Brad:
I just, I just don't know what to do next.

I've spent my whole life looking for the 
perfect boobs.

And now, I've found them.

A smile briefly passes across her face, as she
looks down at her massive chest.

Player Brad:
And they're wonderful!

She hugs her chest, boobflesh squishing out
around her arms.\!
But as she releases them, her smile fades.

Player Brad:
But now that I've found them, I don't know 
what to do *next*!

Where do I go? What do I do?\!
What do I want anymore, now that I've gotten
everything I wanted?

She sighes and stares back into her coffee.

Player Brad:
Money can't buy happiness.\!
Or breasts, which are basically the same thing.

Well, implants, I guess.\!
But I don't need them!

She pats her chest, sending it wobbling.

Player Brad:
These babies are all real.

She looks a little offended.

Player Brad:
What would I use it for?\!
Boobs forced on others are cruel and 
unworthy boobs!

She gives her breasts another hug.

Player Brad:
I'm happy to lead by example.

She shakes her head vigorously.

Player Brad:
No way!\!
I want to see if I can snap this shirt.

Power to the boobs!

She looks taken aback.

Player Brad:
Bigger\..\..\..\.\.
Bigger breasts?

She looks down at herself.\!
Gives her right boob a poke.

Hefts both of them thoughtfully.

Squeezes.

Player Brad:
Huh.

She starts looking a little excited.

Player Brad:
You know, you're totally right.

Yeah!\.\.
I could always go bigger!\!
Why not?!

She gives your chest a considering look.

Player Brad:
I mean, look at you!\!
I've barely gotten started!

She's getting more and more enthusiastic 
as she speaks.

Player Brad:
Why should this be the end?

If I've reached my dreams, that just means
I didn't dream big enough!

If you're not growing, you're dying!\!
The sky's the limit!

She stands up suddenly, shouting in 
excitment.

Player Brad:
I am Brad!\!
And I'll show this lousy world bett

passages.name: Coffee shop — Coffee shop order — p1
passages.content:
Barista Daryl:
Hi, can I take your order?

We're out of the special. Too much demand
today.

And I like to make it something interesting,
but lately I just haven't been feeling it?

We've still got all the normal stuff.

Barista Daryl:
Sure, we'll have that right out for you.

Barista Joel:
I have an order for \N[1]!

Barista Joel:
Have a nice day!

passages.name: Coffee shop — Coffee shop order — p2
passages.content:
Barista Daryl:
Hi, can I take your order?

Barista Daryl:
I recommend our new drink, the flattest
white.

I've finally started to create again! To work 
my caffeinated arts!

Please, give it a try! If there's just a little more
interest, I might add it to the menu
permanently!

Barista Daryl:
Sure, we'll have that right out for you.

Barista Joel:
I have an order for \N[1]!

// Coffee shop progress advances if the player buys a flattest white.

Barista Joel:
Hey, thanks for trying the new drink.\!
Daryl was worried no one would be interested.

He's been having so much trouble coming up
with new drinks...\!
But the response has been amazing!

Barista Joel:
Have a nice day!

passages.name: Coffee shop — Coffee shop order — p3
passages.content:
Barista Daryl:
Make sure to check out the special of the day,
to the left!

I've finally starting making my special drinks
again!

What would you like?

Barista Daryl:
Sure, we'll have that right out for you.

Barista Joel:
I have an order for \N[1]!

Barista Joel:
Have a nice day!

Barista Daryl:
Sure, we'll have that right out for you.

Barista Joel:
I have an order for \N[1]!

You take a sip of your drink. Huh, this is
actually pretty good!

\N[2]:
Why do I-

Kaede:
What *is* this flavor?! Mine tongue has never
felt the like?

\N[4]: 
Why can I taste things? How can I taste 
things?!

Party experience +500!

You take a sip of your drink. Mmmm, tastes
nothing like steroids!

ATK +1!

You take a sip of your drink.\!
It's...\.\.\. well, it's exactly what the menu
said. Perfectly ordinary coffee with a pile of
cinnamon halfheartedly dumped on top.

It doesn't seem worthy of being a special.\!
Heck, it barely seems worthy of being on the 
menu at all.

It carries such a lack of inspiration, such a 
deep sense of creative failure, that it feels
like the world has grown a little dimmer 
around you.

That a touch of the magic, the joy of life, has
drained away.

On the bright side, that's great for resisting
hostile magic!\.\.
MDF +1!

Barista Joel:
You're \N[1]?

He shrugs.

Barista Joel:
Well, remember that you asked for this.

As he swings his fist towards your face, you
notice he's written your name on his knuckles.

Ow!\.\.\.
25 HP lost!

But you feel a little tougher afterwards.\!
DEF +1!

You take a sip of your drink. For a moment,
you pause to consider the flavor.\.\.
Then the caffeine hits.

The universe freezes.\!
For a single perfect moment you can see
everything, do anything.\!
Your mind commands and your body obeys.

You watch with detached interest as your hand
begins the glacial crawl to bring another sip of
this ambrosia up to your mouth.

Ponder the eons between each beat of your
heart.\!
The eternity that passes between each breath
in and breath out.

T

passages.name: Coffee shop — Shopper — p1
passages.content:
Customer:
Mmmm, there's nothing like a good cup of coffee
after a day of shopping.

She takes a deep sniff of her coffee.\!
There's a sudden *POP* as her chest swells.

Customer:
I, uh, guess this didn't fit as well as I thought.

Customer:
You're right! I shouldn't think of this as a 
problem, it's an opportunity!

passages.name: Coffee shop — Shopper — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
Mmmm...

She takes a long, happy sip of her coffee.

Customer:
Coffee after a long day of shopping is good,
and so is coffee while planning the next day
of shopping.

passages.name: Coffee shop — Shopper — p3
passages.content:
The same woman as yesterday is here, 
warming her hands on a cup of coffee.

Customer:
I had to move up a size or two, but I managed
to find some nice replacements.

She takes a deep sniff of her coffee.\!
With a loud *POP*, a button flies off the top of
her shirt, revealing a deep canyon of cleavage.

Customer:
Seriously?\!
Maybe I should go somewhere with 
better-sewn buttons.

Customer:
...\.\.This is one of my favorite stores. I'd hate
to just walk away.\!
I'll give it one more try tomorrow.

passages.name: Coffee shop — Shopper — p4
passages.content:
Customer:
And besides, I am a queen at shopping. There's
no way this store is going to defeat me.

She takes a determined sip of coffee.

passages.name: Coffee shop — Shopper — p5
passages.content:
Customer:
I just don't get it.

She stares into her coffee.

Customer:
I've used all my tricks.\!
Checked all my favorite brands.

I even got my measurements checked *three
times*.

But, well, you can see the results.

She gestures at her shirt which is trying and
failing to contain her chest.

Customer:
Maybe this sale just isn't for me.\!
Maybe I've finally met my match.

She sighes, too discouraged to even drink her
coffee.

You give her a brief pep talk.

Sales can't defeat people. The only one who
can defeat her is herself.\!
And even if she doesn't find something, isn't
the experience enough?

Isn't it worth it just for the thrill of the hunt?

Customer:
You're right!\!
I'm not going to give in until I'm sure I've seen
everything this sale has to offer!

If nothing matches my style, I can make a 
new style!

Customer:
Yeah...

She sighes and goes back to staring glumly
into her cup.

passages.name: Coffee shop — Shopper — p6
passages.content:
Customer:
Mmmm...

She takes a long, happy sip of her coffee.

Customer:
Tomorrow is going to be the big day.\!
I'll find something nice even if I have to try on
every outfit in the store!

passages.name: Coffee shop — Shopper — p7
passages.content:
Customer:
So.\!
I may have tried on every outfit in the store.

This is the best fit I could find.

She looks down at herself.

But you know what?\!
I think I kind of like this look.

Bold and unconventional, while still being 
casual.\!
Really says "I'm not afraid to relax."

Though I am probably going to have to start
shopping in speciality stores.

Which is great! Totally new stores to check
out!

She takes a long, happy sip of her coffee.

Customer:
Shopping trip: complete success!

passages.name: Coffee shop
passages.content:
Customer:
I prefer my tea, thank you.

The honey compliments it perfectly.

passages.name: Coffee shop
passages.content:
Customer:
Ah, nothing like a latte in the morning.

passages.name: Coffee shop — Alraune
passages.content:
She's holding a cup of coffee and staring at
the sweeteners.

Garden Volunteer:
Hmm... don't really feel like sugar today...\!
Artificial sweeteners taste weird...\!
Honey in coffee is weirder...

She reaches down and tries a bit of her nectar.

Garden Volunteer:
Mmmm!

She dumps more in her coffee and takes
a happy sip.

Garden Volunteer:
This is delicious!

passages.name: Coffee shop — Escaped cat — p1
passages.content:
Barista Daryl:
Yeah, that cat just showed up recently. But 
they look so comfy, I don't want to disturb
them!

passages.name: Coffee shop — Escaped cat — p2
passages.content:
Barista Daryl:
Yeah, that cat just showed up recently. But 
they look so comfy, I don't want to disturb
them!

You give Felix a call.

Shelter Head Felix:
Hello Coffee Bean.\!
I hope you know this misbehavior is going
in your permanent record.

You're lucky you didn't get roasted and 
brewed here!

Daryl gets a sudden thoughtful look.

Barista Joel:
No.

Barista Daryl:
What?

Barista Joel:
Whatever drink idea you had about brewing
cats, we are *not* serving it.

Barista Daryl:
Aww....

Meanwhile Felix has gotten Coffee Bean into 
a cat carrier.

Shelter Head Felix:
Thank you!\!
That's \v[143] out of 3 cats rescued!

passages.name: Coffee shop — Escaped cat — p5
passages.content:
Barista Daryl:
Everyone enjoyed having the cat around so 
much that we went back to the shelter and
adopted them.

If I can't serve a cat drink I can at least have
a cat!

passages.name: Coffee shop — Matcha latte — p1
passages.content:
Customer:
Lattes are fine as long as they're *matcha*
lattes.

Coffee tastes like ass.

passages.name: Coffee shop — Matcha latte — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
Lattes are fine as long as they're *matcha*
lattes.

Coffee tastes like ass.

Shouldn't that mean-

Customer:
Using it and eating it are two different things!

passages.name: Florauna room real — Day 2 start event — p1
passages.content: Your glasses suddenly turn on.

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Computer — p1
passages.content:
You log onto the local forum.

You check out the top few threads.

SocraticMachine:
I've been accepted into the closed beta for
Better Earth, which is supposed to be the hot
new ARG game.

I'm lucky Titan Games' headquarters are in
our city.

I'll be posting my thoughts as I play through.

So far the writing is incredibly cheesy. All the
characters refer to me as 'Hero', and the plot
is like someone vomited up a meal of too
much generic fantasy.

The graphics are impressive though. The 
implementation of the alternate reality is 
seamless.

Of course, I've only seen it in their building.
Which should be the easiest to program. We'll
see how it does in the real world.

Sneeple:
How's the gameplay?

EternalDarkness:
Still bitter I didn't get in on that. They only 
accepted what, six people or something?

Horndog69:
Pics or it didn't happen.

Sneeple:
Or what didn't happen?

EventBot:
Come help out at Garden Park today!
Volunteer day is from 9 am until the park
closes.

Help keep your neighborhood park running!

-EventBot
"I'm a friendly reminder!"

PeonyRose:
I know a lot of you like the park, so
here's a chance to pay it back.

AGoodBoy:
Sorry I'm going to miss it. I'll try to make it up
to you later.

ImNotDaisy:
I'll be there.

EventBot:
Come to the mall today for great savings!
Especially the blowout sale at the department
store.

Running all this weekend!

-EventBot
"I'm a friendly reminder!"

PeonyRose:
Thanks for the heads-up! I'm going to be at
the park all day (and you should be too), but
others will be interested.

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Computer — p2
passages.content:
You log onto the local forum.

You check out the top few threads.

SocraticMachine:
To remind everyone of the context of this 
review, I have been accepted into the closed 
beta of Better Earth, the hot new ARG game. 

These are my thoughts after the first day of testing.

My rating is still positive. The game continues
to impress the more time I spend with it.

I previously called out the writing as a
problem, and it continues to be painfully 
cliche. However, some good points have 
become clear.

As far as I can tell, every member of the beta
is following a different quest chain. I have not
seen anyone else doing the same actions or
getting the same rewards.

I can only speculate that they have managed
to procedurally generate quests that feel like
they were written by a real person, albiet one
with a desperate need for more originality.

The fact that these quests all include different
real-world actions only increase the admiration
I have for this acheivement.

The graphics and integration with the world
also continue to amaze. Even though an event
changed my current appearance to this,
everything continues to feel absolutely real.

Horndog69:
Sold!

Was it a random event? Are hot gacha avatars
a thing now?

What happens if you jump up and down?
Can you take off your equipment and post 
more pics?

SocraticMachine:
It's fascinating to see the world from this new
perspective. Everything looks and feels 
different.

I have not been able to find a place where the
simulation fails no matter how daring the
exploration.

I don't see how any other company could
possibly approach this level of verismilitude.
But then I didn't think Terra Games could 
either.

Current rating: A must play!

EternalDarkness:
Now I'm even more salty I didn't get in!
Just, so much salt.

Horndog69:
Pics! More pics!

CoveredInBees!:
I know I've been talking about this for a while,
but I've finally gotten the chance to try making
my own honey!

I'm so excited!

AGoodBoy:
I thought you lived in

passages.content:
You log on to the local forum and check out
the top few threads.

LordOfTheBeans:
Looks like the department store is closed today
"for clean-up"?

Whatever happened yesterday must have
made a real mess.

Jimbo:
There's something weird going on, right?\!
It's not just me?

PeonyRose:
They say they're going to make up for it with
an amazing sale.

ImNotDaisy:
I hope so! We need something nice to wear!

SocraticMachine:
birb.\!
typing with toes hard\!
flying fun

EternalDarkness:
Uh, are you okay?

SocraticMachine:
yes

It now loads forums twice as fast!

passages.content:
You overclock your computer.

It now loads forums twice as fast!

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Mirror
passages.content:
You concentrate and your hands fly to your
face. The quickly begin scrubbing it free of dirt
you didn't even realize was there.

Hey, you clean up nice!

And your face is left pleasantly tingling from
the cleaning.

Though it looks a little different than before.
Must have been more dirt on it than you
thought.

Your face is still clean from the last time. No 
need to clean it again.

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Exit — p1
passages.content: It's too late to go outside.

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Exit — p2
passages.content:
System Message:
Good morning playtesters!
Please stop by the Terra Games offices for 
your next quest!

System Message:
And thank you again for helping Terra Games!

You see the bus just pulling up.

Where would you like to go?

System Message:
Downtown is still under construction.
Please excuse our dust!

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Exit — p3
passages.content:
You see the bus just pulling up.

Where would you like to go?

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Exit — p4
passages.content:
System Message:
Good morning playtesters!
Today marks the official end of the Better
Earth playtest!

System Message:
Please stop by the Terra Games office for 
the final activities!\!
And thank you again for all your help!

Head to Terra Games?

As you get ready to leave, \N[2] stumbles
up to you.\!
She looks completely exhausted.

\N[2]:
I-\. *yawn*\. was up all night studying those
bits I tore off the "robot".

I think-\.\. I think I should take a nap.

She stumbles back over to the desk and sits
down.\!
Then pillows her head on her arms and 
immediately falls asleep.

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Exit — p5
passages.content: It's too late to go outside.

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Exit — p6
passages.content:
Goddess Earth:
Hero! We have important information for you!

Please come visit us!

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Bed — p1
passages.content:
Go to bed for the night?

You slide into bed and close your eyes.

As you start to fall asleep, your mind drifts
back over the events of the day.

Your initial change is still a shock. But you've
managed to avoid anything else happening.

Several parts of your body have started to
shift as the game does... \.\. whatever it's 
doing.

You've changed quite a bit, your body shifting
time and time again.

You're almost starting to get used to the 
sensation of flesh reshaping itself.

Your last thoughts about the day, just before
you finally drop into a deep dreamless sleep,
are mostly:

Time passes.

Unwillingly, you start to slowly wake up.

Trying to move as little as possible, you feel
around for your glasses and slide them on. \.\.

You open your eyes to the sight of Kaede,
virtual hands groping through your chest.\.

\N[2] is futilely trying to pull her away.

\N[2]:
Stop that already!

Kaede:
But aren't you curious?

\N[10] grew these in a day! \.\.

Don't you want to know how they feel?

Look at the bountiful breasts \N[10]
already has! And they grew them in a day! \.\.

Don't you want to know how they feel?

\N[2]:
No, just stop!

Kaede:
You don't understand how rare it is for a mortal 
to have this much flexibility. And I can feel 
they have the potential to be so much more.

Kaede:
There has been little change, but there is so
much potential here. So many slumbering
possibilities.

She licks her lips and gives \N[2] a
too-large grin.

Kaede:
Won't it be fun to find out how much 
\N[10] can grow?

You must have moved, because they both
suddenly notice you're awake.\.
\N[2] starts babbling apologies.

\N[2]:
I'm sorry! I tried to stop her but she wouldn't-

Kaede grins at you and takes one last swipe
through your chest. Then she moves back to
let you up.

Kaede:
Aren't you curious too?

You may have rejected the Goddess's 
blessing, but you must realize how rare it is 
for a mortal like you to get this much of a 
chance to change.

Kaede:
I can see you're uncer

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Bed — p2
passages.content:
As you start to fall asleep, your mind drifts
back over the events of the day.

Your initial change is still a shock. But you've
managed to avoid anything else happening.

Several parts of your body have started to
shift as the game does... \.\. whatever it's 
doing.

You've changed quite a bit, your body shifting
time and time again.

You're almost starting to get used to the 
sensation of flesh reshaping itself.

Your last thoughts about the day, just before
you finally drop into a deep dreamless sleep,
are mostly:

Time passes.

Unwillingly, you start to slowly wake up.

Trying to move as little as possible, you feel
around for your glasses and slide them on. \.\.

You hear a click as you do.

You open your eyes to the sight of Kaede,
virtual hands groping through your chest.\.

\N[2] is futilely trying to pull her away.

\N[2]:
Stop that already!

Kaede:
But aren't you curious?

\N[10] grew these in a day! \.\.

Don't you want to know how they feel?

Look at the bountiful breasts \N[10]

She licks her lips and gives \N[2] a

Won't it be fun to find out how much

You must have moved, because they both

\N[2]:
I'm sorry! I tried to stop her but she wouldn't-

Kaede grins at you and takes one last swipe

Kaede:
Aren't you curious too?

You may have rejected the Goddess's
