chance to change.

Kaede:
I can see you're uncertain. Maybe you're 
afraid.

But you must kn

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Bed — p3
passages.content:
You're not tired yet. There's a whole day of 
game playing ahead of you!

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Bed — p4
passages.content: Go to sleep for the night?

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Bed — p5
passages.content:
You're not tired yet. There's a whole day of 
game playing ahead of you!

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Bed — p6
passages.content:
Go to sleep for the night?

// Run cutscenes, if any need to be run. Remember to change this in 
both ARG and real if adding additional cutscenes.

// If the player has read Arcadia announcing herself on the forum, the 
next night Arcadia will create minions to go out and change things.

// Boolean to make sure only one cutscene is played per morning, 
even if the requirements for multiple are met.

Goddess Arcadia:
Hero!\!
My minions have reported that you spent all
today getting your rocks off!

I knew you'd start to enjoy yourself 
eventually!

You hear muffled whispers, and one or two
cries of "Burn!"

Goddess Arcadia:
\}What...\. What do you mean that's not what
they did? You said-\.\.
Wait, really?

She nervously clears her throat.

Goddess Arcadia:
Well, this still counts as my victory!\!
\}No I will not be taking any questions.

The feeling of her presence fades.

// Boolean to make sure only one cutscene is played per morning, 
even if the requirements for multiple are met.

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Elina — p1
passages.content:
// Ask how she's doing, ask about class, let her bring something up?

\N[2]:
We did it!

We survived.\. That's good.\. That's very good.

And we saved a goddess.

I think I'm starting to get the hang of this.

\N[2]:
Tomorrow will be less dangerous, right?

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Elina — p3
passages.content:
\N[2] is humming happily to herself as
she tinkers with the arms she took from
\N[4]'s robot.

\N[2]:
That was exciting! \!
Seeing that "robot" move.

I'm sure I can learn something if I keep
studying it!

\N[2]:
Programmed?\! What?!\! 
I...

She freezes.\!
Not like a person does.\!
Like software does.

You hadn't realized until now, but people, real
3-D humans, are never truly still.\!
Their chests move as they breathe.\! They sway
a little on their feet as they stand.

There are a thousand tiny motions, never the
same twice, that communicate that you're 
seeing a real person in front of you.

And it's only as \N[2] goes as flat and still
as an image on a computer screen that you
realize she had all those little tics as well.

And then she blinks, and suddenly she's a 
moving, breathing person again.

\N[2]:
Sorry, I got distracted for a moment there.\!
Did you ask something?

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Elina — p4
passages.content:
\N[2] is still sitting here, studying the arms 
she tore off \N[4]'s robot.

\N[2]:
If I trace this wire\. *yawn*\. here...\!
Yes! That's part of the\. *yawn*\. trigger!

She blinks up at you.

\N[2]:
Oh, is it morning already?

She sways a little.

\N[2]:
It was so interesting I lost track of time.\!
But maybe...\.\. maybe I should take a little
nap.

She puts her head down on the desk and
immediately falls asleep.

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Elina — p5
passages.content:
\N[2] has pillowed her head on one of the
robot arms and gone to sleep.

\N[2]:
I said I'd come later!

She goes back to sleep.

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Near Clothes — p1
passages.content:
Kaede is...\| examining your underwear?

Kaede:
So this is what they're wearing these days...

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Near Clothes — p2
passages.content:
Kaede:
I was looking at those!

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Near Clothes — p3
passages.content:
\N[2]:
I tried to stop her...

\N[2]:
You don't have to listen to her, you know.

It's okay to stay as you are if you want to.

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Near Clothes — p5
passages.content:
\N[4] is muttering to herself.

\N[4]:
If possession didn't work, what are my other
options?

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — In front of fridge — p2
passages.content:
Kaede:
While I guarded my goddess, the winds
carried me word of a Jimmy of Dean.

Tell me, do you have his modern-day
ambrosia?

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — In front of fridge — p4
passages.content:
\N[4]:
Hey, don't worry about today.\!
Everyone fails their first overthrowing.\!
You'll get them next time!

\N[4]:
Hmmph.\!
This is what happens when you don't have 
the drive to seize power immediately.

You brought this mess on yourself.

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — In front of fridge — p5
passages.content:
Kaede:
Greetings on this fine morn, hero!\!
Verily, I do look forward to another day of
adventure at thine side.

I haven't had this much fun in centuries!

Kaede:
This form ist an odd one, but enjoyable.

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — In front of fridge — p6
passages.content:
Kaede:
Ah, it dost mine heart good to see another
goddess freed.

Soon we shalt overthrow that dark goddess!

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Iterate day — p2
passages.content:
You wake up to the sound of repeated chimes
from your glasses.

You fumble them on to see \N[4] with
her arms buried elbow-deep in your chest.

\N[4]:
Why isn't this working?! \!
I should be able to just slip in and take over!

System Message:
Error! Haunting does not include possession! \.
Ability disabled!

\N[4]:
Stop saying that!!!

Kaede is perched on your dresser laughing at
her.

Kaede:
Perhaps a little more to the left?\!
Try squeezing yon mammary, might as well
get some pleasure out of thine incompetence!

Kaede is perched on your dresser giving 
advice.

Kaede:
No, slightly to thy left!\!
Thou art completely missing the soul! Have
you even done a possession before?

So this is your life now.\!
Starting every day with someone's arms
buried in your chest.

You sigh and walk through \N[4] to get 
ready for the day.

\N[4]:
Hey!

\N[4]:
I'll get you next time!\!
You and your little kitsune too!

Kaede laughs.

You compliment \N[4] on her betrayal.\!
Really, she should have had you. You didn't
see this one coming at all.

\N[4]:
Shut up!\!
I don't need your pity!

Still, you think she looks a little pleased.

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Iterate day — p3
passages.content:
// This is for compatability. There are some tfs that could have 
happened before I added tracking for people changed, so this is 
checking if those have happened and then iterating the appropriate 
variables.

// If the milkshake quest was completed but the farm hasn't been 
iterated (due to using a save from an older version), iterate it now.

You wake up to the sound of voices from your
glasses.\!
It seems you were so tired last night you 
forgot to take them off.

\N[2]:
What?\.\. No!

Kaede:
But this is how we have awakened the hero
every day so far!\.\. And now thine turn hast
come!

Wouldst thou go against tradition?

\N[4]:
I hate to say it, but furry and brainless has a
point. \.\.
I took my turn yesterday.

\N[2]:
You were trying to steal \n[10]'s soul!

\N[4]:
And now it's your turn!

Kaede:
Compose thyself, the hero's soul is safe. Just,\.
give that heroic chest a gentle caress.\!
T'will be fun for both you and them.

\N[2]:
I said no!

...\.\.This is kind of weird, but you have to admit
this is a pretty funny prank to play on 
\N[2].

...\.\.It looks like this really *is* your life now.\!
Sigh.

You open your eyes to see your three 
companions arguing.

Kaede notices you stirring.

Kaede:
Look, thou hast nearly lost the moment with
thy indecision!\!
Needs must!

She hops on to your bed and begins to make 
squeezing motions at your chest.

You both freeze for a moment when you
actually feel a faint pressure on your chest.

It's faint.\.\. More like the touch of the wind 
than anything else.\.\.
But you can definitely feel something where
her hands pass.

Kaede:
Praise Florauna!

She redoubles her efforts, rubbing and 
caressing and even bending down to give
gentle nips with her teeth.

Your back arches by itself.\!
It's only feather-light touches!\.\.
Why does it feel so *good*?!

But her touch is so light that it doesn't do much
at all.

System Message:
Good morning \N[10]!\.\.
Today-\.\.\. Uh...

System Message:
...Am I interrupting something?

System

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Iterate day — p4
passages.content:
You wake up slightly during the night when
something soft and warm slips into your bed.\!
Purring, it lulls you back to sleep.

// Morning cutscenes. Each cutscene should be wrapped in its own 
chack for switch 160, so that only one can trigger.

You are awakened by the sound of something
incredibly heavy hitting the ground.

Mysterious Voice:
\{ONE.

Goddess Hadea:
Stop that!\!
Don't lift that!

Mysterious Voice:
\{TWO.

You can somehow hear faint voices.

Goddess Hadea:
I'm not responsible for anything that breaks
when you do that!

Mysterious Voice:
\{THREE.

Goddess Hadea:
Stop already!\!
We have things to do!\!
A dark goddess to fight!

Mysterious Voice:
\{FOUR.

Goddess Hadea:
Isn't that a better thing to do with your 
muscles?!

Mysterious Voice:
\{FIVE.

Goddess Hadea:
Don't just move on to your next exercise,
respond to me!!

The goddess's voice suddenly gets louder.

Goddess Hadea:
Hero!\!
Another of our sisters has reappeared!

But the idiot musclehead won't listen to a word
I say!

Go!\!
Recruit her to our cause!\!
Bring her to help!

And if you can make sure I'm not responsible
for anything she breaks, do it!

As she finishes speaking, you get a hazy vision
of a building.\!
The\..\..\..\. Louis Armstrong Rec Center?\!
Looks like that's your next destination.

// Changes > 20, gym completed (except for talking to fittina), Miku 
event not started yet, Miku tf forum thread read (only shows up 
after changes >20)

.\..\..\..Five more minutes.

// If no morning cutscene was played, get out of bed normally.

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Underwear — p1
passages.content:
You quickly gather up your clothes and stuff 
them in your laundry basket.

Kaede:
Hey!

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Smaller clothes pile — p1
passages.content:
You quickly gather up your clothes and stuff 
them in your laundry basket.

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Pride muttering — p2
passages.content:
You can hear \N[4] talking to herself.

\N[4]:
So what if you're tied to some idiots?\!
Doomed to haunt them for eternity?\!
Come on, you've worked with worse!

Remember, these are idiots.\! 
Morons.\!
Gullible fools!

It's just a setback. \!
Just a little setback.
You can do it, \N[4]!

She frowns.

No, I meant \N[4]. \!
My name is \N[4]!

\N[4]:
Stupid curse.

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Bathroom — p2
passages.content:
\N[4] gives you a bright, insincere smile.

\N[4]:
Why hello Hero!\!
I'm so happy to be saving puppies with you!

Or whatever other trite inanities you want me
to help with!

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Bathroom — p4
passages.content:
\N[2]:
So we may have created a new goddess.\!
A new dark goddess.

Who's angry at us.\!
And can casually obliterate an archmage.

She takes a few panicky breaths.

I'm sure this is fine.\!
Everything's fine.

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Character in front of dresser — p2
passages.content:
// Responses:
1: Told her to check behind the dresser
2: Told her to check the computer
3: Told her no.

Kaede is sticking her face in each drawer, 
one-by-one.

Kaede:
Boring. \!
Boring. \!
Boring.

She turns to you.

Kaede:
Why dost thou only have clothes within thy
drawers?

Is it not tradition to keep one's pornography
within thy bedroom?

Kaede:
Aha!

She sticks her head behind the dresser to 
check it out.

You give a quick explanation of internet porn.

Kaede:
Ah, so thine pornography is in this "computer"
then!

Kaede:
Fie! Thou art a poor host indeed!

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Character in front of dresser — p3
passages.content:
Kaede has stuck her head behind the dresser.

Kaede:
Ooo, that is a most prodigious pair of breasts!

Kaede:
Or perhaps a thigh?\!
Tentacles?

It is hard to discern what lies within these 
sheaves of paper.

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Character in front of dresser — p5
passages.content:
Kaede is still searching through your dresser.

Kaede:
Hmph. If thou wishst not to reveal thy
pornography, it must especially "freaky".

I must see it!

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Character in front of dresser — p7
passages.content:
Kaede:
Curse that interfering spirit!

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Looking at computer side — p2
passages.content:
Kaede:
So this is the site of all the pornography.

She sticks her head into the computer.

Kaede:
I see...\!
Tiny wires,\! green plates,\! spinning disks... 

She turns to you.

Kaede:
Thou art into some weird stuff!\!
Nice.

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Looking at computer side — p5
passages.content:
Kaede:
A new goddess!\!
To see such an ascension is a rare sight 
indeed!

What dost thou think her domain will be?\!
Pleasure?\.\.
Pornography?\.\.
Erotic woodprints?

Regardless, it should be most exciting!

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Looking at computer side — p6
passages.content:
\N[2]:
That "computer" woman showed up just in 
time.

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Looking at computer side — p8
passages.content:
\N[2]:
Let's try not to anger any more goddesses 
today, okay?

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Looking at computer side — p9
passages.content:
\N[2]:
I didn't want to interrupt...\!
But what does 'swole' even *mean*?

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — On dresser trigger — p2
passages.content:
Kaede:
Worry not, if she had truly gained control of 
thyself I would have stopped her.

After seeing if she did anything interesting,
of course.

Kaede:
Hmph.\!
At least she was proving herself more 
entertaining than thou hast been so far.

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — p1
passages.content:
\N[4]:
Ugh, do we have to go out adventuring 
*every* day?

Why can't we do something fun for once?\!
Like watch TV?\!
Or plot world conquest!

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — p2
passages.content:
\N[4] is sulking.\!
More than usual.

\N[4]:
Stupid furface thinks she knows it all.

I don't see *her* breaking out of the 
underworld.\!
She never freed a goddess.

Who does she think she is?!

passages.name: Apartment 1 ARG — Escaped cat — p1
passages.content:
There's a cat sleeping in your kitchen.

How did she even get here?

You give Felix a call, and he shows up to
collect the cat.

Shelter Head Felix:
Oh hello Rip Van Winkle.\!
Did you have a good nap?

He coaxs her into a carrier, where she
immediately goes back to sleep.

Thank you!\!
That's \v[143] out of 3 cats rescued!

passages.name: Floor 1 real — Tailor door — p1
passages.content:
The sign says "Tailor".
But it looks like the store closed when 
everyone left.

passages.name: Floor 1 real — Tailor door — p2
passages.content: Looks like the tailor is still closed.

passages.name: Floor 1 real — Employees only — p1
passages.content:
\{EMPLOYEES ONLY

It's locked.

passages.name: Floor 1 real — Employees only — p2
passages.content: Your glasses turn on.

passages.name: Floor 1 real — Autorun event — p1
passages.content: There is a click as your glasses turn on.

passages.name: Floor 1 real — Autorun event — p3
passages.content:
You step into a surprisingly busy store.

Manager:
Everyone! Please! Quiet down!

Now, as I was saying, we're prepared to 
reward anyone who can figure out how to 
make the store *stay* clean!

Money!\.\. Free merchandise!\.\. A shiny
rock Jane found in her backyard!

One of the employees gives a lazy wave.

Jane:
It's a really cool rock!

The manager turns back to the crowd.

Manager:
Now, let me demonstrate the problem.

She begins folding the messy pile of clothes
next to her.

Manager:
We've been cleaning ever since the power
came back on.

She finishes folding and stacks the clothes in
a neat pile on the nearest display.

Manager:
And yet-
\>What's that over there?!

Everyone turns as she points off to the side.

After a few moments of staring at nothing, she
turns back.

Manager:
And as you can see, the clothes I just cleaned
up have mysteriously ended up back on the
floor while we weren't looking.

This keeps happening!\.\.
All.\.\. The.\.\. Time!!!

She breathes angrily for a few seconds.

Manager:
So please, *someone* figure this out.

passages.name: Floor 1 real — Elevator — p1
passages.content:
No response.\!
Looks like the power is still out.

passages.name: Floor 1 real — Elevator — p2
passages.content:
After a moment's wait, the elevator arrives on
your floor.

passages.name: Floor 1 real — Elevator — p3
passages.content:
The doors slide open, revealing the elevator
is packed solid, floor to ceiling, with furniture.

Manager:
Yes, clearing that out is on the list.

passages.name: Floor 1 real — Elevator — p4
passages.content:
After a moment's wait, the elevator arrives on
your floor.

passages.name: Floor 1 real — Transfer — p2
passages.content: Your glasses turn on.

passages.name: Floor 1 real — Rick — p2
passages.content:
Some Guy:
Rick, come on. Look at this voltmeter. Just
look at it.\!
The local field is completely haywire!

We could be looking at the first signs of Earth's
magnetic field reversing. Localized right in our
town!

Rick:
Jim.\.\. Jimbo.\.\. Jim-my-boy.\.\.
You cannot explain what's happening here
with conventional science!

This is a manifestation of something greater.\!
Something from beyond our reality.

He grabs the instrument his friend is holding
and twists a dial.

Rick:
Just look at the ohmmeter!

Jim grabs the instrument back and turns a 
dial.

Jim:
That's ridiculous!\!

If you took a look at the *ammeter*, you'd 
see that there's no sign of the signature
everyone says an interdimensional incursion
would have!

Did you even look at the poll I posted?!

passages.name: Floor 1 real — Rick — p3
passages.content:
Rick:
Poor Jim, always blind to the true wonder of 
what's happening in front of him.

The extradimension beings could hand him a
note and he'd claim it was a spontaneous
materialization of the auora borealis.

passages.name: Floor 1 real — Jim — p2
passages.content:
Some Guy:
Rick, come on. Look at this voltmeter. Just
look at it.\!
The local field is completely haywire!

We could be looking at the first signs of Earth's
magnetic field reversing. Localized right in our
town!

Rick:
Jim.\.\. Jimbo.\.\. Jim-my-boy.\.\.
You cannot explain what's happening here
with conventional science!

This is a manifestation of something greater.\!
Something from beyond our reality.

He grabs the instrument his friend is holding
and twists a dial.

Rick:
Just look at the ohmmeter!

Jim grabs the instrument back and turns a 
dial.

Jim:
That's ridiculous!\!

If you took a look at the *ammeter*, you'd 
see that there's no sign of the signature
everyone says an interdimensional incursion
would have!

Did you even look at the poll I posted?!

passages.name: Floor 1 real — Jim — p3
passages.content:
Jim:
Rick has always had a more mystical bent.\!
But everything happening here can *clearly*
be explained with science.

passages.name: Floor 1 real — Detritus 1 — p2
passages.content:
You clean up the pile of clothes.

But as soon as you turn your back, they're
back on the floor.

passages.name: Floor 1 real — Employee 1 — p2
passages.content:
Employee:
At this point I just pretend like I'm working 
whenever the manager looks over.\!
Not much point in anything else.

passages.name: Floor 1 real — p2
passages.content:
Employee:
Welcome!

To make up for all the downtime, we're 
throwing the extra-special Swell Times sale.

Pick anything you like and wear it up to the 
register. If it fits, you'll get 90% off the price!

Anything that doesn't fit is full price, but why
should that matter?

passages.name: Floor 1 real
passages.content:
TAILOR
Alterations, repairs, and fashion suggestions!

passages.name: Floor 1 real — Manager — p2
passages.content:
Manager:
Please, please, I hope you can help.

Would you like to see that demonstration
again?

She neatly stacks the clothes again.

Silently, you both turn and look away.

When you turn back, the clothes are a mess
again.

Something is obviously happening here, but
you can't seem to see it.

passages.name: Floor 1 real — Manager — p3
passages.content:
The manager has cleaned up the clothes 
again, but this time nothing seems to happen.

Manager:
And sometimes things stay clean.\.\.
For a bit.

We haven't been able to figure out *why* it
works sometimes.

passages.name: Floor 1 real — Manager — p4
passages.content:
Manager:
You fixed it?\!
You're sure?

She waves over an employee and tells them 
to try cleaning up some of the mess upstairs.

A few minutes later, she gets the report that
everything seems to finally be going well.

Manager:
Thank you!\!
Thank you so much!

We want to make sure this holds, but if it does
we'll be reopening tomorrow.

Come see me then for your rewards.\!
And I hope you'll check out the *exciting*
apology sale we'll be holding while you're
here.

passages.name: Floor 1 real — Manager — p5
passages.content:
Manager:
Thank you so much! We couldn't have opened
without you!

Here, let me give you your rewards.\!
Here's the money.

Gained $1500!

Some very shiny rocks.

Gained 2 raw mana!

And some *very* exclusive merchandise.

Gained Exclusive Lingerie!

Manager:
Do you know they only made five hundred of
those?\!
Collectors' items, all of them.

Sold out almost immediately.

You're lucky to get the last set we had!

Oh, and I'd be happy to let you use my 
employee discount. Just let me know.

passages.name: Floor 1 real — Manager — p6
passages.content:
Manager:
You'd like to buy some things?\!
Sure!

Though I'm afraid these aren't eligible for the 
sale.

Manager:
Oh, you're looking for a swimsuit?

Sure, I've got one that a customer just
returned that I don't think can go back on 
the rack.

Too, uh, stretched out.

She rummages around in a display.

Manager:
Here, take it.\!
Consider another thank you for cleaning up 
the place.

Store swimsuit acquired!

passages.name: Floor 1 real — Customer 1 — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
I don't have any ideas. But I can check to see
if there's anything I want to get when they
reopen!

passages.name: Floor 1 ARG — Tailor door — p1
passages.content:
The sign says "Tailor".
But it looks like the store closed when 
everyone left.

passages.name: Floor 1 ARG — Tailor door — p2
passages.content: Looks like the tailor is still closed.

passages.name: Floor 1 ARG — Employees only — p1
passages.content:
A complicated magical sigil pulses over this 
door.

It won't open.

passages.name: Floor 1 ARG — Robot — p1
passages.content:
Still and silent. \.\.
Must be out of power.

passages.name: Floor 1 ARG — p1
passages.content:
Greedy Ghost:
All the clothes are so pretty.\.
I want them ALL.

passages.name: Floor 1 ARG — Ghost mastermind — p2
passages.content:
Probably Evil Woman:
Come \N[10],
your quest awaits!

passages.name: Floor 1 ARG — Autorun event — p1
passages.content:
Mysterious Woman:
Hero \N[10]!
Thank goodness you're here!

It's horrible, horrible!
The spirits of the restless dead have broken
free of Hadea's prison!
You must help!

I have found where Goddess Hadea is trapped,
weak and isolated and so very very
vulnerable.

As a weak innocent I know what this is like, so
I wish to help her. \.

But I am too weak!

You must help me hero! Help open her prison!

Come, I will take you there!

Mysterious Woman:
The goddess is trapped behind this barrier, but
I have found this barrier-breaking device-

\N[2]:
What IS this?

Is it a metal golem? No, it doesn't have any 
power runes.

Mysterious Woman:
It's a- \.\.\^

\N[2]:
Could it be a new type? Or is it one of this
world's "machines"?

Mysterious Woman:
Yes, it's for- \.\.\^

\N[2]:
It looks like it's made to move. But how does
it move? I don't sense any enchantments!

Mysterious Woman:
You see, it- \.\.\^

\N[2]:
And what about-\.\.\^

Mysterious Woman:
Shut up you blithering simpleton and let me
talk!

This device I found has the power to take on
this seal and the goddess inside! It's the
perfect tool to solve all my problems!

But these idiot ghosts have grown drunk on 
their freedom and refuse to listen to me!
Which is why I need pawns like you!

Your role is to go to the top floor and turn back
on the power! Nothing more!

She breathes heavily for a minute.

Mysterious Woman:
Er, please, Hero.\!
Noble \N[10].\!
Help a weak innocent?

Mysterious Woman:
I don't think you understood hero, I'm an
innocent who needs help.

Won't you take my quest?

Mysterious Woman:
You know what, I'm just going to pretend you
said yes.

Mysterious Woman:
Thank you great \N[10]!

I know where the mystical artifact you must
activate is, but I cannot fight my way through
the spirits guarding it.

Follow me and I shall guide you to it.

But take care, for many types of spirits lurk
between us and our goal. 

Most of the Sins, I believe. The Underworld
loves its theming.

Come, I shall guide you to the

passages.name: Floor 1 ARG — Autorun event — p3
passages.content:
You step into a surprisingly busy store.

Manager:
Everyone! Please! Quiet down!

Now, as I was saying, we're prepared to 
reward anyone who can figure out how to 
make the store *stay* clean!

Money!\.\. Free merchandise!\.\. A shiny
rock Jane found in her backyard!

One of the employees gives a lazy wave.

Jane:
It's a really cool rock!

The manager turns back to the crowd.

Manager:
Now, let me demonstrate the problem.

She begins folding the messy pile of clothes
next to her.

Manager:
We've been cleaning ever since the power
came back on.

She finishes folding and stacks the clothes in
a neat pile on the nearest display.

Manager:
And yet-
\>What's that over there?!

Everyone turns as she points off to the side.

Spirit:
Aha!\.\. Exactly as planned!

The spirit knocks over the pile of clothes, then
leaps through the ceiling and vanishes.

As everyone else looks at the clothes, your 
whole party turns to \N[4].

\N[4]:
What?\|
Why are you are staring at me?!

Kaede:
Hast thou a sister perhaps?\.\. A twin?

\N[2]:
Are there MORE of you?!

She suddenly looks excited.

Do the others have "robots" too?

\N[4]:
No! There isn't anyone in the world, under or 
over, who could match my genius!

After all, what even is their plan?\!
Mildly inconvenience a few humans?\!
I could come up with better plans in my sleep!

passages.name: Floor 1 ARG — Rage spirit — p1
passages.content:
Angry Ghost:
Augh! I can't believe I missed today's sales!

Being dead is so AGGRAVATING!

passages.name: Floor 1 ARG — p1
passages.content:
Sleepy Ghost:
What? \|
Am I supposed to be haunting something?

passages.name: Floor 1 ARG — p1
passages.content:
Jealous Ghost:
Why do they get to shop, huh?\.
Why shouldn't I get to go shopping too? \.
Why should they get all the deals?

passages.name: Floor 1 ARG — Old intro
passages.content:
\N[2]:
Hey, how does your door opener work?

Probably Evil Woman:
It's a robot.

\N[2]:
Could you explain that more? What's a robot?\.
What operating principles does it use? \.
What's its power source?

Probably Evil Woman:
It-

\N[2]:
Is it an armored living creature, or something
like a golem? Does it eat?

Probably Evil Woman:
It's a robot! It's a machine that moves and 
does things! None of that other stuff is 
important!

She paused for a moment, then smiles.

Probably Evil Woman:
Look, it needs to eat the lightning. You can get
it started on the top floor.

Do that and I'll be happy to show you how it
works up close and personal.

passages.name: Floor 1 ARG — Elevator — p1
passages.content:
No response.\!
Looks like the power is still out.

The call button flickers for a moment, then
fades.
It must need more power than you can
provide.

passages.name: Floor 1 ARG — Elevator — p2
passages.content:
After a moment's wait, the elevator arrives on
your floor.

passages.name: Floor 1 ARG — Elevator — p3
passages.content:
The doors slide open, revealing the elevator
is packed solid, floor to ceiling, with furniture.

Manager:
Yes, clearing that out is on the list.

passages.name: Floor 1 ARG — Elevator — p4
passages.content:
After a moment's wait, the elevator arrives on
your floor.

passages.name: Floor 1 ARG — Spirit vendor — p1
passages.content:
Spirit:
I know we're supposed to be vengeful, but 
I've never been able to get into the whole
venging thing.

Can I interest you in some deals instead?

passages.name: Floor 1 ARG — Ghost boss fight — p2
passages.content:
About To Betray You:
Thank you so much for your help hero. Now,
it is time for your reward.

Her human form shimmers and fades.

Pride Spirit:
All this time, and you never even had a clue!\!
Do you simpletons have the barest hint of an
idea of what is going to happen to you now?

Kaede gives her a bored look.

Kaede:
Now that we've turned on the power, you shall
attempt to destroy us with yon golem.

She starts counting off on her fingers.

Kaede:
Thou are the one who led the escape of the 
spirits from yon underworld.

Thou plots to overthrow the Goddess Hadea
and steal her power. 

Thou art so bad at command that thy own
armies barred thy way, forcing you to seek
our aid.

Thou hast the acting ability of a stunned 
patridge, and the intellect of a particularly
dim trout.

Have I missed aught of the truth?

\N[2]:
I think that's everything.  Though you should 
have called us simpletons more.

Pride Spirit:
You forgot one thing! \!
The part where I \C[2]\{KILL YOU!!

Pride Spirit:
No! I was so close!\!
Ultimate power was within my reach!

Fine.\! Fine! \!
You may have defeated me.\!
You may have somehow seen through my 
disguise.

You may have the ridiculous stroke of luck
that let you beat my robot.\!
But I will have the last laugh!

It will drain me for centuries, but I curse you!\!
May you rot in agony forevermore!

System Message:
Please hold while we load the automated 
cursing algorithms.\!
This will be fun.

\>\^Generating Curse:
\>Stats halved\.

\>\^Generating Curse:
\>Reticulated splines\.

\>\^Generating Curse:
\>Himboization\.

\>\^Generating Curse:
\>Twerking\.

\>\^Generating Curse:
\>Ennui\.

\>\^Generating Curse:
\>The Jigglies\.

\>\^Generating Curse:
\>Nihilistic Chipmunks\.

\>\^Generating Curse:
\>Your curse here!\.

\>\^Generating Curse:
\>Endless meetings\.

\>\^Generating Curse:
\>Filler\.

\>\^Generating Curse:
\>Filler Filler\.

\>\^Generating Curse:
\>Unsexy vampires\.

\>\^Generating Curse:
\>Uncanny Valley Girl\.

\>\^Generating Curse:
\>

passages.name: Floor 1 ARG — Rick — p2
passages.content:
Some Guy:
Rick, come on. Look at this voltmeter. Just
look at it.\!
The local field is completely haywire!

We could be looking at the first signs of Earth's
magnetic field reversing. Localized right in our
town!

Rick:
Jim.\.\. Jimbo.\.\. Jim-my-boy.\.\.
You cannot explain what's happening here
with conventional science!

This is a manifestation of something greater.\!
Something from beyond our reality.

He grabs the instrument his friend is holding
and twists a dial.

Rick:
Just look at the ohmmeter!

Jim grabs the instrument back and turns a 
dial.

Jim:
That's ridiculous!\!

If you took a look at the *ammeter*, you'd 
see that there's no sign of the signature
everyone says an interdimensional incursion
would have!

Did you even look at the poll I posted?!

passages.name: Floor 1 ARG — Rick — p3
passages.content:
Rick:
Poor Jim, always blind to the true wonder of 
what's happening in front of him.

The extradimension beings could hand him a
note and he'd claim it was a spontaneous
materialization of the auora borealis.

Rick has always had a more mystical bent.\!
But everything happening here can *clearly*
be explained with science.

passages.name: Floor 1 ARG
passages.content:
TAILOR
Alterations, repairs, and fashion suggestions!

passages.name: Tailor Real — Rose and Lily — p1
passages.content:
\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[5]We have a very important date coming
up tomorrow.
\C[30]Everything needs to be perfect.

\C[5]And so we want to look our best!
\C[30]But... \C[0]*She gestures at the nectar 
running down both their bodies*
\C[30]We'd ruin all our favorite outfits.

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]And this *has* to go perfectly.
\C[5]The conversation is going to be hard
enough! 

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[5]We don't want to have to worry about our
appearance too.

\C[30]You look great Lily, we look great, but 
we want to maybe try to look a little more 
normal?

*Lily blushes dark green*
\C[5]We'd like to have the relationship talk
first and save the nudist talk for later.

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
(Together)\C[30]But \C[5]that \C[30]means \C[5]clothes!

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]We've already tried everything we own.
\C[5]It was horrible! The mess! The laundry!

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]Can you make something for us?
\C[5]Or suggest something?

\C[5]Can you recommend something?
\C[30]Or make something?

Tailor:
To start, what is that liquid like?

With their permission, he takes a little. He rubs
it thoughtfully between his fingers.

Tailor:
You're right, this would make an absolute 
mess with most fabrics.

We should be able to start you with some 
swimsuits.  Those will still get wet, but they
should bear it a lot better.

Over the long term, I could probably do
something with some raincoat material. Real
waterproof stuff, that is.

And something you can still go wild with:
accessorize!

We've got some very cute hats. Plus you should
be able to do all sorts of things with hair clips
and ribbons.

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
(Together)\C[30]Thank \C[5]you!

They lean forward and give him a massive
hug, planting a kiss on either side of his head.

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]This will make everything so much easier.
\C[5]Only one thing to worry about!

\C

passages.name: Tailor Real — Tailor — p1
passages.content:
Tailor:
Hmmm... 
It's a good thing I enjoy a challenge.

passages.name: Tailor Real — Tailor — p2
passages.content:
Tailor:
It's a shame the department store isn't open
yet, but at least I've got some orders to take
up my time.

passages.name: Tailor Real
passages.content: Dapper!

passages.name: Tailor Real
passages.content:
A glamorous winter coat, perfect for a night
out on the town.

passages.name: Tailor Real
passages.content: A stunning red dress.

passages.name: Tailor Real
passages.content:
Looks suitable for casual wear, but still has
a very classy feel to it.

passages.name: Tailor Real
passages.content:
Rough wearing clothes for outdoor exploration.
Though they still look well-tailored and
fashionable.

passages.name: Tailor Real
passages.content:
Entirely filled with green suits. Who is this for,
the Riddler?

passages.name: Tailor Real
passages.content:
An assortment of outfits, all of them classy
and well-made.

Though my face itches and I'm not sure how

passages.name: Floor 3 real — Clerk — p1
passages.content:
Sleeping Clerk:
\.\.Just five more minutes...

Clerk:
I wasn't sleeping! I'm working hard!

Oh, you're not my manager.

passages.name: Floor 3 real — Clerk — p2
passages.content:
Sleeping Clerk:
\.\.I'll start cleaning soon...
\.\.Just five more minutes...

Clerk:
I'm awake! I'm awake!\!
Time to clean!

She runs off into the store.

passages.name: Floor 3 real — Elevator — p1
passages.content:
No response.\!
Looks like the power is still out.

passages.name: Floor 3 real — Elevator — p2
passages.content:
After a moment's wait, the elevator arrives on
your floor.

passages.name: Floor 3 real — Elevator — p3
passages.content:
The doors slide open, revealing the elevator
is packed solid, floor to ceiling, with furniture.

Looks like you won't be riding it today.

passages.name: Floor 3 real — Stairs up — p1
passages.content: Your glasses turn on.

passages.name: Floor 3 real — Stairs up — p1
passages.content: Your glasses turn on.

passages.name: Floor 3 real — Pet clerk 2 — p2
passages.content:
Sleeping Clerk:
\.\.I'll start cleaning soon...
\.\.Just five more minutes...

Clerk:
I'm really awake this time!\!
Time to clean!

She runs off into the store.

passages.name: Floor 3 real
passages.content:
The rug here looks pretty comfortable. Take
a quick nap?

System Message:
Good night.

HP/MP restored!

passages.name: Floor 3 real — Guard spirits event — p1
passages.content: Your glasses turn on.

passages.name: Floor 3 real — Red Lever — p1
passages.content: The lever is off. Turn it on?

passages.name: Floor 3 real — Red Lever — p2
passages.content: The lever is on. Turn it off?

passages.content: The lever is off. Turn it on?

passages.name: Floor 3 real — Green Lever — p2
passages.content: The lever is on. Turn it off?

passages.content: The button is off. Turn it on?

passages.content: The button is on. Turn it off?

passages.content: The button is off. Turn it on?

passages.content: The button is on. Turn it off?

passages.content: The switch is off. Turn it on?

passages.content: The switch is on. Turn it off?

passages.content: The switch is off. Turn it on?

passages.name: Floor 3 real — Poker prelude — p1
passages.content:
You hear muffled voices to the south.

Aha! Full house! Let that blow your mind!

I lose again! \! I'll win next time, just you wait.
And then I'll show you all.

passages.name: Floor 3 real
passages.content:
The rug here looks pretty comfortable. Take
a quick nap?

System Message:
Good night.

HP/MP restored!

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Specials — p1
passages.content:
TODAYS SPECIAL
Sold out

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Specials — p2
passages.content:
TODAY'S SPECIAL
        Flattest White

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Specials — p3
passages.content:
TODAY'S SPECIAL
        Superfood Smoothie
Made with a blend of quinoa, pomegranite,
and every other fad food you've ever seen.

So healthy everyone around you will get
smarter too!

          TODAY'S SPECIAL
        The Breakfast of Champions
Carefully made with a minimum of illegal 
performance enhancers!

          TODAY'S SPECIAL
       Coffee With Cinnamon
A tribute to my recent creative block.

          TODAY'S SPECIAL
    We Punch You in the Face\!
                 Literally.

Why would we offer this?\!
Why would you order it?!

          TODAY'S SPECIAL
                The LD10

Caffeine with a hint of coffee flavor.
Enough energy to get through the day or die trying.

          TODAY'S SPECIAL
        The Sparkle Unicorn

Feel like a pretty pretty princess.\!
One absolutely *drenched* in edible glitter.

          TODAY'S SPECIAL
            Super Espresso

Strip the scales from your eyes!\!
Feel more awake than you've ever been!

\}Not recommended for anyone sensitive to
caffeine, capsacin or stimulants, people with
heart conditions or anxiety, or anyone really.

\}User assumes all responsibility and liability 
for making the absurd decision to actually 
consume this monstrosity. 
On the bright side, it's tasty.

          TODAY'S SPECIAL
        Ambrosia Protein Shake

Build muscle!\!
Build muscle on top of muscle!\!
    \{ \{GET SWOLE!!!

Daryl notices you looking at the board.

Barista Daryl:
Today's special came to me in a dream.\!
Weird dream, but its promises of "getting
totally swole dude!" seem to hold up.

          TODAY'S SPECIAL
             Candy Shake

Make your teeth cry for mercy!
Made out of exotic candy, it'll take you to
another level!

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Coffee shop order — p1
passages.content:
Barista Daryl:
Hi, can I take your order?

We're out of the special. Too much demand
today.

And I like to make it something interesting,
but lately I just haven't been feeling it?

We've still got all the normal stuff.

Barista Daryl:
Sure, we'll have that right out for you.

Barista Joel:
I have an order for \N[1]!

Barista Joel:
Have a nice day!

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Coffee shop order — p2
passages.content:
Barista Daryl:
Hi, can I take your order?

Barista Daryl:
I recommend our new drink, the flattest
white.

I've finally started to create again! To work 
my caffeinated arts!

Please, give it a try! If there's just a little more
interest, I might add it to the menu
permanently!

Barista Daryl:
Sure, we'll have that right out for you.

Barista Joel:
I have an order for \N[1]!

// Coffee shop progress advances if the player buys a flattest white.

Barista Joel:
Hey, thanks for trying the new drink.\!
Daryl was worried no one would be interested.

He's been having so much trouble coming up
with new drinks...\!
But the response has been amazing!

Barista Joel:
Have a nice day!

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Coffee shop order — p3
passages.content:
Barista Daryl:
Make sure to check out the special of the day,
to the left!

I've finally starting making my special drinks
again!

What would you like?

Barista Daryl:
Sure, we'll have that right out for you.

Barista Joel:
I have an order for \N[1]!

Barista Joel:
Have a nice day!

Barista Daryl:
Sure, we'll have that right out for you.

Barista Joel:
I have an order for \N[1]!

You take a sip of your drink. Huh, this is
actually pretty good!

\N[2]:
Why do I-

Kaede:
What *is* this flavor?! Mine tongue has never
felt the like?

\N[4]: 
Why can I taste things? How can I taste 
things?!

Party experience +500!

You take a sip of your drink. Mmmm, tastes
nothing like steroids!

ATK +1!

You take a sip of your drink.\!
It's...\.\.\. well, it's exactly what the menu
said. Perfectly ordinary coffee with a pile of
cinnamon halfheartedly dumped on top.

It doesn't seem worthy of being a special.\!
Heck, it barely seems worthy of being on the 
menu at all.

It carries such a lack of inspiration, such a 
deep sense of creative failure, that it feels
like the world has grown a little dimmer 
around you.

That a touch of the magic, the joy of life, has
drained away.

On the bright side, that's great for resisting
hostile magic!\.\.
MDF +1!

Barista Joel:
You're \N[1]?

He shrugs.

Barista Joel:
Well, remember that you asked for this.

As he swings his fist towards your face, you
notice he's written your name on his knuckles.

Ow!\.\.\.
25 HP lost!

But you feel a little tougher afterwards.\!
DEF +1!

You take a sip of your drink. For a moment,
you pause to consider the flavor.\.\.
Then the caffeine hits.

The universe freezes.\!
For a single perfect moment you can see
everything, do anything.\!
Your mind commands and your body obeys.

You watch with detached interest as your hand
begins the glacial crawl to bring another sip of
this ambrosia up to your mouth.

Ponder the eons between each beat of your
heart.\!
The eternity that passes between each breath
in and breath out.

T

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Kyle — p1
passages.content:
The man on the left is staring worriedly into
his drink.

Man:
I'm just worried that it'll all turn out wrong.

The other man reaches out and grabs his hand
reassuringly.

Other man:
Kyle. Kyle. It'll be fine.

We've both talked to them about joining our
relationships before. It'll all work out.

Kyle:
But Lily has never been up for it before.

Other Man:
And so we gave them space. But now Rose 
and Lily have both said they want to discuss
it.

Kyle:
Darren, that's why everything has to go right!
If this is a chance for us all to join together,
it needs to go perfectly.

And that's not happening with the store
closed.

Darren:
Look, you know that Rose and Lily care for
each other, right?

Kyle:
Yes...

Darren:
And they both care about both of us?

Kyle:
Yes...

Darren:
That's what's needed. That's the important
part.

We'll be able to work out the rest somehow,
if we're all trying.  Whatever form that takes.

Look, it's just a power outage. Soon the
store's going to open back up.

And then we're going to go back in there and
get them something that shows just how
valuable they are to us.

It'll be fine.

Kyle stares into his drink again. But he does
seem less worried.

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Kyle — p2
passages.content:
The man on the left is staring worriedly into
his drink.

Man:
I'm just worried that it'll all turn out wrong.

The other man reaches out and grabs his hand
reassuringly.

Other man:
Kyle. Kyle. It'll be fine.

We've both talked to them about joining our
relationships before. It'll all work out.

Kyle:
But Lily has never been up for it before.

Other Man:
And so we gave them space. But now Rose 
and Lily have both said they want to discuss
it.

Kyle:
Darren, that's why everything has to go right!
If this is a chance for us all to join together,
it needs to go perfectly.

But what if I choose the wrong gift?

Darren:
Look, you know that Rose and Lily care for
each other, right?

Kyle:
Yes...

Darren:
And they both care about both of us?

Kyle:
Yes...

Darren:
That's what's needed. That's the important
part.

We'll be able to work out the rest somehow,
if we're all trying.  Whatever form that takes.

Look, a gift is a nice idea, but it's not the
essential part. The essential part is us, and the
love we'll communicate with our gift.

Here, let's take a minute to finish our drinks
and relax.

And then we're going to go back in the store 
and get them something that shows just how
valuable they are to us.

It'll be fine.

Kyle stares into his drink again. But he does
seem less worried.

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — p1
passages.content:
Customer:
Excuse me, I'm *trying* to enjoy my drink.

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Sleepy ghost — p1
passages.content:
Sleepy Ghost:
Iced caffe mocha... \.\.
Venti...\.\.
Two extra shots...

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Ghosts and Brad — p1
passages.content:
Spirit 1:
I miss the days I could drink coffee...

Spirit 2:
I don't. I prefer tea.

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Ghosts and Brad — p3
passages.content:
Brad is staring dejectedly into a cup of coffee.

She sighes a deep, heartfelt sigh.

Player Brad:
I just, I just don't know what to do next.

I've spent my whole life looking for the 
perfect boobs.

And now, I've found them.

A smile briefly passes across her face, as she
looks down at her massive chest.

Player Brad:
And they're wonderful!

She hugs her chest, boobflesh squishing out
around her arms.\!
But as she releases them, her smile fades.

Player Brad:
But now that I've found them, I don't know 
what to do *next*!

Where do I go? What do I do?\!
What do I want anymore, now that I've gotten
everything I wanted?

She sighes and stares back into her coffee.

Player Brad:
Money can't buy happiness.\!
Or breasts, which are basically the same thing.

Well, implants, I guess.\!
But I don't need them!

She pats her chest, sending it wobbling.

Player Brad:
These babies are all real.

She looks a little offended.

Player Brad:
What would I use it for?\!
Boobs forced on others are cruel and 
unworthy boobs!

She gives her breasts another hug.

Player Brad:
I'm happy to lead by example.

She shakes her head vigorously.

Player Brad:
No way!\!
I want to see if I can snap this shirt.

Power to the boobs!

She looks taken aback.

Player Brad:
Bigger\..\..\..\.\.
Bigger breasts?

She looks down at herself.\!
Gives her right boob a poke.

Hefts both of them thoughtfully.

Squeezes.

Player Brad:
Huh.

She starts looking a little excited.

Player Brad:
You know, you're totally right.

Yeah!\.\.
I could always go bigger!\!
Why not?!

She gives your chest a considering look.

Player Brad:
I mean, look at you!\!
I've barely gotten started!

She's getting more and more enthusiastic 
as she speaks.

Player Brad:
Why should this be the end?

If I've reached my dreams, that just means
I didn't dream big enough!

If you're not growing, you're dying!\!
The sky's the limit!

She stands up suddenly, shouting in 
excitment.

Player Brad:
I am Brad!\!
And I'll show this lousy world bett

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Spirit 2 — p1
passages.content:
Spirit 1:
I miss the days I could drink coffee...

Spirit 2:
I don't. I prefer tea.

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — p1
passages.content:
Annoyed Customer:
I can't believe they shut down the department
store in the middle of the big opening sale!

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — p1
passages.content:
Customer:
I tell you, the manager of that department 
store is going to be getting quite the stronly
worded note from me.

I can't believe the power went out in a new
building. If their building is that shoddy, how
is their merchandise?

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — p1
passages.content:
Irritated Customer:
This was supposed to be a pick-me up before
more shopping.

Now it's a pick-me-up until I can shop again.

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — p1
passages.content:
Annoyed Customer:
I can't believe they kicked us out of the
department store.

And I had just found the perfect skirt too!

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Other counter clerk — p1
passages.content:
Barista Joel:
Whoa, we got a huge rush of people suddenly.
What happened?

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Other counter clerk — p2
passages.content:
Barista Joel:
Welcome!\!
Talk to Daryl if you want to order something.

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Other counter clerk — p3
passages.content:
Barista Joel:
I'm so happy to see Daryl making new drinks
again.

He's really been hurting, not being able to 
come up with anything.

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Other counter clerk — p4
passages.content:
Barista Joel:
You need something to wake up someone, and
normal coffee doesn't work?

Hmmm.

Barista Joel:
Hey Daryl, do you still remember the recipe for
that super-espresso you made a few years 
back?

The one that kept us up for a week straight?

Barista Daryl:
Yeah, let me see if we've got everything.

He starts going through the shelves.

Fine ground coffee.\..\..\..\.. check.

Yerba mate.\..\..\..\.. check.

Guayusa extract.\..\..\..\.. check.

Desoxyn Lite.\..\..\..\.. check.

And that just leaves.\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..

Barista Daryl:
Hey Joel, did we ever more Guatemalan 
insanity peppers?

Barista Joel:
No.\!
I don't know why you had those in the first 
place.

Those things are *nasty*!

Barista Daryl:
For passion!\!
For art!\!

To explore never-before seen frontiers of the
barista's craft!

Joel sighs.

Barista Joel:
No, there was no way I was getting more of 
those things if we didn't need them.\!
Can you leave them out?

Barista Daryl:
Leave them out?\!
Leave them *out*?!\!
They were the heart and soul of that drink!

Without them I might be able to make a
drink that would awaken your mind, but it
wouldn't nourish your *soul*!

Also, I'm pretty sure you need the peppers \}to
make you sweat out the rest of the drink
before it makes your heart explode.

Barista Joel:
Daryl, you know I love helping you with your
art.

And you've made some stunning works of 
unparalleled creativity.

But do we need to have The Talk again about
liability and how far you can go without 
requiring a waiver?

Barista Daryl:
Fine, I'll tone it down some.\!
But it still needs an insanity pepper!\!
That's my limit!

Joel sighs and turns back to you.

Barista Joel:
And there you have it.\!
If you bring us a Guatemalan insanity pepper,
we can make you your drink.

You should check the farm in Garden Park.
They've grown some pretty weird stuff in the
past.

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Other counter clerk — p5
passages.content:
Barista Daryl:
Have they found the ingredients for my genius
to work yet?

Barista Joel:
Take a look in the farm in Garden Park to see
if they've got any insanity peppers.

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Other counter clerk — p6
passages.content:
Daryl takes a sniff of the pepper you hand him
and immediately starts coughing.

Barista Daryl:
Oh wow.

He continues, eyes streaming.

Barista Daryl:
That's the kick I remember!\!
With this I can make something that would
wake up a *rock*.

Barista Joel:
(May not actually work on rocks).

Barista Daryl:
Just give me a minute.

He pulls out a bunch of equipment and gets
to work.\!
Grinding, blending, filtering, until finally he 
hands pours the final product into a cup.

He starts to hand it to you, until Joel pointedly
clears his throat.

Barista Joel:
A-*hem*!

Daryl rolls his eyes.

Barista Daryl:
Fine.

He hands Joel the cup.

Barista Joel:
Order for \N[1]!

He hands you the cup.

Barista Joel:
Enjoy!

You hear them talking as you turn away.

Barista Daryl:
You know, I had forgotten how fun that was to
make. I think I'll add it to the daily special
rotation.

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Other counter clerk — p7
passages.content:
Barista Joel:
Good luck with the drink!\!
And if you ever want to try a less *intense*
version, Daryl's added it to the daily specials.

Check back every day to see if it's available!

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — p1
passages.content:
Frustrated Customer:
The department store shuts down *and* it's
going to take forever to get coffee.

Today is the worst.

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — p1
passages.content:
Customer:
What happened? It suddenly got really busy
in here.

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Shopper — p1
passages.content:
Customer:
Mmmm, there's nothing like a good cup of coffee
after a day of shopping.

She takes a deep sniff of her coffee.\!
There's a sudden *POP* as her chest swells.

Customer:
I, uh, guess this didn't fit as well as I thought.

Customer:
You're right! I shouldn't think of this as a 
problem, it's an opportunity!

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Shopper — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
Mmmm...

She takes a long, happy sip of her coffee.

Customer:
Coffee after a long day of shopping is good,
and so is coffee while planning the next day
of shopping.

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Shopper — p3
passages.content:
The same woman as yesterday is here, 
warming her hands on a cup of coffee.

Customer:
I had to move up a size or two, but I managed
to find some nice replacements.

She takes a deep sniff of her coffee.\!
With a loud *POP*, a button flies off the top of
her shirt, revealing a deep canyon of cleavage.

Customer:
Seriously?\!
Maybe I should go somewhere with 
better-sewn buttons.

Customer:
...\.\.This is one of my favorite stores. I'd hate
to just walk away.\!
I'll give it one more try tomorrow.

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Shopper — p4
passages.content:
Customer:
And besides, I am a queen at shopping. There's
no way this store is going to defeat me.

She takes a determined sip of coffee.

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Shopper — p5
passages.content:
Customer:
I just don't get it.

She stares into her coffee.

Customer:
I've used all my tricks.\!
Checked all my favorite brands.

I even got my measurements checked *three
times*.

But, well, you can see the results.

She gestures at her shirt which is trying and
failing to contain her chest.

Customer:
Maybe this sale just isn't for me.\!
Maybe I've finally met my match.

She sighes, too discouraged to even drink her
coffee.

You give her a brief pep talk.

Sales can't defeat people. The only one who
can defeat her is herself.\!
And even if she doesn't find something, isn't
the experience enough?

Isn't it worth it just for the thrill of the hunt?

Customer:
You're right!\!
I'm not going to give in until I'm sure I've seen
everything this sale has to offer!

If nothing matches my style, I can make a 
new style!

Customer:
Yeah...

She sighes and goes back to staring glumly
into her cup.

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Shopper — p6
passages.content:
Customer:
Mmmm...

She takes a long, happy sip of her coffee.

Customer:
Tomorrow is going to be the big day.\!
I'll find something nice even if I have to try on
every outfit in the store!

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Shopper — p7
passages.content:
Customer:
So.\!
I may have tried on every outfit in the store.

This is the best fit I could find.

She looks down at herself.

But you know what?\!
I think I kind of like this look.

Bold and unconventional, while still being 
casual.\!
Really says "I'm not afraid to relax."

Though I am probably going to have to start
shopping in speciality stores.

Which is great! Totally new stores to check
out!

She takes a long, happy sip of her coffee.

Customer:
Shopping trip: complete success!

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG
passages.content:
Customer:
Ah, nothing like a latte in the morning.

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG
passages.content:
Customer:
I prefer my tea, thank you.

The honey compliments it perfectly.

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Alraune
passages.content:
She's holding a cup of coffee and staring at
the sweeteners.

Garden Volunteer:
Hmm... don't really feel like sugar today...\!
Artificial sweeteners taste weird...\!
Honey in coffee is weirder...

She reaches down and tries a bit of her nectar.

Garden Volunteer:
Mmmm!

She dumps a handful in her coffee and takes
a happy sip.

Garden Volunteer:
This is delicious!

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Escaped cat — p1
passages.content:
Barista Daryl:
Yeah, that cat just showed up recently. But 
they look so comfy, I don't want to disturb
them!

passages.name: Coffee shop ARG — Escaped cat — p2
passages.content:
Barista Daryl:
Yeah, that cat just showed up recently. But 
they look so comfy, I don't want to disturb
them!

You give Felix a call.

Shelter Head Felix:
Hello Coffee Bean.\!
I hope you know this misbehavior is going
in your permanent record.

You're lucky you didn't get roasted and 
brewed!

Daryl gets a sudden thoughtful look.

Barista Joel:
No.

Barista Daryl:
What?

Barista Joel:
Whatever drink idea you had about brewing
cats, we are *not* serving it.

Barista Daryl:
Aww....

Meanwhile Felix has gotten Coffee Bean into 
a cat carrier.

Shelter Head Felix:
Thank you!\!

passages.content:

passages.name: Street ARG — Car front — p2
passages.content:
A lightning bolt shoots from your fingers, and
you hear the car engine rumble to life.

But the energy keeps pouring out of you.

And then the stream of electricity arcs.

Driver:
Whaaaaaaaa!!!

The stream of electricity continues to pour
from your fingers, despite anything you do to
try and stop it.

So much energy passes through the car that
it begins to glow and twist. \.\.
Meanwhile the man is nearly floating off the 
ground on a web of electricity.

The hood of the car rises into the air, pulled 
up by strings of lightning.\!
Folds itself much smaller.

Then slams into the man, wrapping around 
him.

Then another piece.\.\. And another.

The whole scene grows so bright that you
have to close your eyes, tears streaming down
your face.

// 0 = event not activated
1 - pulled self away, no TF.
2 - just changed
3 - day after change

Until finally you feel the flow of energy abate.

You open your eyes.

The car has vanished, leaving behind a single
changed figure.

Driver:
Uh...

She looks ill.

Driver:
I...\.\.\. ugh...

She spasms, making a loud clicking noise.\.\.
She clutches her stomach.

She clicks again, looking like she's about
to heave.

And again.

Except this time it's followed by the sound of
an engine starting up.

She gives a massive belch, blasting you with
the smell of exhaust.\!
Then pounds her chest a time or two, 
straightening up and looking relieved.

Driver:
Oh, that feels so much better.

She turns to you.

Driver:
Thanks for the help!

passages.name: Street ARG — Driver — p2
passages.content:
The man is staring blankly into the open hood
of the car.

Driver:
Why won't you start?

I gave you gas.\.\. I changed your oil.\!
Do you need a jump? \.\.A new battery?\|
A hug?

Driver:
Ow!\.\.
I don't need a jump, the car does!

passages.name: Street ARG — Driver — p3
passages.content:
She's carefully rocking back and forth on her
wheels.

Driver:
So that's the brake...\|
That's the gas...

She starts, then blushes.

Driver:
And that must be the stick shift.

Driver:
Hee!\.\.
That tickles!

passages.name: Street ARG — Driver zooming — p2
passages.content:
Driver:
Wheeeeee!\!
This is so much more fun than driving!

And I get double the gas mileage!

passages.name: Street ARG — Escaped dog — p1
passages.content:
A dog is here eagerly sniffing at a dumpster.

You give Doug a call and he arrives a few
minutes later.

Shelter Head Doug:
Come on Daisy, good girls don't roll in trash.\!
We are going to have to give you such a bath
when you get back.

\v[144] out of 3 dogs rescued!

passages.name: Street ARG — Kyle — p1
passages.content:
Kyle:
Oh no oh no oh no.

He's staring at the box for the model robot he
just bought.

Kyle:
Batteries not included.\!
My gift for Darren needs to be perfect! It can't
be missing anything!

He turns to the department store.

Kyle:
It's okay Kyle. You can just go buy batteries.
It'll be fine.

He turns back.

Kyle:
But I shouldn't *need* to buy batteries!\!
It's fine, this is fine!

I don't need to make everything perfect, no
one will mind. No one.

Kyle:
...But what if he does?

Kyle:
He won't.

Kyle:
Unless...

Kyle:
Come on Kyle, just make a decision!\!
One or the other!

Kyle:
I'm stuck.\!
I-\. I just can't-

I just can't get the strength to move!\!
It'll all go wrong somehow!

passages.name: Street ARG — Kyle — p2
passages.content:
Kyle:
I-\. I can't.

I just need a nudge.\!
The energy to choose!\!
Augh, why am I like this?!

He takes a deep breath.

Kyle:
No, no, this is fine.\!
I can just give this to Darren.

I wouldn't mind if he gave me this, so he
won't mind if I give him this.\!
He won't hate me forever for a single tiny
mistake.

He takes another deep breath, not noticing
his boxed robot starting to crackle with
electricity.

You have to shield your eyes as it grows 
brighter and brighter.

Kyle:
This will all be fine.\!
This is fine.\!
This is fine.

This is-\!
\{ALL SYSTEMS OPTIMAL

The light fades, revealing a changed Kyle.

Kyle:
I'm going to-

She jerks as she realizes her hands are 
empty.

Kyle:
Oh no.\!
Oh no oh no oh no.

She starts frantically patting herself down, 
searching for the box.

Kyle:
It can't be missing.\!
Oh god, how is it missing.

She checks the former location of her pockets,
her front...

Kyle:
Where?\!
Where?!\!
W- where...?

Her hands find something unexpected on her
chest.

Kyle:
What...?

She squeezes.

Kyle:
Ah!

She finally takes a look at herself.

Kyle:
Oh.\!
Oh!

Kyle:
Oh, I think Darren is going to enjoy this
even more than another model kit!\!
\}(I've seen those pictures on his computer.)

She gives her breasts another squeeze.\!
And smiles.

Kyle:
Ooo, I think I should go give him his present.\!
\}(I'm going to enjoy this more too.)

She happily walks away.

Let me know if you're interested in meeting

A cat is one of the most affectionate pets you
can get, and it knows how to take care of 
itself.

want to meet them anyway.

Welcome!

We've got some amazing dogs here looking
for a new home.

They're called man's best friend for a reason.
You won't find another pet as loyal or as
friendly.

our animals.

scowling at the CATS jar.

them equal again.

You don't have enough money!

Volunteer:

our animals.

You leave the jars alone.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG — Shirt statue — p1
passages.content:
There's no response.

You'll need to free the others before you can
help this poor man.

The potion runs off uselessly.\!
It looks like a potion isn't enough to cure 
what's wrong here.

You dust off the petrified customer and give
them a quick polish.\!
If you have to be a statue, you might as well
look your best!

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG — Shirt statue — p2
passages.content:
...\!
...\!
...\!
...\.meow\....

You put the shirt on the statue.

Hair practically explodes out of the customer's
head as stone turns back into flesh.

You hear sputtering as she paws at the 
suddenly much longer hair covering her face.

Customer:
What?\.\. What?!\!
Where did-?!\! How did-?!?!

She suddenly calms down, pulling her hair 
out of her face with the ease of long practice.

Customer:
Argh!



First that stupid alarm makes me rush out of 
the changing rooms without my clothes, then
my hair tie vanishes!

I don't care anymore about evacuating! \!
I'm going to go find my pants!

She stalks off to the south.

The potion runs off uselessly.\!
It looks like a potion isn't enough to cure 
what's wrong here.

You dust off the petrified customer and give
them a quick polish.\!
If you have to be a statue, you might as well
look your best!

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG — Clothing pile 2 — p1
passages.content:
A pile of clothing.\!
Must have been left behind when everyone
evacuated.

You smooth the wrinkles out of the clothes
and hang them back up on the racks.

Looks like someone left $50 in a pocket!
Nice!

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG — Apron statue — p1
passages.content:
Petrified Customer:
I had just found something white...\!
But now everything's grey...

You place the item on the statue.

A ghost leaps out of nowhere and snatches it!\!
The ghost runs off into the floor.
That must not have been the right item.

You tie the apron onto the petrified man.

Customer:
What- what happened?

She looks around frantically.

Something happened! I-\. something feels 
wrong!

She looks down at herself.



Customer: I-\! I!\!
*She blushes*
I can't believe I went out in this!

I can't believe I forgot to change back after
this morning...\!
I save it for special occasions.

A ghost leaps out of nowhere and snatches it!\!
The ghost runs off into the floor.
That must not have been the right item.

A ghost leaps out of nowhere and snatches it!\!
The ghost runs off into the floor.
That must not have been the right item.

A ghost leaps out of nowhere and snatches it!\!
The ghost runs off into the floor.
That must not have been the right item.

A ghost leaps out of nowhere and snatches it!\!
The ghost runs off into the floor.
That must not have been the right item.

Another envy spirit springs out of hiding to the
south. \!
That must be the last one! Catch it!

The potion runs off uselessly.\!
It looks like a potion isn't enough to cure 
what's wrong here.

You dust off the petrified customer and give
them a quick polish.\!
If you have to be a statue, you might as well
look your best!

I can't believe I'm wearing this in public!

She pauses and looks around.

But no one seems to mind...

...Maybe I should wear it out more.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG — Apron statue — p3
passages.content:
Customer:
(She thinks I look good!)\!
(She thinks I'd make a good maid!!)

I'd love to serve you m'lady!

(Wearing my costume outside was the best 
mistake I ever made!)

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG — Ghost Mastermind — p1
passages.content:
Probably Evil Woman:
Here's the second floor, clothing and 
accessories. \!
It's okay I guess.

Probably Evil Woman:
Ugh. Envy spirits.
Thieving little pests.

*She raises her voice*
They are \{the dregs of the underworld!

\{That's right you little pests,
I mean you!

Probably Evil Woman:
There.

\N[2]:
Envy spirits? Are they dangerous?

Probably Evil Woman:
*She scoffs*
Yeah, maybe if you had a *soul* they would
be.

Kaede barely chokes back a laugh.

Probably Evil Woman:
*She raises her hand to her mouth with an
exaggerated gasp of surprise*
That's me!\! That's us!

We're in danger! \!
We should leave this floor as soon as possible.

This way to the stairs!

The probably evil woman stops in front of what
appears to be the statue of a customer.

Probably Evil Woman:
This poor fool. One of those spirits must have
fixated on something he had, and stole it and
his vitality.

\N[2]:
Is there any way to help him?

Probably Evil Woman:
*Rolls her eyes*
Oh sure, we *could* hunt down the spirit that
stole his item and return it to him.

That should give his vitality back.\!
But that would take *forever*.

Let the idiot face the consequences of being
too stupid to run. We have better things to do.

Almost Certainly Evil Woman:
It's a good thing I chased away those spirits,
otherwise we might have some problems.

She's too distracted talking to you and walks
straight into another petrified customer.

Almost Certainly Evil Woman:
Now we just need to-

Almost Certainly Evil Woman:
Uh...

Almost Certainly Evil Woman:
Huh.\! This is the only path to the stairs.\!

Well, simple enough. If you could just smash
this unfortunate fool, we can get through.

Kaede:
Yes, that would be the heroic thing to do, would
it not?\! Smiting a poor innocent?

Almost Certainly Evil Woman:
Uh, um, the plight of these poor unfortunates
has truly touched my pure and innocent
heart.

Let's \.\.*sigh* \.\.rescue them.

She examines the statues.

Almost Certainly Evil Woman:
This one looks like he's be

Employee:
Sir, I'd really advise just getting one as

A pet is a lot of work to care for, and it's best

Customer:

Or no, a snake?\!
Or...

Employee:
Are you sure you don't want to hold one of

Customer:

Employee:

Customer:
Hmmm...

Customer:

Which do you like more? Snakes or rabbits?

Customer:

I would like to be introduced to your politest

She's a real cutie!

grow out into inch-long claws.

to spread down his fingers from the point of
contact.

Both hands are now developing a coat of pink
scales, even as they slim down.

the customer transfers the snake up to his
shoulders.

look of long elegant gloves.

Wow, she really is affectionate!

Ugh, I WANT you to talk to me!\!
You NOT-DISGUSTING deviant!

\c[2]Guard Spirit 2:
Such a SMALL butt...

\c[2]Guard Spirit 2:
It's not the most beautiful thing I've ever
seen...

\c[2]Guard Spirit 2:
Go AWAY!\!
*Sniffling* I'm not sad for you at all!

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG — Guard spirit 1 — p2
passages.content:
\c[3]Guard Spirit 1:
Do you need to...\! uh...\!
\{WOW.

\c[2]Guard Spirit 2:
That's not the biggest butt I've ever seen!\!
Not the sexiest, juiciest butt.

\c[3]Guard Spirit 1:
...you can pass.

\c[3]Guard Spirit 1:
Do you need to hear our riddle again?
Or have you SOLVED IT?

\c[2]Guard Spirit 2:
Don't worry, needing to hear our riddle again
is ENTIRELY NORMAL!

\c[3]Guard Spirit 1:
I like big butts and I CANNOT LIE!\!
\c[3]My brother likes big butts and CANNOT 
TELL THE TRUTH!

\c[3]Guard Spirit 1:
There are SIX controls here, two switches, 
two buttons and two levers!

\c[2]GS2: Only ONE green control is on!
\c[3]GS1: And ONE switch!

\c[2]GS2: The RED LEVER is on!
\c[3]GS1: In total, THREE buttons and switches 
are on!

\c[2]GS2: And finally, there is only ONE red 
control on!
\c[3]GS1: Will you solve our clever riddle?

\c[3]Guard Spirit 1:
THAT'S\! ...correct?

\c[2]Guard Spirit 2:
IMPOSSIBLE!

\c[3]Guard Spirit 1:
IMPROBABLE!

\c[2]Guard Spirit 2:
UNFORESEEN!

\c[3]Guard Spirit 1:
We will KEEP OUR WORD.

Spirits:\>
\c[3]WRONG!
\C[2]RIGHT!\<

\c[3]That means a PENALTY!
\c[2]There ALWAYS has to be punishment!

\c[3]We will take from you the most valuable
thing in the world:\!
YOUR BUTT!

You feel your butt SLOWLY DEFLATE!\!
...Err, slowly deflate.

\C[3]AHAHAHAHAHA!\!
Can you feel it SHRINKING?!\!
\C[2]I'm sure it's FINE!

\c[2]Guard Spirit 2:
...Huh?

\c[3]Guard Spirit 1:
Brother!\! They have no butt to speak of!

\c[2]Guard Spirit 2:
What?!

\c[3]Guard Spirit 1:
Terrible!

\c[2]Guard Spirit 2:
What a not SAD AND PITIFUL existence!

\c[3]Guard Spirit 1:
I guess we'll take away from their BREASTS
instead? \!
They're like a CHEST BUTT!

You feel your breasts SLOWLY DEFLATE!\!
Err, slowly deflate.

\C[3]Haha. Heh.

\c[3]Guard Spirit 1:
Brother!\! They have no breasts either!

\c[2]Guard Spirit 2:
What?!

\c[3]Guard Spirit 1:
Such a SAD and PITIFUL existence!

\c[3]Guard Spirit 1:
Go on through. I can't bear to make your life
EVEN WORSE.

\c[2]Guard Spirit 2:
*Sn

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG — Guard spirit 1 — p3
passages.content:
\c[2]Guard Spirit 2:
I didn't SAY we needed to make the riddle 
harder!

\c[3]Guard Spirit 1:
Then you should have HELPED MAKE IT!

\c[2]Guard Spirit 2:
I thought I could leave it to you, since you're
a CLEVER and INTELLIGENT individual!

\c[3]Guard Spirit 1:
...\!
Why do you always have to make it personal?

\c[3]Guard Spirit 1:
I can't believe someone like you EXISTS!\!
Get away from me you DISGUSTING FILTH!

\c[3]Guard Spirit 1:
Please, go on through.

\c[3]Guard Spirit 1:
I just want to watch you walk away.

\c[3]Guard Spirit 1:
No breasts or butt...

\c[3]I know we're damned spirits, but some 
things feel too cruel even for us.\!
Your life is already so miserable and joyless
I can't make it worse.

\c[3]Go on through.

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG — Envy Spirit — p1
passages.content:
This spirit keeps glancing at their opponents'
stash of chips and then their own.

Envy Spirit:
One more hand!\! One more hand, and then 
I'll have more than them.

They'll see, they'll see.

The spirit turns to you.

Envy Spirit:
Come, pay the $50 to join in. I'll beat you too,
you'll see.

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG — Envy Spirit — p2
passages.content:
Envy Spirit:
I hate this game!\!
I always lose!

But this time I'll show them. They'll drag
themselves into my hotels, begging for mercy.
And I'll turn to them and whisper "no".

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG — Greed spirit — p1
passages.content:
The greed spirit is staring at the pot for the
poker game.

Greed Spirit:
All this beautiful beautiful money.\!
Soon it will be mine, yes, yes.

The spirit turns to you.

Greed Spirit 1:
Join us if you want.  Buy-in is $50.

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG — Greed spirit — p2
passages.content:
The greed spirit is glumly watching the glutton
spirit set up a faintly transparent Monopoly
board.

Greed Spirit:
I'd be so much happier about this if the money
was real...

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG — Gluttony Spirit — p1
passages.content:
The gluttony spirit is staring off into the
distance.

Gluttony Spirit:
First I'll buy a hamburger.  No, a cake. A 
chocolate cake.  Or maybe some pizza...

Greed Spirit:
Stop daydreaming and play!

Gluttony Spirit:
Right, right!

They discard their entire hand.

Gluttony Spirit:
Give me more cards. All the cards.

The spirit turns to you.

Gluttony Spirit:
Uh, if you want to join you can. It's $50 to
start.

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG — Gluttony Spirit — p2
passages.content:
The gluttony spirit is slowly setting up a 
transparent Monopoly board.

Gluttony Spirit:
They hate Monopoly.\!
That's fair.\!
I hate Monopoly too.

Gluttony Spirit:
But I'm also a glutton for punishment.

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG — Bird guide — p1
passages.content:
Bird:
I'm so glad she's happy.\!
And not splattered across the room.

Or sporting massive breasts.\!
Why does haywire magic always *do* that?

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG — Poker game — p1
passages.content:
Join the poker game?

You sit down for a few hands of poker.

It's a tough fought hand, but you manage to
pull ahead.  You happily claim the pot.

Gained $200!

Envy Spirit:
Come back! I'll show you!

The cards just aren't going your way.  It's not
long before you've lost your entire stake.

Lost $50!

Greed Spirit:
Come back when you have enough cash!

Gluttony Spirit:
Or if you want to bet your soul, your delicious-
looking soul...

You sit down to play.\!
Everything goes your way. It's like the cards
have fallen in love with you.

It isn't long before you've cleaned the spirits
out of everything they had.

Gained $1000!
Gained raw mana!

Greed Spirit:
No! My beautiful money!

Envy Spirit:
I can't believe you did so well.\!
I hate you!\! Hate hate hate!

Gluttony Spirit:
So much for poker. \!
Back to Monopoly then?

Greed Spirit:
But I thought we escaped Hell!

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG — Poker game — p2
passages.content:
The ghosts are slowly setting up a Monopoly
board.

None of them look enthusiastic. It'll probably
take them a while.

passages.content:

USUALLY!

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG — Gregory scene trigger — p1
passages.content:
You see SocraticMachine and a very excited 
bird talking.

Bird:
Coo! Coo!\!
You have passed the three Spirit Trials! The
time has come to grant you the Power of Bird.

Bird:
Hold your arms out and repeat after me.\!
Coo. Coo. Peep peep tweet.

Player SocraticMachine:
Coo coo? Peep peep tweet?

Bird:
No!\! No, you do the chant with a sparrow 
accent like that and who knows what could
happen!

Try it again!\!
Coo. Coo. Peep peep tweet.

Player SocraticMachine:
Coo. coo. Peep peep. Tweet!

Bird:
What are you, a pelican?\!
But you're closer. One more time.\!
Coo. Coo. Peep peep tweet.

Player SocraticMachine:
Coo. coo. Peep peep tweet.

Bird:
That's better! Keep that up and I can almost
guarantee the Power of Bird will leave you
with all your limbs!

Player SocraticMachine:
What was-\.\^

Bird:
No time now, hurry along!\!
The Spirit Orb isn't going to retrieve itself from
the rafters!

Both:
Tweet tweet chirp!

Bird:
That's it!\! Now flap your arms, bob your head!

Both:
Tweet peep chirp peep chirp!\!
Coo chirp chirp tweet!

Player BirbcraticMachine:
Did it- it worked!

The bird looks her up and down.

Bird:
Four limbs, wings, I'd call that a success.\!
And like I said, almost *no* chance that you'd
turn into a chicken. Or explode.

Or turn into an egg. Or, and I don't know why
this keeps happening, grow massive thighs.

Gregory is ignoring the bird in favor of 
examining her new body. \!
She gives an experimental flap of her wings,
lifting her briefly into the air.

Player BirbcraticMachine:
I can fly!\!
I have to make a post about this.

She paws at her pants pocket with one of her
wings.

Player BirbcraticMachine:
...This may take some thought.

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG — Poker prelude — p1
passages.content:
You hear muffled voices to the south.

Aha! Full house! Let that blow your mind!

I lose again! \! I'll win next time, just you wait.
And then I'll show you all.

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG — Ghost Mastermind — p1
passages.content:
Almost Certainly Evil Woman:
Ugh.

Almost Certainly Evil Woman:
This floor is infested with sloth spirits.

They're even more useless than the envy
spirits on the last floor.

And look at this laziness!

Almost Certainly Evil Woman:
Sleeping on the job.\!
In any proper world, the penalty for this would
be DEATH!

Kaede:
Death for sleeping on the job?

\>Kaede:
\>Death for sleeping on the job?\<
I can see it.\!
What penalty would thoust impose for littering?

Barely Even Hiding It Anymore:
Oh, death, definitely.

Kaede:
Mopery?

How Is She So Bad At This?:
Death!

Kaede:
Lese Majeste?

How Does She Not Realize We Know?
Oh, death is too good for them.\!
Double-death!

She nods happily to herself while Kaede tries
not to laugh.

Elina:
Excuse me!

\>Elina:
\>Excuse me!\<
Are the sloth spirits dangerous?

At This Point You're Playing Along Out Of Pity:
Not unless you wake them up. And *nothing*
wakes a sloth spirit up.\!
This floor should be a casual stroll to the stairs.

At This Point You're Playing Along Out Of Pity:
Let's get going! We've wasted enough time!\!
Uh, great hero.

Looks like the power is still out.

The call button flickers for a moment, then

It must need more power than you can
