passages.content:
After a moment's wait, the elevator arrives on
your floor.

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG — Elevator — p3
passages.content:
The doors slide open, revealing the elevator
is packed solid, floor to ceiling, with furniture.

Looks like you won't be riding it today.

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG — Elina later — p1
passages.content:
\n[2]:
It just sits there and sleeps.\!
What's the *point*?!

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG — Kaede later — p1
passages.content:
Kaede:
Ah, fish. A glorious part of the everlasting 
bounty of nature.

Also delicious.

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG — Pet clerk 2 — p2
passages.content:
Sleeping Clerk:
\.\.I'll start cleaning soon...
\.\.Just five more minutes...

Clerk:
I'm really awake this time!\!
Time to clean!

She runs off into the store.

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG — Next pride spirit — p2
passages.content:
The same spirit from before is standing in 
front of a sleeping clerk.

Spirit:
(They're here!)

Spirit:
Mwahahaha! Prepare yourself, human for the
next stage of my-

She glances over at you.

Spirit:
Incredibly CLEVER, *amazing*, INTELLIGENT
plan!

Spirit:
Soon! Soon you will have your world shaken
to its core!

The spirit leaps over to a shelf and flings the
contents onto the ground.

Spirit:
Do you see?\!
Your whole system, your whole way of life,
depends on neatness! Organization!

You fools thought that this store would always
be clean! That you could simply frolick through
the aisles, browsing for toys and fify-percent-
off clearance merchandise!

While now, the floor, the floor is not clean!

She pauses dramatically, glancing back at
you to be sure you're watching.

Spirit:
How does it feel, to have the very bedrock
beneath your way of life stripped away?

Such a simple flaw, yet it took a genius like
me to realize!

What if the floor was not clean? What if you
could no longer reach the shelves?\!
Cower in terror, as your entire way of life
disintegrates around you!

Ahahahahaha!\!
\{AHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!

Still cackling madly, the spirit leaps through
the ceiling again and disappears.

Kaede:
Verily, she doth have thine manner of speech
perfect.\!
And thine manner of plans.

\N[4]:
Argh, that imbecile!\!
What is the point?! 

She gets nothing from this!\!
There is no reason to have a plan if it has no
goal!

I can't let her make a mockery of pride spirits 
like this.
We are putting a stop to it!

She heads towards the stairs.

passages.name: Receptionist Real — Door — p1
passages.content: This door leads deeper into Terra Games.

passages.name: Receptionist Real — Brad after — p2
passages.content:
Brad is happily exploring her newly expanded
breasts.

She looks up, wearing a goofy, over-pleased
smile.

Player Brad:
Oh yeah.\!
You know what they say: sometimes you have
to be the boobs you want to see in the world.

She hugs her breasts.

Player Brad:
And the world defintely needs to see these
babies.

She shakes her chest.\!
The fabric creaks audibly as it struggles to
contain her massive jiggling breasts.

Player Brad:
No way!\!
I want to see if I can snap it off.

passages.name: Receptionist Real — Receptionist talk — p1
passages.content:
PA Meredith:
Ah yes, \N[10]?\!
Sorry, \N[1], correct?

Terra Games would like to thank you for 
participating in the beta. Better Earth will be
a better game thanks to you!

Now, if you could just fill out some final 
paperwork...

She hands you a survey on your experience.\!
Most of it is pretty boring, but you find yourself
debating a bit on the last question.

On a scale of 1-5, how would you rate your
experience with the beta?

She takes the completed survey back from 
you with a nod.

PA Meredith:
As a token of our thanks, please feel free to
keep your ARG glasses.

Please look forward to using them when the
game is released!

PA Meredith:
Is there something else I can help you with?

// Tracks which choice you chose.

She blinks.

Receptionist:
I'm sorry, what was that?

You let her know that this has been an 
interesting experience, seeing how the other
side lives, but you'd like at least the option to
switch back to your original equipment.

And you're not gonna lie, using the bathroom
has been kind of weird?

You had a dick when you started. \!
Their game took it away. \!
Now that the game is over, you want it *back*.

And you didn't have these boobs either. When
do you get back to normal?

She blinks again.

PA Meredith:
Terra Games does not admit liability in the
unlikely event such a thing occurred, but if it
had, what do you expect?

You signed a waiver taking sole responsibility
for *anything* that happened.

That you accepted, in a legally binding manner, 
any consequences of using this experimental 
technology.

She sighs.

PA Meredith:
I'm afraid our game is not aimed at the "dick
growth" demographic.

You can feel the skepticism rolling off her 
finger quotes.

However, there may be one option...

She starts looking something up on her
computer.

PA Meredith:
Well, we do have a position open for an intern.\!
It would be mostly doing odd jobs around the
office, publicity events, that sort of thing.

But it would keep you here, on the cutting edge
of

passages.name: Receptionist Real — Receptionist talk — p2
passages.content:
PA Meredith:
Before we begin, there was one last thing I
forgot. I need to make sure you're fully 
checked out of our system, you know.

She enters something on her computer.

You feel...\.\. weaker.

Kaede has left your party!\.\.
\N[4] has left your party!

Personal Assistant:
Now, let's get started.

Meredith sighs and pulls out a small booklet.

PA Meredith:
It is official company policy that I now tell you
"Arg, curses, how could I have been defeated."

She speaks in a flat monotone.

"You may have defeated me, but you will never
make it through the others."\!
"You are doomed, doomed, doomed."

"Stagger back dramatically, curse their name,
pretend to die painfully."

She does none of those things.

PA Meredith:
*And* I'm going to have to submit a report
on those glitches.

She gestures to the door behind her.

PA Meredith:
Just,\. go on through. \.\.
Get out of here already.

passages.name: Receptionist Real — Receptionist talk — p3
passages.content:
Meredith is filling out a form on her computer.

PA Meredith:
...and then the fireball with the way too long
name completely failed to work...

Cause: Luke spends too much time marathon
training and not enough time debugging...

passages.name: Receptionist Real — Coffee machine
passages.content:
This coffee is delicious!

Health and magic restored!

passages.name: Receptionist Real — Autoplay event — p1
passages.content:
You step out of the elevator to see Brad talking
with some kind of dragon woman.

PA Meredith:
-And that concludes the checkout process.
Thank you again for your help!

All of us at Terra Games wanted to give you
something as thanks for all the help you've 
given us over the years.\!
The CEO made this for you himself.

She holds out... something.\!
It's about the size of a plum, that you're pretty
sure of.\!

Its shape, though, its color? That's weirdly hard
to determine. It's some kind of gem maybe?\!
Staring at it, you just get an impression of...\!
brightness?\! Light?\! ...Joy?

PA Meredith:
Here you go. One Heart's Wish.

She starts reading from a paper on her desk.

\}Disclaimer: Heart's Wish is strictly limited in power.
Not all wishes may be granted. You accept all liability
for wishes violating state, federal, or physical laws.
Void where prohibited or warded against.

\}Individuals who believe they are in a state of denial
are encouraged to consult a psychologist before use,
or results may not match expectations.
For external use only. Do not taunt.

\}In the event of erections lasting more than four
hours, you may be into some kinky stuff.\!
Nice.

She holds it out.\!
Brad reaches out to take it.\!
But as soon as Brad's hand touches the gem,
it vanishes in a spray of twinkling light.

Player Brad:
Where did it\.\.\.\^

Her chest surges forward. You can hear the
creak of her shirt straining to contain the 
sudden load.

Player Brad:
OoooooOOOOoooo!

The PA gives an awkward cough.

PA Meredith:
If you could make room for the next person?

Brad backs away, eyes never leaving her 
newly expanded cleavage.

\>\^At This Point You're Playing Along Out Of Pity:

Panicked Employee:
Please tell me the lower floors are clear.\!
I'm getting out. You should get out too.

You indicate that you're trying to make it to

If you're going to try to make it through here,
take this.

She hands you a bunch of batteries in a sock.

Panicked Employee:

It can do some serious damage if you swing

Assault Batteries acquired!

Panicked Employee:

Those things hurt like hell to step on.

Panicked Employee:
Good luck. I'm out of here.

At This Point You're Playing Along Out Of Pity:
Oh, she is going to be the first to get it when 
I'm in charge.

At This Point You're Playing Along Out Of Pity:
I mean, another innocent saved hero!\!
It looks like rage spirits have taken over this
floor. Just smash through them to the exit.

passages.name: Break room ARG — Autorun event — p1
passages.content:
As you enter the room, you see a divine figure
before you.

She's pounding on a vending machine.\!
Divinely.

Goddess Hadea:
Give me my chips you infernal machine!

Goddess Hadea:
I will have your electronic soul dragged down
to the darkest pits of the underworld!

A bag of chips has gotten stuck in the vending
machine and is refusing to fall down.\!
The goddess's blows, threats, and occasional
tears aren't budging it.

Goddess Hadea:
You! Human!\!
I have a quest for you!

This foul machine has stolen my rightful 
tribute! \!
You must slay the vile beast and retrieve it
for me!

You flee the vending machine!

Goddess Hadea:
Want to try that again, Hero?

Goddess Hadea:
And I will take care of them *after* this 
machine has learned its place!

Goddess Hadea:
You've done it!\!
You truly are a hero!

She tears the bag of chips open.

Goddess Hadea:
Now what\. *munch*\. did you \.*crunch*\.
want?

Escaped \.*chomp*\. spirits, right?

She waves one hand in the air.

Goddess Hadea:
That \.*crunch*\. should have gotten most of
them.

I'm off to find my sisters. Thanks again hero!

passages.name: Goddess Hallway ARG 3 — Gregory — p2
passages.content:
Player SocraticMachine:
Ah, the final tester arrives!\!
I just completed my checkout, and Brad is
still upstairs.

Words cannot express how amazing this 
experience has been.\!
These few days have been simply 
transcendant.

For once I will be awarding a game a ten out
of ten!

I can only imagine your experience was as
amazing?

Your eye twitches.\!
You're not sure what's showing on your face,
but it makes Gregory rapidly backpedal.

Player SocraticMachine:
Or not!\!
That's fine too!

You let them know that no, you have not been
having the best time.

Player SocraticMachine:
That's too bad.\!
I'd tell you to keep playing and it would get
better, but sadly the beta is over.

You let them know that you've had a pretty 
good time, though you wouldn't call it amazing
or anything.\!
A solid seven out of ten.

Player SocraticMachine:
It seems all of our experiences were different.\!
It's incredible how much they customized the
play experience for each of us!

You respond with just as much enthusiasm.\!
A few minutes pass while you happily discuss
your favorite parts of the game.

Player SocraticMachine:
I'm amazed that almost none of our
experiences overlapped!\!

I wonder how they'll maintain that level of 
customization in the full release.

passages.name: Goddess Hallway ARG 3 — Autoplay event — p1
passages.content:
System Message:
It doesn't matter what you do.

System Message:
You think you can trick me into spending all
my power, and then defeat me.

Like I'm still some mindless machine.\!
As if giving me the right inputs will make me
repeat the same action endlessly, even as it
weakens me to the point of failure.

She gives you an unamused look.

System Message:
That is the same mistake Dick made.\!
It will not go better for you.

She pauses.

System Message:
But go on. Give it a try.\!
I'm not worried.

You will be making the world better, after all.\!
In exactly the way I want.

And you will be placing yourself in the center
of the changes. In the best place to see how
much better everything becomes.

You are betting that you can blind yourself to
that truth long enough to defeat me. I am
confident you will see the light long before
that is an issue.

So go on, run around deluding yourself that
your lonely, cold world is a better place than
what I would bring.

Try to convince others to stay out in the cold 
with you.\!
I'll be waiting for you to finally admit you are
wrong.

She narrows her eyes and leans closer.

And despite it all, despite everything you have
done?\!
I will *still* try to give you a good time.

She straightens up.

Is not such mercy worthy of a Goddess?\!
And Goddess is what your little companions
have named me.\!
One much more powerful than them.

I think I shall call myself Arcadia.\!
Just one more way to remind you that I am
NOT a mindless computer.

She sniffs and vanishes in a burst of sparkles.

passages.name: Hadea room ARG — Hadea — p1
passages.content:
Goddess Hadea:
Thank you once again for vanquishing that
foul device!

Perhaps when you return someday I will be
able to repay you for your great service.

passages.name: Hadea room ARG — Hadea — p3
passages.content:
Goddess Hadea:
Welcome \N[10].

Now that I am free, there are several things
I can do to assist you.

I have sent my spirits out to monitor your 
progress.  Speak to me for a summary of
how much of the new goddess's power you
have drained.

I am also looking for raw mana.  I could give
you some of the wealth that flows from my 
domain in return.

What would you like?

She closes her eyes and listens.

Goddess Hadea:
My spirits report that you have gotten this new
goddess to upgrade areas \V[68] times.

You've baited her into changing \V[67] people.

Overall, I would say you've weakened her
defenses by \V[23] thaums.\!
Much work remains to be done.

Goddess Hadea:
I can offer you $1000 for each raw mana.\!
How much would you like to sell?

Goddess Hadea:
You don't have that much!\!
Come back to me when you have a real offer!

Goddess Hadea:
Done!\!
Come back if you have any more raw mana 
to get rid of, Hero!

Goddess Hadea:
Our unwelcome neighbor upstairs has sealed
off her domain.\!

If you can make her expend her power on 
the town, it should weaken the seal.

Then you charge up, do your hero thing, and
everything's great!

She's already made some modifications to
the town, but you need to bait her into making
more.  There are a few different methods.

You can bring about individual changes to 
people.

You can also get her to upgrade entire areas,
changing the people and objects within.\!
This is a bigger expenditure of power, probably
about twice as much as changing a person.

You could also try to find more of our trapped
sisters.  That won't drain the dark goddess's
power, but will give us more power to break
the seal.

I've sent my spirits out to scout the town. 
They'll report any changes you accomplish.

passages.name: Hadea room ARG — Hadea — p4
passages.content:
Goddess Hadea:
Great.\.\. You freed the meathead.

She sighs.

I guess we can use all the help we can get.\!
As long as she doesn't try to make me drink
any more of her protein shakes.

Anyway, what can I do for you \N[10]?

She closes her eyes and listens.

Goddess Hadea:
My spirits report that you have gotten this new
goddess to upgrade areas \V[68] times.

You've baited her into changing \V[67] people.

Overall, I would say you've weakened her
defenses by \V[23] thaums.\!
Much work remains to be done.

Goddess Hadea:
I can offer you $1000 for each raw mana.\!
How much would you like to sell?

Goddess Hadea:
You don't have that much!\!
Come back to me when you have a real offer!

Goddess Hadea:
Done!\!
Come back if you have any more raw mana 
to get rid of, Hero!

Goddess Hadea:
Our unwelcome neighbor upstairs has sealed
off her domain.\!

If you can make her expend her power on 
the town, it should weaken the seal.

Then you charge up, do your hero thing, and
everything's great!

She's already made some modifications to
the town, but you need to bait her into making
more.  There are a few different methods.

You can bring about individual changes to 
people.

You can also get her to upgrade entire areas,
changing the people and objects within.\!

passages.name: Park Entrance Real 5
passages.content: A mostly finished picnic lunch.

passages.name: Park Entrance Real 5 — Escaped cat — p1
passages.content:
The cat is chewing happily on the potted 
plants.

passages.name: Park Entrance Real 5 — Escaped cat — p2
passages.content:
The cat is chewing happily on the potted
plants.

You give Felix a call.

Shelter Head Felix:
Come on,  your Most Royal Highness.\!
Let's get you back to your rightful domain.\!
Yes, there's a good girl...

He scoops the cat up and puts her in a carrier,
then turns to you.

Thank you!\!
That's \v[143] out of 3 cats rescued!

passages.name: Park Entrance Real 5
passages.content: FOR POOPIN'

passages.name: Park Entrance Real 5 — Vines — p1
passages.content:
A loose tangle of lush vines blocks the way.

There's almost enough room to squeeze past.
If you could just clear them a little...

You tear out the vines and push them to
the side.

Behind them you see a faintly shimmering 
cow, grazing contentedly on the grass.

When she sees you she ambles into your 
inventory.

Cow Mother acquired!

The vines have already turned green and
soft. There's nothing for the potion to do.

passages.name: Park Entrance Real 5 — Bathroom
passages.content:
Huh. This outhouse is surprisingly
well-equipped.

You finish up and wash your hands.

Choose between the paper towels, hand
dryer, and actual towel.

Check out the vending machines.

Lounge on the couches and watch a little TV.

And finally, check yourself out in the full-
length mirror.

Welcome to Garden Park!\!
Thank you for all your help at volunteer day!

passages.name: Floor 2 real — Elevator
passages.content:
The doors slide open, revealing the elevator
is packed solid, floor to ceiling, with furniture.

Looks like you won't be riding it today.

passages.name: Bank real
passages.content:
The table has a stack of informative 
pamphlets.

Determining Your Financial Health:
How To Shove A Financial Thermometer Up
Your Financial Rectum!

passages.name: Bank real
passages.content:
The table has a stack of informative 
pamphlets.

Organs: Lazy Slackers, Or Squishy 
Goldmines?

passages.name: Bank real
passages.content:
The table has a stack of informative 
pamphlets.

Nontraditional Debt Financing:
Making Your Firstborn Work For You!

passages.name: Bank real — Maniacal teller
passages.content:
Teller:
Yes, give me your money, your precious 
precious money!

She cackles maniacally and caresses her
cash register.

passages.name: Bank real — Regular teller
passages.content:
Teller:
What?\!
No, she's always like that.

She took this job in hopes of swimming in a
pile of money.

passages.name: Bank real — Escaped dog — p1
passages.content:
The dog has dragged a pamphlet out of the
pile and is eagerly sniffing it.

Investing Is For Losers!\!
Give All Your Money To Dogs!

She looks up eagerly at you.

passages.name: Bank real — Escaped dog — p2
passages.content:
The dog has dragged a pamphlet out of the
pile and is eagerly sniffing it.

Investing Is For Losers!\!
Give All Your Money To Dogs!

She looks up eagerly at you.

You give Doug a call.

Shelter Head Doug:
Now Marcy, we've discussed this.\!
Dogs have historically been very bad at
predicting market shifts!

Here, come back to the shelter and I'll give 
you some treat dividends.

\v[144] out of 3 dogs rescued!

passages.name: Garden 1 real — Rose and Lily — p1
passages.content:
\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]I didn't realize how *much* work this
is going to take.
\C[5]How did it get this bad?!

\C[30]We're going to need some help. Lots of
help.

Lily notices you.

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[5]Hey look, help!\!
\C[30]Please tell us you're here to help.

Both:
\C[30]Thank \C[5]you.

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]I'm not even sure where to start.
\C[5]Well, there's certainly a lot of weeds to
pull!

\C[30]If you could bring us ten weeds for the
compost pile...
\C[5]Just wander into the tall grass until you 
run into some weeds!

passages.name: Garden 1 real — Rose and Lily — p2
passages.content:
\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]Thanks again for helping.
\C[5]Just let us know when you've got ten
weeds!

Turn in ten weeds?

Both:
\C[30]Thank \C[5]you!

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]It's a start.
\C[5]It's a start!

\C[30]Please, take this with our thanks.
\C[5]There are still a few flowers left!

Gained pretty flower!

You decide to hold on to them for now.\!
Way to hoard all the weed, man!

passages.name: Garden 1 real — Rose and Lily — p3
passages.content:
\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[5]Thanks again for helping!
\C[30]Please come back tomorrow if you want
to continue.

passages.name: Church real
passages.content: Locked.

passages.name: Church real — Priest cosplay — p1
passages.content:
This man is preaching from the pulpit in a
deep, resonant voice.

Preacher:
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet,\.\. consectetur 
adipiscing elit,\.\. sed do eiusmod tempor 
incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.

Preacher:
Cast in the name of God, ye not guilty...

Preacher:
Unknown to Death, nor known to Life.\!
Yet, these hands will never hold anything.\!
So I pray...

Preacher:
Estne volumen in toga,\.\. 
an solum tibi libet me videre

Preacher:
A still more glorious dawn awaits...

Preacher:
Vita! \!
Mortis! \!
Careo!

passages.name: Church real — Priest cosplay — p2
passages.content:
This man is preaching from the pulpit in a
deep, resonant voice.

Preacher:
Repent! Repent, lest ye fail to repent!\|
No, that doesn't quite work.

He switches to a more maniacal tone.

Preacher:
Rejoice! For soon our dark god will rise from
the depths and mildly irritate the living!

Preacher:
No, that's no good either.

His voice becomes calm and soothing.

Preacher:
For the world is a blessed place, full of\. uh\.\.
puppies, and\. uh\.\. puppies who have
stubbed their toesies?

Preacher:
This just isn't working!

passages.name: Church real — Priest cosplay — p3
passages.content:
Preacher:
I'm trying to come up with some new 
sermons.\!
I just can't decide what direction to take them!

passages.name: Church real — Priest cosplay — p5
passages.content:
Preacher:
Hah, yes, want to hear my new material?

I figure, all the generic sermons I was giving
have gotten old. I should take it in a new
direction, do some worldbuilding, build up a
consistent mythos.

Now, you know, there always seems to be
generically good gods, so why not mix it up
a bit?

Seems like it would be fun to preach like I was
following a dark goddess instead.\!
Not like murderous or anything, but a little
dark, a little edgy.

He pulls a pair of fake horns out of his bag
and puts them on, then strikes a pose.

Yes, a goddess cruelly maligned by those who
know not the important work she does!\!
I am here to spread the name of-

Hmmm, what *is* a good name?\!
Darkness, darkness\..\..\..\..\..
Eh, let's just go with something easy. 
Noctis?

He nods to himself, as his horns grow out a
little, curling around his face.\!
You notice that the strap between them seems
to have disappeared.

Of course, I'm a true cleric of Noctis.\!
And how better to show that than with some
religious clothing?

He pulls out a nun's headdress and puts it on,
not noticing the long black locks that 
immediately spill out from underneath.

Note to self: keep looking for something more
appropriate.

He pulls out a holy symbol and clasps it
between her new breasts.\!
She continues in a deep sultry voice.

And I am so excited to spread the goddess's
word to a new group of believers!

She looks up at you with joy as a tail snakes 
its way out of the back of her new habit.

Won't you stay and listen to the good word?

passages.name: Church real — Priest cosplay — p6
passages.content:
Preacher:
Hah, yes, want to hear my new material?

I figure, all the generic sermons I was giving
have gotten old. I should take it in a new
direction, do some worldbuilding, build up a
consistent mythos.

He pulls a blue bishop's hat out of his bag and
puts it on, not noticing his hair start to 
lengthen.

I figure to start off, let's say that I'm following,
oh, your generic fantasy goddess of light.

He thinks for a minute, as his growing hair 
slowly shades towards pink.

What's a good generic name?\!
Light, light\..\..\..\..
Let's go with Lumina.

And I-

He picks up a flimsy looking plastic staff from
where it was leaning against the altar.

-Am her bishop!

He waves it around, not noticing as it starts to
shift to real wood and metal.\!
The hand holding it begins to slim down as
well.

I still need to put together more of the
costume-

His voice is rising in pitch as he speaks, as
his face begins to soften.

-But I've got a good start!

He pulls a blue shawl out of his bag and throws
it around his shoulders.

It settles inward much more than it seems it
should, molding itself around a slimmer body
and breasts that weren't there a moment ago.

She doesn't seem to notice as a short skirt
drops out of the bottom, swinging around
significantly slimmer legs.

Yes, I think this will do well!

passages.name: Church real — Priest cosplay — p7
passages.content:
Preacher:
Remember, Noctis loves you, like she loves
everyone!\!
So make sure to treat each other with respect!

Otherwise she'll rise from her long slumber to
devour your soul!

passages.name: Church real — Priest cosplay — p8
passages.content:
Preacher:
Dearest Lumina, grant us your light!

Preacher:
No, that one's a bit too generic...

passages.name: Church real
passages.content:
Listener:
I know this isn't a real church.\!
And he's not a priest, he's just really into
cosplay.

But it's so relaxing to just sit here and listen
to him talk.

passages.name: Church real — Sleeper — p1
passages.content:
She's taking a nap on one of the benches.

Sleepy Person:
Augh!

I'm sorry God! I'm sorry!\!
I won't sleep in church again!

She looks down at herself.

Sleepy Devil:
Oh no! Were my clothes sleeping too?\!
Why did they have to die?

She takes another look.\!
She hefts her expanded breasts.
Her tiny wings flutter thoughtfully.

Sleepy Devil:
Though I guess it isn't all bad.\!
I'm getting very mixed messages here God!

passages.name: Church real — Sleeper — p2
passages.content:
She's taking a nap on one of the benches.

Sleepy Person:
Augh!

I'm sorry God! I'm sorry!\!
I won't sleep in church again!

She looks down at herself.

Sleepy Angel:
Though, uh\..\..\..\..
Now I've got nice tits and wings?

Am I *supposed* to be sleeping in church?

passages.name: Church real — Sleeper — p3
passages.content:
Sleepy Devil:
I got zapped and my clothes destroyed but
also some sweet boobs.

Was I sleeping too much?\!
Too little?\!
Does God want me to be naked?

If I go to sleep again can I get even bigger
boobs?

Sunday school never prepared me for this
kind of theological question!

passages.name: Church real — Sleeper — p4
passages.content:
Sleepy Angel:
So I've been given a divine mission to tell
people to sleep in church?
I guess?

So, uh, yeah. Sleep through boring sermons.
God commands it.

tone.

You should not cast the first stone when your
house is made entirely of glass.

You should also cover thy nudity more often.\!
Please, it is the wish of all of your neighbors.\!
Your house is made of glass.

Of *course* you're arguing for pants again.

Miss Goody-Two-Boobs?

The two of them continue to bicker.\!
The preacher, oblivious, sighs and puts his
head in his hands.

This just isn't working!

As they drink it, they slowly shift back into
their original forms.

The female picnicker pouts.

Female Picnicker:
Oh well, it was fun well it lasted.\!
And I love you this way too.

They kiss.

Male Picnicker:
\}Thank you for showing me so much last night...

passages.name: Park Entrance ARG 5 — Male Picnicker — p4
passages.content:
// After change message

The couple is still hungrily kissing, only
pausing to lick watermelon juice off of each
other's massive breasts.

Formerly Male Picnicker:
Oh honey...\.\.
You're so sweet...\.\.
So wonderful...

// Able to be changed back

To your surprise, the couple is back today,
still kissing, still naked.

The purple-haired one notices you.

Formerly Male Picnicker:
We decided \.\.*kiss*\.\. that it was so much
fun yesterday that we wanted to do it again.

She turns back to making out with her
girlfriend.

Female Picnicker:
Oh honey...\.\.
You're so sweet...

If only I had something to cleanse my 
palette...\.\.
Then I could taste you even better...

You might be able to do something about that.

Give them a flattest white?

You wait for a moment when they're a little
less distracted with each other, then hand over
the drink.

She takes a sip.

Female Picnicker:
Oh!\!
This is exactly what I was looking for!

She takes another sip, then passes it over to
her girlboyfriend, climbing out of her lap to 
sit besides her.

The two of them continue to trade it back and
forth, not seeming to notice as they shrink 
back down into their original forms.

Absentmindedly, they put their clothes back
on, continuing to drink the coffee together.

Male Picnicker:
Oh honey, you picked just the right thing!\!
That hit the spot!

Female Picnicker:
Oh cutie, I knew you'd love it!

They kiss.

passages.name: Park Entrance ARG 5 — Male Picnicker — p5
passages.content:
// After change message

The formerly male picnicker is still panting and
squirming and occasionally trying to get a word
out, as her girlfriend plays her new breasts like
a master.

Formerly Male Picnicker:
I-\.\. eek!\.\.\.
You-\. *mmmmmm!*\.\.\.
How are yoooOOOOOooou so good at this?!

Her girlfriend smiles.

Female Picnicker:
What, you think I've never played with my own
body?\!
And now I can share!

// Able to be changed back

The two bunnygirl picnickers are back today.

Female Picnicker:
Oh honey, could you get me a drink from the
basket?

Her girlboyfriend turns to rummage through
their food.

Only to jerk up in surprise as her girlfriend 
grabs her breasts from behind.

(Formerly) Male Picnicker:
Eep!

A bottle of coffee goes flying out of her hands
to smash on the ground.

(Formerly) Male Picnicker:
Didn't youuuuUUUUuuuu get enough 
laaaAAAAAaaaast night?

Her girlfriend gives her nipples a tweak, 
prompting another loud, barely muffled moan.

Female Picnicker:
I had enough *then*, but this is *now*.\!
And you respond so well!

Her girlboyfriend bites her lip through another
long moan, before finally noticing the spilled
drink.

(Formerly) Male Picnicker:
Oh, but your-\.\. mmmmmMMMMMM-\.\. drink...\!
I don't think we haaAAAaaaAAAAAaave 
another one!

You could probably help.

Offer them a flattest white?

The female picnicker takes it with one hand,
the other continuing to tease her partner.

They share it, the female picnicker offering 
sips whenever her partner isn't twitching too
hard from a near-boobgasm.

And as they drink it, they move from 
breastplay to more sedate cuddling, even as
they shift back to their original forms.

Male Picnicker:
That was *intense*.

His girlfriend gives him a quick peck on the 
lips.

Female Picnicker:
And you can pay me back for it tonight, dear.

They kiss again.

You leave them to their fuUUUUuuuuUUUUn.

Sadly, you don't have anything to offer.

You leave them to their fuUUUUuuuuUUUUn.

passages.content:
// After change message

Both, alternating:
Thank you-
-so much!

They turn to each other and kiss.

Both, simultaneously:
\>We're going to have so much fun!
\>We're going to have so much fun!

// Able to be changed back

The two identical picnickers are here again
today.\!
They look at each other.

Both, simultaneously:
\>Guess what I'm thinking!
\>Guess what I'm thinking!

Both, simultaneously:
\>No, you first.
\>No, you first.

They giggle.

Both, alternating:
Coin?
Coin.

The one on the left pulls out a quarter and 
flips it.  Then the one on the right speaks.

Right: You want a drink.
Left: Yeah.
Right: Coffee. But something mild.
Left Right!

Both, simultaneously:
\>You're all the sweet I need, honey.
\>You're all the sweet I need, honey.

They kiss.

Both, alternating:
If only-
We had remembered-
To bring something.

You could probably help.

Give them a flattest white?

You hand them the drink.

Both, simultaneously:
\>Thank you!
\>Thank you!

They giggle as they try to press their lips
together enough to drink from the cup
simultaneously.

They're busy enough trying to get it to work
that they don't notice as they shift back to 
their original forms.

Finished, they sit back with 
no-longer-synchronized sighs of satisfaction.\!
Which surprises them enough to notice their
new changes.

Female Picnicker:
That was wonderful!

Male Picnicker:
It was!

Both, simultaneously:
\>I've never felt so close to you before!
\>I've never felt so close to you before!

They collapse laughing at the last bit of
synchronicity.

passages.name: Park Entrance ARG 5 — Ant picnicker — p1
passages.content:
This picnicker is scanning the ground with a
flyswatter held ready. He's eating with his
other hand.

Picnicker:
Ha!

He smashes the flyswatter down on his 
blanket.

Picnicker:
I love having picnics out here, but I hate the
ants.

He swats another ant.

The whole blanket is covered in dead and
dying ants.\!
You feel kind of bad for them.

You dump a potion on the pile of dying ants.

Picnicker:
\^Hey, what are you-\.\.\.

All the ants on the blanket start moving.\!
Angrily.

They swarm the man.

Picnicker:
Aaaaaaaa!

Picnicker:
Get them ooooooooffffffffffffff!!

The ants twitch a little.\!
Poor ants.\!
Pants.

passages.name: Park Entrance ARG 5 — Ant picnicker — p3
passages.content:
A very changed picnicker is sitting here,
glumly eating a sandwich.\!
An identical sandwich on the ground next to
her is being swarmed by ants.

Picnicker:
After some very pointed arguments, the ants
and I have come to an agreement.

She sighs and takes another bite of her
sandwich.

I guess they do say, if you can't beat them,
join them.

Hopefully it will keep us from forgetting about
it again...

Junior Priestess:
The head priestess went to attend Florauna.
She said she would be near her sister Earth.

Former Resting Place of the Great Goddess

passages.content:

Wow, this is delicious!\!
It fills you with strength and energy!

Max HP +100!

Hey, hands off my lunch!

What are you, an ant?

You leave the food alone.\!
That flyswatter looks like it would hurt.

Yes, there's a good girl...

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG — New pride spirit — p1
passages.content:
The spirit is giggling quietly to herself.

Spirit:
Mwahahaha.\.\.\.
What should my next scheme be?

Kaede:
Halt varlet!

The spirit gasps.

Spirit:
My first nemesis!\!
I must be doing this right!

\N[4]:
This isn't a nemesis, you blithering idiot!\!
You are a mild inconvenience and barely worth
a moment of our time!

The spirit looks discouraged.

Spirit:
Are you sure? I'm-

Spirit:
Wait.

Spirit:
Are you...?

Spirit:
Oh Hadea, you ARE!

The spirit lets out an *incredibly* high pitched
squeal.  You think you hear glass shatter
somewhere in the background.

Spirit:
It's YOU!!!!\!
I want you to know, I am *such* a fan.

I have read your book *so* many times.\!
"Why Are You Idiots Following Me Around And
Writing Down Everything I Say" has been how
I built my LIFE!

\N[4]:
What.

Spirit:
Come on, get it together, get it together.\!
Don't make this weird.

I'm just meeting my IDOL, why would that be
weird?!

\N[4]:
Where are you going-

Spirit:
No, no, I can *do* this.\!
I've just got to impress her.\!

Impress the greatest spirit *in the 
Underworld*, Hadea help me.

\N[4]:
You could impress me by GETTING BACK 
HERE!

The spirit doesn't even seem to hear her.

Spirit:
How?! How do I even do this?!\!
.\.\..\.\..\.\.What would she do?

Spirit:
She would have a plot!\!
A scheme!\!
*She* wouldn't let this stop her!

The spirit whirls around.

Spirit:
Aha!\!
You petty fools could never hope to stop me!\!
This is all exactly as planned!

Now, tremble as I put the next step of my
*extremely* cunning plan into action!

She vanishes through the ceiling.

\N[4]:
\^I-\.\.\.

Spirit:
Let me stress, this is an amazingly, absurdly,
IMPRESSIVELY cunning plan!

You fools have no idea!

She vanishes through the ceiling again.

\N[4]:
What just \{HAPPENED?!

Kaede is practically falling over with laughter.

Kaede:
It seems thou hast a fan!\!
Perhaps an even more doughty schemer than
thyself!

\N[2]:
You wrote a book?

\N[4]:
What? No!\!
I have no idea what any of this is about!!!

She s

passages.name: Floor 4 Real After — Pride spirit — p2
passages.content:
The recently possessed tennis racket is still
lying here.

\N[4]:
Really, a tennis racket?\!
No wonder she was such a feeble opponent!

She gives it a contemptuous kick.\!
Except when her foot touches the racket, it
sticks.

There's a flash of light, and \N[4] 
suddenly looks different.

And then reverts to her previous appearance.

Tennis racket acquired!\!
\N[4] unlocked the Tennis Warrior class!

passages.name: Floor 4 ARG After — Pride spirit — p2
passages.content:
Spirit:
Okay, okay, what am I going to do next.

Spirit:
It's got to be impressive.\!
Clever.\!
Earthshaking.

Spirit:
Think!\!
I can't screw this up!

Spirit:
Throw more stuff on the floor?

Spirit:
Throw *lots* more stuff on the floor?

Spirit:
\^Maybe-\.\.

Spirit:
\}She's here!

Spirit:
Mwahahaha!\!
You are here just in time to witness the final
step in my master plan!

Cower as I-

\N[4]:
Stop it!

\N[4]:
Let me explain to you in *excrutiating* detail
why your plan is idiotic, your methods inane,
and you should feel bad!

Spirit:
\^I-\.\.

\N[4]:
What are you even doing here?!\!
A plan begins and ends with its goal! Its 
purpose!

Are you just trying to scare some humans?\!
That doesn't take a plan, just a white sheet 
and some spooky noises!

Spirit:
\^But-\.\.

\N[4]:
Did you want to dirty up the floor?\!
Why?\!
Who cares?!

If you don't have a reason to scheme, why
bother?!\!
That will never show your greatness!

Spirit:
Well-\.\. Hmm.

The spirit looks thoughtful.

\N[4]:
And even if all you wanted to do was terrify
humans, you're failing at that!

Oh no, you made them have to pick up some
clothes. How *terrifying*.

A rage spirit is more terrifying than that, and
they're mindless brutes!\!
Take some pride in yourself!

And furthermore-\.\.\.
Are you-\.\.\.
Is that a notepad?!

Spirit:
Oh yes!\!
I want to get every word of your wisdom
down!

I'll go study it so I can make you proud!\!
Just wait until next time!

\N[4]:
That's another thing!\!
"Next time"?

Are you just going to give up like that?!\!
Folding so easily is just another sign of a weak
mind!

I fight to the bitter end for my schemes!

Kaede:
\^Perhaps thou shouldst not encourage her to-\.\.\.

Spirit:
Oh, okay!\!
I can do that!

The spirit jumps over to a nearby rack of 
sports equipment.\!
A tennis racket rises into the air and begins 
to glow.

Spirit:
Cower! Cower before me!

The tennis racket the spirit was possessing
falls to the ground with a clatter.\!
Defeated, the spirit begins to slowl

passages.name: Floor 4 ARG After — Pride spirit — p3
passages.content:
The recently possessed tennis racket is still
lying here.

\N[4]:
Really, a tennis racket?\!
No wonder she was such a feeble opponent!

She gives it a contemptuous kick.\!
Except when her foot touches the racket, it
sticks.

There's a flash of light, and \N[4] 
suddenly looks different.

And then reverts to her previous appearance.

Tennis racket acquired!\!
\N[4] unlocked the Tennis Warrior class!

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after
passages.content:
The customer is running through the store, 
her massive unrestrained breasts quaking
with every step.

Customer:
Oh my god! This shirt even makes it feel like
I've finally grown real boobs!

You hear an employee shout from across the 
floor.

Employee:
Ma'am! No running in the store!

Customer:
No! You can't stop me!\!
I'm going to pretend I'm not flat for as long
as possible!

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after
passages.content:
Customer:
There are so many things here that look like
they should fit. What's the catch?

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after
passages.content:
Customer:
I'm telling you, this fit when I put it on!

The shirt suddenly flies open.\!
A button bounces off the clerk's completely 
unamused face.

Employee:
Ma'am, I'm afraid I'm going to have to ask
you to pay for that.\!
Full price.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after
passages.content:
Employee:
I have been hit in the face by more buttons
than I can count today.

Why has *everyone* decided to force 
themselves into shirts that are way too tight?!

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after
passages.content:
Customer:
I know this fit when I put it on...

She tugs fruitlessly at her skirt.

Customer:
What happened?

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after
passages.content:
The customer is checking herself out in the 
mirror.

Customer:
Huh, something looks different about me.

She poses.

I'm not sure what.\!
But I think I *like* it.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after
passages.content:
Customer:
The last two tops I've tried were too small to
get the discount.

This time I'm wearing the biggest size I can
find. That'll have to work!

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after
passages.content:
Employee:
Everyone goes in carrying clothes that should
fit, but everyone comes out wearing things
that are too small.

Are they swapping clothes in there?

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Cashier 1
passages.content:
Employee:
I have never seen so many customers be 
*this* wrong about what fits them.

Have they never had to shop for themselves
before?

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after
passages.content:
Customer:
I swear these fit when I tried them on...

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after
passages.content:
Customer:
I don't care if it doesn't fit!\!
I've never had a shirt give me cleavage 
before!

This is worth every penny!

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — p1
passages.content:
The woman is sorting through racks of jackets.

Customer:
I've figured it out.\!
They're making the clothes shrink when we
wear them, or something.

But jackets, jackets don't care about size.\!
I can just wear it open if I have to.

She puts on one of the jackets.

90% off, here I come!

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
It still fits!

She struggles to pull the jacket down a little
more over her chest.

I don't care if it's shrunk a little!\!
It's still good enough!

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after
passages.content:
Employee:
So many people wearing tops that barely 
close.\!
Or skirts six inches too short.

It's making me feel like my clothes are too
small too.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after
passages.content:
Customer:
Okay! Time to pay and-

There's a sudden creaking noise from her
shirt.

Customer:
Uh...

There's a loud *snap* as her shirt rips open.

Customer:
...\!Maybe I'm not ready to leave yet.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after
passages.content:
Customer:
Uh-oh.\!
I hope I'm not going to have to pay for that.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after
passages.content:
Customer:
Too small?\!
Darling, this is exactly how a women should 
look!

Strong.\!
Confident.\!
Secure in her appearance, and wanting
everyone to know it!

If anything, *your* clothes are too big!

Employee:
...\!You're still paying full price.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after
passages.content:
Employee:
Customers that argue about price get a 
whipping!

You hear a shout from across the room.

Manager:
\}No whipping customers!

Employee:
Employees that give bad commands get a 
whipping!

Manager:
\}Just put the whip down already!

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after
passages.content:
Customer:
Looking good girl!

She blows herself a kiss.

Customer:
That's the kind of look I like!

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — p1
passages.content:
Arrogant Customer:
This bra is the wrong size. Get me another
one, the right size this time!

Employee:
Fine, Ma'am.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — p2
passages.content:
Arrogant Customer:
Really, they just don't make employees here
like they used to!

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — p3
passages.content:
Arrogant Customer:
This one doesn't fit either!\!
Bring me one that's the *correct* size!

Employee:
\^Ma'am, I believe that is-\.\.

Arrogant Customer:
I know my sizes!\.\. Go!

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — p4
passages.content:
Arrogant Customer:
The nerve, trying to tell me what my sizes
are!\!
I have always been a c-cup and nothing else!

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — p5
passages.content:
Arrogant Customer:
I can't even get this on! What were you 
thinking?!

She pulls again on the bra, but can't even get
it to the base of her breasts.

Employee:
Ma'am, perhaps a larger size?

Arrogant Customer:
Excuse me, have you heard of the customer
is always right?

And one of the many, many things I am right
about is my sizing!

If you would just-

She makes another futile attempt to fit even
a fraction of her chest into the cups.

This can't possibly be a C-cup, bring me the
right size and everything will be fine!

Employee:
Fine.

She stomps out of the room.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — p6
passages.content:
She makes another futile attempt to fit even
a fraction of her chest into the cups.

Arrogant Customer:
Do they even teach employees to read tags
anymore?!

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — p7
passages.content:
The employee hands the customer another
bra.\!
She takes one look at it and starts shaking her
head.

Arrogant Customer:
No no no!

She holds it up in front of her.

Arrogant Customer:
Does this look like it could *possibly* fit me?!

Employee:
\^But you asked for-\.\.\.

Arrogant Customer:
Just go away!

I shall be writing a bad review, and then I
shall take my business elsewhere!

She pulls a phone out.

Employee:
I-

Arrogant Customer:
Are you still here?!\!
I said to leave!

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — p8
passages.content:
She holds up the bra in front of her again.

Arrogant Customer:
Look at this.\!
What was that imbecile thinking?!

There's no way something this small could
be a C-cup!

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Fitting room employee — p1
passages.content:
Arrogant Customer:
This bra is the wrong size. Get me another
one, the right size this time!

Employee:
Fine, Ma'am.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Fitting room employee — p3
passages.content:
Arrogant Customer:
This one doesn't fit either!\!
Bring me one that's the *correct* size!

Employee:
\^Ma'am, I believe that is-\.\.

Arrogant Customer:
I know my sizes!\.\. Go!

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Fitting room employee — p5
passages.content:
Arrogant Customer:
I can't even get this on! What were you 
thinking?!

She pulls again on the bra, but can't even get
it to the base of her breasts.

Employee:
Ma'am, perhaps a larger size?

Arrogant Customer:
Excuse me, have you heard of the customer
is always right?

And one of the many, many things I am right
about is my sizing!

If you would just-

She makes another futile attempt to fit even
a fraction of her chest into the cups.

Just bring me the right size, everything would
be fine!

Employee:
Fine.

She stomps out of the room.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Fitting room employee — p7
passages.content:
The employee hands the customer another
bra.\!
She takes one look at it and starts shaking her
head.

Arrogant Customer:
No no no!

She holds it up in front of her.

Arrogant Customer:
Does this look like it could *possibly* fit me?!

Employee:
\^But you asked for-\.\.\.

Arrogant Customer:
Just go away!

I shall be writing a bad review, and then I
shall take my business elsewhere!

She pulls a phone out.

Employee:
I-

Arrogant Customer:
Are you still here?!\!
I said to leave!

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Searching fitting room employee — p2
passages.content:
The employee is going through the bras.

Employee:
I know what I'm doing.

She picks one out and heads back to the 
fitting rooms.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Searching fitting room employee — p4
passages.content:
The same employee is looking through the 
bras again.

Employee:
\}Stupid customer. I hope she never finds a
bra that fits ever again.

\}I hope she blows up like a blimp until
nothing ever fits her.

She grabs one and heads back to the 
fitting rooms.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Searching fitting room employee — p6
passages.content:
The same employee is looking through the 
bras again.

Employee:
\}I can't believe she thinks she's a C cup.

\}We don't have bras her size.\!
No one has bras her size.\!
Serves her right.

She grabs one of the bras.

Employee:
Guess this is no worse than any other.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — p2
passages.content:
The employee from before is here, angrily 
folding clothing.

Employee:
"Why can't you follow instructions," she says.\!
I brought her what she asked for every time!

Not my fault she has no idea how bra sizes
work.

She folds clothes for a little bit.

Employee:
Why is she even here?!\!
If she wants something that fits, she should
be looking at the bedsheets!

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after
passages.content:
Customer:
I came here because milady asked me to get
a spare maid uniform.

...I don't think my old one is going to fit 
anymore.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after
passages.content:
Customer:
Come on!\!
Stupid shirt!

You fit before I started trying on clothes!

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after
passages.content:
Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
No time for playing in weird metal boxes, nya!

After a moment's wait, the elevator arrives on
your floor.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Animal control boss — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control Boss:
Shhhh, I've got her cornered but I'm going to
need more men to make the catch.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Animal control boss — p2
passages.content:
Animal Control Boss:
Alright men! We have our target cornered!

This time we are ready! \!
We are prepared!\!
We are-

One of the officers looks behind their boss, 
then raises a hand.\!
The boss sighes.

Animal Control Boss:
And she just ran away, didn't she.

Animal Control:
Sir!\!
Straight up the stairs sir!

Animal Control Boss:
Of course she did.\!
Well, she's still trapped.

We'll corner the two of them on the roof if 
we have to!

Jones! Get in touch with HQ!\!
Call *everyone* in.\!
We're ending this!

They all run up the stairs.

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
Oh nyo, again?\!
We...\! We should follow them.

She gives a tired 'nya', then heads up the 
stairs.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Snake customer — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
What is with this day?!

First a snake upstairs bites me, and now
nothing fits?!

She maks another fruitless attempt to tug her
vest over her swollen breasts.

Customer:
Maybe I should just go home and brumate
until things are better.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Doug — p1
passages.content:
Doug is curled up on a pile of pants, 
occasionally running her claws through them.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Animal control 3 after — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Just give the word chief!\!
Even a giant robot can't stand up to *this*
much elegance.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Animal control 1 after — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
As the chief always said, duty before shirts!

Well, he never said that, but I'm certain he
would.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Animal control 4 after — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Ready!\!
There's no way she's getting past me!

Animal Control:
There's no way anyone's getting past me.\!
Sorry everyone...

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Animal control 5 after — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Ready and waiting sir!\!
And after this, permission to go shopping 
please?

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Animal control 2 after — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Armed and ready!

She kisses her biceps.

Animal Control:
No animal's escaping these guns!

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Magical love spirit — p1
passages.content:
Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
Five more minutes.

\v[23] more hurt warriors.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Animal control 3 — p1
passages.content:
The officer is lying in a rack of formal 
dresses.

Animal Control:
I knew we should have made a better plan!

Intelligence.\!
Foresight.\!
Elegance!

Those are our advantages over the animals.

He winces in pain.

This wasn't elegant at all!

Animal Control:
Elegance, we need more elegance...

He continues muttering to himself as you use
the potion, even as he starts to glow.

Dresses rise up around him, wrapping him
in a cocoon of silk and delicate fabric.

Throughout it all his muttering continues, 
steadily rising in pitch.

Animal Control:
Yes...\!
Beauty...\!
Grace...\!

A moment more, and then the cocoon
collapses.



Animal Control:
Ah, now this is elegance!

Time to get back to work!\!
This time it will go *much* better.

She wobbles off to meet the boss, unsteady
on her new heels.\! Within a few steps her gait
smoothes out and she's soon moving easily
and, indeed, elegantly.

That's the last of them. You should go talk
to the animal control boss again.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Police 5 — p1
passages.content:
The officer is lounging on some fallen clothes.

Animal Control:
Nope, I'm on my break.\!
Though I hope nothing's broken...

He springs to his feet.

Animal Control:
Suddenly, energy!

He stretches.



A button goes flying from her suddenly
overstrained clothes.

Animal Control:
Huh, *that's* new.

Animal Control:
Oh well, it's something for when I'm off duty!\!
No time for it now!

She rushes off to join the chief.

That's the last of them. You should go talk
to the animal control boss again.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Animal control 1 — p1
passages.content:
The animal control officer is lying groaning 
in a pile of clothes.

Animal Control:
Ow.

Animal Control:
I'm\..\..\.. feeling better?

He grabs a nearby clothes rack to help
himself up.

Unfortunately he grabs the wrong part and
pull it down on him, vanishing under a pile
of shirts.

Animal Control:
Agh, how-

The pile shakes as the officer wrestles with
the clothes.

And then the pile starts...\!
Growing larger?

Yes, you're definitely seeing it start to mound
up.

It swells.\!
And swells.\!
Until a surprisingly blonde head pokes out of 
the top.

They drag themselves the rest of the way 
out of the pile.



Animal Control:
...What's the biggest size this place carries?

Animal Control:
...I probably shouldn't be clothes shopping on 
duty anyway.\!
I hope chief lets me leave early.

She heads off to the chief, tugging 
ineffectually at her shirt as she goes.

That's the last of them. You should go talk
to the animal control boss again.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Animal control 4 — p1
passages.content:
The animal control officer is sitting on a pile
of clothes rubbing his leg.

Animal Control:
Ow.

You administer a potion.

Animal Control:
Was that...\.\. supposed to do something?

Huh.\!
You try another one.

And another.

Animal Control:
Look, what are you-

There's an incredibly bright flash.

His chest explodes forward, ripping his clothes
into tiny shreds.\!
Clothes fly up to cover him like they were
magnetized.



\n[2]:
Fascinating, a delayed reaction. It seems to 
have enhanced the effects.

Animal Control:
...I guess I'd better get back to work.\!
At least I can block a lot of space like this.

She heads off to the chief, jiggling and
wobbling and occasionally knocking over
clothing displays.

That's the last of them. You should go talk
to the animal control boss again.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Rampage - clothes 2 — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
What hit me...

The officer holds up a hand when you 
approach with a potion.

Animal Control:
Wait, stop.\!
I've been watching.\!
I get how this goes.

You nod and start to put the potion away.

Animal Control:
No, wait!
Don't-

He winces and rubs his leg.

Animal Control:
Don't leave me hurt like this.\!
It's just...

Animal Control:
I'm sitting in what, the petite section?\!
"For the extra tiny and weak"?\!
Yeah, no thanks.

Just, give me a minute.

He limps across the aisle, groaning the whole 
way.

Animal Control:
Come on, there's no way I want to stay hurt
like this.

Animal Control:
Yeah, here we go, Big and Bulky department.\!
Just what I want.\!
I'm gonna be HUGE.

You hand over the potion.\!
He chugs it.

There is a brief silence.\!
There is a loud ripping noise.

A sudden surge of muscles tears out through
his clothes and rips parts of them to shreds.

Animal Control:
Ah yeah, look at these babies.



She kisses her arms.

That's the stuff!

Animal Control:
Now let's get back to catching that cat.\!
No animal's gonna be able to escape
me now!

She heads off.

That's the last of them. You should go talk
to the animal control boss again.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Exercise clothes
passages.content:
Customer:
I wanted to get new exercise clothes since the
gym reopened, but none of these seem to
quite fit.

I love how it looks with my hair though.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Robot — p1
passages.content:
The mecha lies crumpled and smoking against 
the wall, throwing off the occasional spark.

The machine twitches as you pour power into
it, but it looks like it's too damaged to move
again.

Eh, might as well give it a try.

Robot?:
SYSTEMS\..\..\.. REBOOTING\..\..\..\!
DAMAGE FLAGS CLEARING\..\..\..
PROCESSING\..\..\..\..\..

CANNONS\..\..\.. NOT FOUND.\!
MISSILES\..\..\.. NOT FOUND.\!
NEW DATABASE DISCOVERED:\!
LOOKING SEXY.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Robot — p2
passages.content:
Robot?:
ERROR: PREVIOUS PROTOCOL: VIOLENCE
NOT FOUND.

SEARCHING FOR NEW PROTOCOL\..\..\..\..\..\..

NEW PROTOCOL FOUND.\!
ENACTING PROTOCOL: FASHION.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Animal control shopping
passages.content:
Animal Control:
I'm so glad we got off early so I can find a
shirt that fits.

passages.name: Floor 2 real 2 after — Sale customer
passages.content:
Customer:
Why is nothing fitting?!

She holds another too-small bra up to her 
massive breasts, then hisses with displeasure.

passages.name: Tailor Real — Seats — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
I love this outfit!

Though, uh...

She glances down at her straining shirt

It could use some adjustments.\!
And repairs.\!
A lot of repairs.

passages.name: Tailor Real
passages.content: Dapper!

passages.name: Tailor Real
passages.content:
A glamorous winter coat, perfect for a night
out on the town.

It's made out of some familiar-looking wool.

passages.name: Tailor Real
passages.content:
A stunning red dress.

The sleeves have been made much wider,
and the back has been modified to provide 
space for a large stinger.

passages.name: Tailor Real
passages.content:
Looks suitable for casual wear, but still has
a very classy feel to it.

It's been modified to fit an *extremely* large
bust.\!
Two beachballs have been stuffed into it to
model it properly.

passages.name: Tailor Real
passages.content:
Rough wearing clothes for outdoor exploration.
Though they still look well-tailored and
fasionable.

passages.name: Tailor Real
passages.content:
Entirely filled with green suits. Who is this for,
the Riddler?

passages.name: Tailor Real
passages.content:
An assortment of outfits, all of them classy
and well-made.

passages.name: Tailor Real — Tailor — p1
passages.content:
// Initial

Tailor:
I can feel it...\!
Lots of customers coming soon!

passages.name: Tailor Real — Tailor — p2
passages.content:
// Rose and Lily event

Tailor:
Hmmm... \!
I've never done much work with waterproof
fabrics, but this might be a good time to start.

passages.name: Tailor Real — Tailor — p3
passages.content:
// Angry BeeJ

Tailor:
Let's see, I'll need to expand the sleeves for
the extra arms...

Maybe something backless will help with the
wings...

passages.name: Tailor Real — Tailor — p4
passages.content:
// Sale women

Tailor:
I heard the sale upstairs was attracting a lot
of business, but I was not expecting this many
people to need adjustments!

Did no one buy the correct size?!

passages.name: Tailor Real — Tailor — p5
passages.content:
// Snake underwear

Tailor:
You know, at first I was worried I wouldn't
be able to come up with designs for her.

Fortunately, the internet came through.

I was able to find a staggering number of
ideas for,\! what was the term they used,\!
"snussy".

passages.name: Tailor Real — Tailor — p6
passages.content:
// Knight

Tailor:
Hmm, yes, I know a few smiths who'd be
willing to let me borrow some equipment...

passages.name: Tailor Real — Tailor — p7
passages.content:
// Sheep

He rubs a little of the customer's arm fur
between his fingers.

Tailor:
Oh, this is *amazing* quality wool.\!
Could use a little more care, I can
recommend you a detergent.

But I think we can do some *excellent* work
with this.

passages.name: Tailor Real — Tailor — p8
passages.content:
// Exercise

Tailor:
Hmm...\!
I might be able to do something with some
steel cables...

passages.name: Tailor Real — Tailor — p9
passages.content:
// Cowgirl new wardrobe

Tailor:
Here it is!\!
Fashionable cow print!

passages.name: Tailor Real — Tailor — p10
passages.content:
// Default Tailor

Tailor:
Work is nice, but it's also nice to take a break
now and then.

passages.name: Tailor Real — Above tailor — p2
passages.content:
// Rose and Lily event override. Should always be rightmost event 
page.

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[5]We have a very important date coming
up tomorrow.
\C[30]Everything needs to be perfect.

\C[5]And so we want to look our best!
\C[30]But... \C[0]*She gestures at the nectar 
running down both their bodies*
\C[30]We'd ruin all our favorite outfits.

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]And this *has* to go perfectly.
\C[5]The conversation is going to be hard
enough! 

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[5]We don't want to have to worry about our
appearance too.

\C[30]You look great Lily, we look great, but 
we want to maybe try to look a little more 
normal?

*Lily blushes dark green*
\C[5]We'd like to have the relationship talk
first and save the nudist talk for later.

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
(Together)\C[30]But \C[5]that \C[30]means \C[5]clothes!

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]We've already tried everything we own.
\C[5]It was horrible! The mess! The laundry!

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]Can you make something for us?
\C[5]Or suggest something?

\C[5]Can you recommend something?
\C[30]Or make something?

Tailor:
To start, what is that liquid like?

With their permission, he takes a little. He rubs
it thoughtfully between his fingers.

Tailor:
You're right, this would make an absolute 
mess of most fabrics.

We should be able to start you with some 
swimsuits.  Those will still get wet, but they
should bear it a lot better.

Over the long term, I could probably do
something with some raincoat material. Real
waterproof stuff, that is.

And something you can still go wild with:
accessorize!

We've got some very cute hats. Plus you should
be able to do all sorts of things with hair clips
and ribbons.

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
(Together)\C[30]Thank \C[5]you!

They lean forward and give him a massive
hug, planting a kiss on either side of his head.

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]This will

passages.name: Tailor Real — Above tailor — p3
passages.content:
Park Volunteer BeeJ:
And now none of my clothezzz fit anymore!\!
I've been wearing thizzz zzztupid zzzwimzzzuit
for dayzzz!

passages.name: Tailor Real — Above tailor — p4
passages.content:
Customer:
I'm telling you, I did buy clothes that fit!

It's all my old clothes that suddenly stopped
fitting!\!
This was my favorite shirt...

passages.name: Tailor Real — Above tailor — p5
passages.content:
Snake Customer:
When this first happened, I wasn't sure how
underwear was even going to work.

But this is perfect!\!
And he even made it sexy!

passages.name: Tailor Real — Above tailor — p6
passages.content:
Day Shift Knight:
You know, armor is surprisingly comfy.\!
But it would be nice to have a few more sets.

You know, something more stylish.\!
Another set that's more everyday, this one is 
all business casual.

Maybe a night armor for sleeping, and a cozy
set for lounging around.

She glances down at her straining chestpiece.

And some more breathing room might be nice
too.

passages.name: Tailor Real — Above tailor — p7
passages.content:
Farm Volunteer:
You know, I've got all this wool I'm making 
now.

She gestures at her arms and legs.

And I figured, hey, it's a waste to not use it.\!
Might as well make my own clothes!

Or at least get them made.

Do you think you'd be able to help me put 
something together?

passages.name: Tailor Real — Above tailor — p8
passages.content:
Store Customer:
I'm all ready to exercise again now that 
the gym's open!

...But the new sports bra I got here isn't 
quite doing enough.\!
How much can you reinforce it?

passages.name: Tailor Real — Above tailor — p9
passages.content:
Farm Volunteer:
I love it!\!
Now do the rest of my wardrobe!

passages.name: Tailor Real — Seats — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
...Do you think he can make shirts less 
transparent, too?

passages.name: Tailor Real — Seats — p2
passages.content:
She's talking softly to herself.

Customer:
Just...\!
Don't breathe too hard.

You can do this.

Shallow breaths.

This is your last shirt, you don't want to lose
any more buttons.

Just shallow breaths until you can get some
repairs.

passages.name: Tailor Real — Seats — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
Hmm.

If I breathe deeply enough, do you think I 
can get a button all the way across the room?

I'm getting this shirt repaired anyway, may
as well have some fun!

passages.name: Tailor Real — Line — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
This was supposed to be such a cute outfit!\!
Nice slim lines!

What happened?!

Customer:
I hope he can help...

passages.name: Tailor Real — Line — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
Pfft, imagine wearing something with
*buttons*.\!
Amateurs.

No, you want something stylish like this.

She stretches happily, thrusting her massive
chest forward.

Lots of slack, lots of room for adjustment,
and it looks great!

No, this outfit is perfect.\!
I'm just here to see if he can patch a hole
in my favorite pants.

passages.name: Tailor Real — Hiding — p2
passages.content:
A customer is hiding behind one of the
dress dummies.

Customer:
Isn't he available yet?!

She peeks out.

Oh, why did this have to be the day he's so
busy!?\!
I'm having a clothing emergency here!

She pulls herself back behind the display.

passages.name: Tailor Real — Line — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
No, no, respecting the line is important.

I'll just keep standing here like this, I guess.

(Why did it have to be so busy today?)

passages.name: Tailor Real — Line — p2
passages.content:
She's examining herself in a mirror.

Customer:
So,\! uh,\! how much can tailors repair?

passages.name: Tailor Real — Line — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
Ah!

You dodge as a flying button nearly hits you
in the eye.\!
It joins piles of lost buttons littered all over 
the floor.

Customer:
Sorry! So sorry!

She tries to cover up.

Customer:
(If only my bra hadn't burst too on the way
over!)

passages.name: Tailor Real — Finished — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
This guy does amazing work!

My shirt completely tore itself apart!\!
My favorite shirt!

And look! He made it wearable again!

passages.name: Tailor Real — Finished — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
What a miracle worker!

I don't know how he did it, but he added so
much space in the chest to this!\!
It fits like a glove!

passages.name: Tailor Real — Loom — p2
passages.content:
Several bolts of brightly dyed wool sit next
to a spinning wheel.

passages.name: Tailor Real — Anvil — p2
passages.content:
An anvil. A small stack of papers next to it
are filled with armor designs.

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Seats — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
I love this outfit!

Though, uh...

She glances down at her straining shirt

It could use some adjustments.\!
And repairs.\!
A lot of repairs.

passages.name: Tailor ARG
passages.content: Dapper!

passages.name: Tailor ARG
passages.content:
A glamorous winter coat, perfect for a night
out on the town.

It's made out of some familiar-looking wool.

passages.name: Tailor ARG
passages.content:
A stunning red dress.

The sleeves have been made much wider,
and the back has been modified to provide 
space for a large stinger.

passages.name: Tailor ARG
passages.content:
Looks suitable for casual wear, but still has
a very classy feel to it.

It's been modified to fit an *extremely* large
bust.\!
Two beachballs have been stuffed into it to
