passages.name: Tailor ARG
passages.content:
Rough wearing clothes for outdoor exploration.
Though they still look well-tailored and
fasionable.

passages.name: Tailor ARG
passages.content:
Entirely filled with green suits. Who is this for,
the Riddler?

passages.name: Tailor ARG
passages.content:
An assortment of outfits, all of them classy
and well-made.

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Spider — p1
passages.content:
Spider Woman:
Look at those hands.

The man sews threads like a master! A
symphony of string spread across the fabric!

Ah, I just love to watch him work his magic.

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Spider — p2
passages.content:
Spider Woman:
I wouldn't mind getting her in my web♥

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Spider — p3
passages.content:
Spider Woman:
He spins a cocoon of thread around 
those orbs better than any spider could.

Ah, I just love to watch him work his magic.

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Spider — p4
passages.content:
Spider Woman:
Such creativity! Such adaptability!\!
I wonder what he could make for me ♥

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Spider — p5
passages.content:
Spider Woman:
Metal too?\!
Does his skill know no bounds?

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Spider — p6
passages.content:
Spider Woman:
Look at those hands.

The man sews threads like a master! A
symphony of string spread across the fabric!

Ah, I just love to watch him work his magic.

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Tailor — p1
passages.content:
// Initial

Tailor:
I can feel it...\!
Lots of customers coming soon!

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Tailor — p2
passages.content:
// Rose and Lily event

Tailor:
Hmmm... \!
I've never done much work with waterproof
fabrics, but this might be a good time to start.

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Tailor — p3
passages.content:
// Angry BeeJ

Tailor:
Let's see, I'll need to expand the sleeves for
the extra arms...

Maybe something backless will help with the
wings...

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Tailor — p4
passages.content:
// Sale women

Tailor:
I heard the sale upstairs was attracting a lot
of business, but I was not expecting this many
people to need adjustments!

Did no one buy the correct size?!

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Tailor — p5
passages.content:
// Snake underwear

Tailor:
You know, at first I was worried I wouldn't
be able to come up with designs for her.

Fortunately, the internet came through.

I was able to find a staggering number of
ideas for,\! what was the term they used,\!
"snussy".

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Tailor — p6
passages.content:
// Knight

Tailor:
Hmm, yes, I know a few smiths who'd be
willing to let me borrow some equipment...

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Tailor — p7
passages.content:
// Sheep

He rubs a little of the customer's arm fur
between his fingers.

Tailor:
Oh, this is *amazing* quality wool.\!
Could use a little more care, I can
recommend you a detergent.

But I think we can do some *excellent* work
with this.

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Tailor — p8
passages.content:
// Exercise

Tailor:
Hmm...\!
I might be able to do something with some
steel cables...

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Tailor — p9
passages.content:
// Cowgirl new wardrobe

Tailor:
Here it is!\!
Fashionable cow print!

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Tailor — p10
passages.content:
// Default Tailor

Tailor:
Work is nice, but it's also nice to take a break
now and then.

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Above tailor — p2
passages.content:
// Rose and Lily event override. Should always be rightmost event 
page.

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[5]We have a very important date coming
up tomorrow.
\C[30]Everything needs to be perfect.

\C[5]And so we want to look our best!
\C[30]But... \C[0]*She gestures at the nectar 
running down both their bodies*
\C[30]We'd ruin all our favorite outfits.

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]And this *has* to go perfectly.
\C[5]The conversation is going to be hard
enough! 

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[5]We don't want to have to worry about our
appearance too.

\C[30]You look great Lily, we look great, but 
we want to maybe try to look a little more 
normal?

*Lily blushes dark green*
\C[5]We'd like to have the relationship talk
first and save the nudist talk for later.

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
(Together)\C[30]But \C[5]that \C[30]means \C[5]clothes!

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]We've already tried everything we own.
\C[5]It was horrible! The mess! The laundry!

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]Can you make something for us?
\C[5]Or suggest something?

\C[5]Can you recommend something?
\C[30]Or make something?

Tailor:
To start, what is that liquid like?

With their permission, he takes a little. He rubs
it thoughtfully between his fingers.

Tailor:
You're right, this would make an absolute 
mess of most fabrics.

We should be able to start you with some 
swimsuits.  Those will still get wet, but they
should bear it a lot better.

Over the long term, I could probably do
something with some raincoat material. Real
waterproof stuff, that is.

And something you can still go wild with:
accessorize!

We've got some very cute hats. Plus you should
be able to do all sorts of things with hair clips
and ribbons.

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
(Together)\C[30]Thank \C[5]you!

They lean forward and give him a massive
hug, planting a kiss on either side of his head.

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]This will

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Above tailor — p3
passages.content:
Park Volunteer BeeJ:
And now none of my clothezzz fit anymore!\!
I've been wearing thizzz zzztupid zzzwimzzzuit
for dayzzz!

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Above tailor — p4
passages.content:
Customer:
I'm telling you, I did buy clothes that fit!

It's all my old clothes that suddenly stopped
fitting!\!
This was my favorite shirt...

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Above tailor — p5
passages.content:
Snake Customer:
When this first happened, I wasn't sure how
underwear was even going to work.

But this is perfect!\!
And he even made it sexy!

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Above tailor — p6
passages.content:
Day Shift Knight:
You know, armor is surprisingly comfy.\!
But it would be nice to have a few more sets.

You know, something more stylish.\!
Another set that's more everyday, this one is 
all business casual.

Maybe a night armor for sleeping, and a cozy
set for lounging around.

She glances down at her straining chestpiece.

And some more breathing room might be nice
too.

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Above tailor — p7
passages.content:
Farm Volunteer:
You know, I've got all this wool I'm making 
now.

She gestures at her arms and legs.

And I figured, hey, it's a waste to not use it.\!
Might as well make my own clothes!

Or at least get them made.

Do you think you'd be able to help me put 
something together?

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Above tailor — p8
passages.content:
Store Customer:
I'm all ready to exercise again now that 
the gym's open!

...But the new sports bra I got here isn't 
quite doing enough.\!
How much can you reinforce it?

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Above tailor — p9
passages.content:
Farm Volunteer:
I love it!\!
Now do the rest of my wardrobe!

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Seats — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
...Do you think he can make shirts less 
transparent, too?

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Seats — p2
passages.content:
She's talking softly to herself.

Customer:
Just...\!
Don't breathe too hard.

You can do this.

Shallow breaths.

This is your last shirt, you don't want to lose
any more buttons.

Just shallow breaths until you can get some
repairs.

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Seats — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
Hmm.

If I breathe deeply enough, do you think I 
can get a button all the way across the room?

I'm getting this shirt repaired anyway, may
as well have some fun!

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Line — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
This was supposed to be such a cute outfit!\!
Nice slim lines!

What happened?!

Customer:
I hope he can help...

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Line — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
Pfft, imagine wearing something with
*buttons*.\!
Amateurs.

No, you want something stylish like this.

She stretches happily, thrusting her massive
chest forward.

Lots of slack, lots of room for adjustment,
and it looks great!

No, this outfit is perfect.\!
I'm just here to see if he can patch a hole
in my favorite pants.

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Hiding — p2
passages.content:
A customer is hiding behind one of the
dress dummies.

Customer:
Isn't he available yet?!

She peeks out.

Oh, why did this have to be the day he's so
busy!?\!
I'm having a clothing emergency here!

She pulls herself back behind the display.

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Line — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
No, no, respecting the line is important.

I'll just keep standing here like this, I guess.

(Why did it have to be so busy today?)

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Line — p2
passages.content:
She's examining herself in a mirror.

Customer:
So,\! uh,\! how much can tailors repair?

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Line — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
Ah!

You dodge as a flying button nearly hits you
in the eye.\!
It joins piles of lost buttons littered all over 
the floor.

Customer:
Sorry! So sorry!

She tries to cover up.

Customer:
(If only my bra hadn't burst too on the way
over!)

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Finished — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
This guy does amazing work!

My shirt completely tore itself apart!\!
My favorite shirt!

And look! He made it wearable again!

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Finished — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
What a miracle worker!

I don't know how he did it, but he added so
much space in the chest to this!\!
It fits like a glove!

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Loom — p2
passages.content:
Several bolts of brightly dyed wool sit next
to a spinning wheel.

passages.name: Tailor ARG — Anvil — p2
passages.content:
An anvil. A small stack of papers next to it
are filled with armor designs.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after
passages.content:
The customer is running through the store, 
her massive unrestrained breasts quaking
with every step.

Customer:
Oh my god! This shirt even makes it feel like
I've finally grown real boobs!

You hear an employee shout from across the 
floor.

Employee:
Ma'am! No running in the store!

Customer:
No! You can't stop me!\!
I'm going to pretend I'm not flat for as long
as possible!

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after
passages.content:
Customer:
There are so many things here that look like
they should fit. What's the catch?

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after
passages.content:
Customer:
I'm telling you, this fit when I put it on!

The shirt suddenly flies open.\!
A button bounces off the clerk's completely 
unamused face.

Employee:
Ma'am, I'm afraid I'm going to have to ask
you to pay for that.\!
Full price.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after
passages.content:
Employee:
I have been hit in the face by more buttons
than I can count today.

Why has *everyone* decided to force 
themselves into shirts that are way too tight?!

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after
passages.content:
Customer:
I know this fit when I put it on...

She tugs fruitlessly at her skirt.

Customer:
What happened?

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after
passages.content:
The customer is checking herself out in the 
mirror.

Customer:
Huh, something looks different about me.

She poses.

I'm not sure what.\!
But I think I *like* it.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after
passages.content:
Customer:
The last two tops I've tried were too small to
get the discount.

This time I'm wearing the biggest size I can
find. That'll have to work!

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after
passages.content:
Employee:
Everyone goes in carrying clothes that should
fit, but everyone comes out wearing things
that are too small.

Are they swapping clothes in there?

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Cashier 1
passages.content:
Employee:
I have never seen so many customers be 
*this* wrong about what fits them.

Have they never had to shop for themselves
before?

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after
passages.content:
Customer:
I swear these fit when I tried them on...

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after
passages.content:
Customer:
I don't care if it doesn't fit!\!
I've never had a shirt give me cleavage 
before!

This is worth every penny!

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — p1
passages.content:
The woman is sorting through racks of jackets.

Customer:
I've figured it out.\!
They're making the clothes shrink when we
wear them, or something.

But jackets, jackets don't care about size.\!
I can just wear it open if I have to.

She puts on one of the jackets.

90% off, here I come!

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
It still fits!

She struggles to pull the jacket down a little
more over her chest.

I don't care if it's shrunk a little!\!
It's still good enough!

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after
passages.content:
Employee:
So many people wearing tops that barely 
close.\!
Or skirts six inches too short.

It's making me feel like my clothes are too
small too.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after
passages.content:
Customer:
Okay! Time to pay and-

There's a sudden creaking noise from her
shirt.

Customer:
Uh...

There's a loud *snap* as her shirt rips open.

Customer:
...\!Maybe I'm not ready to leave yet.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after
passages.content:
Customer:
Uh-oh.\!
I hope I'm not going to have to pay for that.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after
passages.content:
Customer:
Too small?\!
Darling, this is exactly how a women should 
look!

Strong.\!
Confident.\!
Secure in her appearance, and wanting
everyone to know it!

If anything, *your* clothes are too big!

Employee:
...\!You're still paying full price.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after
passages.content:
Employee:
Customers that argue about price get a 
whipping!

You hear a shout from across the room.

Manager:
\}No whipping customers!

Employee:
Employees that give bad commands get a 
whipping!

Manager:
\}Just put the whip down already!

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after
passages.content:
Customer:
Looking good girl!

She blows herself a kiss.

Customer:
That's the kind of look I like!

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — p1
passages.content:
Arrogant Customer:
This bra is the wrong size. Get me another
one, the right size this time!

Employee:
Fine, Ma'am.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — p2
passages.content:
Arrogant Customer:
Really, they just don't make employees here
like they used to!

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — p3
passages.content:
Arrogant Customer:
This one doesn't fit either!\!
Bring me one that's the *correct* size!

Employee:
\^Ma'am, I believe that is-\.\.

Arrogant Customer:
I know my sizes!\.\. Go!

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — p4
passages.content:
Arrogant Customer:
The nerve, trying to tell me what my sizes
are!\!
I have always been a c-cup and nothing else!

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — p5
passages.content:
Arrogant Customer:
I can't even get this on! What were you 
thinking?!

She pulls again on the bra, but can't even get
it to the base of her breasts.

Employee:
Ma'am, perhaps a larger size?

Arrogant Customer:
Excuse me, have you heard of the customer
is always right?

And one of the many, many things I am right
about is my sizing!

If you would just-

She makes another futile attempt to fit even
a fraction of her chest into the cups.

This can't possibly be a C-cup, bring me the
right size and everything will be fine!

Employee:
Fine.

She stomps out of the room.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — p6
passages.content:
She makes another futile attempt to fit even
a fraction of her chest into the cups.

Arrogant Customer:
Do they even teach employees to read tags
anymore?!

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — p7
passages.content:
The employee hands the customer another
bra.\!
She takes one look at it and starts shaking her
head.

Arrogant Customer:
No no no!

She holds it up in front of her.

Arrogant Customer:
Does this look like it could *possibly* fit me?!

Employee:
\^But you asked for-\.\.\.

Arrogant Customer:
Just go away!

I shall be writing a bad review, and then I
shall take my business elsewhere!

She pulls a phone out.

Employee:
I-

Arrogant Customer:
Are you still here?!\!
I said to leave!

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — p8
passages.content:
She holds up the bra in front of her again.

Arrogant Customer:
Look at this.\!
What was that imbecile thinking?!

There's no way something this small could
be a C-cup!

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Fitting room employee — p1
passages.content:
Arrogant Customer:
This bra is the wrong size. Get me another
one, the right size this time!

Employee:
Fine, Ma'am.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Fitting room employee — p3
passages.content:
Arrogant Customer:
This one doesn't fit either!\!
Bring me one that's the *correct* size!

Employee:
\^Ma'am, I believe that is-\.\.

Arrogant Customer:
I know my sizes!\.\. Go!

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Fitting room employee — p5
passages.content:
Arrogant Customer:
I can't even get this on! What were you 
thinking?!

She pulls again on the bra, but can't even get
it to the base of her breasts.

Employee:
Ma'am, perhaps a larger size?

Arrogant Customer:
Excuse me, have you heard of the customer
is always right?

And one of the many, many things I am right
about is my sizing!

If you would just-

She makes another futile attempt to fit even
a fraction of her chest into the cups.

Just bring me the right size, everything would
be fine!

Employee:
Fine.

She stomps out of the room.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Fitting room employee — p7
passages.content:
The employee hands the customer another
bra.\!
She takes one look at it and starts shaking her
head.

Arrogant Customer:
No no no!

She holds it up in front of her.

Arrogant Customer:
Does this look like it could *possibly* fit me?!

Employee:
\^But you asked for-\.\.\.

Arrogant Customer:
Just go away!

I shall be writing a bad review, and then I
shall take my business elsewhere!

She pulls a phone out.

Employee:
I-

Arrogant Customer:
Are you still here?!\!
I said to leave!

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Searching fitting room employee — p2
passages.content:
The employee is going through the bras.

Employee:
I know what I'm doing.

She picks one out and heads back to the 
fitting rooms.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Searching fitting room employee — p4
passages.content:
The same employee is looking through the 
bras again.

Employee:
\}Stupid customer. I hope she never finds a
bra that fits ever again.

\}I hope she blows up like a blimp until
nothing ever fits her.

She grabs one and heads back to the 
fitting rooms.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Searching fitting room employee — p6
passages.content:
The same employee is looking through the 
bras again.

Employee:
\}I can't believe she thinks she's a C cup.

\}We don't have bras her size.\!
No one has bras her size.\!
Serves her right.

She grabs one of the bras.

Employee:
Guess this is no worse than any other.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — p2
passages.content:
The employee from before is here, angrily 
folding clothing.

Employee:
"Why can't you follow instructions," she says.\!
I brought her what she asked for every time!

Not my fault she has no idea how bra sizes
work.

She folds clothes for a little bit.

Employee:
Why is she even here?!\!
If she wants something that fits, she should
be looking at the bedsheets!

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after
passages.content:
Customer:
I came here because milady asked me to get
a spare maid uniform.

...I don't think my old one is going to fit 
anymore.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after
passages.content:
Customer:
Come on!\!
Stupid shirt!

You fit before I started trying on clothes!

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after
passages.content:
Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
No time for playing in weird metal boxes, nya!

After a moment's wait, the elevator arrives on
your floor.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Snake customer — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
What is with this day?!

First a snake upstairs bites me, and now
nothing fits?!

She maks another fruitless attempt to tug her
vest over her swollen breasts.

Customer:
Maybe I should just go home and brumate
until things are better.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Animal control 1 — p1
passages.content:
The animal control officer is lying groaning 
in a pile of clothes.

Animal Control:
Ow.

Animal Control:
I'm\..\..\.. feeling better?

He grabs a nearby clothes rack to help
himself up.

Unfortunately he grabs the wrong part and
pull it down on him, vanishing under a pile
of shirts.

Animal Control:
Agh, how-

The pile shakes as the officer wrestles with
the clothes.

And then the pile starts...\!
Growing larger?

Yes, you're definitely seeing it start to mound
up.

It swells.\!
And swells.\!
Until a surprisingly blonde head pokes out of 
the top.

They drag themselves the rest of the way 
out of the pile.



Animal Control:
...What's the biggest size this place carries?

Animal Control:
...I probably shouldn't be clothes shopping on 
duty anyway.\!
I hope chief lets me leave early.

She heads off to the chief, tugging 
ineffectually at her shirt as she goes.

That's the last of them. You should go talk
to the animal control boss again.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Doug — p1
passages.content:
Doug is curled up on a pile of pants, 
occasionally running her claws through them.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Animal control boss — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control Boss:
Shhhh, I've got her cornered but I'm going to
need more men to make the catch.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Animal control boss — p2
passages.content:
Animal Control Boss:
Alright men! We have our target cornered!

This time we are ready! \!
We are prepared!\!
We are-

One of the officers looks behind their boss, 
then raises a hand.\!
The boss sighs.

Animal Control Boss:
And she just ran away, didn't she.

Animal Control:
Sir!\!
Straight up the stairs sir!

Animal Control Boss:
Of course she did.\!
Well, she's still trapped.

We'll corner the two of them on the roof if 
we have to!

Jones! Get in touch with HQ!\!
Call *everyone* in.\!
We're ending this!

They all run up the stairs.

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
Oh nyo, again?\!
We...\! We should follow them.

She gives a tired 'nya', then heads up the 
stairs.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Animal control 1 after — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
As the chief always said, duty before shirts!

Well, he never said that, but I'm certain he
would.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Rampage - clothes 2 — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
What hit me...

The officer holds up a hand when you 
approach with a potion.

Animal Control:
Wait, stop.\!
I've been watching.\!
I get how this goes.

You nod and start to put the potion away.

Animal Control:
No, wait!
Don't-

He winces and rubs his leg.

Animal Control:
Don't leave me hurt like this.\!
It's just...

Animal Control:
I'm sitting in what, the petite section?\!
"For the extra tiny and weak"?\!
Yeah, no thanks.

Just, give me a minute.

He limps across the aisle, groaning the whole 
way.

Animal Control:
Come on, there's no way I want to stay hurt
like this.

Animal Control:
Yeah, here we go, Big and Bulky department.\!
Just what I'm looking for.\!
I'm gonna be HUGE.

You hand over the potion.\!
He chugs it.

There is a brief silence.\!
There is a loud ripping noise.

A sudden surge of muscles tears out through
his clothes and rips parts of them to shreds.

Animal Control:
Ah yeah, look at these babies.



She kisses her arms.

That's the stuff!

Animal Control:
Now let's get back to catching that cat.\!
No animal's gonna be able to escape
me now!

She heads off.

That's the last of them. You should go talk
to the animal control boss again.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Animal control 3 — p1
passages.content:
The officer is lying in a rack of formal 
dresses.

Animal Control:
I knew we should have made a better plan!

Intelligence.\!
Foresight.\!
Elegance!

Those are our advantages over the animals.

He winces in pain.

This wasn't elegant at all!

Animal Control:
Elegance, we need more elegance...

He continues muttering to himself as you use
the potion, even as he starts to glow.

Dresses rise up around him, wrapping him
in a cocoon of silk and delicate fabric.

Throughout it all his muttering continues, 
steadily rising in pitch.

Animal Control:
Yes...\!
Beauty...\!
Grace...\!

A moment more, and then the cocoon
collapses.



Animal Control:
Ah, now this is elegance!

Time to get back to work!\!
This time it will go *much* better.

She wobbles off to meet the boss, unsteady
on her new heels.\! Within a few steps her gait
smoothes out and she's soon moving easily
and, indeed, elegantly.

That's the last of them. You should go talk
to the animal control boss again.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Animal control 4 — p1
passages.content:
The animal control officer is sitting on a pile
of clothes rubbing his leg.

Animal Control:
Ow.

You administer a potion.

Animal Control:
Was that...\.\. supposed to do something?

Huh.\!
You try another one.

And another.

Animal Control:
Look, what are you-

There's an incredibly bright flash.

His chest explodes forward, ripping his clothes
into tiny shreds.\!
Clothes fly up to cover him like they were
magnetized.



\n[2]:
Fascinating, a delayed reaction. It seems to 
have enhanced the effects.

Animal Control:
...I guess I'd better get back to work.\!
At least I can block a lot of space like this.

She heads off to the chief, jiggling and
wobbling and occasionally knocking over
clothing displays.

That's the last of them. You should go talk
to the animal control boss again.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Police 5 — p1
passages.content:
The officer is lounging on some fallen clothes.

Animal Control:
Nope, I'm on my break.\!
Though I hope nothing's broken...

He springs to his feet.

Animal Control:
Suddenly, energy!

He stretches.



A button goes flying from her suddenly
overstrained clothes.

Animal Control:
Huh, *that's* new.

Animal Control:
Oh well, it's something for when I'm off duty!\!
No time for it now!

She rushes off to join the chief.

That's the last of them. You should go talk
to the animal control boss again.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Animal control 3 after — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Just give the word chief!\!
Even a giant robot can't stand up to *this*
much elegance.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Animal control 4 after — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Ready!\!
There's no way she's getting past me!

Animal Control:
There's no way anyone's getting past me.\!
Sorry everyone...

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Animal control 5 after — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Ready and waiting sir!\!
And after this, permission to go shopping 
please?

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Animal control 2 after — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Armed and ready!

She kisses her biceps.

Animal Control:
No animal's escaping these guns!

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Autoplay — p1
passages.content:
Once more, you arrive to find the boss of 
animal control lying groaning on the floor.

Animal Control Boss:
Urgh...

The lovely spirit hikes in, grumbling.

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
I'm here *pant*, I'm here nya.

I sensed *anyather* group of poor warriors
in need of love and justice!

And I totally can do this, nya.\!
Just,\.\. just give me a moment to catch my
breath.

She leans on her knees for a moment,
breathing heavily.

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
Is this normal?\!
Are things always this busy?

\n[2]:
You get used to it eventually!

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
Okay, here's the plan, nya.

I've got maybe one more Magical Lovely Love
Power in me.\!
It should be enough to heal this poor warrior.

Then you go heal the other five I sense, while
I go around the corner and take a *nap*.

For love and justice.

She starts to lead you through the dance,
then frowns.

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
I'm... nyat sure how much power I can put
into this.\!
You're going to need to get closer.

You inch forward.

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
No, no, closer, nya!\!
Right up against the poor warrior!

You move forward again.

She motions you to continue.

Again.\!
And again.

Until you're practically shoving your chest
in the chief's face.\!
Thankfully they still seem too out of it to 
notice.

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
Let's go, nya!

She leads you through the dance again.\!
It's harder this time, having to be careful to
not step on the chief, or slap him in the face
with your jiggling boobs.

She leads you through the dance again.\!
It's harder this time, having to be careful to
not step on the chief.

But finally...

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
Magical Lovely *pant* Love Power!

She throws out her hands, then collapses with
a groan.

You throw your hands out.\!
A wave of power washes out of you.

And this time goes barely six inches.\!
Still, that's enough to work.

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
Be healed!

Several but

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Magical love spirit — p1
passages.content:
The lovely spirit is curled up here.

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
Five more minutes.

\v[23] more hurt warriors.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Robot — p1
passages.content:
The mecha lies crumpled and smoking against 
the wall, throwing off the occasional spark.

The machine twitches as you pour power into
it, but it looks like it's too damaged to move
again.

Eh, might as well give it a try.

Robot?:
SYSTEMS\..\..\.. REBOOTING\..\..\..\!
DAMAGE FLAGS CLEARING\..\..\..
PROCESSING\..\..\..\..\..

CANNONS\..\..\.. NOT FOUND.\!
MISSILES\..\..\.. NOT FOUND.\!
NEW DATABASE DISCOVERED:\!
LOOKING SEXY.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Robot — p2
passages.content:
Robot?:
ERROR: PREVIOUS PROTOCOL: VIOLENCE
NOT FOUND.

SEARCHING FOR NEW PROTOCOL\..\..\..\..\..\..

NEW PROTOCOL FOUND.\!
ENACTING PROTOCOL: FASHION.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Exercise clothes
passages.content:
Customer:
I wanted to get new exercise clothes since the
gym reopened, but none of these seem to
quite fit.

I love how it looks with my hair though.

passages.name: Floor 2 ARG 2 after — Animal control shopping
passages.content:
Animal Control:
I'm so glad we got off early so I can find a
shirt that fits.

passages.content:
You scan through the vending machine's 
offerings.

passages.content:

For all your tennis needs!

passages.content:

passages.content:
After a moment's wait, the elevator arrives on

passages.name: Floor 4 Real After 2 — Animal control — p1
passages.content:
An animal control officer lies on the ground
groaning, covered in mecha action figures.

You apply the potion.

A single click comes from the pile.

Then more, and more, as if something is 
assembling itself.

And then the whole pile stands up.

Animal Control:
Huh.\!
Well, at least I'm armed for any situation now.

She experimentally tenses certain muscles.
Foam darts fly out of her guns.

Animal Control:
...Or maybe not.

She shrugs, then clomps off upstairs.

passages.name: Floor 4 Real After 2 — Kyle — p1
passages.content:
Kyle:
They said yes!\!
I can't believe they said yes!

Kyle:
Rose and Lily...\!
I'm so happy!\!
I want to celebrate!

And that means presents. Presents to show
everyone just how much they mean to me.

But I can't get Rose and Lily another present,
we just got them one.

I- I don't want to come off as weird. Or too 
clingy.

But Darren! He's been there for me through
so much!\!
He deserves a present too!

Kyle:
That's what I'm here for!\!
He loves his model kits. 

Cars, spaceships, whatever.\!
But what he really loves is robots. \!
I thought he had everything, but this place
has a dozen things I've never seen before.

He picks a box off the shelf.

Kyle:
Look at this!\!
It's not just a robot, it moves! It lights up!

Kyle:
He's going to love this so much!

He happily walks out.

passages.name: Floor 4 Real After 2
passages.content: Adult Toys and Games

passages.name: Floor 4 Real After 2 — Autoplay — p1
passages.content:
As you enter the floor you see Kyle and 
Darren looking at a battery display.

Kyle:
You said there was something here you 
thought I'd like?

Darren:
Yeah.

He picks up one of the larger batteries and
holds it out to her.\!
She takes it.

Kyle:
Batteries for a robot...\!
It makes sense these might do something
for me?

Like how Rose and Lily have really gotten
into compost.

She turns it around in her hands.

Kyle:
But how to use it?

She stares at it for a moment.

Kyle:
Electricity is kind of robot food, right?

She licks the end.

Kyle:
Huh.\!
Weird, but not too bad?

Darren mumbles something.

Kyle:
What was that?

Darren:
I, uh, think there's a better way to use it.

Kyle:
Huh?

Darren:
Well, there's these icons...

He turns around and searches through
another display.\|
He picks up a toy.

Darren:
See here?

He holds it out to her.

Darren:
There's some little symbols showing you 
what types of batteries to use, where to place
them, all that.

Kyle:
Ok, so?

Darren blushes.

Kyle:
Wait.\!
Wait.

She grabs his shoulders and stares into his
eyes.

Kyle:
Darren, where did you see these symbols?

You didn't...

Darren coughs awkwardly.

Darren:
Yeah.\!
While I was \}eating you out\{...

Darren:
\}Right above...

Kyle stares down at herself.

They both look back at the battery display.

Darren:
It said one D-cell...

Kyle:
Well...

She grabs a pack of batteries and Darren's 
arm.\!
And blushes a pale blue.

Kyle:
Come on.\!
\}If I'm getting the D then you're going to be
the one putting it in me.

They head off to the register.

passages.name: Floor 4 Real After 2 — Clerk
passages.content:
Store Employee:
You know what, I'm keeping the adult section
closed for now.

I don't want anyone wearing anything there 
up to the register, and I *definitely* don't
want them to try to show me that it fits.

passages.name: Floor 4 Real After 2 — Darren — p1
passages.content:
The man on the left is staring worriedly into
his drink.

Man:
I'm just worried that it'll all turn out wrong.

The other man reaches out and grabs his hand
reassuringly.

Other man:
Kyle. Kyle. It'll be fine.

We've both talked to them about joining our
relationships before. It'll all work out.

Kyle:
But Lily has never been up for it before.

Other Man:
And so we gave them space. But now Rose 
and Lily have both said they want to discuss
it.

Kyle:
Darren, that's why everything has to go right!
If this is a chance for us all to join together,
it needs to go perfectly.

And that's not happening with the store
closed.

Darren:
Look, you know that Rose and Lily care for
each other, right?

Kyle:
Yes...

Darren:
And they both care about both of us?

Kyle:
Yes...

Darren:
That's what's needed. That's the important
part.

We'll be able to work out the rest somehow,
if we're all trying.  Whatever form that takes.

Look, it's just a power outage. Soon the
store's going to open back up.

And then we're going to go back in there and
get them something that shows just how
valuable they are to us.

It'll be fine.

Kyle stares into his drink again. But he does
seem less worried.

passages.name: Floor 5 Real after — Cashier — p1
passages.content:
Store Employee:
I'm just glad it's been quiet up here.

All the customers are down at the clothing
sale.

passages.name: Floor 5 Real after — Cashier — p2
passages.content:
Store Employee:
Can I help you?

You open your mouth to reply.\!
And then realize that you have no way to 
phrase your request in a remotely sane
manner.

You're looking for a magic extension to your
apartment, one that doesn't take up any
space.

Except most people probably can't even see
it, much less interact with it.\!
And you're here because a character in a 
video game suggested it.

That is a long chain of ridiculous-sounding
assertions. \!
You do your best.

Store Employee:
\..\..\..So you're looking for magic space in 
a box.

Something that works without construction, 
without even touching your neighbors.

Just, *poof* and your apartment is bigger?\!
That's really what you're looking for?

Reluctantly you nod.

Store Employee:
\..\..\..We just got in a shipment.

None of us have been able to make it do
anything, but it sounds like that's also what
you're looking for?

// Set to 2 if the player buys the upgrade, 1 if they don't.

// Check if they bought more than one, refund if so.

They reach under the counter for your order,
then pause.

Store Employee:
Sorry, it looks like, somehow, we've only got 
one left.\!
I'll give you back the rest of your money.

Store Employee:
We've been getting a lot of weird stuff in,
we might have more things like that if you
check back later.

passages.name: Floor 5 Real after — Cashier — p3
passages.content:
Store Employee:
Welcome back.

// Set to 2 if the player buys the upgrade, 1 if they don't.

Store Employee:
We've been getting a lot of weird stuff in,
we might have more things like that if you
check back later.

passages.name: Floor 5 Real after — Cashier — p4
passages.content:
Store Employee:
Any luck with that apartment thing?

We've been getting a lot of weird stuff in,
we might have more things like that if you
check back later.

passages.name: Floor 5 Real after — Cashier — p5
passages.content:
Store Employee:
Hey, we just got in a new shipment of things.

They check a list.

Store Employee:
"*Poof* And Then There's Computers"?\!
Is this like a brand name or something?

Buy *Poof* And Then There's Computers
for 500 gold?

As soon as you buy the item it disappears with
a *poof*.

As advertised.

You guess there must be computers now?

Store Employee:
Doesn't look like you have enough money.

passages.name: Floor 5 Real after — Cashier — p6
passages.content:
Store Employee:
Any luck with that apartment thing?

We've been getting a lot of weird stuff in,
we might have more things like that if you
check back later.

passages.name: Floor 5 Real after — Animal control — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Couch\..\..\.. too\..\..\.. comfy\..\..\..
No\..\..\.. energy\..\..\.. to move\..\..\..

Potion!

Animal Control:
Hydration\..\..\.. refreshed\..\..\..
Energy\..\..\.. growing\..\..\..
Motivation\..\..\.. restored!

Animal Control:
Hey, thanks!

She heads off upstairs.\!
...Then comes back and starts dragging the
couch with her.

Animal Control:
It's just too comfy!

passages.name: Roof — Carol and Honey event trigger — p1
passages.content:
You see Carol and Honey up ahead, sitting
on the edge of the roof holding hands.

Honey:
You were right, this is a great view.

She trails off uncertainly.

Carol:
Is zzzomething wrong?

Honey:
It's just.\..\..\..\..\..

She pauses, then blurts it out.

Honey:
How are you not *terrified*?!

Carol:
What?

Honey:
That all of this is going to go away!

She gestures wildly at everything.

Honey:
Look, we flew up here, and that was amazing!\!
But you should know how impossible that is!

When this all happened-

She gestures at herself.

Honey:
I was convinced it was all a dream!

At any moment I might wake up and be back
in my drab grey life.

But then things continued, and then I met you-

She glances up at Carol.

Honey:
And I started to think that maybe it wasn't.

But it's been so good-\.\.
You've been so good-\.\.
That now I'm terrified it is a dream!

That these things can't happen for real.\!
That it is impossible to fly!

That any moment I could wake up back as my
old dull self, back in my drab grey life...

She starts to sniffle.

Honey:
And, and, never have met you...\!
Never ever meet you again...

She's sobbing now, as Carol pulls her into a
hug.

Carol:
Oh Honey...\!
Honey Honey Honey...

Carol:
(Think Carol, think!)\!
(What would a beeologist zzay?)\!
(What would a bee zzzay?!)

Carol takes a deep breath.

Carol:
I can't guarantee this izzn't a dream.\!
Not even the beezz can tell for zzure.

But you know what I can guarantee?\!
That thizz will be a dream to *remember*.

She waves a hand out towards the city.

Carol:
Zzat we are going to do zzo much, be zzo 
great, that it will burn itself into your brain!

Maybe you will wake up and everything will be
back to before!

But we are going to have such a good time 
that you'll zztill have zzomething to carry you
forwardzz!

Honey's sobs slow as she looks up at Carol
with dawning hope.

Honey:
Really?

Carol pulls her into a tight hug, bringing their
faces close together.

Carol:
Yezzz!

We can only do what we c

passages.name: Roof — Carol and Honey event trigger — p2
passages.content:
Honey still looks a little sad, but she's smiling
up at Carol as the beegirl paints images of
elaborate dates.

Carol:
-and that's when we jump out of the zzkydiving
plane. We fly down, enjoying the view, and 
when we land the fireworkzz go off...

You figure you shouldn't interrupt.

passages.name: Roof — Carol and Honey event trigger — p3
passages.content:
Honey still looks a little sad, but she's smiling
up at Carol as the beegirl paints images of
elaborate dates.

Carol:
-and that's when we jump out of the zzkydiving
plane. We fly down, enjoying the view, and 
when we land the fireworkzz go off...

You figure you shouldn't interrupt.

passages.name: Garden 1 real — Rose and Lily — p1
passages.content:
\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]Wow, this is really\..\..\..
\C[5]Not as bad as we thought!

\C[30]We're going to need to figure out who
has the keys to the garden gates, of course.
\C[5]But a little weed pulling, some mowing,
and we'll be ready to replant!

Lily notices you.

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[5]Here to help?
\C[30]Welcome!

Both:
\C[30]Thank \C[5]you!

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:

cleaning up a little.

\C[30]They're growing everywhere.

passages.content:

weeds!

Turn in five weeds?

Both:
\C[30]Thank \C[5]you!

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]It's a start.
\C[5]It's a start!

\C[30]Next is to get some grasscutting 
services in, and then we can start planting!

\C[30]Please, take this with our thanks.
\C[5]There are still a few flowers left!

Gained pretty flower!

You decide to hold on to them for now.\!
Way to hoard all the weed, man!

passages.name: Garden 1 real — Rose and Lily — p3
passages.content:
\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:

\C[5]And then we can start replanting!

Both:
Thanks again for helping!

passages.name: Garden 1 ARG — Rose and Lily — p1
passages.content:
\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]Wow, this is really\..\..\..
\C[5]Not as bad as we thought!

\C[30]We're going to need to figure out who
has the keys to the garden gates, of course.
\C[5]But a little weed pulling, some mowing,
and we'll be ready to replant!

Lily notices you.

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[5]Here to help?
\C[30]Welcome!

Both:
\C[30]Thank \C[5]you!

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]Today we're just taking stock and 
cleaning up a little.
\C[5]Would you mind pulling some weeds?

\C[30]They're growing everywhere.
\C[5]Five should be enough for now!

passages.name: Garden 1 ARG — Rose and Lily — p2
passages.content:
\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]Thanks again for helping.
\C[5]Just let us know when you've got five
weeds!

Turn in five weeds?

Both:
\C[30]Thank \C[5]you!

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]It's a start.
\C[5]It's a start!

\C[30]Next is to get some grasscutting 
services in, and then we can start planting!

\C[30]Please, take this with our thanks.
\C[5]There are still a few flowers left!

Gained pretty flower!

You decide to hold on to them for now.\!
Way to hoard all the weed, man!

passages.name: Garden 1 ARG — Rose and Lily — p3
passages.content:
\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[5]Thanks again for helping!

passages.name: Garden 1 ARG — Rose and Lily — p4
passages.content:
\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]We're just waiting on the mowers.
\C[5]And then we can start replanting!

Both:
Thanks again for helping!

passages.name: Garden 1 ARG — Autoplay event
passages.content:
Last night...

Tim:
It's gone!\!
Carl, it's all gone!

Carl:
What?!

Carl:
No way!\!
Someone took all our weeds?!

Tim:
They're all gone!\!
All of them!

And we never even got a chance to figure out
which kind of weed is the good kind!

Carl:
Why would someone DO that?!

Tim:
I dunno man.\!
I dunno.

Carl:
I wish\..\..\..
I wish\..\..\..

I wish this garden was ours! To do as we
wanted!

Tim:
Yeah! And that we could grow as much weeds
as we wanted!

Carl:
Yeah!

Tim:
...Uh, what was that noise?

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG after — Sleeper — p1
passages.content:
Sleeping Employee:
\.\.Just five more minutes...

She just rolls over and goes back to sleep.

Sleeping Employee:
Nope...\!
Not this time...

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG after — Sleeper — p3
passages.content:
The store employee has set up all the heat
lamps in the store to point at her.

Ssssussssan:
Mmmm, so comfy...

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG after — Coworker — p1
passages.content:
The employee is shaking her sleeping 
coworker.

Employee:
Come on Susan, wake up!\!
The snakes have escaped and you're the only
one who knows how to handle them!

She shakes her coworker.\!
Who just keeps on sleeping.

Employee:
Aaaugh!

Employee:
This is bad!

I mean, the snakes are harmless. But our
manager is going to kill us!\!
We've had so many problems that everything
needs to be *perfect*.

She looks back to her coworker.

Employee:
And she's already on thin ice. 

They keep her around because she's so good 
with the animals, but if she keeps sleeping 
through everything...

Employee:
This calls for drastic measures.\!
Normal coffee doesn't work. We need some 
kind of super coffee.

Could you go to the coffeeshop down the
street and see if they can make anything?\!
I need to stay here and keep an eye out for
our manager.

And don't mind the snakes.  They're harmless,
really!

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG after — Coworker — p2
passages.content:
Employee:
Have you checked at the coffeeshop yet?\!
The guy there makes all sorts of weird drinks,
I'm sure he can think of something!

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG after — Coworker — p3
passages.content:
Employee:
You have it? Great!

With the ease of someone who has had to do
this way too many times, she pours it into the
mouth of her sleeping coworker.

Employee:
Are you sure that was-\.\.\.\^

Susan:
\{I HAVE NEVER BEEN 
THIS AWAKE!

Susan:
\{WHAT'S WRONG, 
WHAT'S WRONG?!?!?!?!

Employee:
\^I-\.

Susan:
TELL ME LATER, I'M GOING FOR A RUN!!!!

You can see her zooming through the rest of 
the floor.

Susan:
OH HI SNAKEY!

Gathering snakes as she goes.

Susan:
ANOTHER FRIEND!

Until all you can see is a giant ball of happy
snakes, still dashing around.

Susan:
SNAKEY CUDDLES!

And then she trips.\!
Onto what sounds like an armful of suddenly
very unhappy snakes.

Susan:
AH! BITEY FRIENDS! BITEY FRIENDS!

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG after — Coworker — p4
passages.content:
Employee:
I wish I could say this was unusual for her...

She's lucky she's so good with the animals.

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG after — Snake — p1
passages.content:
The employee runs up and pushes you away.

Employee:
No!\!
Stay away from them!

Employee:
What are you doing?!\!
Those snakes are harmless!\!
Stay away from them!

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG after — Snake — p1
passages.content:
The employee runs up and pushes you away.

Employee:

Stay away from them!

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG after
passages.content:
After a moment's wait, the elevator arrives on
your floor.

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG after — p2
passages.content:
You gingerly approach the pile of twitching
snakes.\!
There's one especially large tail sticking out
that you're a little worried about.

If the tail is that large, how huge must the
snake be? Is it dangerous?

Suddenly, a figure bursts out of the pile.

Ssssussssan:
I'M OKAY!

Ah. That explains that.

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG after — p3
passages.content:
The previously sleeping employee is going 
around soothing snakes and putting them back
in their cages, still slightly too fast and too 
loud.

Ssssussssan:
WOW! What was IN that?!?!

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG after — Employee after — p2
passages.content:
Customer:
I don't know, the snakes are cool...\!
But the rabbits are really cute...

Are you sure it's a bad idea to get both? They
could play together!

Employee:
Sir, I'd really advise just getting one as
your first pet.

A pet is a lot of work to care for, and it's best
to start with one.

Customer:
That makes sense. I think a bunny, then?\!
Or no, a snake?\!
Or...

Employee:
Are you sure you don't want to hold one of
them? That might help you decide.

Customer:
No, no, I would hate to introduce myself to
them and then leave them behind!
It would be cruel!

Employee:
Well, is there anything else I can do to help
you choose?

Customer:
Hmmm...

Customer:
Oh, I know!

He turns to you.

Customer:
Which do you like more? Snakes or rabbits?

Customer:
Well, there we go!\!
I would like to be introduced to your politest
snake, please.

The clerk vanishes for a moment, then comes
back with a small pink snake.

Employee:
I'd like you to meet one of our best-behaved
young corn snakes.\!
She's a real cutie!

She holds the snake out to him.

Employee:
Here, she loves having her head scratched.

The customer gives a tentative scratch to the
top of the snake's head.

The snake leans into it, seeming to enjoy it 
more and more as the nails on her head
grow out into inch-long claws.

Customer:
Aww, she really does!

He doesn't seem to notice as pink scales begin
to spread down his fingers from the point of
contact.

Employee:
Here, trying holding her.
Just hold out your hands.

The snake immediately starts twining around
the customer's fingers.\!
Both hands are now developing a coat of pink
scales, even as they slim down.

Employee:
She likes to sit on shoulders, too.
Give it a try!

Using his significantly more delicate arms,
the customer transfers the snake up to his
shoulders.

The pink scales have spread all the way up
to the middle of his upper arms, giving the
look of long elegant gloves.

Customer:
Wow, she really is affectionate!

As soon as the snake reaches her new per

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG after — Employee after — p3
passages.content:
// Pet status: 
0 - unchosen
1 - Snake
2 - Rabbit

Employee:
Now, she can get by with a heat lamp from our
store. You might want to look into getting a 
heated blanket for yourself.

I know Susan swears by them.

Employee:
It's always so nice to see someone preparing
for their first experience with a pet!

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG after — Employee after — p4
passages.content:
// Pet status: 
0 - unchosen
1 - Snake
2 - Rabbit

Employee:
Remember, a hay-based diet is best. Though
we offer a range of treats if you want to try 
them.

And you might enjoy chewing on some of our
chew toys to keep your teeth under control.

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG after — Uncertain customer — p3
passages.content:
Customer:
Okay, so I should be buying pinky mice for her
until she gets a little larger.

How about me? Should I be trying to eat mice
too?

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG after — Uncertain customer — p4
passages.content:
Customer:
Rabbits like to eat *what*?!

You know what, I think I'm just going to try 
going vegetarian instead.

passages.name: Floor 3 ARG after — Animal control — p1
passages.content:
In what has become a surprisingly familiar
event, an animal control officer is lying here
groaning.

Animal Control:
Why did it have to be snakes...

You use another potion.

Animal Control:
Huh, no idea what just happened.

She shrugs.\!
It takes a while for the jiggling that follows to
die down.

Animal Control:
Got bit by some snakes? And then maybe 
there was some clothing or something?

She shrugs again, then slithers off upstairs.

passages.content:
You scan through the vending machine's 
offerings.

passages.name: Floor 4 ARG After 2
passages.content:
VR Tennis Controller!
For all your tennis needs!

passages.name: Floor 4 ARG After 2
passages.content:

passages.name: Floor 4 ARG After 2 — Animal control — p1
passages.content:
An animal control officer lies on the ground
groaning, covered in mecha action figures.

You apply the potion.

A single click comes from the pile.

Then more, and more, as if something is 
assembling itself.

And then the whole pile stands up.

Animal Control:
Huh.\!
Well, at least I'm armed for any situation now.

She experimentally tenses certain muscles.
Foam darts fly out of her guns.

Animal Control:
...Or maybe not.

She shrugs, then clomps off upstairs.

passages.name: Floor 4 ARG After 2 — Kyle — p1
passages.content:
Kyle:
They said yes!\!
I can't believe they said yes!

Kyle:
Rose and Lily...\!
I'm so happy!\!
I want to celebrate!

And that means presents. Presents to show
everyone just how much they mean to me.

But I can't get Rose and Lily another present,
we just got them one.

I- I don't want to come off as weird. Or too 
clingy.

But Darren! He's been there for me through
so much!\!
He deserves a present too!

Kyle:
That's what I'm here for!\!
He loves his model kits. 

Cars, spaceships, whatever.\!
But what he really loves is robots. \!
I thought he had everything, but this place
has a dozen things I've never seen before.

He picks a box off the shelf.

Kyle:
Look at this!\!
It's not just a robot, it moves! It lights up!

Kyle:
He's going to love this so much!

He happily walks out.

I don't want anyone wearing anything there

want them to try to show me that it fits.

passages.content: \{Furniture and Housewares

passages.name: Floor 5 ARG after — Cashier — p1
passages.content:
Store Employee:
I'm just glad it's been quiet up here.

All the customers are down at the clothing
sale.

passages.name: Floor 5 ARG after — Cashier — p2
passages.content:
Store Employee:
Can I help you?

You open your mouth to reply.\!
And then realize that you have no way to 
phrase your request in a remotely sane
manner.

You're looking for a magic extension to your
apartment, one that doesn't take up any
space.

Except most people probably can't even see
it, much less interact with it.\!
And you're here because a character in a 
video game suggested it.

That is a long chain of ridiculous-sounding
assertions. \!
You do your best.

Store Employee:
\..\..\..So you're looking for magic space in 
a box.

Something that works without construction, 
without even touching your neighbors.

Just, *poof* and your apartment is bigger?\!
That's really what you're looking for?

Reluctantly you nod.

Store Employee:
\..\..\..We just got in a shipment.

None of us have been able to make it do
anything, but it sounds like that's also what
you're looking for?

// Set to 2 if the player buys the upgrade, 1 if they don't.

// Check if they bought more than one, refund if so.

They reach under the counter for your order,
then pause.

Store Employee:
Sorry, it looks like, somehow, we've only got 
one left.\!
I'll give you back the rest of your money.

Store Employee:
We've been getting a lot of weird stuff in,
we might have more things like that if you
check back later.

passages.name: Floor 5 ARG after — Cashier — p3
passages.content:
Store Employee:
Welcome back.

// Set to 2 if the player buys the upgrade, 1 if they don't.

Store Employee:
We've been getting a lot of weird stuff in,
we might have more things like that if you
check back later.

passages.name: Floor 5 ARG after — Cashier — p4
passages.content:
Store Employee:
Any luck with that apartment thing?

Store Employee:
We've been getting a lot of weird stuff in,
we might have more things like that if you
check back later.

passages.name: Floor 5 ARG after — Cashier — p5
passages.content:
Store Employee:
Hey, we just got in a new shipment of things.

They check a list.

Store Employee:
"*Poof* And Then There's Computers"?\!
Is this like a brand name or something?

Buy *Poof* And Then There's Computers
for 500 gold?

As soon as you buy the item it disappears with
a *poof*.

As advertised.

You guess there must be computers now?

Store Employee:
Doesn't look like you have enough money.

passages.name: Floor 5 ARG after — Cashier — p6
passages.content:
Store Employee:
Any luck with that apartment thing?

We've been getting a lot of weird stuff in,
we might have more things like that if you
check back later.

passages.name: Floor 5 ARG after
passages.content: Authorized Personnel Only

passages.name: Floor 5 ARG after — Animal control — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Couch\..\..\.. too\..\..\.. comfy\..\..\..
No\..\..\.. energy\..\..\.. to move\..\..\..

Potion!

Animal Control:
Hydration\..\..\.. refreshed\..\..\..
Energy\..\..\.. growing\..\..\..
Motivation\..\..\.. restored!

Animal Control:
Hey, thanks!

She heads off upstairs.\!
...Then comes back and starts dragging the
couch with her.

Animal Control:
It's just too comfy!

passages.name: Roof ARG — Carol and Honey event trigger — p1
passages.content:
You see Carol and Honey up ahead, sitting
on the edge of the roof holding hands.

Honey:
You were right, this is a great view.

She trails off uncertainly.

Carol:
Is zzzomething wrong?

Honey:
It's just.\..\..\..\..\..

She pauses, then blurts it out.

Honey:
How are you not *terrified*?!

Carol:
What?

Honey:
That all of this is going to go away!

She gestures wildly at everything.

Honey:
Look, we flew up here, and that was amazing!\!
But you should know how impossible that is!

When this all happened-

She gestures at herself.

Honey:
I was convinced it was all a dream!

At any moment I might wake up and be back
in my drab grey life.

But then things continued, and then I met you-

She glances up at Carol.

Honey:
And I started to think that maybe it wasn't.

But it's been so good-\.\.
You've been so good-\.\.
That now I'm terrified it is a dream!

That these things can't happen for real.\!
That it is impossible to fly!

That any moment I could wake up back as my
old dull self, back in my drab grey life...

She starts to sniffle.

Honey:
And, and, never have met you...\!
Never ever meet you again...

She's sobbing now, as Carol pulls her into a
hug.

Carol:
Oh Honey...\!
Honey Honey Honey...

Carol:
(Think Carol, think!)\!
(What would a beeologist zzay?)\!
(What would a bee zzzay?!)

Carol takes a deep breath.

Carol:
I can't guarantee this izzn't a dream.\!
Not even the beezz can tell for zzure.

But you know what I can guarantee?\!
That thizz will be a dream to *remember*.

She waves a hand out towards the city.

Carol:
Zzat we are going to do zzo much, be zzo 
great, that it will burn itself into your brain!

Maybe you will wake up and everything will be
back to before!

But we are going to have such a good time 
that you'll zztill have zzomething to carry you
forwardzz!

Honey's sobs slow as she looks up at Carol
with dawning hope.

Honey:
Really?

Carol pulls her into a tight hug, bringing their
faces close together.

Carol:
Yezzz!

We can only do what we c

passages.name: Roof ARG — Carol and Honey event trigger — p2
passages.content:
Honey still looks a little sad, but she's smiling
up at Carol as the beegirl paints images of
elaborate dates.

Carol:
-and that's when we jump out of the zzkydiving
plane. We fly down, enjoying the view, and 
when we land the fireworkzz go off...

You figure you shouldn't interrupt.

passages.name: Roof ARG — Carol and Honey event trigger — p3
passages.content:

passages.name: Roof ARG — Animal control boss — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control Boss:
Shhhh, I've got her cornered but I'm going to
need more men to make the catch.

passages.name: Roof ARG — Animal control 3 after — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Just give the word chief!

passages.name: Roof ARG — Animal control 1 after — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
As the chief always said, duty before shirts!

Well, he never said that, but I'm certain he
would.

passages.name: Roof ARG — Animal control 4 after — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Ready!\!
There's no way she's getting past me!

Animal Control:
There's no way anyone's getting past me.\!
Sorry everyone...

passages.name: Roof ARG — Animal control 2 after — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Armed and ready!

She kisses her biceps.

Animal Control:
No animal's escaping these guns!

passages.name: Roof ARG — Animal control 5 after — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Reading and waiting sir!\!
And after this, permission to go shopping 
please?

passages.name: Roof ARG — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
I don't know what to do here, we don't handle
horses!

passages.name: Roof ARG — p1
passages.content:
The animal control officer is trying to ward
off an overly affectionate cow.\!
She keeps pushing it back as it tries to give
her big enthusiastic licks.

Animal Control:
Back, back!\!
I think I preferred the headbuts!

passages.name: Roof ARG — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Yeah?

She yawns.

Actually, can it wait?

She nestles back down into the catnip without
waiting for an answer.

passages.name: Roof ARG — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
I'd better still be able to eat a goddamn steak.

passages.name: Roof ARG — Autoplay — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control Boss:
Alright men! Form up!

Now men, you are here because-

Someone raises a hand.

Animal Control Boss:
Yes?

Animal Control:
Sir!\!
Should you really be calling us men? I mean,
look at us!

There's a thoughtful murmur as everyone 
looks around.

Animal Control Boss:
Of course! I don't call you men because you
have the BODY of men but because you have 
the HEART of men, the SOUL of-

Another hand goes up.

Animal Control Boss:
Yes?

Animal Control:
Sir! I'm pretty sure I don't have the heart
*or* soul of a man!

Animal Control:
I don't think I do either?

Animal Control:
(I've got your boyfriend's heart and soul!)

Animal Control:
(Shush. Also, no you don't.)

Animal Control Boss:
Huh.\!
Well then, what do you want to be called?

The animal control officers huddle up.

Animal controllers?

Too long. Recruits?

I've been here way too long for that. Should
we just go with "women"?

I'm not sure I'm one of those *either*...

Maybe boss should call *us* sir for a change!

What about officers?

Huh, I like that one.

Yeah, at least I'm pretty sure I'm one of those.

They turn back to their boss.

Animal Control:
Sir!\!
(Ma'am?)\!
We'd like to be called officers, sir!

Animal Control Boss:
Noted officer!

Now officers, to get back to our mission, we 
are here to put an end to this chaos!\!
Behind me are our two targets, trapped!

They cannot escape anymore!\!
Steal your hearts, officiers, for we shall...

She continues her rousing speech as the lovely
spirit turns to you.

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
Oh no!\!
Nyo!

They-\. they can't do this again!\!
I can't bear another round of healing!

She chases her tails for a moment in worry.

Oh, we have to stop them nya!

She focuses, breathing heavily.

Slowly, as she builds more and more energy,
an image begins to waver into view between
the shelter heads and animal control, visible
even without your glasses.

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
Please!\!
You can't do this, nya!

I can't take it anymyore!

How To Shove A Financial Thermometer Up
Your Financial Rectum!

Giving All Your Money To A Dragon:
The Bold New Investment Strategy!

passages.name: Bank 2 real
passages.content: TREASURY

passages.name: Bank 2 real — Dragon fight — p1
passages.content:
Assistant Dragon:
Hahaha! Yes!

Gold! Finally, gold!

This is exactly what I wanted!

She flops onto the pile of gold and starts
wriggling happily.

Vice Princess:
You monster!\!
You won't get away with this!

You'll be sorry when my knight finally arrives
to rescue me!

Assistant Dragon:
Your knight has abandoned you!\!
And now the gold is all mine!

She picks up a handful of coins and happily
pours them on herself.

Vice Princess:
You say that, but lo! Is that my knight I hear
approaching?

They both turn to you.

Assistant Dragon:
Who the heck is that?

Vice Princess:
A savior!

Please, gracious lady, please! Won't you save me from
this hideous beast?

Please, noble sir, please! Won't you save me from
this hideous beast?

Before you can get a word out, the dragon
jumps at you.

Assistant Dragon:
Fools! You have no chance!

Defeated, the assistant dragon stumbles 
backwards.

Assistant Dragon:
Ugh...

The cell in the back unlocks.

Vice Princess:
That was good for a first try!

She pulls a clipboard out from somewhere
in her dress.

Vice Princess:
Now, I took a few notes.\!
Let's review.

She looks up from the clipboard.

Vice Princess:
Now, before we start, I want to let you know
that it's always difficult to take on new job
responsibilities.

Especially when they've been sprung on you
as suddenly as this one.

And "be a menacing monster" is defintely an
unusual task to be assigned by corporate.\!
So I really appreciate the enthusiasm with
which you've approached it.

She looks back to her clipboard.

With that said, I do think you need to add a 
bit more rage to your presentation. More 
roaring and general monsterness would really
help sell the whole dragon act.

She scans down the clipboard.

Let's see, that was the main point...

I'll need to check in at the front to see why
Kacie never showed up...

I'm glad we finally got you the chance to "swim
in a pile of gold", I know that's been your
professional development goal for the past
several years...

She looks

passages.name: Bank 2 real — Dragon fight — p3
passages.content:
You walk in to see the employees lounging on
piles of gold and chatting.

Day-Shift Knight:
It's okay Liz, I'm sure there are plenty of 
knights out there who would love to fight a
powerful, attractive dragon like you.

Assistant Dragon:
Easy for you to say.\!
Where do I even start looking?

The knight thinks for a moment.

Day-Shift Knight:
Have you considered online dating?/!
Or maybe a ren faire?

Assistant Dragon:
Huh.

She pulls out her phone and starts doing some
searches.

While she searches, the knight is shifting 
uncomfortably on her pile of gold.

Day-Shift Knight:
How are you so comfortable, anyway?\!
I think this gold pile is one of the worst things
I've ever sat on!

She shifts again.\!
The pile collapses, sending her sliding to the
floor in a wave of coins.

Day-Shift Knight:
Ugh.

Assistant Dragon:
Hmm, how to explain it...

She shifts around on her pile of gold, somehow
not dislodging a single coin.

Assistant Dragon:
Here, let's try this.

She picks up a single coin and hands it to
the knight.

Here, hold this in your hands and close your
eyes.

Now, focus on the coin.\!
Feel how it slowly warms in your hands?

As it warms, feel how it feels less and less
foreign.\!
It is accepting your warmth, and your hands 
are accepting it.

Feel how your flesh molds itself to the coin.\!
Feel how the coin molds itself to you.

You and the coin are one.\!
You give yourself to it, and it gives itself to 
you.\!
This is how a hoard is made.

You see the knight's hands glow faintly gold
for a moment.

Assistant Dragon:
Good, good!\!
Now, to make things comfortable, just do that 
with the rest of your pile.

The knight puts her hands down on the pile 
around her.

Assistant Dragon:
Yes...

Focus...

Let the gold speak to you...

You see the pile of gold start to glow.

Let yourself speak to\..\..\.. 
Uh\..\..\..

The glow transfers to the knight's ass.\!
And it,\. slowly but steadily,\. begins to grow.\.\.
Gradually lifting her up off the pile.

Day-Shift Knight:
I

passages.name: Bank 2 real — Knight conversation — p1
passages.content:
The teller(?) is staring off at something in the
back of the building.

You cough.

Teller:
Sorry, didn't see you!\!
We're dealing with the weirdest set of 
promotions I've ever heard of.

I\.\. think?\.\. I can still help you if you want
to do some banking?

My job responsibilities have apparently been
expanded to include "rescuing fair maidens
from durance vile" and "smiting the wicked",
but they do *not* pay me enough for that.

If you need anything else, you're going to 
have to...

She glances back,

Well, see if you can get the manager to take
a break from all that.

You indicate you don't need anything.

Teller:
That's probably for the best.

She goes back to staring towards the back
of the room.

passages.name: Bank 2 real — Knight conversation — p2
passages.content:
Teller:
Maybe I should be questing for a new job...

passages.name: Bank 2 real — Knight conversation — p3
passages.content:
The teller is grumbling to herself.

(I can't believe that rescuing princesses is
going to go on my performance evaluation...)

She notices you and puts on a fake smile.

Teller:
Welcome!\!
If you're here to make a deposit or
withdrawal, I can help you here.

If you're interested in inquiring about a loan
or being menaced by a dragon, please head
to the back.

passages.name: Bank 2 real — Knight conversation — p4
passages.content:
The dragongirl is sitting at the front desk 
today, idly flipping through a paperback.\!
She appears to be taking notes?

She jerks it under the counter as soon as
she notices you, but you still get a glimpse
of a knight showing a ridiculous amount of
cleavage riding a dragon.

You have just enough time to read the title
"Knight Laying Strategies" on her notes before
she hides those too.

She gives a nervous laugh.

Assistant Dragon:
Aha, ha, hi.\!
I'm working the front desk today.

And that's all I'm doing.\!
Working.

She leans in.

Assistant Dragon:
(Please don't tell Kacie what I'm looking into.)
(I'll give you a discount on your next dose of 
draconic power.)

(It'll save you money! Any dragon would love
that!)

Assistant Dragon:
...1%?

At your unamused look, she grits her teeth.

Assistant Dragon:
2%?\!
Okay, okay, I can go as high as 5%! But no 
more!

The gold calls out to me! I can't abandon it!\!
I'll give you your next upgrade for $1900
and not a penny less!

Pay 1900 BE Bucks to the dragon?

She takes a deep breath, then breathes a 
stream of fire over you.

You feel your connection to dragonhood
deepen, but it does not disturb your current
TF.

You hear the sound of gold raining down in
the back room.\!
As well as a surprised shriek. 

The dragongirl once more beams with joy at 
her changes.

Assistant Dragon:
Ah, now we're getting somewhere.

But I can feel there's so much farther I could
go!

She looks wistfully towards the back room.

Assistant Dragon:
Just a little longer until I can go meet the new
gold...

Assistant Dragon:
I guess being amazing isn't for everyone.\!
Come back if you change your mind!

Unfortunately, you don't have enough money.

passages.name: Bank 2 real — Knight conversation — p5
passages.content:

(I can't believe that rescuing princesses is

Teller:

passages.name: Bank 2 real — Knight conversation — p6
passages.content:
(I hope they just let me do my *job* now.)\!
(My actual job, not princess rescue.)

She notices you and puts on a smile.

Teller:
Welcome!\!
If you're here to make a deposit or

If you're interested in inquiring about a loan

passages.name: Bank 2 real — Knight conversation — p7
passages.content:
The dragongirl is visibly restraining herself.

(Just a little longer...)\!
(Just wait until the shift ends and then I can
go play with the new gold...)

She notices you and puts on a fake smile.

Teller:
Welcome!\!
If you're here to make a deposit or
withdrawal, I can help you here.

If you're interested in inquiring about a loan

FOR ASSISTANCE

passages.name: Bank 2 real — Dragon — p1
passages.content:
Assistant Dragon:
Ah, this is more like it.

She reaches out and runs her hands through 
a pile of gold.\!
Then turns to you.

Assistant Dragon:
You could have this too you know.\!
All the power, all the strength of being a 
dragon.

Now, I have this feeling that I'm supposed to
take this slowly. Give you a bit at a time, as
rewards for puzzles and riddles and all that
crap.

But screw that.\!
I'm a dragon! Rules are for other people!

The thing I want is *money*.\!
Pay me and I'll grant your wishes.\!
I could always use a bigger hoard.

I'll ease you into it. $1000 for the first step.

Pay 1000 BE Bucks to the dragon?

She takes a deep breath, then breathes a 
stream of fire over you.

You feel your connection to dragonhood
deepen, but it does not disturb your current
TF.

As she takes the money, it vanishes.

The room fills with a bright glow as gold rains
down from above.

As the glow fades, you see the hoard isn't the
only thing that's grown.

The dragongirl sighs with delight as she runs
her hands across her changed form.

Assistant Dragon:
Yes!\!
We give to the hoard, and the hoard gives
back!

Give me a hug!

She dives happily into the nearest gold pile.

A bar of gold comes flying out at you.

Assistant Dragon:
And just give that a big cuddle if you start 
forgetting what it's like to be a dragon!

Hugging Gold (For Hugging) acquired!\!
So huggable!

Assistant Dragon:
I guess being amazing isn't for everyone.\!
Come back if you change your mind!

Unfortunately, you don't have enough money.

passages.name: Bank 2 real — Dragon — p2
passages.content:
The dragongirl stands up from the pile of gold
she's been lounging on.

Assistant Dragon:
Ah, back for another step towards draconic
perfection?\!
Good choice.

She thinks for a moment.

Assistant Dragon:
It's going to be $2000 this time.\!
This hoard isn't going to fill itself!

Pay 2000 BE Bucks to the dragon?

She takes a deep breath, then breathes a 
stream of fire over you.

You feel your connection to dragonhood
deepen, but it does not disturb your current
TF.

You once more have to shield your eyes as 
gold rains down.\!
You very carefully do *not* call it a golden 
shower.

As the glow fades, you hear a gasp of surprise
from the cell in the corner of the room.

As the glow fades, you hear a gasp of surprise
from the cell in the corner of the room.

As the glow fades, you hear a gasp of surprise
from the cell in the corner of the room.

You see the dragongirl once more beaming
with joy at her changes.

Assistant Dragon:
Ah, now we're getting somewhere.

But I can feel there's so much farther I could
go!

She turns to the nearest gold pile.

Assistant Dragon:
But first, I have some important introductions
to make.

Assistant Dragon:
I guess being amazing isn't for everyone.\!
Come back if you change your mind!

Unfortunately, you don't have enough money.

passages.name: Bank 2 real — Dragon — p3
passages.content:
The knight is shifting around on a pile of gold.

Day-Shift Knight:
I don't understand what she sees in this.\!
This is one of the most uncomfortable things
I've ever tried to sit in.

passages.name: Bank 2 real — Dragon — p4
passages.content:
The dragongirl appears to be browsing movie
reviews on her phone.

Assistant Dragon:
Eragon maybe?\!
Ooo, Dragonheart is a whole series...

She notices you and stands up, jiggling.

Assistant Dragon:
Ah, back again?\!
I'm impressed.

You've been wealthi-\.\. more dedicated than
I expected.

I guess you're ready to take the last step
towards truly embracing the power of the
dragons.

She pauses.

Assistant Dragon:
Of course, such power does not come 
cheaply.\!
The last step will cost $5000.

A true dragon, of course, would know that
building one's hoard comes first and would
not begrudge me the money.

Are you a true dragon?

Pay $5000 to the dragon?

She takes a deep breath, then breathes a 
stream of fire over you.

You feel your connection to dragonhood
deepen, but it does not disturb your current
TF.

You once more have to shield your eyes as 
gold rains down.\!
You very carefully do *not* call it a golden 
shower.

As the glow fades, you hear a gasp of surprise
from the corner of the room.

The dragongirl smiles.

Assistant Dragon:
Congratulations!\!
You too are now a true dragon.

Yes...\!
You can feel it, deep inside you.\!
A fire just waiting to be stoked.

Telling you that a true dragon is beyond all
these silly games./!
That you should pay attention to the important
things: gold and power.

That it is time to seize what you want for 
yourself!

Do you listen?

You feel your form change as you embrace
your inner fire. Your lesser shape falls away
to reveal the true draconic glory beneath.

The growing blaze inside you makes you feel
strong.\.\. Powerful.

You laugh with delight.\!
What could possibly hope to stand against a
dragon?

Assistant Dragon:
I think a lot of things could, actually...

The world is yours to take! To dominate!

Assistant Dragon:
I don't think so...

Time to show those puny humans who's boss,
and accept their terrified tribute!

Assistant Dragon:
Why are you shouting that?

As you charge out to take your rightful place,
you stoke the

passages.name: Bank 2 real — Dragon — p5
passages.content:
The dragongirl is still cuddling with a pile of 
gold.\!
She looks up as you approach.

Assistant Dragon:
Excuse me.\!
I've got a new pile of gold I'm planning to
spend the rest of the day getting to know.

Come back tomorrow if you want another
taste of draconic magnificence.

She turns back to rubbing the gold all over
herself.

passages.name: Bank 2 real — Dragon — p6
passages.content:
The dragongirl is playing with her enormous
mounds.\!
Of gold.\!
She looks up as you approach.

Assistant Dragon:
Now we're getting somewhere!\!
Anyone would be jealous of this hoard!

She gives a considering look at your chest.

Assistant Dragon:
You must have a pretty amazing hoard
yourself.

Anyway, come back tomorrow if you want 
another taste of draconic magnificence.\!
I've got some gold to introduce myself to.

She turns back to seeing how much gold she
can fit in her cleavage.

passages.name: Bank 2 real — Dragon — p7
passages.content:
Day-Shift Knight:
What was that?!

She pulls uncomfortably at the front of her
armor.

Day-Shift Knight:
I think I got gold down my cleavage.

passages.name: Bank 2 real — Dragon — p8
passages.content:
The dragongirl is still struggling to not stare
at the knight exploring her enhanced body.

Assistant Dragon:
New plan.

First, find a girlfriend.\!
Then share my hoard with her.

She goes back to trying not to stare.

passages.name: Bank 2 real — Dragon — p9
passages.content:
The dragongirl has curled up in one of the new
piles of gold to look for more movies.

Assistant Dragon:
Oh, this one works!

No, wait, porn.\!
But *hot* porn!

...Still probably a bad idea.

passages.name: Bank 2 real — Princess — p1
passages.content:
She's chewing on a pen while she stares at a
clipboard.

Vice Princess:
Let's see...\!
I should probably scream more, that seems 
like a princessy reaction...

passages.name: Bank 2 real — Princess — p2
passages.content:
The manager/princess has dropped her pen
and is staring down at herself.

Vice Princess:
I...\.\. I...\.\.

She twitches.

Vice Princess:
I was not projecting this much growth for 
this quarter!

She squeezes her newly expanded assets.

Vice Princess:
Feels nice though...

passages.name: Bank 2 real — Princess — p3
passages.content:
The princess/manager is still exploring her
larger chest.

Vice Princess:
I guess it's not-\.\.
mmMMmm\.\.
a bad thing for growth to exceed predictions...

passages.name: Bank 2 real — Princess — p4
passages.content:
The princess/manager is staring down at her
chest again.

Vice Princess:
I'm getting that feeling again...\!
That we may be about to have another black
swan event affect our assets portfolio...

She moans as her breasts surge outwards
once again.

Vice Princess:
Mmm, yes...\!
I think the head office will be very interested
in our expanded assets...

passages.name: Bank 2 real — Princess — p5
passages.content:
The princess/manager is taking care to run 
her hands over every inch of her huge
breasts, over and over again.

Vice Princess:
Mmmm\.MMMM\.mmmm...
