with a huge smile.

Gym Member:
I gotta make sure to keep my figure!

passages.name: Locker room ARG
passages.content:
Gym Member:
So do you think she ever actually exercises,
or does she just...

passages.name: Locker room ARG
passages.content:
You'd prefer to change somewhere a little less,
uh, poopy.

passages.name: Locker room ARG
passages.content:
You'd prefer to change somewhere a little less,
uh, poopy.

passages.name: Locker room ARG
passages.content:
You'd prefer to change somewhere a little less,
uh, poopy.

passages.name: Locker room ARG
passages.content:
You'd prefer to change somewhere a little less,
uh, poopy.

passages.name: Locker room ARG — Exit — p1
passages.content:
Guardian Hana:
Go on, get changed. There should be some
stalls in the back you can use.

passages.name: Locker room ARG — Exit — p2
passages.content:
Guardian Hana:
Ready for your first test?

K dude, just let me know when!

passages.name: Locker room ARG — Exit — p3
passages.content:
Guardian Hana:
Hey dude, no need to rush things.\!
Go get a drink and get changed and then
we'll head to the next trial.

passages.name: Locker room ARG — Exit — p4
passages.content:
Guardian Hana:
Hey dude, ready for the endurance test?

No problem dude, take your time!

passages.name: Locker room ARG — Exit — p5
passages.content:
Guardian Hana:
You're doing great dude!\!
Go get changed and we'll continue.

One more trial left to go, and you'll be good.

And it's the, you know, brain muscles trial.\!
I mean, those are important, but they're not
IMPORTANT important, if you know what I
mean.

passages.name: Locker room ARG — Exit — p6
passages.content:
Guardian Hana:
Oh hey dude, nice look!

She turns to Kaede.

Guardian Hana:
You've always been great with the, you know,
whole thinking thing, so I thought why not?

Kaede:
Truly, my heart doth warm at thy consideration
Hana.\!
She ist so cute!

The guardian turns back to you.

Guardian Hana:
So dude, ready to really flex those brainmeats?\!
Crunch that grey matter?\!
Push \}philosophically\{ heavy things?!

Guardian Hana:
Awesome dude, let's go!

Guardian Hana:
Okay dude, just say when.

passages.name: Locker room ARG — Exit — p7
passages.content:
Guardian Hana:
Congratulations dude!\!
You have proven yourself worthy to see the
Swolest of Swole herself!

Just need to get changed back first.

passages.name: Locker room ARG — Exit — p8
passages.content:
Guardian Hana:
Are you prepared?

She leans forward, her voice turning serious.

Are you ready to meet the Matriarch of 
Muscles?\!
The Goddess of Glutes?\!
The Sultan of Swole!

She Who Builds Our Bulk And Legs Our Days!!

Are you prepared?

She tries to give you a high-five.

Guardian Hana:
Awesome dude!\!
Then let's get going!

Of course dude, meeting a goddess isn't 
something to just rush into.\!
Let me know when you're ready!

passages.name: Locker room ARG — Autorun event  — p1
passages.content:
Kaede:
What was thy thinking?!\!
Declaring the fault to be with a spirit when 
thou made merely the barest shred of effort.

Hast thou not the brains the Goddess gave
a carrot?

\N[4]:
Oh, I don't want to hear that from you, you 
moldering old buffoon.

Who's the one who taught \N[2] useless
gibberish?!

Kaede:
At least I know what knowledge I imparted
to her wouldst work on at least one spirit.

Dare you claim that you would respond with
aught but scorn to being commanded in the
manner you tried?

\N[4] scoffs.

\N[4]:
I don't do what would work on me, I do what
*should* work on everyone.

The world would be a better place if everyone
just did what I said. The sooner everyone
realizes this the better things will be.

passages.name: Locker room ARG — Changing room — p1
passages.content:
As you step into the changing room, the 
workout clothes in your inventory vanish in
a burst of sparkles, swirling around you.

You feel...\.\.\. different.

Checking yourself out in the mirror, you see
you have indeed changed.



On the bright side, you do seem to be wearing
workout clothes now.\!
And a workout body, for that matter.

Is this what sporty feels like?\.\.
Are you sporty now?

You do a quick exploration of your new body.\!
Yep, this all seems to be real.

\N[4]:
That's a new look.

Guess that brute didn't want you to have to
push an extra set of boulders around.

Guess that brute didn't want you to have to
push an extra set of boulders around.

Guess you looked too flabby to that brute.

Like this you might even have a chance of
doing whatever stupid thing they come up 
with.

Kaede:
Hold thy tongue, knave!\!
The hero shalt overcome any task put before
them!

Or wast thine defeat not sign enough of their
valor?

\N[4] rolls her eyes.

\N[4]:
Defeating me showed that maybe the hero
has a *bit* of a brain.

But this is stupid dumb force. And an idiot like
that guardian is never going to be satisfied.

\N[4]:
Oh please.\!
Even an idiot can get in the way of a genius
plan like mine through sheer dumb luck.

But luck isn't going to help you push boulders
for a brute like that.

Kaede:
Thou varlet!

They start arguing loudly.

Huh, your glasses are missing but somehow
you can still see and hear them.\!
Must be something to do with this form.

passages.name: Locker room ARG — Changing room — p2
passages.content:
You go in the changing booth but nothing
happens. You probably need to complete the
trials first.

passages.name: Locker room ARG — Changing room — p3
passages.content:
You know, a drink would be nice.\!
You grab a cup of water and head into the
changing room.

You feel things shift as another cloud of 
sparkles whirl around you.

Huh, guess you might be doing some running
in the next trial?

passages.name: Locker room ARG — Changing room — p4
passages.content:
You head into the changing room and wait.\!
Nothing happens.

Looks like you're already changed.

passages.name: Locker room ARG — Changing room — p5
passages.content:
As you enter, another cloud of sparkles 
swirls around you.\!
This one feels a little odder though.

Your ears twitch as you try to figure out why.

.\..\..\.You back that thought up and take a 
closer look at it.

You're definitely sporting a few new additions.

Kaede:
By the goddess!

Why, that is a most fetching form indeed.

She looks you up and down.

I shall have to compliment Hana on her artistry.\!
If I didst not know better I might thinkest thou
were a child of my own, freshly out in the 
world.

Go forth!\!
Like this, thou should not fear any trial before
thee.

passages.name: Locker room ARG — Changing room — p6
passages.content:
You head into the changing room and wait.\!
Nothing happens.

Kaede:
Twould be a shame to see thy form vanish so
soon.\!
Stay, enjoy it while it lasts!

passages.name: Locker room ARG — Changing room — p7
passages.content:
For one last time, a cloud of sparkles spins
around you. \!
They peel away, swirling into a tighter and 
tighter ball in the center of the room.

There's a sudden flash, and a set of exercise
clothes appears in their place.

The clothing falls to the floor and slowly fades
into nothing.

It looks like you are back to yourself.

That's one change removed, but still so many
more to go.

passages.name: Locker room ARG — Changing room — p8
passages.content:
No thanks.\!
Now that you're done with the trials, you're 
not going to risk seeing what going in there 
might do to you.

You head into the changing room and wait.\!
Nothing happens.

Nothing happens.

passages.name: Locker room ARG
passages.content:
Sore Gym Member:
I made it a bench closer to the door!

...Maybe I should tone down my workout.

passages.name: Locker room ARG — Boulder
passages.content: A very clean boulder.

passages.name: Locker room ARG — Boulder
passages.content:
A line of boulders appear to be waiting for the
bathroom stall.

passages.name: Locker room ARG — Boulder
passages.content:
A line of boulders appear to be waiting for the
bathroom stall.

passages.name: Locker room ARG — Boulder
passages.content:
A line of boulders appear to be waiting for the
bathroom stall.

passages.name: Locker room ARG — Boulder
passages.content:
A line of boulders appear to be waiting for the
bathroom stall.

passages.name: Goddess room / Exercise room
passages.content:
There's a poster on the wall with a bunch of
different workout plans.\!
One is circled.

DAILY WORKOUT:\!
100 SITUPS\!
100 PUSHUPS\!
RUN 1 MILE

Except someone has crossed out all the 
numbers and replaced them with "INFINITY".

passages.name: Goddess room / Exercise room — Goddess — p1
passages.content:
A woman is sitting here doing situps.

Two hundred and forty seven million seven
hundred eighty eight thousand and ONE!\!
Two hundred and forty seven million seven
hundred eighty eight thousand and TWO!

passages.name: Goddess room / Exercise room — Autoplay event — p1
passages.content:
You see a figure doing crunches in the middle
of the room.

Goddess Fittina:
Two hundred and forty seven million seven
hundred eighty eight thousand and ONE!

Two hundred and forty seven million seven
hundred eighty eight thousand and TWO!

Guardian Hana:
Aw man dude, looks like she's still going.\!
I really hate to interrupt her.

Let's come back later bros, I'm sure she'll be
done by then.

Kaede:
Hana, we hath told you that our mission is of
the utmost importance!\!
A new dark goddess hath arisen!

Guardian Hana:
I know dude, I know. You're my bro and all,
but I just really hate breaking my Goddess's
flow!

She's been at this so long, I'm sure she'll be
done soon.\!
Another century or two, tops.

Kaede:
Time is of the essence!

Come now Hana, you have built thy thews 
to such bulging perfection.\!
Art thou telling me that thou hast trained thy
muscles but lost thy spine?

Guardian Hana:
You're right dude.\!
You're right!

Gotta give it a try.

Guardian Hana:
Oh great goddess, She Who Puts The Bulk In
Our Lats And The Mass In Our Delts, I have 
brought you a supplicant.

Goddess Fittina:
Oh hey Hana!\.\.
\}Two hundred and forty seven million seven
hundred eighty eight thousand and EIGHT!

Always good to see you!\.\.
\}Two hundred and forty seven million seven
hundred eighty eight thousand and NINE!

But I'm in the middle of my reps, could you get 
them to come back later?\.\.
\}Two hundred and forty seven million seven
hundred eighty eight thousand and TEN!

Guardian Hana:
And there you have it dudes.\!
Come on, I'm sure it won't be more than
another decade or two.

\N[2]:
Isn't there at least some way to tell how long
it will be?\!
How many times is she doing that?

Guardian Hana:
Oh right!\!
We can check-

She pauses dramatically.

The Sacred Workout Plan!

She leads you over to the other side of the
room.

Guardian Hana:
Here it is dude!\!
Bask in its glory!

You take a look.\!
It's got a lot of different routines, but one is
circled.

Today's Workout:
100 Push

passages.name: Goddess room / Exercise room — p1
passages.content:
You hear a loud commotion as you step out
into the hallway.

Voice 1:
-But where did all these boulders *come* 
from?!?

Voice 2:
The running track is covered in them!

Voice 3:
We've had another injury! Someone tripped 
over another boulder!

Voice 4:
Two more!

Voice 1:
THAT'S IT!\!
We are shutting down the center until we can
get these boulders out of the way!

EVERYONE OUT!

You try not to look guilty as you head home.

passages.name: Goddess room / Exercise room
passages.content:
Exercising Man:
Okay, I've done fifty situps. How many more?

The other man checks the poster on the wall.

Spotter:
Uh, let's see...

He starts counting on his fingers.

Spotter:
\}Infinity minus fifty...\!
Carry the one...\!
\{Infinity!

Maybe you shouldn't have left that poster up.

passages.name: Goddess room / Exercise room — Bouldering
passages.content:
One of the women here is climbing on the
rocks.

Climbing Woman:
Awesome! I never thought I'd be able to go
bouldering here!

Other Woman:
I don't think that's what bouldering means...

passages.name: Goddess room / Exercise room — Bouldering friend
passages.content:
One of the women here is climbing on the
rocks.

Climbing Woman:
Awesome! I never thought I'd be able to go
bouldering here!

Other Woman:
I don't think that's what bouldering means...

passages.name: Goddess room / Exercise room — Mightyku
passages.content:
Mightyku:
I WILL LIFT ALL THE THINGS!

passages.name: Fittina room ARG — Hana
passages.content:
Guardian Hana:
Hey dude, I stopped at that cafe downtown
on my way over and gave them the recipe
for a killer protein smoothie.

They've added it to their daily specials.\!
Check it out dude, it's an awesome way to 
build muscle!

passages.name: Fittina room ARG — Goddess
passages.content:
Goddess Fittina:
Hey bro, thanks again for helping me out.\!
It was a real bro move!

As thanks, I want to give you some personal
coaching in getting swole!

You hear a gasp of delighted surprise from 
Hana.

Whatever you want bro.\!
Anywhere you've built up too much flab?\!
Arms getting a little too slim?\!
We can take care of it!

You'll need a chunk of raw mana to really get
results though, bro.\!
Gotta have your supplements!

Train with Fittina?

Goddess Fittina:
Sorry bro, but you don't have any flab there.
Good job, but there's nothing to work off!

Guardian Hana:
.\..\..\.Dude, have you considered just getting
a haircut?

Goddess Fittina:
That's what we'll do!\!
The swolest haircut you've ever seen!

She pulls out a massive, ten-foot long sword.\!
It's so heavy her feet visibly sink into the
ground.

Before you can protest, she swings.

And hair flutters to the ground.

Hana applauds.

Guardian Hana:
Dude!\. Goddess!\.
That was sick dude!

They high-five.

Goddess Fittina:
Sorry bro, but not even I can bulk you out
there anymore.

All I can do is give you this high five for 
getting so swole!

Goddess Fittina:
Got it dude!

She runs you through a series of exercises.\!
Eyebrow lifts.\!
Jaw flexes.\!
Cheek puffs.

It feels like your face has gotten less delicate.

Goddess Fittina:
Sorry bro, but not even I can bulk you out
there anymore.

All I can do is give you this high five for 
getting so swole!

Goddess Fittina:
Let's go!

She runs you through about a million pushups.\!
It leaves your arms and hands looking a lot 
bulkier.

Goddess Fittina:
Sorry bro, but you don't have any flab there.
Good job, but there's nothing to work off!

Goddess Fittina:
Got it dude!

She runs you through like a million bar
presses.\!
It really does seem to have burned some of
the jiggle off your chest!

Goddess Fittina:
Sorry bro, but not even I can bulk you out
there anymore.

All I can do is give you this high five for 
getting so swole!

Goddess Fittina:
Got it dude!

She run

passages.name: Fittina room ARG
passages.content:
An unedited copy of the sacred exercises
is hanging on the wall.

Someone has added a message in huge
letters at the bottom.

Message:
\{INFINITY = 100

Hana notices you looking at it.

Guardian Hana:
Like it dude?
We totally crushed math!

passages.name: Fittina room ARG
passages.content:
An elaborate, high-tech smoothie machine.\!
There's no obvious way to operate it.

passages.content: Herb Garden

passages.name: Garden 2 real
passages.content: Japanese Garden

passages.name: Garden 2 real — Rose and Lily — p1
passages.content:
\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]We were almost ready to replant...
\C[5]What happened?!

\C[30]I've never seen any plant this invasive.
\C[5]This all grew up overnight!

\C[30]If you could head out there and start
pulling weeds...
\C[5]We've got some volunteers already, but
we can use all the help we can get!

passages.name: Garden 2 real — Rose and Lily — p2
passages.content:
\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]Suddenly a lot of the weeds died...
\C[5]We should be able to get through the
rest pretty quickly now!

\C[30]Thanks for your help!
\C[5]Thanks for your help!

\C[5]And if you run into any of the other 
volunteers, give them our thanks too!
\C[30]They all left when we weren't looking...

passages.name: Garden 2 real — p1
passages.content:
Garden Volunteer:
Hah! This is nothing!

Just give me an hour or two and-

Thorny vines suddenly lash out from the 
depths of the hedge and drag him out of sight.

passages.name: Garden 2 real — p1
passages.content:
The volunteer is huddled in a corner.

Garden Volunteer:
Oh god, don't let them get me!

I'm sorry!\!
I'm sorry I pulled the weeds!\!
I'm sorry I ever started gardening!

A group of vines yanks him into the hedge.

passages.name: Garden 2 real — Plant boss — p1
passages.content:
An especially large tangle of vines lies here,
swaying back and forth.

As you get close, a massive fanged head pulls
itself out of the ground and attacks!

As you strike the final blow, the plant shrivels
away, leaving only a few sparkling pieces of
raw mana and a single flower.

Around you the vines and thorns grow still.
There's a faint patter of plants raining to the
ground as many of them crumble apart
entirely.

You hear the faint sound of cursing to the east.

They're going after our weeds *again*?!?!

passages.name: Garden 2 real — Plant boss — p2
passages.content: Nothing remains except a few brittle vines.

passages.name: Garden 2 real — p1
passages.content:
You step into an even more overgrown section
of the gardens.
Vines coat the walls around you, arching
overhead to almost blot out the sky above.

You can see twitching and rustling in the vines
out of the corner of your eye as you walk
through.

At the far end of the corridor lies an especially
active tangle of vines.

\C[5]Tomorrow we should be able to get 
through the rest!

\C[30]Thanks for your help!
\C[5]And come back tomorrow if you want 
to keep helping!

\C[5]And if you run into any of the other 
volunteers, give them our thanks too!

passages.content: French Garden

passages.content: Herb Garden

passages.name: Garden 3 real
passages.content: Japanese Garden

passages.name: Garden 3 real — Rose and Lily — p1
passages.content:
\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]Welcome back.
\C[5]We're so glad to see you!

\C[30]For some reason no one from yesterday
came back...
\C[5]So we can really use your help!

\C[30]We've already started cleaning up all
of this mess.
\C[5]AGAIN.

\C[30]Could you take a look around and see
if any of the weeds have started to come back?
\C[5]And take a look at the French Garden
gate too!

passages.name: Garden 3 real — Rose and Lily — p2
passages.content:
Rose is looking stressed.

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]What happened?
When did our lives get this weird?

Lily just gestures at their enormous plant
bottom half.\!
The nectar pool they're standing in.\!
Their nudity.

\C[5]\..\..\..When all this happened?

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]...Right.\!
It just feels so natural, being together with you
like this, I forgot.

\C[5]Awwwww.

They share a hug.\!
Then Rose sighs and looks around.

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]Well, I guess it's time to get this all
cleaned up AGAIN.

passages.name: Garden 3 real — Rose and Lily — p3
passages.content:
\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]Thanks.
\C[5]They should be better after a little rooted
rest!

\C[30]I think that's good enough for the day.
We'll deal with all of this...\.\. this...\.\.
whatever tomorrow.\!
I need a break first.

\C[5]Thanks again for all your help!\!
Take this!

Gained Pretty Flower!

passages.name: Garden 3 real — Rose and Lily — p4
passages.content:
Rose and Lily are chatting.

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]Okay, yes, I know that things are weird.
But when did they get *WEIRD*?

passages.name: Garden 3 real — Rose and Lily — p5
passages.content:
\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]Welcome back!
\C[5]Everyone is feeling much better!

\C[30]Now we just need to get into the rest of
the garden.
\C[5]We'll let you know if we have any ideas!

passages.name: Garden 3 real — p1
passages.content:
You are headed towards the gate when you
hear sudden maniacal laughter.

You take a careful step back as Rose and Lily 
come walking up next to you.

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]Oh great.
\C[5]What is it now?!

Alraune:
Haha!\!
You fools!\!
Foolish fools!

\N[4]:
(I don't know who this is but I like their style.)

Alraune:
How dare you infringe upon our domain?\!
Scurrying forth once again to pillage our
fields and destroy our work!

Well we will tolerate it no longer!

Now you fools will face our wrath! You will
regret ever crossing the Evening Timrose!

She poses dramatically.

Carl:
And Carl!

Evening Timrose:
(Carl, you were supposed to come up with a
cool flower name!)

(You're embarrassing us in front of our 
nemeses!)

Carl:
(I'm sorry Tim!)\!
(I don't know flower names!)\!
(This didn't come with a manual!)

Timrose sighs.

Evening Timrose:
(That's fair.)\!
(It's fine. This is fine.)\!
(I'll work with it.)

(Just remember, we're bad. We're mad.)
(We're intimidating!)

They turn back to you.

Evening Timrose:
Yes, you will fear the wrath of the deadly duo!\!
The Evening Timrose and Carl!

...\!
Carlrose?\!
Carlnation?

And The Very Intimidating Carl!

Carl waves.

Timrose makes a gesture and the gates begin
to grind slowly open.

Evening Timrose:
So many of you little rats came creeping 
around our garden yesterday.\!
Chewing at our plants, biting at our toes.

We know just what to do with rats!

A few of you escaped, but we caught the rest.\!
And now we've made them into something
stronger!\!
Something better!

Something that will spell your doom!

She laughs maniacally as figures start to
shamble out from the mass of thorns beneath 
her.

Zombies?:
Augh...\.\.
Ugh...

Evening Timrose:
Go my minions! Feast upon the intruders!

You fools can spend your last moments 
regretting you ever crossed the Evening 
Timrose!

Carl:
And Carl!

Evening Timrose:
Carlip?\!
Car-dandelion-l?

Regardless, farewell!\!
For now and forever!

The two of them head bac

passages.name: Garden 3 real — Water — p1
passages.content:
A bit of water has collected nearby, making
this patch of soil nice and moist.

A little sign sits next to the partially-shaded 
spot.

Sign:
Certified climate zone 3!

Plant the flower girl following you here?

Zombie?:
Ah\..\..\..\..\..
I can really taste the climate zone 3-ness...

She settles into the ground with a soft sigh of
contentment.

She plants herself in the earth.\!
Then drags herself out with a groan.

Zombie?:
Too\..\..\.. wet..\..\..

Zombie?:
Not\..\..\.. Enough\..\..\.. Sun...

With that, all the new plantgirls are settled into
place.\!
You should probably tell Rose and Lily.

passages.name: Garden 3 real — Water — p2
passages.content: She appears to be sleeping.

passages.name: Garden 3 real — Water — p3
passages.content:
Garden Volunteer:
Hah! Drinking water through your mouth is for
losers!

She closes her mouth for a moment.

Huh, I don't think I need to breath anymore
either.

I think I can have some fun with this.

passages.name: Garden 3 real — Good soil — p1
passages.content:
Pulling up the thornbushes has exposed a patch
of dark fertile-looking soil.

Plant the flower girl following you here?

Zombie?:
Ah\..\..\..\..\..
Soil...

She relaxes, roots digging into the ground
below.

She plants herself in the earth.\!
Then drags herself out with a groan.

Zombie?:
Too\..\..\.. dark..\..\..

Zombie?:
Climate\..\..\.. zone\..\..\.. 2.5\..\..\..\.
At best\..\..\..

With that, all the new plantgirls are settled into
place.\!
You should probably tell Rose and Lily.

passages.name: Garden 3 real — Good soil — p2
passages.content:
She's snoring gently.\!
You can see her roots slowly working their
way deeper into the soil.

passages.name: Garden 3 real — Good soil — p3
passages.content:
The soil here still looks very rich and moist.\!
Anything planted here would grow well.

Would you like to plant-\.\.\^

The seed you've been carrying since Dick
exploded practically leaps out of your pocket
and into the soil.

passages.name: Garden 3 real — Sunlight — p1
passages.content:
The sun seems to be shining especially 
brightly in this spot.

Plant the flower girl following you here?

Zombie?:
Ah\..\..\..\..\..
Praise the sun...

She spreads out all her leaves and petals to
face the sun and closes her eyes.

She plants herself in the earth.\!
Then drags herself out with a groan.

Zombie?:
Too\..\..\.. wet..\..\..

Zombie?:
Climate\..\..\.. zone\..\..\.. 2.5\..\..\..\.
At best\..\..\..

With that, all the new plantgirls are settled into
place.\!
You should probably tell Rose and Lily.

passages.name: Garden 3 real — Sunlight — p2
passages.content:
She's turned her face to the sunlight and
fallen asleep.

passages.name: Garden 3 real — Sunlight — p3
passages.content:
Garden Volunteer:
I never thought I could feel hungry for
sunlight.

She turns her face to the sky.

It's delicious.

passages.name: Garden 3 real — Zombie water — p1
passages.content:
The flower girl stumbles towards you, arms
outstretched.

Alraune:
Water...\!
Pools of water...

Preferably in climate zone three...

I also do best in partial shade...

Have her follow you?

She starts stumbling along behind you.

You already have someone following you!

passages.content:
The flower girl stumbles towards you, arms
outstretched.

Alraune:
Water...\!
Pools of water...

Preferably in climate zone three...

I also do best in partial shade...

She goes back to wandering aimlessly.

Zombie?:
Ah\..\..\..\..\..
Soil...

She relaxes, roots digging into the ground
below.

She plants herself in the earth.\!
Then drags herself out with a groan.

Zombie?:
Too\..\..\.. dark..\..\..

Zombie?:
Climate\..\..\.. zone\..\..\.. 2.5\..\..\..\.
At best\..\..\..

With that, all the new plantgirls are settled into
place.\!
You should probably tell Rose and Lily.

passages.name: Garden 3 ARG — Good soil — p2
passages.content:
She's snoring gently.\!
You can see her roots slowly working their
way deeper into the soil.

passages.name: Garden 3 ARG — Good soil — p3
passages.content:
The soil here still looks very rich and moist.\!
Anything planted here would grow well.

Would you like to plant-\.\.\^

The seed you've been carrying since Dick
exploded practically leaps out of your pocket
and into the soil.

passages.name: Garden 3 ARG — Sunlight — p1
passages.content:
The sun seems to be shining especially 
brightly in this spot.

Plant the flower girl following you here?

Zombie?:
Ah\..\..\..\..\..
Praise the sun...

She spreads out all her leaves and petals to
face the sun and closes her eyes.

She plants herself in the earth.\!
Then drags herself out with a groan.

Zombie?:
Too\..\..\.. wet..\..\..

Zombie?:
Climate\..\..\.. zone\..\..\.. 2.5\..\..\..\.
At best\..\..\..

With that, all the new plantgirls are settled into
place.\!
You should probably tell Rose and Lily.

passages.name: Garden 3 ARG — Sunlight — p2
passages.content:
She's turned her face to the sunlight and
fallen asleep.

passages.name: Garden 3 ARG — Sunlight — p3
passages.content:
Garden Volunteer:
I never thought I could feel hungry for
sunlight.

She turns her face to the sky.

It's delicious.

passages.name: Garden 3 ARG — Sunlight — p4
passages.content:
Garden Volunteer:
I never thought I could feel hungry for
sunlight.

She turns her face to the sky.

It's delicious.

passages.name: Garden 3 ARG — Zombie water — p1
passages.content:
The flower girl stumbles towards you, arms
outstretched.

Alraune:
Water...\!
Pools of water...

Preferably in climate zone three...

I also do best in partial shade...

Have her follow you?

She starts stumbling along behind you.

You already have someone following you!

passages.name: Garden 3 ARG — Zombie water — p2
passages.content:
The flower girl stumbles towards you, arms
outstretched.

Alraune:
Water...\!
Pools of water...

Preferably in climate zone three...

I also do best in partial shade...

Have her stop following you?

She goes back to wandering aimlessly.

passages.name: Garden 3 ARG — p1
passages.content:
You are headed towards the gate when you
hear sudden maniacal laughter.

You take a careful step back as Rose and Lily 
come walking up next to you.

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]Oh great.
\C[5]What is it now?!

Alraune:
Haha!\!
You fools!\!
Foolish fools!

\N[4]:
(I don't know who this is but I like their style.)

Alraune:
How dare you infringe upon our domain?\!
Scurrying forth once again to pillage our
fields and destroy our work!

Well we will tolerate it no longer!

Now you fools will face our wrath! You will
regret ever crossing the Evening Timrose!

She poses dramatically.

Carl:
And Carl!

Evening Timrose:
(Carl, you were supposed to come up with a
cool flower name!)

(You're embarrassing us in front of our 
nemeses!)

Carl:
(I'm sorry Tim!)\!
(I don't know flower names!)\!
(This didn't come with a manual!)

Timrose sighs.

Evening Timrose:
(That's fair.)\!
(It's fine. This is fine.)\!
(I'll work with it.)

(Just remember, we're bad. We're mad.)
(We're intimidating!)

They turn back to you.

Evening Timrose:
Yes, you will fear the wrath of the deadly duo!\!
The Evening Timrose and Carl!

...\!
Carlrose?\!
Carlnation?

And The Very Intimidating Carl!

Carl waves.

Timrose makes a gesture and the gates begin
to grind slowly open.

Evening Timrose:
So many of you little rats came creeping 
around our garden yesterday.\!
Chewing at our plants, biting at our toes.

We know just what to do with rats!

A few of you escaped, but we caught the rest.\!
And now we've made them into something
stronger!\!
Something better!

Something that will spell your doom!

She laughs maniacally as figures start to
shamble out from the mass of thorns beneath 
her.

Zombies?:
Augh...\.\.
Ugh...

Evening Timrose:
Go my minions! Feast upon the intruders!

You fools can spend your last moments 
regretting you ever crossed the Evening 
Timrose!

Carl:
And Carl!

Evening Timrose:
Carlip?\!
Car-dandelion-l?

Regardless, farewell!\!
For now and forever!

The two of them head bac

passages.name: Garden 3 ARG — Zombie soil — p1
passages.content:
The flower girl stumbles towards you, arms
outstretched.

Alraune:
Drains\..\..\..

Well-drained soil...\!
Rich soil...

Have her follow you?

She starts stumbling along behind you.

You already have someone following you!

passages.name: Garden 3 ARG — Zombie soil — p2
passages.content:
The flower girl stumbles towards you, arms
outstretched.

Alraune:
Drains\..\..\..

Well-drained soil...\!
Rich soil...

Have her stop following you?

She goes back to wandering aimlessly.

passages.name: Garden 3 ARG — Zombie soil — p3
passages.content:
The flower girl stumbles towards you, arms
outstretched.

Alraune:
Drains\..\..\..

Well-drained soil...\!
Rich soil...

Have her follow you?

She starts stumbling along behind you.

You already have someone following you!

passages.name: Garden 3 ARG — Zombie sunlight — p1
passages.content:
The flower girl stumbles towards you, arms
outstretched.

Alraune:
Light...\!
Sunlight...

Have her follow you?

She starts stumbling along behind you.

You already have someone following you!

passages.content:
The flower girl stumbles towards you, arms

Alraune:
Light...\!
Sunlight...

Have her stop following you?

She goes back to wandering aimlessly.

passages.content:
The flower girl stumbles towards you, arms

Alraune:
Light...\!
Sunlight...

Have her follow you?

She starts stumbling along behind you.

You already have someone following you!

passages.name: Garden 3 ARG — Autorun event — p1
passages.content:
You walk in on a conversation.

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]Should we even be trying to fix up the
garden, if they can just mess it up again?

\C[30]Maybe there's a reason the garden was
abandoned...

\C[5]Come on Rose! We can't just give up!\!
This garden belongs to the park!\.\. To the
public!

\C[5]We can't just let some randos claim it
for themselves!\!
I say we keep fixing it, and they'll be the ones
to break first!

There is scattered applause from the other
volunteers.

\C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[5]We will not be driven out!\!
We will not be uprooted!

\C[5]It is here that we will plant our flag, and here
that we will flag our plants!

Other Alraune:
Yeah!

One of the other volunteers raises their hand.

Park Volunteer:
Are we all supposed to start making plant puns
now, or...?

\C[30]Rose\C[0] and \C[5]Lily\C[0]:
\C[30]I find that they just happen.
\C[5]Just roll with it!

passages.name: Garden 3 ARG — Soil alraune after — p2
passages.content:
Garden Volunteer:
Huh.\!
Dirt has a flavor.

A good flavor!

She licks her lips as her roots dig around
beneath her.

passages.name: Garden 3 ARG — Soil alraune after — p3
passages.content:
Garden Volunteer:
Huh.\!
Dirt has a flavor.

A good flavor!

She licks her lips as her roots dig around
beneath her.

passages.name: Field ARG — Runner 1 — p1
passages.content:
Jogger:
Ah, nothing like a nice refreshing jog.

passages.name: Field ARG — Runner 1 — p2
passages.content:
Jogger:
I feel so much faster today!

passages.name: Field ARG — Runner 1 — p1
passages.content:
Jogger:
This... is the first step to completing a
marathon!

And this... is the second!

The third!

passages.name: Field ARG — Runner 1 — p2
passages.content:
Jogger:
These new exercise clothes I got are really
helping!

I don't know why, but I have so much more
of a bounce in my step!

She looks down at herself.

And, uh, in other places.

passages.name: Field ARG — Runner 1
passages.content:
He's humming to himself.

Jogger:
And I would walk ten thousand miles...\!
And then I'd stop and take a break...

passages.name: Field ARG — Runner 1
passages.content:
Jogger:
Oh god I hate jogging so much.

Why does it have to be so stupidly healthy?

passages.name: Field ARG — Tennis Coach — p1
passages.content:
Tennis Coach:
They're good boys, all of them.  Good boys.

Couldn't ask for a better set of men. Loyal,
determined, energetic, everything you'd
want in a team.

Course, none of them can play tennis worth a
damn. But you can't have everything.\!

\}Still, would be nice to win some games one of these days.

passages.name: Field ARG — Tennis Coach — p2
passages.content:
Tennis Coach:
I can't quite believe it. We actually won a game
last night!

It's like Lance has been a different man since 
they finally found that new sports drink.\!
Even more different than being a woman now,
I mean.

Who knows? Maybe we'll even win a second
match!

passages.name: Field ARG — Tennis Coach — p3
passages.content:
Tennis Coach:
I'd never believe it if I hadn't seen it with my
own eyes.

We swept the singles competitions last night!\!
I can't believe what that new sports drink has
done for getting these boys into form.

I guess it is true what they all say: all you
need to excel in sports is grit, determination,
and a *massive* pile of questionably legal
supplements.

Good on them!

passages.name: Field ARG — Tennis Coach — p4
passages.content:
Tennis Coach:
I can't believe it.

We won every single match last night.\!
Doubles, singles, didn't matter. The other
teams didn't stand a chance.

I've done my best, but I never thought this
would happen.

He looks at you.

Tennis Coach:
And hey, I heard you helped start this whole
thing.

Here, take this.

Deluxe Racket acquired!

It's a bit better than most you'll find. Just bring
it along if you ever want to give tennis a try!

As he finishes speaking, one of the players 
walks up.  She's dragging the cooler full of 
potion with her.

Tennis Player:
Hey Coach!\!
You know, we had a massive victory last night.

And there's a tradition for what happens when
a team wins.

She hefts the cooler suggestively.

The coach looks her up and down thoughtfully.

Tennis Coach:
You know what? You girls do make it look fun.

He looks at himself.

And I wouldn't mind knocking a few decades
off.

A few of the players grab the cooler and lift
it over his head.\!
Then dump the whole thing on him.

The gushing liquid obscures him completely
for a moment.

Then reveals a changed form.



The new woman licks a few drops of potion off
her lips.

Coach:
Mmm, that is good stuff. I see why you like it.

She looks down at herself.

Coach:
Though it looks like I got quite a bit more than
you boys.

She stretches extravagantly, massive breasts
threatening to rip apart her struggling shirt.

Coach:
Oh, that didn't hurt at all!

Why, this might take a bit of getting used to,
but I think I could get back on the court!

And then I could *really* show you youngins
a trick or two.

passages.name: Field ARG — Tennis Coach — p5
passages.content:
Coach:
Not gonna lie, I never thought I'd have a pair
of ballasts like this to swing around.

She pats her enormous tits fondly, sending 
them jiggling.

But it sure beats being old and decrepit!

passages.name: Field ARG — Thirsty Player — p1
passages.content:
Tennis Player:
I'm just having a hard time getting into 
practice, you know?

I'm feeling tired. Drained. All the things you'd
hear at the start of a commercial for sports 
drinks.

But none of the drinks on the market do
anything for me.\!
I need something fresh! Something new!

...Which is why I'm saying this to everyone 
who walks by, apparently.\!
Sorry about that.

Tennis Player:
Getting hit by lightning is novel, I'll give you
that.

But it doesn't hydrate! It's not giving me the
electrolytes I need!

You hand him a potion.

Tennis Player:
Hmmm?\!
What's this? 

He opens it and takes a sniff.

Tennis Player:
Huh.\!
That smells pretty great.

He takes a cautious sip.

Yeah, that is good!

He starts taking long drinks, not noticing the 
changes that ripple across his form.



Tennis Player:
Thanks! I feel so much better now!

I bet I'm going to win my match tonight!

passages.name: Field ARG — Thirsty Player — p2
passages.content:
Tennis Player:
This drink you gave me is just what I needed!

passages.name: Field ARG — Thirsty Player — p3
passages.content:
Tennis Player:
Even my workouts feel better like this! I can 
push so much faster!

passages.name: Field ARG — Thirsty Player — p4
passages.content:
Tennis Player:
It's always nice to find something new you
love, but it's even better to share it with your
friends!

passages.name: Field ARG — p1
passages.content:
Tennis Player:
-So you're saying this new sports drink of 
yours is how you won your match last night?

Thirsty Tennis Player:
Yeah! It refreshes, it quenches, and it does a
body good!

The other two look her up and down.

Tennis Player:
...I can see it really does a body good.

She smiles and winks.

Other Tennis Player:
I don't know. I'm a lone wolf! A loose cannon!\!
I forge my own path and take no help from
anyone!

Other Tennis Player:
\}But it would be nice to actually win a match.

Tennis Player:
Sure, we'll give it a try.

Thirsty Tennis Player:
Great!

She fills up their water bottles from the potion
you gave her.\!
It doesn't look like the level in her bottle is
going down at all.

Thirsty Tennis Player:
We're gonna be the best team in the league
at this rate!

You can see their bodies already starting to
shift as they walk back to the court.

passages.name: Field ARG — Doubles 1 — p1
passages.content:
Tennis Player:
Come on, take it easy on me this time!

Other Player:
Haha, fool! We are on the tennis court! Where
love means nothing!

Player:
...\!
Okay, you're going down.

passages.name: Field ARG — Doubles 1 — p2
passages.content:
Tennis Player:
This time we're going to win!

passages.name: Field ARG — Doubles 2 — p1
passages.content:
Tennis Player:
We've been practicing a *ton* recently.

But it'll be worth it if we can win the next
tournament.

\}Or any games at all, really.

passages.name: Field ARG — Doubles 2 — p2
passages.content:
Tennis Player:
I've never felt so connected to my partner!\!
Tonight is going to be the best matches of 
couples' tennis I've ever played!

Partner:
It's "doubles' tennis," honey.

Tennis Player:
...\!
Are you sure?

passages.name: Field ARG — Doubles 3 — p1
passages.content:
This player is muttering to themselves.

Tennis Player:
\}Remember, the ball goes over the net, not
under.\!
Ball goes under the net, not over.

passages.name: Field ARG — Doubles 3 — p2
passages.content:
Tennis Player:
I don't know what's up.

I feel more energetic, but I just can't catch
my balance!

passages.name: Field ARG — Doubles 3 — p3
passages.content:
Tennis Player:
I've figured it out!

You have to work with the boobs!\!
Use the jiggling to pull you around, to put
power in your swing!

passages.name: Field ARG — Doubles 4 — p1
passages.content:
Tennis Player:
Ready for my serve?\!
You sure?

HERE GOES!

He spikes the ball straight into the net.

passages.name: Field ARG — Doubles 4 — p2
passages.content:
Tennis Player:
Are you ready for a POWER SERVE?!

passages.name: Field ARG — Lone Wolf tennis player — p1
passages.content:
Tennis Player:
Let the other guys work together.

I play singles.\!
I'm a lone wolf!\!
No one to hold me down or hold me back!

Too much of a tennis player for anyone to 
match!

\}...No one wants to be my partner...

passages.name: Field ARG — Lone Wolf tennis player — p2
passages.content:
Tennis Player:
Haha! Yes!\!
Fear me! The lone wolf of the tennis court!\!
Awooo~!

passages.name: Field ARG — Lone Wolf tennis player — p3
passages.content:
Tennis Coach:
Haha, come at me!\!
I'll take you both on!

passages.name: Field ARG — Battle tennis player — p1
passages.content:
Tennis Player:
I'd be fine with being his partner, but I like 
playing against him more.

Competition is how you truly advance.\!
Iron sharpening iron.\!
The true battle of body versus body and 
heart versus heart!

He takes a swing and hits the ball into his
opponent's chest.

Tennis Player:
Hah! That's another point for me!

passages.name: Field ARG — Battle tennis player — p2
passages.content:
Tennis Player:
Sit!\!
Stay!\!
Backhand topspin lob!

Good girl! Now prepare to face my ultimate
serve!

passages.name: Field ARG — Battle tennis player — p3
passages.content:
Tennis Player:
Awww!\!
Who's a good doubles partner?\!
You're a good doubles partner!

She gives her partner a few scritches behind
her dog ears.\!
Her partner tries to hide how obviously 
pleased she is with the praise.

passages.name: Field ARG — Tennis Player — p1
passages.content:
Tennis Player:
Look, I hate to say it, but these other guys 
are trash. Just, total crap at tennis.

Which is why I have a plan. You gotta think
outside the box.

Can't play tennis? Why not teach a swarm of 
rats to instead!\!
Can't hit the ball with a racket? Use a gun!
There ain't no rule that says you can't!

Tennis Player:
Anyway, Coach says that there actually are
rules.\!
And that Air Bud wasn't a documentary.

And that I'm stuck in the timeout corner for
approximately forever.

\}Why does tennis even have a timeout 
corner...

passages.name: Field ARG — Tennis Player — p2
passages.content:
Tennis Player:
Okay, I've got a new plan. Thinking outside
the box again.

Where the box is the timeout corner, and the
thinking outside of it is leaving it.

I snagged myself some of this sports drink
everyone is enjoying so much.

He takes a big drink.\!
And moans in surprise.

Tennis Player:
Oh.\!
Oh wow.\!
This is *amazing*.

Another drink.

Tennis Player:
Mmmmmmm.\!
Ohhhhhhh.\!
I can see why everyone is so in to this.

One hand starts to grope at his swelling chest,
as he continues to drink with the other.

Tennis Player:
Ohhhhh.\.\.
This is so good.\.\. So good.\.\.
MmmmMMMMmmm!

He tilts up the cup, licking the last few drops
out eagerly.\!
It drops to the ground as both his hands start
to roam his swiftly feminizing body.

Tennis Player:
I-\.\. mmMMMmmm\.\. think I'm happy to-\.\.
oooOOOOooo\.\.
stay in time out for a bit.

passages.name: Field ARG — Tennis Player — p3
passages.content:
Tennis Player:
You know what?\!
Mmm-\.\.
I don't mind being in time out.

\}ah\.\.\^

Maybe I should-\.\. \}ooo\{\.\. break the rules
more often.

passages.name: Field ARG
passages.content:
Tennis Fan:
Go!\!
Win!\!

You can do it!

passages.name: Field ARG — p1
passages.content:
You come across the tennis team having a 
meeting.



Thirsty Player:
And that's why I think this new sports drink is
so great!

She's pouring what appears to be an endless
stream of beverage into a big cooler from the
potion bottle you gave her.

Thirsty Player:
Helps build you up *and* is delicious!

But don't just take my word for it!

She turns to the other singles players.

Singles Player 1:
It's pretty great, I guess.\!
I am playing a lot better.\!
Can stand on my own, now.

Singles Player 2:
My serve has never been this great!\!
And my return!\!
And every other part of my game!

Doubles Player:
You make a good argument...

Coach:
Are you certain you're all okay with this?

I'll be the first to admit that it massively
improved your game, but look at what else it
does to you!

He gestures at the changed singles players.

Doubles Player 1:
Eh, I don't really care either way.

Doubles Player 2:
I'll do anything if it means I get to start winning
matches!

Doubles Player 3:
It looks like it could be fun?

Doubles Player 4:
\}Turning into a woman is a bonus, actually...

Coach:
Okay, just wanted to check that you all knew
what you were getting into.

Can't say I'd mind winning some matches for once.

They all gather around the drinks cooler.

All:
Cheers!

You can see their forms start to shift as they
each down a cup.

Hair lengthening, chests pushing out, 
backsides swelling...

And then back to practice.

passages.name: Field ARG — Return to entrance
passages.content: Return to entrance?

passages.name: Field ARG
passages.content:
Exercising Person:
It's always nice to do your stretching outdoors
before you start working out.

passages.name: Field ARG — Loud Batter
passages.content:
Batter:
\{OKAY!
YOU CAN THROW THE BALL NOW!

Pitcher:
I... I can hear you fine!\!
Please put away the megaphone!

The batter fiddles with a knob.

Batter:
\{\{\{NO.

passages.name: Field ARG — Pitcher
passages.content:
Pitcher:
I'm pretty sure her plan is to give me a
headache so the pitch is easier to hit.

Pitcher:
Ain't no rule?\!
Really?!

Whoever came up with Air Bud should be shot.

passages.name: Field ARG — Baseball equipment — p1
passages.content:
One of those treasure-chest-shaped duffel
bags.\!
You'd heard they were getting popular.

It looks like no one is paying attention to it.
See if there's anything useful inside?

You find a spare metal bat that no one seems 
to be using.\!
Metal Bat Wand acquired!

You leave the bag alone.

passages.name: Field ARG
passages.content:
Soccer Player:
Okay, I'm going for another 300 juggles!

passages.name: Field ARG
passages.content:
Soccer Player:
Can we stop doing tricks and play already?

passages.name: Field ARG
passages.content:
The soccer player is trying to juggle the ball.

Soccer Player:
5, 6, 7-

He misses the kick.

Soccer Player:
At *some* point I'm going to get ten!

passages.name: Field ARG
passages.content:
She's staring at a particularly lush patch of
clover.

Cowgirl:
It looks so tasty...\!
Why does it look so tasty?

I shouldn't be eating grass, right?\!
Even if it looks delicious?\!
And smells delicious?

She reaches out a hand hesitantly and plucks
a few pieces.

And tastes delicious?

passages.name: Field ARG
passages.content:
Tennis Player:
Cooperating?!\!
This goes against all my wolfly instincts!

Her partner steps over and starts scratching
her behind the ears.\!
She melts into her hand, tail wagging furiously.

Tennis Player:
I mean it!\.\. *pant*\!
I'm a wolf!\! 
You'd better watch out around me!

She dissolves into happy pants and wiggles
as the scritches continue.

passages.name: Field ARG — Tennis Miku
passages.content:
Miku:
Ready for our tennis match?

Miku:
Yeah!

passages.name: Field ARG — Tennis Miku
passages.content:
Miku:
Ready for our tennis match?

Miku:
Yeah!

passages.name: Field ARG — Doggirl
passages.content:
Doggirl:
Oh yeah!

I'm gonna chase the *hell* outta this ball.

She wags her tail eagerly.

passages.name: Locker room 2 — Boulder
passages.content: You don't want to cut in line.

passages.name: Locker room 2 — Boulder
passages.content: You don't want to cut in line.

passages.name: Locker room 2 — Leg day lamia — p1
passages.content:
She's wincing as she changes clothes.

Sore Gym Member:
Ugh, leg day, leg day, leg day.

She rubs her legs and winces again.

Sore Gym Member:
Why do I keep doing this to myself?

passages.name: Locker room 2 — Leg day lamia — p2
passages.content:
Sore Gym Member:
Ah, that was a good workout.

She notices you looking at her snake half.

Sore Gym Member:
This? I got it at the department store.

\}Kind of accidentally, but still.

It's great! No leg day ever again!

passages.name: Locker room 2
passages.content:
Showering Gym Member:
Ah, nothing like a nice long shower.

passages.name: Locker room 2 — Glutes other
passages.content:
Concerned Gym Member:
I know you love it, but seriously, another
yoga class?!

Bootylicious Gym Member:
Hey, this beautiful ass isn't going to maintain
itself!

The black-haired woman slaps her own ass
with a huge smile.

Bootylicious Gym Member:
\}...I think.

passages.name: Locker room 2 — Glutes other
passages.content:
Concerned Gym Member:
I know you love it, but seriously, another
yoga class?!

Bootylicious Gym Member:
Hey, this beautiful ass isn't going to maintain
itself!

passages.name: Miku Apartment — p1
passages.content:
You awaken very slowly.

Ugh, you do not feel well.

Were you drinking last night? This feels like a
full-body hangover.\!
You don't remember drinking, but why else
would you feel this way?

You reluctantly open your eyes.

.\..\..\..\..\..\..
This isn't your apartment.

You stumble as you get out of bed.\!
Everything just feels *off* for a moment.

passages.name: Miku Apartment
passages.content: A few dresses are hung up on the wall.

passages.name: Miku Apartment
passages.content: Full of girly clothes.

passages.name: Apartment 1 — Computer
passages.content:
You log onto the local forum.

You check out the top few threads.

Miku392:
Did the forum get hacked or something?\!
Everyone's username has changed to 
Miku!

Miku57:
Could this be a prank by the mods?

Miku824:
If it is, no one told me about it.

Miku27:
Hey, you're not a mod, I'm a mod!

Miku69:
Well I'm a mod at least and I can't access
anything.

Miku151:
Heh, nice.

Miku69:
Is this really the time?

Miku437:
Just woke up like this!\!
No seriously, this is what I look like now.\!
WTF is happening?

Miku827:
"One morning, as Gregor Samsa was waking
up from anxious dreams, he discovered that
he had been changed into a cute idol."

Could be worse!

Miku213:
Hey, the same thing happened to me!

But check it out, look, it kept all my gains!\!
Girl abs!

Miku17:
Whoa, you could grate cheese on those
things!

Miku97:
Hey, my clothes changed too!\!
This is awesome!

Miku17:
Yeah, this sort of thing happens. I've been a 
cowgirl since Thursday.\!
Horns, boobs, the whole package.

Though I woke up today with a few changes
too.\!
I say just relax and enjoy it!

Kaede:
So we art not the only ones afflicted by this
dreadful curse.\!
'Tis a blight on the whole region!

'Tis more support for this being a dream.\!
A pleasant one to many, methinks.

Though I dost imagine it must be a nightmare
to some.

passages.name: Apartment 1 — Exit — p1
passages.content:
Kaede:
Let us tally forth Hero! Yon dreamer awaits!

Truly, thou are blessed by the gods themselves
to have me at your side.

Imagine if it were either of the others who
found thyselves here. How lost thou would
be!

Without mine divine prowess, mine puissiant 
knowledge, thou wouldst not even know where
to begin to search!

I must admit to some small measure of 
anticipation of their faces, when we rescue
them from this durance vile.

Perhaps we shall chance upon them alongst
our way, and see what aid we may render.

She nods happily.

Kaede:
Now, onward!

As you step outside, Kaede sniffs the air.

Kaede:
Yes, yes, the scent of humans lies thick 
amongst the breeze. 

'Tis odd, it seems it ist the same smell in
different trails. Methinks that many hast fallen
afoul of this base trickery.

She sniffs again.

Kaede:
Many of them art bound in that direction.\!
Onwards!

She follows whatever trail she has found.

As you begin to draw close to a nearby park,
she turns to you.

Kaede:
Now hero, mortals may sense that that thou
current state is not quite real, much as thee 
managed.

It means that they mightest find themselves
emboldened to act out those things they
wouldst never dare do underneath the sun's
bright gaze.

Gird thy loins with the strongest of steels, hero,
for we must be prepared to witness the worst
depravities mortal minds could conceive.

But we shall wade through them, no matter
long,\.\. or hard,\.\. or wet they may be! For
that is the price we pay for a better tomorrow!

passages.name: Apartment 1 — Exit — p2
passages.content:
Kaede:
Come, let us venture forth!

passages.name: Apartment 1 — Bed
passages.content: It's too early to go to bed.

passages.name: Apartment 1
passages.content:
You turn on the TV to the news.

NewsMiku:
And that was Miku, with word from the Miku on
the street.

Now we go to Miku for the weather.

Just normal news, looks like.

passages.name: Apartment 1
passages.content:
The clothing here is all a lot more feminine
than you remember.

Kaede:
Hero, I hadst not realized thou hadst changed
thy style.

Thou hast been listening to the great goddess
Florauna after all!

passages.name: Apartment 1
passages.content:
You're pretty sure these aren't yours?

Though you would look pretty cute in them.

passages.name: Apartment 1
passages.content:
You're pretty sure these aren't yours?

Though you would look pretty cute in them.

passages.name: Apartment 1 — Kaede — p1
passages.content:
...There's someone asleep in your bedroom
door.

???????:
Augh\..\..\..\..
What varlet hast set up a drum inside mine
head?

She climbs to her feet.

????:
Hero? Art thou the reason for the incessant
furor within mine pate?

Tis not fair that I shouldst have such a
pounding within mine head without the 
memories of the revel that must have 
preceded it!

Kaede?:
Of course hero!\!
Hast thou lost thy wits, to not recognize thy
closest companion?

Kaede?:
Methinks the answer to that is somewhere
between yes and no.

She licks a finger and feels the air.

Yes, not quite real, but speedily approaching.\!
Methinks this is yon dark goddess building a
change.

A dream that shall soon become real.

Though if this be a dream, odds must be a 
dreamer.\!
The center of this world, the source of this
change.

If we perchance find that soul, we mightst be
able to avert yon changes.

She looks down at herself.

Of course, I have no need to wait uponst
another to free me from this form.

Canst thou believe that goddess ist foolish
enough to believe she couldst trap a 
venerable master of forms such as I in an
unwanted shape?!

Kaede:
Now, give me but a moment to reclaim my 
form, then we shall go see what spike we might
put in this scoundrel's plans!

She focuses.

Nothing changes.

Kaede:
This doth be a most pussiant curse indeed.\!
But worry not, I shalt prevail!

She focuses again.

Her brow furrows as she concentrates harder 
and harder.

You can see the strain building in her body as
every muscle tenses.

Until finally...

A pair of fox ears pop out of the top of her 
head.

She dusts off her hands happily.

Kaede:
Ha, the varlet should have known no form
could holdst me for long!

She brushes a lock of teal hair away from
her eyes.

'Tis truly a regret that thou dost not possess
my own control of mine form.

She brushes the teal hair away again.

Though that would make thy journey so much
less interesting!\!

Her bangs flop in front of her eyes once more.

One who\..\..\.. cha

passages.name: Apartment 1 — p1
passages.content:
You awaken very slowly.

For a brief instant, you feel odd.

But it passes.

Though something still feels off.

Groggily, you get to your feet, struggling
against a feeling that the world just isn't quite
real right now.

Your glasses don't seem to be working quite
right either.

At least this can't get weirder than your last
few days have been?\.\. Probably?

passages.content:

Kaede:

passages.content:

???????:
Augh\..\..\..\..
What varlet hast set up a drum inside mine
head?

She climbs to her feet.

???????:
You there!\!
Art thou the knave who hast struck me down 
and stolen away mine companions?

Thou shouldst make thy peace with thine gods
if so, for thou faces the chosen of a goddess 
herself!

She climbs to her feet, ready to fight.

Kaede?:
How dost thou know mine name, stranger?

She looks around, then examines you closely.

Kaede?:
We art still in the hero's apartment...\!
And thou dost have a heroic mien...

Kaede?:
Why, ist that you \N[1]?

Kaede?:
Why, that is quite the fetching form thou hast
taken.

Though I must admit I find thy previous form
more pleasing to the eye.

Kaede?:
Methinks the answer to that is somewhere
between yes and no.

She licks a finger and feels the air.

Yes, not quite real, but speedily approaching.\!
Methinks this is yon dark goddess building a
change.

A dream that shall soon become real.

Of course, I have no need to wait upon her
pleasure.

'Tis foolish indeed to think that she could trap
a venerable master of forms such as I in an
unwanted shape!

She pauses and looks you up and down.

Kaede:
Though you shalt have to fend for yourself,
hero.

Why, even if I couldst shift thy form, wouldst
be a crime to make you any less fetching!

Kaede:
Now, give me but a moment to reclaim my 
form, then we shall go see what spike we might
put in this scoundrel's plans!

She focuses.

Kaede:
This doth be a most pussiant curse indeed.\!
But worry not, I shalt prevail!

She focuses again.

Her brow furrows as she focuses harder and
harder.

You can see the strain building in her body as

Until finally...

'Tis truly a regret that thou dost not possess
my own c

Were you drinking last night? This feels like a

You reluctantly open your eyes.

You stumble as you get out of bed.\!
Everything just feels *off* for a moment.

Yup, you're looking different again. Should

At least you're quickly feeling better.

passages.content:
Miku:
No no no!

Nothing here is good!

She rips the clothing she's holding in half
and throws it on one of the piles around her.

passages.name: Store — Old Autoplay — p1
passages.content:
As you approach the next location, Kaede
once more halts you.

Kaede:
Now remembereth Hero, thou might be 
exposed to the wildest excesses of man once
we happen upon another crowd of mortals.

Thy kin may sense that they lie in a state much
like a dream, and dreams bear no
consequences for aught mortals might do.

Who knows what debauched acts might be
performed? What dark fantasies might find the
light of day?

She shivers with anticipation as you open the
door.

Miku:
Ooo, how does this one look on me?

Employee Miku:
It looks fine.

Miku:
Hmm, I'm not sure...\!
Next!

Other Miku:
Hmm, I wonder how that would look on me...

Employee Miku:
The same?

Miku:
How about this one?\!
I love all the themed accessories you have!

Employee Miku:
Fine. It's fine.

Other Miku:
How would I look in that one?

Employee Miku:
The same.

Miku:
I'm trying a swimsuit this time!\!
A little more daring than I'd usually like, but
why not!

Employee Miku:
Sure. Great. Whatever.

Other Miku:
Huh, do you think *that* would look good
on me?

Employee Miku:
Yes!\!
You two look identical!

Everything she's wearing would look the 
same on you!

Other Miku:
...Are you sure?

passages.name: Store
passages.content:
Poster:
Feeling bored?\!
Tired?\!
Squamous?

Why not take a trip with the Dreamlands
Travel Agency!

Now offering luxury trips to Lost Carcosa!

Kaede tries to cover up the poster.

Kaede:
Beware Hero! 'Tis not for the mortal mind
to contemplate!

She takes another look at the poster.

Besides, Lost Carcosa hast become much too
touristy in recent times.

passages.content:

passages.content:
Employee Miku:
This is one of those nightmares.\!
Where I'm stuck at work and all the customers
are horrible.

...

At least they're all kind of hot.

Employee Miku:
Anyway, is there anything I can help 
you find cutie?

She thinks for a moment.

Employee Miku:
Paint, paint...

Ah yes, follow me!

She leads you to another part of the store.

Employee Miku:
Sorry for all the mess, it's been so weird here
since everything turned into a nonsense 
dreamscape!

She giggles.

Employee Miku:
Anyway, here we are!\!
Paint!

Now, there was something about it...\!
Some new corporate policy...

Oh right, you have to fight a vicious beast
for it!\!
Really, it's not the weirdest promotion 
corporate has had us do.

Employee Miku:
By fighting this beast you waive all liability for
injuries from fighting this beast!\!
Havefunbye!

Employee Miku:
We hope you have enjoyed this stunning
victory and/or slow and humiliating death!

She leads you back to the main part of the 
store.

Employee Miku:
Sure!

Employee Miku:
I'll be honest, I have no idea how I just did
that.

Employee Miku:
Let me know if you need anything!

Employee Miku:
Sorry, daring battles to the death are limited
to one per customer.

Employee Miku:
Sure!

Employee Miku:
I'll be honest, I have no idea how I just did
that.

Employee Miku:
Let me know if you need anything!

Employee Miku:
Sure!

Employee Miku:
I'll be honest, I have no idea how I just did
that.

Employee Miku:
Let me know if you need anything!

passages.name: Store — Miku trying
passages.content:
Miku:
This must be a dream.  There's no way this
could ever be this comfortable otherwise.

...There's no way this would fit otherwise.

passages.name: Store — Miku thinking
passages.content:
Miku:
Yay!

She poses.

I love this outfit so much!

passages.name: Store — Streaker
passages.content:
Miku:
Oh wow, I'm going to finally do it.

I've always wanted to go streaking!

But, you know, don't want to get arrested.

But what are they going to say?\!
"It was her, the person who looks just like 
everyone else!"

This is the perfect opportunity!

passages.name: Store — Miku 1
passages.content:
Miku:
I'm looking for more of a casual, everyday
sort of look.

passages.name: Store — Clerk 1
passages.content:
Store Miku:
Dreams where you're at work are the worst
dreams.

passages.name: Store — Intro miku
passages.content:
Miku:
No, this one isn't any good either!

Store Miku:
Ma'am, could you please at least use the 
dressing rooms?!

passages.name: Store — Kaede
passages.content:
Kaede:
Hmm, this calls for pondering.

passages.name: Store — Big Miku
passages.content:
Miku:
I've been wishing I could fit into some of the
clothes they have downtown.

I should have specified *which* clothes.

passages.name: Store — p1
passages.content:
A pile of shredded lingerie.

The clothing dissolves into a cloud of angry 
mist!

The clothing dissolves into a massive cloud 
of angry mist!

You clean up the scraps of torn clothing.

passages.name: Store — Autorun — p1
passages.content:
You both press yourself against the wall and
try not to breath too loudly.  

After a few moments, you hear footsteps 
recede into the distance.

Kaede:
Well.

Perhaps we shouldst take our shelter for a 
time and let those knaves disperse.

She looks further into the store.

Kaede:
And perhaps we might find some ploy to
draw yon knaves' attention away.

passages.name: Store — Exit
passages.content:
You shouldn't go outside yet.\!
You don't know if they're gone.

passages.name: Store — p1
passages.content:
You can faintly hear voices from up ahead.\!
Kaede turns to you.

Kaede:
Hero, thou shouldst hold close all mine 
warnings from before.

Even if these souls ahead prove welcoming,
they shouldst know that they live in something
bordering upon a dream.

Be not shocked by all of the

She licks her lips.

Bold and unrestrained depravity we might
find ourselves subject to.

passages.name: Store — p1
passages.content:
The voices ahead finally become clear.

Miku:
And how does this one look on me?

Store Miku:
Fine. It looks fine.

Miku:
Hmm...

She pulls another shirt from the rack and 
holds it up to herself.

Well how do you think this one would look?

Store Miku:
Fine. They all look fine.\!
Are you planning on trying on the entire
rack?!

Miku:
Oh, not just this rack!

Kaede:
Player, there ist something deeply wrong with
thee and thy era!

First thou has no idea of the true magnificence 
of mine presence!\!
And now thy peers are using a time of 
unrestrained freedom for, for, dress-up!

She turns to the store and cups her hands
around her mouth.

Kaede:
Whyfor art thou notst fornicating?!

Miku:
...What?

Store Miku:
I think she asked why we're not fucking.

Miku:
Hey screw you lady!\!
I'd never be able to fit into any of this 
normally!

I'm enjoying this while it lasts!

She turns back to the clothes rack.

Miku:
Now what else do I want to try on...

Store Miku:
\}God, why can't I manage to wake up...

And my self-portrait is complete!

Kaede takes a closer look at the paint the
Miku is using.

Kaede:
'Tis a combination...\!
Paint, hair dye, and...

Sexual lubricant?

Truly, thy age has invented such wonders,
Hero!

Kaede:
And this shouldst serve as a way to conceal
thy hair!

Not that brown ist not a doughty color, but 'tis
not the hue born by these Miku.

Art Miku:
Looking for paint?\!
Feel free to take it!\!
Art is for everyone!

Art Miku:
...Except I just ran out.\!
Of everything.

There's probably more somewhere in the 
store?

Yeah, none of us have any idea what's up
with her.

She shoves past you and stomps away.

Kaede:
'Tis a problem, \n[10].\!
Yon Miku has torn through all that we might
use in thy concealment.

Still, some few garments might remain, if
we be brave enough to search.

passages.name: Store — Clothes 1 — p1
passages.content:
Shredded pieces of uniforms.\!
You'll need to keep looking.

passages.name: Store — Clothes 2 — p1
passages.content:
There's one dress that looks good.\!
Until you pull it out and realize the crotch is
missing.

passages.content:
A pile of shredded lingerie.

The clothing dissolves into a cloud of angry 
mist!

The clothing dissolves into a massive cloud 
of angry mist!

passages.name: Store — p1
passages.content: Yellow paint was found!

passages.name: Store — Old art intro — p1
passages.content:
Kaede:
\N[10], perhaps we might find
aught here to color thine hair.

Brown tis a fine and doughty color, but tis not
the one these Mikus will be looking for.

Art Miku:
Did you say hair?\!
I've been looking for paint to finish the hair
of my self portrait!

Do you think you could find me some?\!
If you let me use a little you can keep the
rest!

Kaede:
Why Hero, I believe we might kill two ghosts
with one stone here.

If this paint canst be used for her hair, it must
be good for thy own as well!

passages.name: Store
passages.content: \{ACCESSORIES

passages.name: Store — Miku employee
passages.content:
Employee Miku:
This is one of those nightmares.\!
Where I'm stuck at work and all the customers
are horrible.

...

At least they're all kind of hot.

She notices you there.

Employee Miku:
Oh, I'm sorry, is there anything I can help 
you find?

She thinks for a moment.

Employee Miku:
Paint, paint...

Ah yes, follow me!

She leads you to another part of the store.

Employee Miku:
Sorry for all the mess, it's been so weird here
since everything turned into a nonsense 
dreamscape!

She giggles.

Employee Miku:
Anyway, here we are!\!
Paint!

Now, there was something about it...\!
Some new corporate policy...

Oh right, you have to fight a vicious beast
for it!\!
Really, it's not the weirdest promotion 
corporate has had us do.

Employee Miku:
Let me know if you need anything!

Employee Miku:
Let me know if you need anything!

passages.name: Store
passages.content:
Merchantku:
Hey there, looking to buy some accessories?

passages.name: Store
passages.content: \{FITTING ROOMS

passages.name: Store — Queen Miku
passages.content:
Miku:
Yes, yes, bow before me peons!

Miku:
You saw nothing!

passages.name: Store — Swimsuit Miku
passages.content:
Miku:
Oh yeah baby, that's a nice pose. Now stick
out your chest...

passages.name: Store — Disguise trigger
passages.content:
Kaede:
\N[10], art thou prepared to assemble thy
disguise?

What dost thou wish to use for thy hair?

You touch the tip of the paint tube to your
hair, highly skeptical that this will do anything.

Color wicks across your scalp like paper
dropped into water.\!
In seconds you can't tell your hair was ever
a different color.

Kaede:
And with what clothes shalt thou adorn 
thyself?

The uniform practically leaps onto you.\!
It fits... suprisingly well?\!
Much better than it should, actually.

At least shifting to fit it will help your disguise?

Kaede:
By the decree of the great goddess Florauna
herself, thou must accessorize. What shalt be
thy choice?

You pull out your accessory to complete the
look.

You finish the last bit of your disguise.

And then stagger, as something heavy
falls on your head.

Enormous Sword acquired!

Staggering to your feet, you look in the mirror.

// If A is on, the default response is not being used.

You look at yourself in the mirror.

You look okay, you guess.

Buy why does this skirt have to be so short?!

// If A is on, the default response is not being used.

You look at yourself in the mirror.\!
Lookin' pretty great, if you do say so 
yourself.

Kaede:
Perhaps this ist not the best disguise...

Kaede:
'Tis fine.\!
Perchance.

You take another drag of your cigarette.\!
You don't understand what her problem is.

// If A is on, the default response is not being used.

You look at yourself in the mirror.\!
Hey, looks pretty nice!

The disguise even worked in a bit of makeup
to provide some splashes of color!

Kaede:
Could thoust please stop smiling like that?

// If A is on, the default response is not being used.

You shiver a little.\!
You thought the costume you picked up
would have been warmer.

On second glance, maybe not.

But what really matters here is that you have
knives.\!
Lots and lots of knives.

Way Too Many Knives acquired!

// If A is on, the default response is not being used.

A heavenly chorus plays all around you as

passages.name: Store — p1
passages.content:
There's one outfit remaining on the rack.\!
Though it's too big.

Busty Mikuniform acquired!

passages.name: Store — p2
passages.content: Only shredded clothing remains on the rack.

passages.name: Store — Slim mikuniform — p1
passages.content:
There's one outfit remaining on the rack.\!
Though it's too small.

Slim Mikuniform acquired!

passages.name: Store — Slim mikuniform — p2
passages.content: Only shredded clothing remains on the rack.

passages.name: Store — Slim mikuniform — p1
passages.content:
There's one outfit remaining on the rack.\!
It's just right!

Medium Mikuniform acquired!

passages.name: Store — Slim mikuniform — p2
passages.content: Only shredded clothing remains on the rack.

passages.name: Store — Third intro scene — p1
passages.content:
Kaede:
Hero, wait, take not another step!

Kaede:
Hero, these errant buffoons hast given me 
an idea!

Miku:
Hey, screw you!

Kaede:
Those varlets outside swarmed in numbers
too high for even our doughty party to ward
off.

So if we canst not beat the Miku, we shall
become the Miku!

This merchant seemst to stock many a good.
Surely we might craft a most cunning disguise
for you!

Kaede:
Well-

She pauses.

Opens her mouth.

Reconsiders.

Frowns.

Kaede:
Trust me when I say hero that thou dost not
wish to know.

Kaede:
'Tis a cunning plan indeed, is it not?

If thou truly dost not know any of mine tales, 
we shalt have to make new ones!

Kaede:
But hero, there ist no other choice!

Kaede:
Now let us see what treasures this merchant
holds.\!
Methinks three items shall suffice.

She walks off into the store.

passages.name: Store — Old Kaede — p1
passages.content:
Kaede has cornered a set of Mikus and is
interrogating them.

Kaede:
What dost thou even think thee art doing?!\!
You couldst be doing anything! Why this?!

Miku:
I could never fit into a size zero like this! I'm 
enjoying it while I can!

Miku:
Are you kidding? No consequences!\!
I'm trying on everything in the store!

And I'm not even going to put it on the rack
for reshelving afterwards!

She runs off into the store laughing.

Kaede:
Well? And what is thy absurd reason?

The final Miku blushes.

Miku: 
\}I'm just enjoying being pretty...

Kaede throws up her hands.

Kaede:
Fine! Whatever!

She turns back to you.

Kaede:
Meet me back at the exit when thou art done
with this nonsense, Hero.

Mine senses tell me of another place to search.

She heads back to the front of the store.

passages.name: Store — Old Kaede — p2
passages.content:
Kaede pinches her nose tiredly.

Kaede:
Truly, I canst not tell if the fault lies in thee or
if thy world has grown so tight that *this*
feels like freedom.

passages.name: Store — Debug Tree
passages.content: So much power! (120 V)

passages.name: Store — ARG trigger
passages.content:
Your glasses do nothing. Terra Games 
probably forgot to program them to work in
dreams.

You'd file a bug report, but the beta is officially
over.

passages.name: Park — Autoplay event — p1
passages.content:
Indeed, as you enter the park you see off in
the distance a pile of teal-haired bodies.

Kaede:
See?

She licks her lips.

Kaede:
'Tis been barely a nonce and already a great
mass of mortals has come together to indulge
all of their basest impulses!

Kaede:
We should get closer.

Purely to check whether the dreamer we
seek lies amongst them, of course!

You approach.

As you get closer, you start to be able to make
out the noises coming from the\..\..\..
surprisingly clothed pile?

Miku:
-You're right, hugs *are* amazing.\!
I don't know why I ever let society's standards
of masculinity keep me from doing this!

The Miku holding her pats her gently on the
back as she starts to cry.

Miku:
And crying! It feels so good to not be holding
my emotions!\!
Why didn't I do this earlier?!

From what you can hear, similar conversations
are going on all over, as well as a lot of hugs
and cuddling.

It's surprisingly platonic, given everything
Kaede was saying.

Kaede:
Where's the orgy?!\!
There was supposed to be an earthshattering
orgy!

One of the Mikus looks up in irritation, a few
tears on her face.

Miku:
We can have empty sex *anytime*! I've never
had a chance for emotional processing like this!

There's a chorus of agreement from all around.

Kaede wanders back to you, looking stunned.

Kaede:
I thought I was prepared to see the deepest,
darkest desires of humanity.

But I was *not* prepared for *this*!!

Kaede:
Still, needs must.\!
I shall check if any of this aberrant crowd art
the dreamer.

But I believe we shalt need to explore the 
next grouping of dream energy I dost sense,
on the far side of this glade.

She heads off through the crowd.

passages.name: Park
passages.content:
Miku:
No, no, this is all wrong!\!
I'm supposed to be a miko, not a Miku!

Oh Florauna, why have you set me this trial?

passages.name: Park
passages.content:
The two Mikus are leaning into each other in 
a hug.

Miku 1:
This is so nice...

Miku 2:
Yeah...

Miku 1:
And I don't want to fuck you!

Miku 2:
I know!\!
Who would have though that just touching could
feel so good?

And not, like, sexy touching!

Miku 1:
I just, never had anything like this before.\!
Thank you so much for this!

Miku 2:
Hey dude, I'm just learning it too.\!
Thank you!

They both sigh happily and cuddle a little 
closer.

passages.name: Park
passages.content:
The two Mikus are leaning into each other in 
a hug.

Miku 1:
This is so nice...

Miku 2:
Yeah...

Miku 1:
And I don't want to fuck you!

Miku 2:
I know!\!
Who would have though that just touching could
feel so good?

And not, like, sexy touching!

Miku 1:
I just, never had anything like this before.\!
Thank you so much for this!

Miku 2:
Hey dude, I'm just learning it too.\!
Thank you!

They both sigh happily and cuddle a little 
closer.

passages.name: Park
passages.content:
Miku 1:
Huh.

Miku 2:
Yeah.

Miku 1:
So I spent my whole life trying to be all buff
and manly, and for what?

They all look down at themselves.

Miku 3:
Yeah, doesn't seem to be much point in that
now.

Miku 2:
Yeah...\!
I'd be getting angry if anyone said it before,
but now...?

passages.name: Park
passages.content:
Miku 1:
You know, I never really let myself think about
it before, but being cute is kind of fun?

Miku 2:
Yeah! Yeah!

She jumps up and down excitedly.

Miku 2:
Look at me! I'm bubbly!

passages.name: Park
passages.content:
Miku 1:
You know, I never really let myself think about
it before, but being cute is kind of fun?

Miku 2:
Yeah! Yeah!

She jumps up and down excitedly.

Miku 2:
Look at me! I'm bubbly!

passages.name: Park — Kaede 2
passages.content:
Kaede:
Come hero, the dreamer awaits!

Head out?

Kaede:
Simply speak the word when ready!

passages.name: Park
passages.content:
Miku:
I'm an idol now. I want to sing!\!
But a singer needs a stage...

Miku:
You know, I bet we could do something with
these tables...

passages.name: Park — Feral warning — p1
passages.content:
As you start to walk away, one of the members
of the cuddlepile calls out to you.

Miku:
Oh, watch out for the feral Mikus!

Another Miku:
They're animals that got changed too! They
really don't seem to be happy about it.

Yet Another Miku:
No, they're people whose minds couldn't bear
the majesty of being Miku!

This Is Certainly A Lot Of Mikus:
Or they're just LARPing!

Maybe The First Miku:
Why would they be LARPing?!\!
Animals make the most sense!

They devolve into friendly bickering.

Kaede:
...\!
Well. It seems we have another reason to 
find this dreamer posthaste.

Another Miku:
They're animals that got changed too! They
really don't seem to be happy about it.

Yet Another Miku:
No, they're people whose minds couldn't bear
the majesty of being Miku!

This Is Certainly A Lot Of Mikus:
Or they're just LARPing!

Maybe The First Miku:
Why would they be LARPing?!\!
Animals make the most sense!

They devolve into friendly bickering.

Kaede:
...\!
Well. It seems we have another reason to 
find this dreamer posthaste.

of the cuddlepile calls out to you.

Miku:
Oh, watch out for the feral Mikus!
