passages.name: Pet shelter night — Autorun
passages.content:
Goddess Arcadia:
Minion!

Fire Minion:
Burn!

They salute.

Goddess Arcadia:
Report! How have you made these humans
happy?

The minion starts gesturing wildly as they
launch into an extended explanation.

Goddess Arcadia:
What do you mean you *missed*?!

The gestures get more wild, with occasional 
hops and spurts of flame.

Goddess Arcadia:
Okay, yes, so you got startled by the dogs...\!
And so the two of them got switched?

Goddess Arcadia:
Maybe it'll be okay.\!
Humans do like cute cat *and* cute dog 
pictures...

Goddess Arcadia:
We'll wait and see!

But if it doesn't work...\!
If you make these humans unhappy...

Goddess Arcadia:
I will be very disappointed in you!

So do better next time, okay?

passages.name: Pet shelter 4 — Ball player — p1
passages.content:
Visitor:
Who's gonna get the ball?\!
Who's gonna get the ball?!

Is it you?\. Is it me?

Ball!

Both her and the dog's tails are wagging 
rapidly.

passages.name: Pet shelter 4 — Ball player — p2
passages.content:
Visitor:
I'm back with a ball!

Who's gonna get it?\!
Who's gonna get it?!

passages.name: Pet shelter 4 — Sign
passages.content:
Dogs only.\!
Cats will be chased and barked at!

passages.name: Pet shelter 4 — Cat toy — p1
passages.content:
Visitor:
I'll go home after I finally catch this toy!

She bats at it.

Visitor:
Come here already!

passages.name: Pet shelter 4 — Cat toy — p2
passages.content:
Visitor:
I missed so much quality toy time while this
place was closed!

passages.name: Pet shelter 4 — Autoplay — p1
passages.content:
A few minutes pass.

Shelter Head Felix:
Ah, it's finally done!

She pours the catnip tea. A wave of scent
washes through the room.

Shelter Head Doug:
What is that smell?!

Shelter Head Doug:
It smells...

Shelter Head Doug:
So good!\!
I- I have to try it!

She grabs the mug from Felix.

Shelter Head Felix:
Hey!

Doug chugs the tea.

Shelter Head Doug:
Hahahaha!\!
Ahahahahahahahahaha!

She grabs the kettle and runs off, laughing 
drunkenly.

Shelter Head Felix:
...Hey!

Shelter Head Felix:
Betrayal!\!
Again!

She glares off in Doug's direction.

Shelter Head Felix:
And you left your stupid stick behind!

She flings it off towards the dogs.

Her eyes go wide.

Shelter Head Felix:
Stick!\!
Gotta catch the stick!!!!!

passages.name: Pet shelter 4 — Spirit — p1
passages.content:
Cat:
Nyaaa~~ :3

...That wasn't a meow. The cat literally just
said "nya".

passages.name: Pet shelter 4 — Spirit — p2
passages.content:
Cat?:
Hello, nyaa!\!
I'm a magical love heart <3 spirit guide!

I heard the cries of the poor kitties and
puppies here! Your pure and overwhelming 
love for them has let me appear to help!

You trade a confused glance with the rest of
your party.

/n[2]:
Do you mean those two?\!
/n[10] doesn't even have a pet...

Magical Love Heart <3 Spirit Guide:
Hmm...

Magical Love Heart <3 Spirit Guide:
Their pure and overwhelming love for pets 
has let me appear to help!

Go! Rescue the poor things!\!
I will send the spirits to show you where they
hide!

passages.name: Pet shelter 4 — Spirit — p3
passages.content:
Magical Love Heart <3 Spirit Guide:
There are still such cute puppies and kitties
out there who need your help, Hero!

passages.name: Pet shelter 4 — Catdoggirl — p1
passages.content:
Catdoggirl:
But where am I supposed to go?

passages.name: Pet shelter 4 — Doug after — p1
passages.content:
Shelter Head Doug:
No cats! No cats allowed!

We should never have allowed cats! Then 
maybe this wouldn't have happened!

passages.name: Pet shelter 4 — Doug after — p2
passages.content:
Doug is pacing back and forth, tail lashing
furiously behind her.

Shelter Head Doug:
It's no good.\. No good!\!
I won't accept it!

Think.\. Think!\!
What is the most doggish thing I can do?

She paces for a moment longer.

Shelter Head Doug:
A stick.\. Chasing a stick!\!
But it can't be just any stick.

To counter this I need the best stick any dog
has ever dreamed of chasing.\!
But I can't leave the poor pups alone!

She finally seems to notice you.

You!\!
Are you here to help?\!
I need your help!

Please go to the orchard in Garden Park and
pick up the *best* stick you can find.\!
Please!\!
Before I start to nya!

Shelter Head Doug:
Thank you!\!
And here.

She rummages around in her dress for a 
moment.

Shelter Head Doug:
Take this!\!
It will help.

She hands you a cute puppy.

That's Snowlily.  She's the pickiest dog we
have when it comes to sticks.\!
If she likes it, it's going to be one of the 
best sticks out there!

Puppy acquired?

passages.name: Pet shelter 4 — Doug after — p3
passages.content:
Doug is pacing back and forth, tail lashing
furiously behind her.

Shelter Head Doug:
Have you found the stick yet?\!
I don't know how much longer I can stand
this!

She stares at a scratching post, then shudders
and turns away.

passages.name: Pet shelter 4 — Doug after — p4
passages.content:
You hand the stick over.\!
The puppy jumps out of your inventory to
follow.

Shelter Head Doug:
Thank you.\!
You can't even understand how much I 
appreciate this.

Shelter Head Doug:
I think Felix has something she wants you to
do.

passages.name: Pet shelter 4 — Doug after — p5
passages.content:
She tosses the stick out, then stares at it.\!
After a few moments she sighs and walks over
to collect it.

Shelter Head Doug:
I'm sure this'll feel good eventually...

passages.name: Pet shelter 4 — Doug after — p6
passages.content:
Doug is staring into the catnip tea, a 
blissed-out smile covering her face.

Shelter Head Doug:
Nyaow does it smell so good?

She laps up a little of the tea.

Shelter Head Doug:
Nyaow does it *taste* so good?

She purrs.

passages.name: Pet shelter 4 — Felix — p1
passages.content:
Shelter Head Felix:
Even if I can't be a cat, at least I can 
surround myself with them.

This is how things should have been from the
beginning!

passages.name: Pet shelter 4 — Felix — p2
passages.content:
Shelter Head Felix:
Thank goodness you've shown up.

Her tail starts wagging.

She grabs it and holds it still.

Shelter Head Felix:
No! No!\!
None of that!

She pulls out a roll of tape and begins to
angrily tape her tail to the back of her dress,
muttering to herself.

Shelter Head Felix:
\}I will not wag. Wag is the mind-killer. Wag
is the little death that brings oblivion. I will 
not wag.

She turns back to you.

Shelter Head Felix:
And this isn't even the worst thing I've had
to deal with!

The urges...\!
The dark, beastial urges...

Do you know how many squirrels there are
around here?\!
Do you know how-

She shudders.

Chaseable they feel?

And not in the cool, suave, stealthy way. Not
like a cat would.\!
In the stupid barking idiot way!

You have to help before I find myself doing 
something completely inane!

I'm going to try to act more catlike in the
hopes it'll reverse this madness.\!
It's not much of a plan, but I'm desperate.

I need you to go to the farm in Garden Park
and get me some catnip.\!
Catnip tea is a thing humans can drink, and 
I'll chug it forever if that's what it takes.

I'd go, but the cats need someone to watch
them.\!
They've had enough scares recently!

Shelter Head Felix:
Thank you!

Her tail starts to wag again.\!
She glares and starts applying more tape as 
you leave.

passages.name: Pet shelter 4 — Felix — p3
passages.content:
Shelter Head Felix:
No catnip yet?

She sighs.

Shelter Head Felix:
It's fine.\!
It's not like my mind is constantly under 
assault by dark and feral forces or anything!

She stares at a nearby rawhide bone for a 
moment before shuddering and tearing
her gaze away.

passages.name: Pet shelter 4 — Felix — p4
passages.content:
You hand over the catnip.

Shelter Head Felix:
Thank you!

You see her dress twitch as her tail tries to
wag.

She starts the leaves brewing.

Shelter Head Felix:
Let's give that some time to brew.\!
It should be done by the time you finish
whatever idiocy Doug is asking for.

passages.name: Pet shelter 4 — Felix — p5
passages.content:
Felix is staring at the teapot.

Shelter Head Felix:
Come on, brew already!

passages.name: Pet shelter 4 — Felix — p6
passages.content:
Felix is clutching the Best Stick.

Shelter Head Felix:
Hahahahahaha, stick! Stiiiiiiiick!

Her tail is wagging so hard it's torn off all the
tape.

Shelter Head Felix:
The best stick!

passages.name: Pet shelter 4 — Sign
passages.content:
Cats Only


\{\{NO DOGS ALLOWED

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Best stick — p1
passages.content:
A beam of sunlight shines down from the 
clouds as you approach the stick.\!
Is...\. is that an angelic chorus?

Snowlily sniffs at it, then starts jumping 
around with overwhelming puppy bliss.\!
Looks like this is the stick!

Best Stick acquired!

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Best stick — p2
passages.content:
A beam of sunlight shines down from the 
clouds as you approach the stick.\!
Is...\. is that an angelic chorus?

Snowlily sniffs at it, then starts jumping 
around with overwhelming puppy bliss.\!
Looks like this is the stick!

Best Stick acquired!

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Stick — p1
passages.content:
Much too short.\!
Worthless as a stick, really.

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Puppy — p1
passages.content:
The puppy jumps out of your inventory as
you enter the orchard.

She sniffs excitedly at a tangle of sticks and
leaves on the ground.

Then turns her nose up in contempt.\!
These appear to be inadequate sticks.

She hmphs back into your inventory.

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Stick — p1
passages.content:
Too long.\!
The puppy can barely move it.

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Stick — p1
passages.content:
That is an entire tree.\!
Snowlily spends a few moments tugging on it 
anyway before finally giving up.

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Stick — p1
passages.content:
Too brown.\!
Ugh.

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Stick — p1
passages.content:
Too sticky.\!
It's covered in sap.

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Stick — p1
passages.content: That's not a stick, it's a snake!

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Stick — p1
passages.content: That's not a stick, it's a snake!

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Stick — p1
passages.content: That's not a stick, it's a snake!

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Stick — p1
passages.content:
It not clear why, but Snowlily seems to find
something *incredibly* offensive about this
stick.

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Stick — p1
passages.content:
Not a stick, just a piece of raw mana.\!
Disappointed, you put it back.

A moment later you come to your senses 
and go back for it.

Raw mana acquired!

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Stick — p1
passages.content:
Too many leaves.\!
You leave well enough alone.

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Stick — p1
passages.content:
Too short, too gnarled, too thin, and has some
kind of weird fungus growing on it.

Snowlily retreats back into your inventory in
absolute disgust.

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Stick — p1
passages.content:
A tree root, not a stick.\!
It's still attached to the tree.

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Stick — p1
passages.content:
Snowlily spends several minutes sniffing it
and considering.\!
Looks like it's almost good enough, but not
quite.

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Dryad
passages.content:
Snowlily runs up and starts tugging on what
looks like a root.

Park Volunteer:
Hey!\!
That's my foot, thank you very much!

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Stick — p1
passages.content:
Ugh, not a real stick.\!
Artificial stick substitute.

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — p1
passages.content:
That's...\. that's definitely not a stick.

You eventually have to stick the abandoned
underwear into your inventory to get
Snowlily to stop sniffing it.

Trash panties acquired!

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Stick — p1
passages.content:
It's a branch from an apple tree.\!
It still has some very angry fruit.

And to add insult to injury, the branch broke
during the battle!

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Stick — p1
passages.content:
It's a branch from an apple tree.\!
It still has some very angry fruit.

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Stick — p1
passages.content:
It's a branch from an apple tree.\!
It still has some very angry fruit.

And to add insult to injury, it's not even a 
good branch!

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Stick — p1
passages.content:
Just, an inferior stick.\!
4/10 at best.\!
We are all *very* disappointed.

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Stick — p1
passages.content:
Somehow this is the absolute worst stick 
you've ever seen.\!
You can't even say how.

It's just, just, absolute trash.\!
Snowlily emphatically agrees.

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Fairy
passages.content:
Fairy:
Aww, who's a cute puppy!

Snowlily sniffs with contempt.\!
Apparently the fairy is not a good stick.

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Fairy
passages.content:
The fairy is playing with a stick.

Fairy:
This is mine!\!
Go away dog!

Snowlily's sniff carries an impressive amount
of contempt.

Not only doesn't she care, but she can't
believe anyone could enjoy such an inferior
stick.

The fairy's taste casts significant doubt on
their intelligence, judgement, and basic
competence.

Snowlily is confused how someone with such
poor stick judgement can even be trusted to
feed themselves, her sniff conveys. Maybe
they aren't.

passages.name: Orchard stick quest — Fairy
passages.content:
Fairy:
Sticks are so old.\!
All the cool people are into rocks now.

Snowlily turns her nose up.\!
The classics are classics for a reason, she
seems to say.

passages.name: Orchard shelter rampage — Autoplay event — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Hi there, I'd be careful if you're going to go
wandering in there.

We got a report of a dog with a chainsaw that
we're trying to take care of.

Animal Control:
Yes, I know, it sounds ridiculous, but-

Felix goes sprinting by.

Shelter Head Felix:
Ahahahahahaha!\!
You'll never catch me!

All trees will become sticks!

Animal Control:
...Yes, that.

passages.name: Orchard shelter rampage — Entrance animal control — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
We can't keep you out, but we heavily suggest
avoiding dogs with chainsaws.\!
And any other animal with chainsaws.

Maybe just avoid chainsaws in general?

passages.name: Orchard shelter rampage — Entrance animal control — p2
passages.content:
Animal Control:
A cat and dog ran past here towards the farm,
fighting like mad.

Scratched me up good.

passages.name: Orchard shelter rampage — Animal control
passages.content:
Fairy:
How many trees would a dog chainsaw if a 
dog could chainsaw trees?

Hmm, it doesn't flow as well as the original...

passages.name: Orchard shelter rampage — Animal shelter boss pep talk — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control Boss:
Men!

You are here because you are the few!\!
The proud!\!
The brave!

You are the ones chosen to stand between 
civilization and the wild!\!
To protect our way of life from the chaos that
would tear it down!

He pulls out a large poster.

Animal Control Boss:
This is our target today.\!
Our enemy!

He sneers.

Animal Control Boss:
A *dog*. Running wild in our parks!

Now, I know we have all feared the day that
animals would learn to use power tools.\!
Tossed and turned, terrified that tomorrow
would be the day.

But even if that terrible day has come at last,
we shall not falter!\!
We will not be overcome!

Chainsaws may be a step up from teeth and
claws, but it will not stop us!\!
We have trained for this!

We are the line that stands between humanity
and the raging wilds, and we shall perservere!

One of his underlings raises their hand.

Animal Control:
Sir!\!
Are we certain this is our job?\!
That appears to be a whole-ass person, sir!

Animal Control Boss:
Of course this is our job, soldier!\!
See these ears?\!
See this tail?

He taps them on the picture.

Animal Control Boss:
They mean this is what is widely known as 
a dog!

And dogs are our responsibility!\!
Our duty!

Now, the time has come to do our duty!\!
Men, move out!

They march deeper into the woods.

passages.name: Orchard shelter rampage — Animal control
passages.content:
Animal Control:
The boss is right, we all knew this day would
come.

It's a good thing we did all those 
anti-chainsaw drills.\!
And anti-drill drills, for that matter.

passages.name: Orchard shelter rampage — Animal control
passages.content:
Fairy:
Wow!\!
I never knew dogs were so evil!

passages.name: Orchard shelter rampage — Animal control
passages.content:
Fairy:
I'm not sure that's the point here...

passages.name: Orchard shelter rampage — Animal control — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Ah, sometimes you just have to stop and 
smell the flowers.

Other Animal Control:
You really don't.\!
I'm way too allergic.

Animal Control:
Oh, that can't be right.\!
They smell so nice!\!
Are you telling me you've never tried it?

Other Animal Control:
Please no.\!
I-\.\. I-

The animal control officer shoves a flower in
his colleague's face.

Other Animal Control:
Oh no.\!
I-

*Achoo!*

He sneezes so hard his hat flies off his head.\!
Crimson hair bursts from his head, falling
down to his shoulders.

*ACHOO!*

Another sneeze, as his body shifts. Breasts
surge forth to tent the front of his shirt,
while hips bulge and strain against his 
suddenly too-small pants.

Eyes watering, the new woman holds a hand
to her nose.

A-\.\.
A-\.\.
A-\.\.\^

\{\{*ACHOO!*

The final sneeze is so powerful it blasts her
clothes straight off her body, except for
shredded remains of her pants on her legs.

Rose petals swirl through the air, as larger 
petals burst out from her body to provide
minimal cover.

She staggers as great rose petal wings and 
a thorny tail drag her backwards, catching
herself on her knees with vines growing out
of her hips.

Both animal control people just stare for a 
moment.

Animal Control:
Gesundheit?

passages.name: Orchard shelter rampage — Animal control — p2
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Huh, that's the second worst allergy attack
I've ever seen.

passages.name: Orchard shelter rampage — Animal control — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Ah, sometimes you just have to stop and 
smell the flowers.

Other Animal Control:
You really don't.\!
I'm way too allergic.

Animal Control:
Oh, that can't be right.\!
They smell so nice!\!
Are you telling me you've never tried it?

Other Animal Control:
Please no.\!
I-\.\. I-

The animal control officer shoves a flower in
his colleague's face.

Other Animal Control:
Oh no.\!
I-

*Achoo!*

He sneezes so hard his hat flies off his head.\!
Crimson hair bursts from his head, falling
down to his shoulders.

*ACHOO!*

Another sneeze, as his body shifts. Breasts
surge forth to tent the front of his shirt,
while hips bulge and strain against his 
suddenly too-small pants.

Eyes watering, the new woman holds a hand
to her nose.

A-\.\.
A-\.\.
A-\.\.\^

\{\{*ACHOO!*

The final sneeze is so powerful it blasts her
clothes straight off her body, except for
shredded remains of her pants on her legs.

Rose petals swirl through the air, as larger 
petals burst out from her body to provide
minimal cover.

She staggers as great rose petal wings and 
a thorny tail drag her backwards, catching
herself on her knees with vines growing out
of her hips.

Both animal control people just stare for a 
moment.

Animal Control:
Gesundheit?

passages.name: Orchard shelter rampage — Animal control — p2
passages.content:
Alraune Control:
Great.\!
Now I'm *made* of pollen.\!
I-

She pauses, and cautiously sniffs herself.

Alraune Control:
I'm.\..\..\. not sneezing?

She picks a flower and smells it.

Alraune Control:
At all?

Alraune Control:
...That's actually pretty worth it.

passages.name: Orchard shelter rampage — Animal control — p3
passages.content:
Alraune Control:
First thing after work, I'm bringing my wife
*all* the flowers.

She's going to be so happy to be able to have
them in the house!

passages.name: Orchard shelter rampage — Animal control — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Oh no.\!
Flowers.\!
Why did it have to be flowers?

Animal Control:
I just have the *worst* luck with flowers.

He turns to face the field and sets his 
shoulders.

Animal Control:
But no.\!
I have to do this.

I've already been written up once for refusing
to pursue a suspect.

Just go for it, how bad can it be?

There is a sad, wet crunch, like a foot
crushing a large insect.\!
You hear soft buzzing.

Animal Control:
Uh-oh.

Another crunch.\!
The buzzing grows louder.

Animal Control:
Why?!\!
Why is it always flowers?!

He flees, pursued by a swarm of angry bees.

passages.name: Orchard shelter rampage — p1
passages.content:
The officer is sitting here covered in stings,
groaning. 

Animal Control:
Why did it have to be bees?

passages.name: Orchard shelter rampage — p2
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Great, now I'm going to get written up for
being out of uniform.

At least my stings don't hurt anymore.

passages.name: Orchard shelter rampage — Animal control — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Reporting that we have cornered the dog up
ahead!

Forces are moving in for the capture!

passages.name: Orchard shelter rampage — Felix — p2
passages.content:
Animal Control:
On the downside, the tree got chainsawed.\!
On the brightside, none of us did.

She looks down at her exposed belly.

Animal Control:
Though my shirt might have gotten hit?

passages.name: Orchard shelter rampage — Ending event — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control Boss:
Men!

Up ahead is our objective!\!
One (1) stray dog!

One that is making themselves a public
nuisance!

Are you all ready to do your duty and secure
that dog?!

Animal Control Boss:
Well?\!
Speak up men!

Animal Control:
Sir, are you certain we have enough men for
this?

We've never faced a dog with a chainsaw
before!

Animal Control 2:
It's entirely outside protocol, sir!

Animal Control Boss:
Do not worry!

I have trained all you men to the greatest of
standards!\!
There is *nothing* you can't take on together!

And if you don't believe in yourselves, believe
in me!\!
I've caught more dogs than you've had warm 
meals, soldier!

My years of experience mean I can say with 
confidence that you all are *exactly* as many 
men as we need to capture that dog!

The crowd of animal control officers look more
confident with his reassurances.

Animal Control Boss:
Now let's move out men!

Meanwhile, Felix has started cutting down
another tree.

Shelter Head Felix:
Yes, yes, this will make the best sticks yet!

She's too caught up in the lure of sticks to
notice animal control slowly surrounding her.

The tree crashes to the ground as they move 
in.

And a familiar figure leaps out of it, tail
bristling.

Shelter Head Doug:
Felix!\!
How could you?!\!
I was napping!

Another betrayal!

Felix growls back.

Shelter Head Felix:
It's always whining with you, Doug!\!
Complaining at your luck to be a cat.
Crying about this tree *I* claimed!

Are you really trying to take my sticks away
from me?\!
The only thing I have left!?

Go lick your butt or something and leave me
alone!

They growl angrily at each other.

Animal Control Boss:
Forwards men!\!
While she's distracted!

They leap on both shelter heads.

It's hard to tell, but things do not seem to 
be going well for them.

A moment later Felix and Doug run past you, 
still arguing.\!
Behind them the animal control officers lie 
groaning on the ground.

Their leader raises a shaky hand.

Animal Control Boss:
S

passages.name: Orchard shelter rampage — Animal control — p2
passages.content:
Animal Control:
That dog bit me!\!
And said some very hurtful things!!

passages.name: Orchard shelter rampage — Animal control
passages.content:
Animal Control:
We should have expected a hidden cat
ambush.\!
It's the oldest trick in the book!

...Dogs can't read.\!
Why would someone teach her that trick?!

passages.name: Orchard shelter rampage — Animal control
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Anyone else feel a little weird after getting 
scratched by that cat?

passages.name: Orchard shelter rampage — Mascot — p2
passages.content:
Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
Good work hero!\!
But the job isn't over yet!\!
To the farm of love and justice!

passages.name: Orchard shelter rampage — Animal control
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Wow, they just ripped a new path through 
the trees to get out!

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — Dead vines — p1
passages.content:
The vines are weak and brittle and won't bear
your weight.

Green spreads rapidly through the vines as
they absorb the potion. You can see the stalks
swelling as new leaves unfold.

They should bear your weight now.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — Trash 7 — p1
passages.content:
You collect an entire skeleton. Odd.

\V[9] pieces of trash collected.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — Trash 2 — p1
passages.content:
You pick up an empty "juice" bottle.

No wait, this is actually juice.  Huh.

\V[9] pieces of trash collected.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — Trash 1 — p1
passages.content:
You pick up a pile of old papers.

\V[9] pieces of trash collected.

And there's a pastry underneath, still in the
plastic!

Acquired Healing Pastry!

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — Trash 5 — p1
passages.content:
A bunch of seedy-looking advertisments.

"Roy's Back-Alley Bargains! Almost
as legal as you think!"

You tear them down.

\V[9] pieces of trash collected.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — Trash 6 — p1
passages.content:
You find some... trash(?) on the ground?

\V[9] pieces of trash collected?

The bra looks torn, but the panties are in 
okay condition. Do you want to keep them?

This is underwear, just to be clear, that you
found on the ground in a secluded area in a
park. You're sure you want to touch it? 
Maybe wear it?

Trash Panties shamefully slipped into pocket.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — Trash 4 — p1
passages.content:
Old food. Yuck.

\V[9] pieces of trash collected.

And a cup of still-warm coffee!

Coffee acquired!

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — Trash 3 — p1
passages.content:
You sweep up a whole bunch of broken glass.

\V[9] pieces of trash collected.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — Thorns — p1
passages.content:
Thorns have overgrown this portion of the
hedge maze, blocking it completely.

The magic of your absorbed gloves protects
your hands as you rip out handful after
handful of thorns. Soon the way is clear.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — Elf guard — p1
passages.content:
Halt, hero!

You may be here to help, but that doesn't
mean you can help yourself to our treasury.

The only way in here is through me.

Your last blow sends the guard flying back.

Elf Guard:
Too strong...

Elf Guard:
And don't come back.

Elf Guard:
Feel lucky I'm sparing your life.

Elf Guard:
Good idea.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — p1
passages.content: Raw mana found!

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — Mimic — p1
passages.content:
Mimic:
Five more minutes.\!

*She slams the lid shut*

Mimic:
I'm sleeping!

*She slams the lid*

Mimic:
Hey!\!
I was sleeping!

...And you're an intruder!

One second before I beat you up!

She holds up a hand and turns to the chest
next to her.

And then stares for a moment at its empty
interior.

She turns back to you.

Mimic:
You stole my breakfast!\!
Do you know how hard it is to get?!

The elves refuse to buy me anything, they're
all "Mimi, we can feed you just as well from
the natural bounty of the hedges", "Mimi,
coffee is a pollutant for your body",

"Mimi, I've made a joyous wonderbread much
better than any pastry from leaves and nectar."\!
Let me tell you, it isn't!

It's going to be *weeks* until I can talk
someone else into getting anything for me!\!
Unless I drag myself all the way out there,
which will also take forever!

She looks very tired.

Mimic:
Ugh, beating people up without any coffee
*sucks*.

She glares.

Mimic:
But you deserve it, punk!

She pulls out some coffee and a pastry and
devours them.

Mimic:
Ahhh, part of a balanced asskicking!

Mimic:
Fine, fine! You've defeated me!\!
Whatever.

She reaches down into her box and 
rummages around for a bit.\!
Finally she pulls out a crumpled wad of
paper.

Unfolding it, she begins to read in a flat voice.

Mimic:
Oh Hero/Villain/Overly Burly Squirrel, thou
hast passed the, uh, final challenge?

She squints at the paper.

Mimic:
I think I spilled coffee on this bit.\!
It says you get some kind of, uh, reward?

What was that supposed to be?\!
It's been a while...\!
Just kind of a splotch on the paper...

One moment.

She ducks back into her box and shuts the 
lid.

You hear many things being moved inside.\!
Finally, she pops back out.

Mimic:
Here we go!\!
\}Ah, I've been meaning to throw that out
for ages.

A...\. blob of goo plops into your inventory?\!
At least there's also a shiny rock attached.

Mimic:
Now \{GO AWAY!

She slams the chest lid shut.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — Mimic — p2
passages.content:
Mimic:
Haven't you done enough already!?

She slams the chest lid shut.

...You know, you could probably replace her 
breakfast if you wanted.

Give her a coffee and pastry?

She glares at you for a moment.

Mimic:
Hmmph, it's the least you could do.

She swipes the food from you and hides it in
her chest.

Mimic:
...\!
Thanks.

Mimic:
Huh, really?\!
Thanks!

She eagerly takes it.

Mimic:
This stuff is so hard to get out here!

The elves refuse to buy me anything, they're
all "Mimi, we can feed you just as well from
the natural bounty of the hedges", "Mimi,
coffee is a pollutant for your body",

"Mimi, I've made a joyous wonderbread much
better than any pastry from leaves and nectar."\!
Let me tell you, it isn't!

It takes *weeks* to talk anyone into getting 
things for me.\!
And dragging myself out of the maze also 
takes forever.

Mimic:
Feel free to raid the treasury any time you
want if you keep bringing me stuff!

You offer her the food, but run into the slight
problem that you don't actually have it.

Mimic:
Are you having fun taunting me?!

She slams the chest lid shut.

You offer her the food, but run into the slight
problem that you don't actually have it.

Mimic:
Are you having fun taunting me?!

She slams the chest lid shut.

You leave.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — Mimic — p3
passages.content:
Mimic:
Oh.\!
It's you again.

Hi, I guess.

Mimic:
Hey, how's it going?\!
The elves haven't refilled the treasury, I
doubt they're going to do that for a while.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — p1
passages.content: 100\G were found!

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — p1
passages.content: Espresso found! Still warm, too.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — p1
passages.content:
Someone's breakfast found!
Gained 1 coffee and 1 healing pastry.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — p1
passages.content: 100\G were found!

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — p1
passages.content: Raw mana found!

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — Trash Monster — p1
passages.content:
A foul smell rises from this pile of trash.

A wind you can't feel begins to pick it up.

\C[3]I will prevent you from removing all this 
lovely filth!

Somehow picked up the entire mound of 
trash!\!
And the tree next to it!

\V[9] pieces of trash collected. \V[11] left.

You found a piece of raw mana glittering
underneath the pile!

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — Elf healer — p1
passages.content:
Elf Healer:
Be careful, there's a dangerous spirit ahead.

Let me heal you.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — Elf healer — p2
passages.content:
Elf Healer:
You truly are a hero! 

I still sense a darkness in the maze. It feels
like there are \V[11] pieces of trash left.

Let me heal you.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — Elf healer — p3
passages.content:
Elf Healer:
Welcome hero!

Let me heal you.

I'm afraid one of our less wise members is
commiting blasphemy in the clearing ahead.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — Sheep spirit — p1
passages.content:
There is a black sheep here. Faint stars flow
over its wool in dizzying patterns.

It's wedged itself into the hedge wall and
refuses to move. It looks terrified.

Move it by force?

You try to grab it, but your hands pass through
it. It's only an image in the game, after all.

It tries to back further into the hedge anyway.

It tries to back further into the hedge as you
look at it.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — Sheep spirit — p2
passages.content:
There is a faintly translucent sheep here.
Stars swirl over its black wool.

You try to grab it, but it dodges out of the way
of your hand. More tries have just as little
success.

\N[2]:
Here, let me help.

Let her help?

She motions you to step back, then spreads
her arms. She slowly moves forward until
the sheep is backed into the corner of the
corridor.

She then grabs its head and front legs and
tips it back until it's resting on its side. She
motions for you to come over.

\N[2]:
Not the first time I've had to mess with sheep.
Though this one is more... celestial than what
I've worked with in the past.

*She glances down*
Doesn't seem to make much of a difference.

With her restraining the sheep, you're easily
able to wave your hand through it and add it
to your inventory.

\N[2]:
*She steps back* Fine, have fun.

It takes some effort, but finally you're able to
wave a hand through the sheep and add it to
your inventory.

Okay, it takes a lot of effort.

A lot of effort and at least two falls, where the
sheep dodges and your feet slip as you try to
turn.

At least you only fell into more thornbushes
once.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — p1
passages.content: 30\G were found!

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — Elina cutscene trigger — p2
passages.content:
As the last enemy fuzzes out into digital static,
\N[2] sits heavily on the ground.

\N[2]:
That *hurt!*\|
They were actually trying to kill us! \|
I could have died!

\N[2]:
I\.\.\. kinda have to tell you something...

I have no idea what I'm doing.

I was just supposed to be the damsel in
distress.\.
Just supposed to sit in that room and wait to
be rescued.

\>But look at this world!

She gestures around.

You've got glowing lights on all the walls! \.
And those weird water bowls that empty
themselves!\. And, and big metal boxes that
eat people then spit them out somewhere else!

I couldn't just sit around and *not* get a 
chance to see all this!

So I, uh, invited myself along. \|
That's not a problem, right?

*She stands back up*
Thanks. \.\. That helps.

*She takes a few deep breaths*
I can do this. \.\.
So monsters are scary. And pain hurts. So 
what.

We've got espresso and stuff that can bring 
me back. Pain will pass.

There's a big new world and I'm going to see
it. \|
I'm *not* going to go back to waiting in a 
cage forever.

She looks back at you.

\N[2]:
Okay, I think I'm ready. \.
Let's keep exploring.

She glares at you.

\N[2]:
You know what? No. There is no way I am
leaving. \.\.\.
You're not getting rid of me that easily.

She pulls herself to her feet.

I am *not* going to go back to sitting in a 
cage. \.
Monsters aren't going to stop me, and neither
are you.

This is my chance to see a brand new world
and I'm going to take it no matter what you
or anything else does.

Are you coming, or are *you* too scared?

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — Elf farmer — p2
passages.content:
Elf 1:
So I figured, why not try this whole agriculture
thing? It seems to work pretty well for the 
humans.

It looks like the remains of that trash spirit
are pretty good fertilizer too.

Elf 2:
I knew we shouldn't have let you go exploring.

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — Elf not farmer — p2
passages.content:
Elf 2:
What about nature's bounty? What about our
culture?

Elf 1:
Look, I'd just like to cut down on how often I
have to stab an animal to death for dinner.

Is that so wrong?

passages.name: Hedge Maze ARG 2 — p2
passages.content:
Elf guard:
Owwww....

passages.name: Farm shelter rampage intro
passages.content:
An employee badge dangles from the cow's 
ear.

passages.name: Farm shelter rampage intro
passages.content:
An employee badge dangles from the cow's 
ear.

passages.name: Farm shelter rampage intro
passages.content:
An employee badge dangles from the cow's 
ear.

passages.name: Farm shelter rampage intro
passages.content:
\{A short time ago...

Shelter Head Felix:
Dig dig dig.\!
Dig dig dig!

Animal Control Boss:
Alright men!\!
This time for sure!

Last time may have gone poorly.\!
But we will not be outsmarted by animals.

We have learned.\!
We have prepared.\!
This time, our numbers are enough to handle
dogs *and* cats!

Now, quietly, forward!

They creep closer, Felix too distracted by 
digging to notice.

Animal Control Boss:
Carefully, carefully...

Shelter Head Felix:
You-!

Animal Control Boss:
Now! Everyone-\.\.\^

There is a sudden rumble of hooves.

A group of cows stampedes through the 
officers.\!
Doug is on the back of the lead cow, clawing 
desperately to stay on.

Felix barely dodges the herd, leaping over a 
fence and fleeing.

The officers scatter everywhere to escape.\!
Most of them make it.

passages.name: Floor 2 rampage intro — Autoplay
passages.content:
\{UPSTAIRS

Doug is happily scratching at the racks of 
pants, ripping pair after pair to shreds.

She's purring loudly as she does, eyes 
blissfully closed.

Animal Control Boss:
Alright men, you are the few!\. The proud!\.
The elite of animal control!

I didn't think I'd have to call you in, but 
together we can take on any type *and* any
number of animals!

Rabid wolverines!\!
A horde of beavers!\!
Cats *and* dogs!

We can-

An officer raises their hand.

Animal Control Boss:
Yes soldier?

Animal Control:
Sir!\!
What's that noise sir?

Animal Control Boss:
That noise?

Animal Control Boss:
I hear it...

Animal Control Boss:
What is that...

Animal Control Boss:
Well f-

Felix goes zooming by on the back of a 
familiar-looking mecha.\!
Animal control officers go flying.

\n[4]:
Huh, I wondered where that had gotten to.

passages.name: Floor 2 rampage intro — Animal control boss
passages.content:
Animal Control Boss:
Shhhh, I've got her cornered but I'm going to
need more men to make the catch.

passages.name: Floor 2 rampage intro — Animal control 3 — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
I knew we should have made a better plan!

Intelligence.\!
Foresight.\!
Elegance!

Those are our advantages over the animals.

He winces in pain.

This wasn't elegant at all!

Animal Control:
Elegance, we need more elegance...

He continues muttering to himself as you use
the potion, even as he starts to glow.



Animal Control:
Ah, now this is elegance!

You let her know the boss needs her.

Animal Control:
This time it will go much better!

She wobbles off to meet the boss, unsteady
on her new heels.\! Within a few steps her gait
smoothes out and she's soon moving easily
and, indeed, elegantly.

passages.name: Floor 2 rampage intro — Police 5 — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
Nope, I'm on my break.\!
Though I hope nothing's broken...

He springs to his feet.

Animal Control:
Suddenly, energy!

He stretches.



A button goes flying from her suddenly
overstrained clothes.

Animal Control:
Huh, well, that's something for when I'm off
duty!

She rushes off to join the chief.

passages.name: Floor 2 rampage intro — Animal control 1 — p1
passages.content:
The animal control officer is lying groaning 
in a pile of clothes.

Animal Control:
Ow.

Animal Control:
I'm\..\..\.. feeling better?

He grabs a nearby clothes rack to help
himself up.

Unfortunately he grabs the wrong part and
pull it down on him, vanishing under a pile
of shirts.

Animal Control:
Agh, how-

The pile shakes as the officer wrestles with
the clothes.

And then the pile starts...\!
Growing larger?

Yes, you're definitely seeing it start to mound
up.

The officer finally bursts out of the pile and
looks down at himself.



Animal Control:
...What's the biggest size this place carries?

You let her know the boss needs her.

Animal Control:
Guess I shouldn't be clothes shopping on duty
anyway.

She heads off to the chief, tugging 
ineffectually at her shirt as she goes.

passages.name: Floor 2 rampage intro — Animal control 4 — p1
passages.content:
The animal control officer is sitting on a pile
of clothes rubbing his leg.

Animal Control:
Ow.

You administer a potion.

Animal Control:
Was that...\.\. supposed to do something?

Huh.\!
You try another one.

And another.

Animal Control:
Look, what are you-

There's an incredibly bright flash.

His chest explodes forward, ripping his clothes
into tiny shreds.\!
Clothes fly up to cover him like they were
magnetized.



\n[2]:
Fascinating, a delayed reaction. It seems to 
have enhanced the effects.

You let the officer know the boss needs her.

Animal Control:
Sure, at least I can block a lot of space like
this.

She heads off to the chief, jiggling and
wobbling and occasionally knocking over
clothes displays.

passages.name: Floor 2 rampage intro — Rampage - clothes 2 — p1
passages.content:
Animal Control:
What hit me...

The officer holds up a hand when you 
approach with a potion.

Animal Control:
Wait, wait.\!
I can see how this goes.

Animal Control:
What is this, the petite section? That'll never
do.

Groaning, he limps across the aisle.

And finally collapses gratefully against another
clothes display.

Animal Control:
There we go, Big and Bulky department.\!
C'mon, give me the stuff.\!
I'm gonna be HUGE.

You hand over the potion.



Animal Control:
Ah yeah, look at these babies.

She kisses her arms.

That's the stuff!

You let her know her boss needs her.

Animal Control:
Oh yeah, no animal's gonna be able to escape
me now!

She heads off.

passages.name: Pet shelter 5 — Shelter volunteer
passages.content:
Pet Shelter Volunteer:
I'm so glad everything's back to normal!

passages.name: Pet shelter 5 — Shelter volunteer
passages.content:
Shelter Volunteer:
I don't know what the secret is, but this catnip
tea is delicious.

passages.name: Pet shelter 5 — Autoplay — p1
passages.content:
Doug and Felix are sitting slumped at a table.

Shelter Head Felix:
Ugh, my head...\!
What did we even get up to yesterday?

Shelter Head Doug:
I think I remember\..\..\.. riding a cow?

Shelter Head Felix:
Or maybe a robot?

They both stare down at the table, ears and
tails drooping.

Shelter Volunteer:
Hey guys, you looked pretty out of it so I
made you some tea.

Doug looks suspiciously at it.

Shelter Head Doug:
It's not catnip, is it?

Felix smirks.

Shelter Head Felix:
No hair of the cat that bit you?

Shelter Volunteer:
Nope, just some chamomile!

Though a lot of us have been really enjoying
that tea you made.\!
It's almost good enough to sell!

She wags the tail you're pretty sure she didn't
have yesterday with happiness.

The two of them stare into their tea for a 
while.

Finally Felix breaks the silence.

Shelter Head Felix:
You know\..\..\..
I guess\..\..\..

Dogs aren't as bad as I always thought?

Shelter Head Doug:
\..\..\..\..\..

Yeah, I guess there are worse things to be
than a cat?

Neither of them notices the best cat and dog
appearing behind them.

Shelter Head Felix:
From here on, let's just focus on making this
place the best it can be for dogs *and* cats,
okay?

Shelter Head Doug:
Yeah.\!
Shake?

They shake hands.

Shelter Head Doug:
Good girl! Good shake!

Felix gives her a very unaumused look.

Shelter Head Doug:
Sorry, sorry, force of habit.

Behind them the animal spirits give cries of
joy at their reconciliation.\!
Once more their power washes over the
shelter heads.

Shelter Head Doug:
Huh.

Shelter Head Doug:
My head feels better!

Shelter Head Felix:
...

Shelter Head Felix:
Me too?

Shelter Head Doug:
This really is good tea!

Kaede:
Such love!\!
Their hearts grew three sizes that day!

Kaede clasps her hands with joy.

Kaede:
Close enough!

passages.name: Pet shelter 5 — Spirit — p1
passages.content:
Cat:
Nyaaa~~ :3

...That wasn't a meow. The cat literally just
said "nya".

passages.name: Pet shelter 5 — Spirit — p2
passages.content:
Cat?:
Hello, nyaa!\!
I'm a magical love heart <3 spirit guide!

I heard the cries of the poor kitties and
puppies here! Your pure and overwhelming 
love for them has let me appear to help!

You trade a confused glance with the rest of
your party.

/n[2]:
Do you mean those two?\!
/n[10] doesn't even have a pet...

Magical Love Heart <3 Spirit Guide:
Hmm...

Magical Love Heart <3 Spirit Guide:
Their pure and overwhelming love for pets 
has let me appear to help!

Go! Rescue the poor things!\!
I will send the spirits to show you where they
hide!

passages.name: Pet shelter 5 — Spirit — p3
passages.content:
Magical Love Heart <3 Spirit Guide:
There are still such cute puppies and kitties
out there who need your help, Hero!

passages.name: Pet shelter 5 — Lovely spirit — p1
passages.content:
The lovely spirit is curled up on a cat bed in
the corner, snoring loudly.\!
Occasionally one of her legs twitches.

passages.name: Pet shelter 5 — Lovely spirit — p2
passages.content:
The lovely spirit is curled up on a cat bed in
the corner, snoring loudly.\!
Occasionally one of her legs twitches.

passages.name: Pet shelter 5 — Doug
passages.content:
Shelter Head Doug:
Good enough to sell...\!
I wonder if we could turn this place into a 
cafe...

passages.name: Pet shelter 5 — Shelter volunteer
passages.content:
Shelter Volunteer:
Wow, I guess the shelter heads really cleaned
up this place while we couldn't get in.\!
It feels so much bigger!

passages.name: Pet shelter 5 — Ball player
passages.content:
Visitor:
I'm glad the shelter is open again.\!
I've missed this ball!

Visitor:
Do you think it's open for adoption?

passages.name: Pet shelter 5 — Catdoggirl
passages.content:
Catdoggirl:
I'm so glad they resolved their differences.\!
It makes things much less confusing for me.

passages.name: Pet shelter 5
passages.content:
Visitor:
Hooray!\!
The shelter's open again!

passages.name: Pet shelter 5
passages.content:
Somewhere Snowlily has found an entire
potted tree.\!
And is judging it, so hard.

passages.name: Pet shelter 5 — Snowlily
passages.content:
Somewhere Snowlily has found an entire
potted tree.\!
And is judging it, so hard.

passages.name: Pet shelter 5 — Felix
passages.content:
Shelter Head Felix:
Wow, they really cleaned up this place while
we were gone.

Did we always have these tables?

passages.name: Pool
passages.content: HOT TUB

passages.name: Pool
passages.content: COLD TUB

passages.name: Pool
passages.content: WADING POOL

passages.name: Pool
passages.content: LAP SWIMMING

passages.name: Pool — Beachball 1
passages.content:
Swimmer:
Go long!

passages.name: Pool — Beachball 1
passages.content:
Swimmer:
Having a ball!

passages.name: Pool — Beachball ball
passages.content: A normal ball.

passages.name: Pool — Bad swimmer
passages.content:
Woman:
Oh, I wish I could go in the pool!

She stares longingly at the water.

But no matter what I never seem to figure
out how to float.

If only it was easier...

passages.name: Pool — Hot tubber
passages.content:
Woman:
Ahhh, so nice...

passages.name: Pool — Cold tubber
passages.content:
Man:
Hah, this is for real men!\!
None of that wimpy warm water for me!

passages.name: Pool — Cold tubber
passages.content:
The man is visibly shivering.

Man:
Every time!\!
Can't we hang out in the hot tub for once?!

passages.name: Pool — Tanner
passages.content:
Woman:
Ah, nothing like working on my tan.

passages.name: Pool — Tanner
passages.content:
Woman:
Ah, nothing like working on my tan.

passages.name: Pool — Tanner
passages.content:
Woman:
Ah, nothing like working on my tan.

passages.name: Pool — Tanner
passages.content:
Woman:
Relaxing at the pool is so nice!\!
No, I don't swim, I just like the atmosphere.

passages.name: Pool — Tanner
passages.content:
Woman:
...Do you think they notice that we're *inside*
and don't have any sunlight?

passages.name: Pool — Tanner
passages.content:
Woman:
Ah, nothing like working on my tan.

passages.name: Pool — Lifeguard 1
passages.content:
Lifeguard:
I am the guardian of the pool.\!
Nothing escapes my steely gaze!

He blows a whistle.

Lifeguard:
Hey you!\!
No roughhousing!

passages.name: Pool — Lifeguard 2
passages.content:
Lifeguard:
It's so much easier watching the swimming
lanes.

Everyone just wants to exercise.

passages.name: Pool — Lap swimmer — p1
passages.content:
Swimmer:
I know I'm slow, but I wish those guys in the
other lanes would shut up about it.

If only I could get faster.\!
I've heard of those special competition 
swimsuits, maybe if I had one of those?

Thinking about it, you saw some of them at
the department store.

Tell him about them?

You let him know.\!
Though, thinking about it, if he wants to go 
fast he should probably avoid any that are
on sale.

Swimmer:
Really?!\!
Thanks!

He runs off.

passages.name: Pool — Lap swimmer — p3
passages.content:
The swimmer from yesterday is sitting on the
edge of the pool.

Swimmer:
Okay.\!
I've got the swimsuit.

He looks down at the full body covering suit.

Swimmer:
A little weird, but it's supposed to help.

Swimmer Bully 1:
Hah!\!
Is that a *girl's* swimsuit?!

Swimmer Bully 2:
Are you just admitting you're a sissy who 
doesn't know how to swim?

The swimmer grits his teeth and ignores them.

Swimmer:
Nothing to do but go for it.

He pushes off.

And zooms off across the pool.

The bullies' jaws drop as he finishes his lap.

Swimmer:
Wow!\!
I've never gone that fast before!

She looks down at herself, noticing her 
changes.\!
Then shrugs.

Swimmer:
This swimsuit was totally worth it!

The two other swimmers exchange glances.

Swimmer Bully 1:
We have got to get some of those swimsuits.

Swimmer Bully 2:
Restore the natural order!

They rush off.

passages.name: Pool — Lap swimmer — p4
passages.content:
Swimmer:
Who's the slow one now?!

Swimmer:
I'm swimming faster and I've got the pool to
myself!

This swimsuit was worth every dollar!

passages.name: Pool — Lap swimmer 3 — p1
passages.content:
Swimmer:
Hah!\!
Hurry up slowpoke!

What's the matter, you don't know how to
swim?

passages.name: Pool — Lap swimmer 3 — p2
passages.content:
Swimmer:
Hah!\!
Slowpoke finally gave up and left!

passages.name: Pool — Lap swimmer 3 — p4
passages.content:
She gives a nervous laugh.

Swimmer:
The pool's here for everyone, right?

passages.name: Pool — Lap swimmer 1 — p1
passages.content:
Swimmer:
I'm just saying, maybe they shouldn't let
people *that* slow into the pool.

Leave it to people who know what they're 
doing!

passages.name: Pool — Lap swimmer 1 — p2
passages.content:
Swimmer:
Ah, glad to see that the pool has been left
for the *serious* swimmers.

passages.name: Pool — Lap swimmer 1 — p4
passages.content:
Swimmer:
Just you\. *pant*\. wait!\!
It's not the swimsuit that makes the swimmer,
it's the swimmer that makes the swimsuit!

passages.name: Pool — Beach umbrella person
passages.content:
Woman:
It's not really the beach, but it's the best we
can get.

passages.name: Pool — Beach man
passages.content:
Man:
It's not the beach, but at least we've still got
some things to relax with.

passages.name: Pool — Swimmer
passages.content:
Woman:
Someday I'll learn how to float and get out
of the kiddy pool!

passages.name: Pool
passages.content:
Swimmer:
Ah, it's nice to just float around in the pool.

passages.name: Pool — Swimmer
passages.content:
Man:
Yeah, you can keep the deep water to 
yourself.  I'm staying where it's *shallow*.

passages.name: Pool — Reluctant
passages.content:
She's muttering to herself.

Woman:
The water is safe.\!
The water will not hurt me.

There are no monsters hiding in the water.\!
There are no sharks.

Or if there are monsters, they're the sexy
kind.\!
Yeah, sexy monsters. Come on, you can do
this for the sexy monsters.

She doesn't move forward.

passages.name: Pool — Arrogant
passages.content:
Man:
It's my first time at a swimming pool like this.

Man:
I'm not impressed.

passages.name: Pool — Swim instructor — p1
passages.content:
Swim Instructor:
Okay everyone, today we're\.\. *yawn*\.\.
going to be learning the breaststroke.

Just\.\., give me a minute.\!
Didn't sleep well last night.

You take a step back as energy crackles 
through the swim instructor's body.

It arcs through the water, striking the rest of 
the class.

Swim Instructor:
Wow!\!
Okay!\!
I'm ready for class now!

You got a little tingle too.\!
Your chest feels warm.

Swim Instructor:
I hope everyone's prepared!\!
Today we're learning the breaststroke!

Swim Instructor:
It's like this.

He swims a few strokes to demonstrate.

Swim Instructor:
Now, the most important part is that you bring
your hands back to your chest with each 
movement.

He reaches out his hands and then pulls them
back in, brushing against his chest.\!
The class members imitate him.

Swim Instructor:
That's right!

Out.

And brush.

And out.

And brush.

They continue practicing.\!
Every time the instructor's hands brush against
his chest, they leave it a little softer.\!
A little larger.

Swim Instructor:
And out.

But no one seems to notice as it swells out,\!
and out,\! and out... 

Swim Instructor:
And brush.

His strokes are ending far forward of where
they used to, blocked by the firm globes sitting
proudly on his once-flat chest.

Swim Instructor:
Keep going!

And the jutting nipples that stick even 
farther forward.

Out.\!
\}Mmmmmm

And brush\!
\}Ooooo

The rest of him has softened and swelled to
match.

Out.\!
\}Oh!

And the class is following along.

And brush\!
\}Aaaaah...

Both in motion and in growth.\!
They're all breathing heavily now, flushed and
panting.

\}Ooooooh\.\.\{
Out-\.\.
\}mmmmm!

And-

There is a sudden loud *SNAP!*.

You dodge as a piece of cloth flings itself at
your face.

Swimming Student:
My top!

The class turns to look.\!
Then looks down at themselves.

Swim Student:
What?!

Swim Student:
Huh.

Swim Instructor:
Well.\!
I think that about wraps up the lesson for 
today.

Good job everyone.\!
Many of you are suddenly violat

passages.name: Pool — Swim instructor — p2
passages.content:
Swim Instructor:
Ah, I feel so much more energetic.\!

passages.content:

Are you sure these are the right swimsuits?

They were the most expensive they had, that
means they're the best.

Swimmer Bully 1:
I'm just glad they were on sale.\!

The other swimmer rolls his eyes.

Swimmer Bully 2:
That's just what they *look* like.\!
The wimp's swimsuit also looked like a

Swimmer Bully 1:
Right!\!
And these look even more like womens, so

Now get in the pool!

They jump in.

Hah!\!
Let's show that wimp how *real* men swim!

He gives a powerful kick forward.\!
Then another, and another.

But even though they all have the same power
behind them, each moves him less far.

Which isn't really a surprise.\!
Each time he kicks his chest also surges
forward.

His-\.\. her growing breasts, for the rest of her
body is swiftly turning very female, are rapidly
getting in her way.

The bigger they get, and they are getting 
*very* big, the more they drag against the 
water.

The more mass she has to move with every
kick.

The slower she goes.

But no matter how slowly she swims, her
chest continues to swell at the same rapid
speed.

Bigger than her head.

Wider than her shoulders.

Down to her belly button, then her waist, then
farther.

Until she's trying to tow massive soft floats 
through the water, each of them several feet
across.



On the other side of the pool her buddy isn't
having much more luck.

She's also struggling with a swelling chest, 
but it's much more manageable than her
friend's.

Why, her breasts are only a relatively tiny
foot or two across!\!
Each.

But even as her growth tapers off, mere
beachballs compared to her friend's blimps,
she still seems to be struggling more and
more.

It's only as she bobs higher up in the water
that you can see the culprit.



Her breasts may have settled down, but her
hips and ass are still going.

Hips growing wider than her shoulde

passages.name: PA Office Real — Licenses clerk — p1
passages.content:
You walk up to the clerk, busily working at her
desk.

Clerk:
Hello, can I help you?

You let her know that you're here to drop off
the application for a food license.

Clerk:
Ah yes, of course.

She takes it and begins scanning over the 
paper.

Clerk:
Yes, yes, this looks good...\!
Clear statement of intent...\!
All the signatures present...

She stamps it then sets it in a pile to the side.

Clerk:
Well, everything seems to be in order.\!
Just give us three to six months for processing
and you should receive your license!

Clerk:
Well *that's* not going to work.

You give her a sad look.

Clerk:
Look, you can't expect bureacracy to work
that fast!

You deploy puppy-dog eyes.

Clerk:
Okay, fine, I may be able to speed things up.\!
But you'll need to do me a favor first.

I've been too busy to deal with it, but we're 
having a...\.\. situation in the basement.

Head down there and gather four rat tails
and I should be able to expedite your application.

You nod.\!
Honestly, it would be pretty great if you could
shortcut more bureacracy with basic fetch 
quests.

Clerk:
Great. The stairs down are in records across
the hall.  I'll unlock the door for you.

She ducks out for a moment.

passages.name: PA Office Real — Licenses clerk — p2
passages.content:
The clerk is busy reading through a massive
pile of paperwork.

Clerk:
Let me know when you've gathered the tails!

passages.name: PA Office Real — Licenses clerk — p3
passages.content:
Clerk:
You're back!

You glare at her.

Clerk:
What?

She blinks.

Clerk:
What didn't I explain? You just need to go 
down into the basement, collect some tails,
and come back.

As far as I'm aware everyone should still be
down there.\!
Just hunt them down and get their tails.

How are you running into any problems?

Clerk:
Attack?!\!
You-\!
What?

Why?!

She gasps.

What have you done?!?!

You stare at each other for a moment in 
mutual incomprehension.

You let her know that you need her to explain
again what she wanted you to do.

In detail.\!
Using very small words.

Clerk:
I need you to go downstairs and collect tails
from the people there.

You know, their stories.\!
Interview them!

...Tales.\!
*Tales*.\!
Oh.

Clerk:
Look, the interns all went feral a few days 
ago and won't come out of the basement.

They all started dressing up like rats and 
proclaiming that soon their "great 
underground empire" would rule the world.

I'm all good with make-believe, but not if it
gets in the way of doing your filing!\!
And I *highly* doubt any expansion of their 
"empire" is following building codes.

She composes herself.

Clerk:
Here at city hall we pride ourselves on 
providing a nurturing environment for all
citizens of our city, interns included.

At the very least we need to know why they've
all gone feral so we can make the program 
better next year.

But I've been so busy with all the work they
dropped that I haven't had time to go down
and ask them.

\}Also they seem to have decided I'm a devil
figure in their new culture and I can only take
so many attempted exorcisms a day...

That's why I need someone else to go down
and get their responses!\!
Their tales.

Clerk:
Please tell me you didn't hurt them.

Corporal punishment has been illegal since
the eighties, and would *not* help you get
your business license earlier.

You indicate that hurting them was never on
your mind. Obviously.

She sighs in relief.

Clerk:
Thank goodness.

Well, if we have cleared up this

passages.name: PA Office Real — Licenses clerk — p4
passages.content:
The clerk has gone back to her paperwork.

Clerk:
Let me know when you've gotten the stories
from four of the rats-slash-interns.\!
\}Rinterns?

And no fighting!

passages.name: PA Office Real — Licenses clerk — p5
passages.content:
Clerk:
You've polled all the interns?\!
Thank you!

She listens closely to your report.

Clerk:
Okay, so I can see some changes we might
make for next year's staff.

Free coffee.

Less peer pressure.

More help with job placement afterwards.

And giving interns the ability to call for 
corporate executions.

We'll keep all of these in mind!

She smiles and pulls out the pet shelter cafe
form.

Clerk:
And as promised, here you go!

She stamps a big "APPROVED" across it.

Clerk:
I look forward to visiting!

passages.name: PA Office Real — Licenses clerk — p6
passages.content:
The clerk has gone back to her paperwork.

Clerk:
Thanks again for all your help!

This cannot-

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:

\n[4]:

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:

Make me the prettiest maiden of love and

passages.content:

Oh no, Lovely Warrior Lovey \n[10]!\!
This can't be!

She yawns and rubs her eyes.

While I was sleeping a new threat has arisen!\!
Puppies and kitties and everything that is
right in this world lies in danger once more!\!
The cafe must open!

Please!\!
Lovely Maiden \n[10]-chan!\!
Say you will help!

Kaede:
...\.\.But we hast already resolved to lend
our aid.

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
Oh, uh...

\n[4]:
You're late!

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
Oh.\!
Huh.

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
Well.\!
Good luck then.

I must go renew my energy!\!
For love and justice!

\n[4] scowls.

\n[4]:
She's just going back to sleep, isn't she.\!
So unprofessional.

passages.name: PA Office Real

Tax codes, municipal laws, form binders...

Something is almost hidden between a few

"Audited by Adoration: The steamy tale of two

No idea how that got there.

\}Please put it back.

Alert!\! Alarm!\!
Danger! Danger!

THEY'VE COME FOR US!\!
THEY'VE FINALLY COME FOR US!

WE'RE DOOOOOOOOOOOOMED!!!!!!!!!!!

\n[2]:
We're not actually going to hunt her down,
right?

The poor thing seemed traumatized enough

\n[4]:

We just beat her up a little and then cut off

Think of the fetch quests we could avoid!

Kaede:

It sits poorly with me to disfigure a beast

Methinks the true villain lies above.\!
'Tis the one who gavest us this mission who
shouldst be the true target of our ire.

\n[4]:
Fine, fine.\!
As long as we get to do violence to 
*someone*.

Maybe there's a good explanation?

You both pause as you hear shrieks in the

Rat:
THEY'RE BACK!!\!
WE'RE DOOOOOOOOOMED!

The guard sighs and pinches the bridge of her 
nose.

Rat Guard:
Just checking, you're not here to "beat us
down, crush our dreams, and drive us 
weeping before you", right?

You let her know that you'd never even think
of doing such a thing.\!
Never even crossed your mind.

You'd never want to do any violence to them,
*especially* not anything involving their tails.

Rat Guard:
That seems like a weirdly specific denial but
okay.

What are you here for then?

You let them know you're just here to survey 
them about their internship.

Rat Guard:
...Right.

Rat Guard:
Well, whatever.\!
You can talk to people as long as you don't
make a mess.

And this is more interesting than doing data

That's all the stories you were asked to collect.\!
You can take them to the clerk now.

No, no, I had no problems with it.

The job scene is pretty cutthroat out there.\!

"Started secret underground empire" just

passages.name: Basement — Mouse — p1
passages.content:

The internship?\!
Of course I took something better!

She scoffs.

Mouse:
Look, I took this job for one reason.

Businesses *need* licenses to operate.\!
Licenses from this office.\!
Its hand is wrapped tight around the very
beating heart of commerce in this city.

I thought I'd get to decide what businesses
live and die!\!
To stand at the center of things and thrill with
power!

But it was just *filing*.\!
Of course I left!

That's all the stories you were asked to collect.\!
You can take them to the clerk now.

Someday, all shall cower in fear of my wrath!

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Shelter volunteer
passages.content:
The pet shelter volunteer is talking to a pair
of animal control officers.

Animal Control:
So we're looking for a pair of strays who 
caused a lot of damage, a black-haired 
catgirl and a brown-haired doggirl.

Do you know of anyone who could have done
it?

Shelter Volunteer:
No...\!
I'm sure no one here could have done it...

Animal Control:
Sir!\!
Are you sure it's not the shelter heads?

They look so close!

Animal Control:
Of course not officer!\!
Look at them, they're much too busty to be
who we were chasing the other day.



Animal Control:
I guess...

Let's see, where should the rest of the cat
beds go...

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Autoplay — p1
passages.content:
Shelter Head Felix:
Are you here to help with setting up the cafe?

You nod.

Shelter Head Felix:
Good.\!
Excellent.

She looks around the shelter.

Shelter Head Felix:
Let's see...\!
We've got enough people setting up the
tables...

We've got people testing out menu items...\!
People cleaning up the place...

Where should we put you?

Doug calls out from behind the counter.

Shelter Head Doug:
Papers!

Shelter Head Felix:
Right, the paperwork!

She hands you a set of papers.

Shelter Head Felix:
Here, this is the form to apply for a food
license for the shelter.

If you could just take it to city hall and drop
it off with the permits office.\!
Get us that license and we should be able to
open tomorrow!

There's scattered cheering from the volunteers
around the shelter.

Town Hall destination added to bus stop!

Shelter Head Felix:
Alright everyone, back to work!

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Autoplay — p3
passages.content:
Shelter Head Felix:
You've returned!\!
How did it go?

You hand her the approved form.

Shelter Head Felix:
Excellent.\!
Thank you for your assistance.

Shelter Head Doug:
She did it?!

Shelter Head Felix:
She did it!

Felix turns to the rest of the room and cups
her hands around her mouth.

Shelter Head Felix:
Good news everyone, we're approved to 
open tomorrow!

The volunteers all cheer.

She turns back to Doug.

Shelter Head Felix:
We're actually doing this!

One more step towards making a home for
all cats and dogs!

Shelter Head Doug:
And all dogs and cats!

They hug.

Then begin to glow.

Once more you hear cries of joy as the best 
dog and cat bless their unity.\!
And their hearts (and other parts) swell with 
joy.



Shelter Head Doug:
Hooray!





Shelter Head Felix:
I can't wait!



They're too excited to notice their hug loosen,
as blossoming chests push them apart.

And then the power crests and rolls out across
the shelter.\!
Tails and ears pop up on the volunteers who 
had not yet sampled the teas.

It hits you and you find yourself reaching up 
into the air, your magical compact suddenly in
hand.

Words come unbidden to your mouth.

Magical Makeup Powers!

You rise up into the air, spinning and glowing 
and briefly flashing your panties to everyone
around.

The volunteers applaud politely.

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Autoplay — p5
passages.content:
You walk in on a bustling scene, full of 
customers trying out the new drinks and
playing with the animals.

Felix calls to you from across the room.

Shelter Head Felix:
Our gratitude again for the help yesterday!\!
Just grab a seat wherever!

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Spirit — p1
passages.content:
Cat:
Nyaaa~~ :3

...That wasn't a meow. The cat literally just
said "nya".

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Spirit — p2
passages.content:
Cat?:
Hello, nyaa!\!
I'm a magical love heart <3 spirit guide!

I heard the cries of the poor kitties and
puppies here! Your pure and overwhelming 
love for them has let me appear to help!

You trade a confused glance with the rest of
your party.

/n[2]:
Do you mean those two?\!
/n[10] doesn't even have a pet...

Magical Love Heart <3 Spirit Guide:
Hmm...

Magical Love Heart <3 Spirit Guide:
Their pure and overwhelming love for pets 
has let me appear to help!

Go! Rescue the poor things!\!
I will send the spirits to show you where they
hide!

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Spirit — p3
passages.content:
Magical Love Heart <3 Spirit Guide:
There are still such cute puppies and kitties
out there who need your help, Hero!

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Lovely spirit — p1
passages.content:
The lovely spirit is curled up on a cat bed in
the corner, snoring loudly.\!
Occasionally one of her legs twitches.

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Lovely spirit — p2
passages.content:
The lovely spirit is curled up on a cat bed in
the corner, snoring loudly.\!
Occasionally one of her legs twitches.

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Doug — p1
passages.content:
Shelter Head Doug:
We're so close to turning this into a real
pet cafe!

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Doug — p2
passages.content:
Shelter Head Doug:
We're all ready to start tomorrow!\!
Come check us out then!

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Shelter volunteer — p1
passages.content:
Shelter Volunteer:
This is so exciting!\!
Making the shelter into a cafe is going to 
help so much with adoptions!

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Shelter volunteer — p2
passages.content:
Shelter Volunteer:
This is so exciting!\!
Making the shelter into a cafe is going to 
help so much with adoptions!

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Shelter volunteer — p3
passages.content:
Shelter Volunteer:
So many more people are coming now that
we're a cafe!

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Snowlily
passages.content:
Somewhere Snowlily has found an entire
potted tree.\!
And is judging it, so hard.

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Customer — p1
passages.content:
This man is staring into a cat's eyes over a 
cup of catnip tea.

Customer:
No!\!
No tea for you!

Customer:
No!\!
I said the tea is mine!

Customer:
That's enough!

He chugs the entire cup and slams it back
down to the table.

Customer:
Hah!

He puts his arms behind his head and 
stretches.

Customer:
The sweet taste of victory!

He doesn't seem to notice the way he loses
height as he stretches, sinking down in the
seat.

Or the way his shorts slide down off his 
thinning waist, only to catch on his wider 
hips.

He's too busy giving the cat a smug look to
pay attention as the bottom half of his shirt
just fades into dust, revealing a nice stretch
of rapidly swelling underboob.

Or the way his hair shades suddenly to violet,
dropping down to his shoulders in wild curls.

Customer:
I'm so sorry kitty, it's too bad you can't afford
to buy your own.\!
Get a job you freeloader!

He's just too busy gloating at the cat glaring 
at him, even as his ears fuzz out and grow 
points, shifting up to the top of his head.

Even as his lower pants make way for a tail to
snake out behind him.

Even as his face softens and his voice pitches
ever higher.



Customer:
Hah!\!
Suck it!

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Customer — p2
passages.content:
The new woman is still taunting the cat.

Customer:
Too bad kitty, that was a delicious cup of tea!

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Sale customer
passages.content:
Customer:
Like my outfit? I just got it at the sale down
the street.

She takes a sip of her catnip tea.

Customer:
Ah, the taste of stylish victory.

passages.name: Pet shelter 6
passages.content: A tree that looks perfectly fine to you.

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Shelter volunteer — p1
passages.content:
Shelter Volunteer:
I can't wait to share this tea with everyone!

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Shelter volunteer — p2
passages.content:
Shelter Volunteer:
Welcome!\!
Can I get you anything?

I recommend the catnip tea for cat lovers and
the spice tea for dog lovers!

Shelter Volunteer:
Sorry, you don't have enough money!

The tea is delicious!

You feel briefly itchy, as your ears gain a point
and your tail thins down and stretches out.

You feel briefly itchy as your ears gain a point.

Sticks suddenly seem a lot less interesting.\!
You could really go for batting around a mouse,
and maybe licking your butt.

You feel the catnip speaking to something
deep within you.\!
As if a switch in your soul has just changed 
from "dog" to "cat".

Something about the catnip is just wonderful
to you.\!
So calming, so soothing...

Shelter Volunteer:
Sorry, you don't have enough money!

Mmm, the spice tea is wonderful!\!
The best part is chewing on the cinnamon
stick they included.

You pant a little, as your ears flop out and
your tail gets a lot more fluffy.

You pant a little in excitement as your ears
flop out.

The catnip tea is smelling a lot more boring
now.\!
You'd rather go for a walk.\!
Ooo, and maybe chase some squirrels!

Your tail wags eagerly at the thought.

Something about it really makes you want to
chew more sticks.\!
And maybe shoes.\!
Ooo, and chase sticks too!

You feel something shift within your soul.\!
As if a switch deep within you has just 
changed from "cat" to "dog".

Sticks are wonderful, aren't they?\!
Yeah!\!
You could chew on this thing forever!

Shelter Volunteer:
Just let me know if you want anything!

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Tea
passages.content: Catnip tea is steeping on the counter.

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Felix — p1
passages.content:
Felix is directing the volunteers.

Shelter Head Felix:
Good work so far everyone!

Roberta, make sure to scatter the cat beds 
so they have somewhere to hide! We don't
want them to feel too exposed!

Sarah, make sure the next test batch of tea
is ready for the tasting!

Maurice, make sure there are plenty of toys
for the dogs!\!
And give me one of those too!

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Felix — p2
passages.content:
Shelter Head Felix:
Once more you have my gratitude for
procuring the forms for us.

Come back tomorrow to see the fruits of 
our labors!

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Tea
passages.content: Catnip tea is steeping on the counter.

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Tea
passages.content: Catnip tea is steeping on the counter.

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Tea
passages.content: Catnip tea is steeping on the counter.

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Donation jars
passages.content:
There are two donation jars here, labeled
CATS and DOGS.

It looks like they have exactly the same
amount of money in each.

Donate?

As you put in the money you see Doug twitch,
then visibly restrain themselves.

Shelter Head Doug:
(It's okay, it's okay. Both dogs and cats are
fine.)

You don't have enough money!

You see Felix visibly restraining themselves.

Shelter Head Felix:
(We made an agreement. We don't need 
complete parity anymore. Either animal is
fine. Either animal is fine.)

You don't have enough money!

You leave the jars alone.

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Animal Control
passages.content:
The pet shelter volunteer is talking to a pair
of animal control officers.

Animal Control:
So we're looking for a pair of strays who 
caused a lot of damage, a black-haired 
catgirl and a brown-haired doggirl.

Do you know of anyone who could have done
it?

Shelter Volunteer:
No...\!
I'm sure no one here could have done it...

Animal Control:
Sir!\!
Are you sure it's not the shelter heads?

They look so close!

Animal Control:
Of course not officer!\!
They have too much, uh...

She hefts her chest.

Animal Control:
The ones we're seeking were much less 
endowed!



Animal Control:
You have a point...

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Animal Control 2
passages.content:
The pet shelter volunteer is talking to a pair
of animal control officers.

Animal Control:
So we're looking for a pair of strays who 
caused a lot of damage, a black-haired 
catgirl and a brown-haired doggirl.

Do you know of anyone who could have done
it?

Shelter Volunteer:
No...\!
I'm sure no one here could have done it...

Animal Control:
Sir!\!
Are you sure it's not the shelter heads?

They look so close!

Animal Control:
Of course not officer!\!
Look at them, they're much too busty to be
who we were chasing the other day.



Animal Control:
I guess...

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Unexpected customer — p1
passages.content:
Customer:
Mmmm...

He takes a deep sniff of his catnip tea.

Customer:
This smells de-\!
Delic-\!
De-

He gives an utterly massive sneeze, one that
suddenly rises in pitch halfway through.

There's a flash of light and you're pretty sure
you feel a few scraps of cloth fly past you.



Customer:
Uh...

She stares down at the cat-shaped cutout on
her chest.

Customer:
I can't help but feel this wasn't quite what
was meant to happen...

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Unexpected customer — p2
passages.content:
She takes another tentative sniff of her catnip
tea.\!
Then gives a cute squeaky sneeze.

This time all her clothes stay intact.

Customer:
You know what, maybe I'm just allergic.

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Mysterious figure
passages.content:
Cloaked Figure:
This tea is weak and insipid. Watery, tasteless,
and one of the worst things I've ever had the
misfortune to drink.

Shelter Volunteer:
...\!
So are you asking for a refund, or...

They drain the rest of their drink.

Cloaked Figure:
No. Get me another cup.

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Volunteer
passages.content:
Shelter Volunteer:
Oh great.\!
I forgot that being a cafe meant we'd have to
deal with *customers*.

passages.name: Pet shelter 6
passages.content: ADOPTIONS
